text: This is a great place for breakfast regardless of where you live. It's worth the ride or a long walk. I was lucky enough to discover this place thanks to Hotel Broad Ripple. The quinoa bowl was deliscious, just don't forget to add avocado. If you are lucky Mason will sing for you! Oh and this place has Matcha Green Tea and they know how to properly prepare a straight cup of matcha. A true blessing for matcha lovers.

They have two different menus for you to order from. One is chinese/ Japanese American styled restaurant and one is authentic Chinese food. The regular menu is the same as other restaurant, nothing special about it. The ramen is delicious and I would recommend the black garlic broth with BBQ pork. The egg drop soup is kind of plain and my first take out order egg drop soup actually tasted lightly sour like it's about to go bad. The wonton soup is plain too, but you can tell the wonton are made fresh, not the frozen kind from take out chinese restaurant. The authentic chinese menu are  very good. I like their garlic stirred fried veggies. I can say these menu items are not full of MSG, but lot of spice and soy sauce, sesame oil to make the flavor come out.

I visited this place for the first time tonight with two other couples. I did not particularly like having to pay $5.00 to "valet" park my car 20 feet from me. I was stopped when I arrived and told the price. I asked if I could park myself and was told "no, no one parks themselves." I'm perfectly capable of parking my own car AND it cost me $5.00 to park it very close to where I was stopped. I don't agree with that. There's no need for forced valet parking. 

To get to the positive-we were greeted by a friendly young lady when we arrived. We were seated quickly but we did have a reservation. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. The food dishes ordered at my table ranged from the burger to rabbit fettuccine, fried chicken, stew and meatloaf. Everyone said their meal was delicious. I would return for dinner other than the valet issue which may have me think twice.

Visited Voodoo Gumbo during our visit to Nashville since my husband loves Cajun cuisine which is not readily available in our area.  Drove about 1/2 hr from our hotel to the restaurant which was in a strip mall with TJ Maxx.  Since it was 3:00 in the afternoon the restaurant was empty.  We were instructed to order at the register, the food was freshly cooked &  brought to our table.  My husband had the seafood gumbo (his favorite) which he loved.  He also had the shrimp po'boy & I had the oyster po'boy with coleslaw.
There were so many oysters I had to eat 1/2 of them first in order to pick up the sandwich.  Both po'boys were excellent, crispy & "melted in your mouth" tender. The po'boys were filling but we had to have the beignets which were hot & delicious. We inquired if there was a Voodoo Gumbo up north but was told by William it was privately owned.   Hi to Joyce & DeAnna who were also friendly & welcoming! We will definitely come back our next visit to Nashville.
I have been a regular at the Meridian Boise Fry location for about 3.5 years now. The food, drinks, and staff are incredible. Check out the attached photos for a look inside!

I just don't get it. I guess there's not much around here in the way of burrito places, but to me, this place isn't the place that I got excited to go to after reading the reviews. Everything tasted really prepackaged to me. The menu was unique, and they're trying with the different sauces, but the honey Siracha just fell flat. The owners are really nice and the place is cool, but it's just not for us. We won't be back, the authentic Mexican places in glassboro and Washington Township are better choices.

This place is great - all the tapas were delicious, super friendly and helpful waiters. Good atmosphere. Meatballs and mushrooms and bacon wrapped dates in particular were great. Would definitely go back!

This restaurant was a huge disappointment for me.  I was in the city for one night on business and picked 3 restaurants - couldn't find the other 2 and this was my 3rd choice.  I will not be going back on a future trip.  

The restaurant was empty, except for one large party.  The staff at the door were friendly and helpful, however one of the kitchen staff actually challenged me about a food allergy after I made a special request.  The server talked a lot about their 'specialties' - which were 'sustainable fish' (in conversation later, I figured out that he didn't even know what sustainable meant), homemade items, and fresh ingredients.  I didn't experience any of the above.

I wasn't sure what to order (the menu does look enticing - with many choices), so I ordered a cup of italian wedding soup while I thought about my meal.  It was the WORST soup I have ever had.  It is NOT italian wedding soup.  The ingredients are prepared separately and then thrown together when ordered.  The broth is like a brine - I only had a few sips and I swelled up the next day.  There were no beans, only flavorless meatballs and uncooked spinach floating in the brine.  I finally decided on a pizza because they insisted seafood was their specialty and I love shrimp on a pizza.  So I asked for the 5 cheese pizza, which is described as a white pie with 5 different cheeses (no tomato sauce).  I asked them to leave off the gorgonzola and add on shrimp.  They got the shrimp right...that was about it.  I basically got a cheese pizza....tomato sauce and all.  All the cheeses are mixed together so you cannot appreciate the flavors of the different cheeses.  As I was taking my pizza in a box to go, I asked the server "you're sure this doesn't have tomato sauce, right" and he says "of course - our 5 cheese pizza never has tomato sauce".  Wish I had opened the box right there and saved myself the trouble of throwing it away in my hotel room.  Finally, I'll mention my flat sparkling water.  While I waited on my pizza I sat at the bar and had a glass of 'sparkling' water.  Don't order Pellegrino here - they don't even know what it is.  When I asked for a glass, they offered me the wine list.  LOL.  So then I asked for sparkling water and got a very old bottle of not-so-bubbly water.  And when the server asked me if I wanted to take the rest with me, I told him 'no thanks, it was flat anyway' and he didn't offer to do anything about it.  The only reason this restaurant is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is that the bread was amazing.  But I highly doubt it's made in house!

My experience here is hit or miss, depending on what area of the facility you're in.  The key to having a good time here is to go during non-peak hours.

Service in the sit-down eating area - hit or miss, leaning towards hit.  Sometimes we get friendly, attentive service.  Other times, deplorable.  It all depends on the server and how busy the place is.  Food is solid.  I especially like the nachos.

They have good pool tables.  Again, service around the pool tables is hit or miss.  Pricing for pool table use is acceptable during non-peak hours.  

Arcade area and bowling area are standard D&B style.  There's sometimes a really long wait for bowling.  But there's enough other stuff to do in the meanwhile, if you're that set on bowling during peak hours.

I love coming to Cielo for Sunday brunch. It's a very non -St Louis experience. The service  is always professional and relaxed. They make a fantastic omelet and wonderful creme brûlée french toast.  My friends love the bottomless bloody Mary's. Have also had lunch but never dinner. That menu looks fantastic if a little pricey.

Came here around 3AM and burgers were good but everything else was okay. Service was horrible!! Saw multiple tables walk out and the bartender, Shawn, over charged our table. I do understand he was busy but there were better ways to handle the situation.
Great food, great prices and customer service. Their queso dip is amazing.

The Best Mexican food i have came across in Pinellas County so far! Its a classy place great food, I love the salsa! great bar, great drink! A huge selection of handmade margaritas I will say the Cucumber Margarita is a must on a hot day it is super refreshing!

Popped by Tijuana Flats for a quick bite on a sunny Saturday for lunch, with a few friends. It wasn't too packed, compared to some of the other restaurants around. We placed and paid for our orders with the cashier, and a food runner brought our food out to our table, in about 10ish minutes. I ordered the Chicken bowl, which was pretty filling. The bowl itself wasn't the most flavorful, but I was able to spruce it up with their hot sauces, which they had quite a variety of at a sauce bar. I'd pop by here again when I'm in the area, if I'm craving tex mex, but I'll definitely explore other options first if I'm feeling adventurous.
I liked the atmosphere but the Tuesday special doesn't include the gluten free option, even if you pay the difference in the crusts. Our waitress Carmen and Abby were wonderful!
What an incredible spot in our little city! If you're interested in a good cup of coffee and feeling connected to your community, Code Coffee is the perfect place for you.

Have eaten at this location many times while on business travel. Shrimp cocktail is amazing and the wedge is simply the best I have ever eaten.  Nice atmosphere even when crowded. Convenient location downtown. Recommend this location 100%.
One of the best breakfast spots in town!! The fried green tomato omelet was amazing!!

If your looking for great roti, this is the place for it!  It's a Mom and Son run shop and they are both very pleasant and proud of their business.  The rotis are freshly made to order which means you have to wait a little but its we'll worth it.  Give them I try, you won't be disappointed.

Spent the afternoon at the bar...   Chips and Salsa were good.  2 types of salsa.  Awesome. Enjoyed some margaritas.  Drinks were good. Atmosphere was also excellent.  Ready...   The bartender seemed about ready to fight the whole night.   Maybe that's taking things too far..  Okay, you get the gist. Not the friendliest chap in Nashville that I've met.  Just a cautionary note to those sitting at the bar.
New favorite place to eat sushi. I always get spicy salmon , it's under number 8. Staff is pretty friendly. I always like to come back.

Es el Restaurant dentro del Hyatt Regency! 
Vine a la exposición de mi Rubro y tuve reuniones en ese Restaurant ! 
Buen clima, buena música ! 
El sushi es muy bueno ! 
Recomiendo el corte de carne NY delicioso ! Pero a $ 28 otra opción la hamburguesa  a precio $ 18 !

La atención es buena ! 
Si piden la carne tengan en cuenta que demora unos 25 min ! 

Les dejo fotos de los platos que comimos ! 

Saludos !

This was our first visit. Tiffany was awesome. Our only complaint is our steak with pasta was burnt so she had to redo our order. Our sliders were burger meat and not steak we still paid the same price. We heard and read alot of complaints about the food being cold and long wait time. I must say we didn't wait long and our food was hot.

I haven't left a review in quite a while, but I had to leave one for this restaurant. The food came out quickly and was delicious. Andre was our waiter, and the service was excellent. Kid friendly. We are from the Caribbean, and we're also used to Caribbean food in NY-- and we're glad to have found this place!

This place used to be one of our go-to's. It recently closed and reopened, and we were excited to go back and try one of our favorite lunch spots.

Whatever new ownership there is has absolutely ruined the menu. I ordered what turned out to be the worst salad I've ever had here; the lettuce was flavorless and wet, the chicken was absolutely disgusting, and they were out of multiple of the ingredients but charged me the full value of the salad before telling me. Used to be one of my most recommended spots in Nashville, now I'm just waiting for it to close again.
This might have been the worst service I have ever experienced in my life. Then the manager instead of apologizing he looked for excuses. Stay away from this location.
IOU's group enjoyed a fabulous dinner. Even managed a protein high!  The wait staff was fantastic!

The menu looks great and some of the staff were really nice. The burgers appear to taste great. My party loved them. Their were plenty of patrons however I am not particularly ecstatic about returning in the near future. I asked for the endless fries and was met with a huge sigh. I asked for additional condiments and it never came although the waitress returned to take my platter instead asking if I was done. I was happier with my party than the server. She seemed to be over worked. Will try again to compare.

Such amazing Vegan food me and my girlfriend drove down here from Orlando on a recommendation from the lead singer of Municipal Waste and boy I was not disappointed one bit! Anyone who's vegan or just loves tasteful fresh good food has to check this place out! 5 stars

We had dinner there here a few months ago and it was great but last night it wasn't. I had the salmon on the ceder plank w/ the balsamic mustard sauce and it was way salty. My wife had the almond crusted sole and hers was also salty. It was to bad because the pieces of fish were big and fresh and cooked just right. Chefs we can add our own salt as you have a large jar of it on the table.
We enjoyed the happy hour but the margarita oyster needs more spice.

Honestly never had a bad experience here. Staff is always kind and courteous and food is always great. We really appreciate this because the other fast food restaurants in the area unfortunately often disappoint.

We were looking for a good cup of coffee and something small to eat a 3pm, July 4th in the old town in Phili and found this place with Yelp. Nice small spot with a fine interior (wood). My wife took just a Cappuccino my kids the eggplant sandwich and I took the cheese sandwich. They make their own bread fresh - so the sandwiches are great but more upscaled price-wise. Service was very friendly and fast. Definitely a good spot to go for a break time snack.
This place is awesome. Hot good food that is priced perfectly. The people who work here are nice. What else do you want??

Seriously the freshest fish I've ever eaten. NO DEEP AT THE BOTTOM OF THE OCEAN TASTE :D

I've always been flippy floppy on eating fish. I'm not a fan of it but Frenchy's has changed my mind! If I could eat fish as fresh as this... I would eat it everyday!

We saw a sign on a vehicle parked along the beach, googled it, and decided to give it a try. 

I had the Veggie Delight and combo'd it. The sandwich was huge and after combo'ing it there was way too much food for one person to eat. I liked being able to get a bottle of water as my drink in the combo meal. I made 2 meals out of it, literally! My friends tried the California Pesto and the Greek, both with the vege patty, and they both said they were really good. 

Slightly more expensive than I like to spend (but I'm cheap) but the extra money was worth it to know I was getting fresh & green!!!

3-31-3012 - Pretty damn good steak. Steak was good and hot, decent quality meat, broccoli rabe good, onions very good.  Roll was good quality local bread.  Counter staff were polite.

Mac & Cheese was just OK because kind of bland, and it was reheated by "Chef Mike" so there were hot and cold pockets. I would suggest that they either make smaller batches during the day, or reheat it outside of the styro cup and stir it once or twice while reheating before handing to the customer.  The ambience is good, it's warm and indoors for Californians freezing their butts off.

THE BAD: CASH ONLY - CASH ONLY - CASH ONLY. BE WARNED. DING THEM A STAR FOR THIS.

I went for an early dinner and ordered off a limited early dinner menu.  I had a glass of Riesling recommended by the waiter, which was a great choice, along with the BBQ shrimp (divine - some of the best shrimp I've ever had!) and the Caesar-style salad, which was fine but sort of gloppy.  Excellent service, and a nice atmosphere.
I don't know what this food is. But it sucks. The rice is awful!! How can you mess up rice at a Chinese place ???

Couch Tomato has a very nice atmosphere with a rooftop deck. The picknick tables have umbrellas which is perfect for sunny days. The decor and tables are very nice. Food is on the expensive size considering that the portions are not very large. I got the BLT sandwich-very tasty. Ordering is very convenient. You pay at the counter and then they call your name over the loudspeaker when your meal is ready. I would recommend to a friend.
Super cute trendy spot in Santa Barbara. Great friendly service they have a breakfast lovers dream menu all the good all day - great spot!

Always dependable, good quality food and drink. Excellent choices for kids as well and it's a ton of food for that price! Have had several things on the menu but last night had the tuna which was really nice...wife had the salmon which was yummy too. Not a sushi fan so can't speak to the sushi but others at our table got it last night and had rave reviews. It gets packed on weekend nights, so highly encourage a reservation!

So good! The pick 3 sampler is awesome for a first timer! You get three nice servings of gumbo with garlic bread and so far they're all delicious. The staff is super nice and create a fun friendly environment with their cheerful demeanor. I'll be back for sure! Also be sure to get the boudin balls they're great!

Every bite was worth it. The burgers are amazing. Very good bun. Super fast service. Real feel good ambiance. Love everything about this place, it's worth going outside of downtown Nashville for one of these gem burgers. You can't go wrong no matter which one you pick!

My boyfriend and I very much enjoyed our experience at Mesa Verde. I ordered the jackfruit tacos with a side of avocado, which were served in lettuce cups and beautifully seasoned (you would never guess it's made from the smelliest fruit in the world) and very yummy. I also really appreciated the generous size of the avo side (1/2 the fruit) when you normally only get a couple slices at other places. BF had the potato latkes with a side of poached egg and also really enjoyed it. We're both meat eaters but I just wanted to try something new. The kombucha they had on that day was also really good (passion green tea, I believe) and even after we had declined dessert and paid the check, they presented us with a sample of their delicious baklava and soy ice cream, which was just the perfect finish to our meal! I've had baklava in Turkey and this was really amazing, so that should say something. Really worth trying this place!

Casual with good food.  One of the biggest and most diverse menus in Santa Barbara, generally at reasonable prices.  Daily specials are extra value.  Grilled  artichoke appetizer is phenomenal.  Home brewed beers are diverse and generally very good.

Can be loud, service is spotty and sometimes slow or inattentive.  No reservations so may wait for a table.  Parking is a mess at busy times.  All in all a great local hang out for food and drink in a vibrant atmosphere with out too much cost or attitude.  Not a romantic hide away by any means though.

AN AWESOME SURPRISE!

This place a not your average chicken joint.  They serve chicken that has been marinated for at least 24 hours.  Everything is full of flavor and there are traditional sides such as rice but there are fun sides such as quinoa and plantains.  

The Staff is friendly and they bring your food to your table after you order.  

Generous portions and excellent food!
Amazing calzones with plenty of options. They serve fairly Big calzones that is worth the price. Would highly recommend!

Waited 45 minutes to be seated with a party of 10 after calling for a reservation and being told they didnt accept them. Waited an additional 30 minutes at the table and never even saw a waitress. Wasted an hour and a half without ever even ordering a drink. Service was the worst I have experienced.

One of the best breakfasts I've had.  We booked a reservation after a walk that my family and I were participating in.  From the first phone call to to the last cup
Of coffee we had the best experience.  The service was impeccable!  Thank you to all for accommodating our group.  We will definitely be coming back!!!

So, I don't eat BBQ often and it's not because I don't want to, but because I have certain standards a place has to meet for me to consider it worthy of trying. I will say, I was highly impressed with this place! I had the pulled pork, Mac and cheese, and green beans. Everything was absolutely perfect! The selection of sauces was great and the portions were huge! This was a great place for families. I thought it was nice that they play the national anthem at noon every day. The service was friendly (typical order then sit down style BBQ). Parking lot was accommodating. I cannot wait to go back!
Pizza dough was raw, the amount of toppings was skimpy, price was way to high for a cheap pizza. The pizza was similar to little Caesars.

I gave them 1 star because their Paneer Tikka App had Artificial coloring(Red/Saffron Color) which i absolutely hate! 

Unfortunately, Taj India didn't live up to my standards in terms of quality of food! Sorry for disappointing folks!

Go for the experience-  the ice cream was great, but know that you'll be paying 'boutique' prices. Lovely view of the STL Wheel as we enjoyed our desserts. The food looked good, too. Dreamsicle Shake, All American Hot Fudge Sundae, Hawaiian Sundae were top notch. The Hawaiian used real pineapple, so it was not too sweet--perfect with the toasted coconut and the macadamia nuts.

Wonderful happy hour outside tonight, and in the cozy bar as well! A nice, quiet place to drink great wine and talk....our server was excellent - wish I'd caught his name (he's 6'9") because he didn't hover, but was really attentive. I'd given up on this place when it transitioned from Piatti, but now I'm sold. A great little hideaway spot to have good food and good vino!

The environment here is delightful and I mean come on, this is the place that was voted to have the #1 bathroom in the U.S. So, I of course had to check it out...it was pretty cool for a bano but I wasn't overly impressed...but who am i to judge bathrooms?! 

Anyway, let's get to the good stuff...the food! Their dill pickle soup (which I tried from a friend's bowl) is to die for. If you like pickles, and I DO (it's the only thing Snookie and I have in common), you can't miss with this. I actually ordered their soup special for the day though, the corn chili chowder (meatless) and that my fellow yelpers was amazing! I also ordered the birdseed salad and found it to be very tasty! 

For desert, I got a pretzel...yes i said pretzel ice cream cone and stayed pretty safe and went with their chocolate ice cream. It was sweet and salty and hit the spot! My friends got the pineapple upside down cake and it was quite the sweet treat! I am SO getting that next time and suggest you do too!

One down, I will say is one of my friends got the grilled cheese sandwich with apples on it and halfway through her meal, realized there weren't any apples on it. She didn't want to complain so she didn't say anything. I am sure if she would have, they would have offered a new sandy, at least I hope they would.

One other slight annoyance, is that when we got there, the seating seemed to be a bit unorganized and we were taken to one table but then it was dirty so then we went to another. No biggie but I will say while our server was certainly sweet, he moved a little on the laid back/slow side. We had to wait longer than I think we should have, given the lack of a huge crowd.

Overall, though I would totes recommend this place and I sent my sister and niece that way this weekend while they are in town. I hope they leave with happy tummies...I think they will y'all!

We were able to get a seat outside and were quickly greeted with menus and our server. Warning... they do not have Mimosas...this is sad for a breakfast place. I had the Mexican skillet which was very filling and had a bit of a spicy kick. My wife had the steak burrito,  which for those who might be interested in this... it is ground steak more like burger or sausage. It is not flank steak. She was a bit disappointed based on this but still said it was good and filling. Would definitely recommend for a quick inexpensive breakfast and we will go back...just not for steak and mimosas!

I haven't eaten fast food since my last visit to this Hardee's. You gave me food poisoning. Thanks for turning me into a healthy individual I guess. Wish I could give you 0 or negative stars for food so awful it makes you sick with poison.
Solid local restaurant that never disappoints. A little higher priced for Mexican food in town, but well worth it.

Before trying Joe's Next Door for a lunch break, I was told that the BLT would change my life. That's a pretty high bar of expectation to set, but wooooow... yeah, I loved it. 

Joe's is located right on main street in Carmel, so you can't miss it. Stop in for a wide variety of spices, sauce, frozen meals, wine, sandwiches -- and obviously, meat. 

For lunch I've opted for the BLT twice and the Cuban once. Both were delicious, but they really do work some magic on the BLT. It only takes about 5 minutes for them to make it, and the staff is very friendly. 

Be sure to grab a small bag of Broad Ripple Chip Co with your sandwich... and definitely, opt for the BLT.

Wonderful ambience and an incredibly warm greeting as we walked in the door. Beautiful place for a romantic dinner or a party with friends.  Food was very fresh and delicious.  Particularly enjoyed the table side guacamole, made to our taste.  The service was impeccable with everyone trying to make our experience enjoyable.  Would highly recommend this restaurant. Outstanding!

This is one of my all time favorite spots for a perfect Sonoran hot dog..
Clean, friendly & fast
Most of all great food

I loved the original Cafe European and was so excited when they decided to open a new location after selling the previous. This location is more cafe style- which was actually perfect bc I would always stop to pick up lunch anyway. The owners are such lovely people. Everything is homemade and tastes absolutely delicious, and I was glad to see them keep some of my favorites from the old menu (like the cilantro chicken sandwich). They're so accommodating too. They have a regular menu and specials that always sound amazing- it's so hard to choose! My only qualm is that parking in that little plaza can get terrible so sometimes I don't stop just because of parking. It isn't their fault so I didn't knock off any rating and I know they have an agreement with the lot across the street, I'm just a snob and I don't want to cross Westshore in my heels ha- but it is disappointing sometimes nonetheless.
What a concept!!! Wish we had this in Cali. We have access to some of the best food in the country in so cal and I've not seen a place like this. Amazing meatballs. Amazing service. Cool vibe.

Ok - so I was born & raised in the area but have since moved to FL ... When I get back this way, I ALWAYS get my cheesesteak fix & usually attempt to try different merchants.  Especially avoiding Pat & Geno's ... 

Let me start at my arrival.  Upon entering the establishment I was glad to see most of the tables full at 3 pm -- good sign.  

I was first in line to order ... And there were 2 gals present to assist w/ the order ... Surprisingly, I wasn't greeted or even acknowledged for 5 minutes!!!!!  The chick answered the Phone while I patiently waited ... Not even once making eye contact!!  That should've been the sign .... 

Two (2) cheesesteaks ordered; 1 American wit & 1 Provo wit/out .... They charge an extra buck for the cheese on a cheesesteak (what?!?) ... Ended up getting one as a combo which included fries & a soft-drink ... Total was $22 bucks!!  

Waited about 7 mins for my order.  Upon calling my number (same rude chick at the counter) I expressed my order was to go & politely asked for a bag ... To which her reply was, "you'll have to wait a minute!" Excuse the *^#¥ out of me ... But she did manage to hand me a bag this allowing me to bag my own food - how Customer Service is that?! 

Now on to the food review -- the sandwiches were average size.   Cheese was properly melted & distributed throughout ... The drip factor was present but the meat wasn't chopped up ... Ok, not a big deal ... But upon biting in the meat was a little chewy .... Flavor was mediocre but enough to fill the roll.  Onions had a decent flavor but that was about all I can say about that.  

Overall, I would NOT go back.  There are many better places to give your money for a better quality experience & service.   Try Campos nearby for a much better experience from friendly to quality!   In fact, I've got a better local location in Orlando, FL from a Philly transplant who opened his shop called Brianto's!!  Well worth it as he uses best quality meat & flies in Amoroso rolls to add that authentic experience!

If you find yourself stuck in Old City on a weekend and you are looking to dance...this is the best place to do it.  The DJ is decent and they play a good combination of pop and hip-hop hits that you can definitely boogie to.  Also the dance floor is not usually super packed and people are generally having a decent time. 

It is usually pretty dark in the whole place and I wouldn't recommend coming here to have  casual beer with your friends and chat.  This is more of a bar for the end of the night when you just want to let loose.  Drink prices are reasonable and they usually have some solid beer choices on tap.  I've never been here for the food...it feels more like a dirty dance floor club to me but I imagine it looks nice during the day too.  A very interesting building from the outside though I've seen one too many drunk girl fall down the stairs out front...

I love this place so much that I don't even know where to begin this review.  I have dined or had drinks here at least 25 times over the last five years.  I have never had a less than perfect experience or less than perfect meal.
     Starting with the atmosphere, what can I say that has not been said before?  The place is gorgeous, no really.... it is stunning.  The old converted church is lovely in every possible way and exudes charm from every corner both inside & out.
     This is an elegant establishment and I just don't think we have enough of those in a world that is becoming ever more casual.  Check in with the host, check your coat and hang out at the bar.  They have a nice wine list that will surely have something for your enjoyment.  The bartenders have been the same for years & will create some of the finest cocktails in New Hope - I recommend the classic Martini.  The host will come get you when your table is ready and whisk you away to a romantic dining room on the second floor.  Look around as you climb the stairs, there is a lot to see in this beautiful old church.  
     The grand dining room is large, complete with stunning art and magnificently high ceilings.  The tables for couples will be adorned with red rose petals.  
     The food has always been exceptional, understand it is Southern cooking, Creole to be exact - lots of seafood, lots of classics such as jambalaya & gumbo.  The fresh French baguette they bring over is always warm, flakey in the outside and delicate on the inside.  The service has never been less than five stars.  I always like a little banter with whomever is serving and my last experience here was no exception.  Our server both entertained us with his quick wit and informed us about everything we considered on the menu.
    We both ordered the beet salad with spinach & goat cheese as our starter and as a vegetarian I got the Eggplant Napoleon as my meal.  Creamy, buttery, fresh, flavorful with just the right spice to make an impression - delicious!!!  Naturally dessert had to be ordered and I got the carrot cake, be warned - it is a very large piece and is served with a scoop of homemade ice cream.  I couldn't finish the whole thing & I never leave dessert unfinished on my plate.  
     As I said at the start, I have never had less than a five star experience at Marsha Brown's and will be back again in a few weeks.
Great tater tots and finger foods. Expensive but tasty drinks. Fun night of bowling.

Truthfully not as good as my first visit on opening night.  First off they were told us that they didnt have any monkey bread at 6 pm on a Monday night no worries that happens.  But all the items we ordered were just not as good.The brussel sprouts were over cooked with a little too much char on them.  The cioppino seafood also was overcooked too.  We asked if the Restaurant upstairs was open on Monday night for a night cap beacuse we dont care for Itailan wine.  Two different employee told us it was open and surprise it was closed.  dont your employees know your hours?  Service was fast and friendly.

Holy moly, this was an amazing lunch. Ordered at the bar and sat down at a booth, got the Grilled chicken mushroom and Swiss sandwich with an appetizer of chicken quesedilla egg rolls (flautas). DELICIOUS.  Shot a game of pool in the back of the bar.  21+ to enter. Great moderate noise level, friendly staff, good lighting, cleans bathrooms, stocked pool table.

UPDATE: 7/10/2019

Today I got a burger with American cheese, bacon, and extra onions. I've got to say, I have found my new favorite burger place and that goes for all of US as far as I'm concerned. I don't know what they put in it but it's got me coming back for more.
Just look at the photo and you can see the pickles are perfectly sliced thin, crispy, they're not too thick, the onions are sliced perfect, tomatoes are sliced perfect and all laid out in the right order. The shredded lettuce is just enough to hold it all together and keep things from sliding off. The buns are toasted perfectly. All together every bite was great. I hate when you buy a meal like a burger and every other bite, or only three or four bites, are good. Every bite of this burger was balanced with everything. That's a hard thing to do.
Keep up the good work!

Ok, I do not understand how this place receives 3.5 stars. 
Staff are amazingly friendly and professional. Food is fantastic. Easy in and out. Big diverse menu. Real quality meat. What else could you ask for?
I have hade the classic cheesesteak with extra cheese about 7 times now. Always great. Hot, fresh, packed with yumminess.
I tried the French Dip recently and it's now my absolute fav in Boise area. The AuJus is rich and piping hot. Good flavor, not watered down. 
I will share a "mishap" that happened yesterday though. 
I ordered this sandwich and got something that didn't even look close to what I had last time. Meat was fine, as usual, but the provolone cheese was grated and lumpy. WHAAAAAT?!?! No go. 
I took it up to the counter and explained politely that doesn't even look good. 
They gasped exactly as I did then after apologizing hurriedly remade a new one. They explained why that happened, which usually I don't care about but because I really like this operation I appreciated, then brought me my delicious masterpiece. 
Ok, maybe not masterpiece but it was fabulous. Juicy, cheesy, bread was so soft and lightly toasted it was as if it came out of the oven two mins prior. SO fresh. 
Incredible meal. 
Don't forget to get a frequent buyer card and always ask for your military discount (if applicable). They'll ask for proof so no fakeys or posers. 
Get ther
Enjoy

Was looking for something good to eat and Peí Wei hit the mark. Peí Wei is awesome as far as airport food goes. Everything was delicious and well prepared. Service was excellent. Great dining experience.

This was my first wine bar after moving from Atlanta to St Pete. What makes this place so freakin awesomely versital is the layout and multiple seating options. It has a nice but small bar around the bartendar that seats about 10 people. It has another ledge and stool chairs that acts as a bar (but no bartender there). It has multiple tables and sitting areas to accomodate groups of people. And it has a couple of handsome sofas (and not something that looks like it wasa reject picked up on frat row) that allow for an intimate experience that great for a date where you could actually carry on a conversation. They even have a very small patio area too - only big enough for a small group though.

There are waiters assigned to the seating areas, so this is not one of those help-yourself to a wine spout on the wall establishments. They also have beer here if you want to be that way but no open bar. 

The reason I chose this as the first wine bar was because it did look elegant and not like some hole in the wall but also b/c it was the only one open until Midnight on a Friday. Most of the other wine bars in the area close at 10pm! Wussies. 10pm is a pathetic closing hour for a wine bar on a Friday night.


What also makes this place kinda cool and they seem to always have events or specials or something going on here. From the calendars I've seen they seem to consistently have a "SUPER" happy hour every last Friday of the month that last from 4pm to Midnight.

My only complaint was the music. No, the volume was fine; it was suicide-inducing theme that ran with every song selction. You know - sad Adel songs, Bruno Mars songs and the like. I'm like - are they purposely playing these depressing tunes to engage you to drown more of your sorrows in more wine?

We'd go back though. Hopefully Pandora or whatever they decide to play will be less depressing.
This is an updated review after trying their gluten-free shroom burger and fries. The gluten-free bun was thick and soft, but a bit crumbly. The fries were very good. Overall great GF burger.
Considering this is actually a chain, their pizza is fairly decent. They have a very thin crust option and the prices are reasonable.

Well, the low stars may be our own fault. We didn't realize they aren't always open and we came during low-season. So, when we went in the only options for us to choose from were ribs and pulled pork. We also got the baked beans and cole slaw.

The ribs were good, very moist. The pulled pork was nothing special. We did like the hot BBQ sauce (mild was very bland), and the sides we ordered. They felt bad they were out of all their food and did throw in extra ribs and pulled pork to help make up for it. Because of their great service, we will definitely come back during a busier time (maybe Summer?) and give them another shot!

Home away from home, Fat Dan's is one of my favorites! 

Love the bartenders, love the wings, Wednesday's they have a killer meatloaf sandwich, great rotating craft beer selection and of course all of the Chicago sports games your heart desires!

Go Cubs!

Dick and Jenny's used to be one of my favorite restaurants.  It fell out of my rotation when I couldn't count on being there before opening to secure a table or late enough to avoid an hour or more wait (no reservations accepted).  I had heard that the restaurant changed hands and intended to revisit.  Finally I did and was happy with the results.  Despite there being no cocktail list on the menu, I was able to impress upon the waiter my interest in a well crafted cocktail and was rewarded with an ingenious beverage involving gin, cilantro, muddled cucumber and other things.  It was rather delicious.  The appetizers including crab cakes, portabello blue cheesecake, and something resembling a pasty were phenomenal.  My lamb shank was very good as well.  I could give this restaurant 5 stars, but a couple of the sauces were not quite as good as everything else.  I will definitely return.
Absolutely the best burger ever. Staff is very friendly. Place is very clean. Love that they have real milkshakes.....First time there and will definitely be back. Worth the 20 minute ride.

This is the best meal I've ever had in Philly and one of the top 3 ever.
Yes, there is best steakhouse, and best Italian, etc.. etc, but for an American/Continental menu this is tops.
I lost track of how many tastings they brought, but they were all wonderful.
Fried Turnip strips with powdered sugar. Liquid ravioli with crab. Something with bacn foam on top. It just went on and on every 10 minutes and each was perfect.
Salad with 5 lettuces' had a wonderful dressing and the Pork app. was wonderful. 
Poached lobster was as good as anywhere and the lobster bisque in a small cup was the best ever. Not thick like most, but more of a hearty type broth. Hard to describe, but if it's on the menu, get it. The chicken was a type of bird from China that was on the small side, but pure white when you cut into it and had a wonderful taste.
My only complaint , and it's minor, was the choice of dessert. The donuts with dipping sauce were not on a par with the rest of the evenings food.
They were a little chewy , not light like I thought they would be. The dipping sauces were good, but next time there were other desserts that I would try.
Service was attentive, parking is what you can find on the street, and at night the place can be a little hard to find, but just look the sign at the corner of 45th and Larchwood.
If people asked me for a BYO in downtown I would say this first and Fond second. If you're in the suburbs then Sycamore, or Lotus Farm to Table in Media.

Yummers!

I went for dinner on a Tuesday and while it was fairly busy, I was seated right away indoors. The outside seating looks great, but it was a tad too chilly for my liking.

While the menu isn't really extensive, the food is particularly good. I got the pasta of the day (the last one) and it was BEYOND delicious. The noodles were house made (!!) along with the sauce. The dish was topped with perfectly cooked chicken and goat cheese. It was delectable. 

My guest had the BBQ brisket and was fairly pleased. 

Several reviews say that the service is a tad slow, and I can agree and disagree to that. I came for brunch a few months back and it was really slow. However, on my most recent trip, I was very pleased with our waiter. He was very good about checking in with. 

I'm sure I will return.

I used to live near the intersection of Bay to Bay and Macdil and the thing I miss most about living there is being walking distance to Datz. It is one of my favorite restaurants in Tampa and where I chose to have my birthday dinner there this year (it fell on a Sunday which would have been a problem in the past, but they are now open until 8 on Sundays).

For drinks, they have a full liquor bar of course. I've had their Bloody Mary before and it's fantastic. However, I'm a big craft beer fan and Datz always has a huge selection of good beers to choose from. And it's not always the same which is even better.

Food is where Datz really shines. The menu is always changing and I always like to try something different when I come here, so while I can't recommend one specific dish, I can pretty much recommend everything. I have never been disappointed by anything I've ordered here. And as if I hadn't had enough to eat already on my birthday, they gave me a free cupcake for desert which was, of course, delicious!

I am very torn.  On the good side - - the room was very clean and new.  I thought the bed was comfortable, my wife did not.  My wi-fi worked and continued to work.  The location was really good, for the tourist things we were doing.  The concierge was helpful in explaining hiking trails near the hotel.  Now for the not so good: getting to/from room took forever, and I thought the staff was not very friendly, excluding the concierge.  The front desk clerk was nice, but gave us a little attitude when we asked him to explain again the best way to get to our room (we were almost as far as you can be from the front desk; had to walk outside to another building, take one elevator up; walk down a hallway; then take another elevator up; then walk down a hallway).  When we ordered a drink from the bartender on New Year's Eve, she did not say a word, other than "do you want to run a tab or pay now."  How about, hello, thank you, have a good night, Happy New Year.  We checked out via the tv, but had a question about the bill.  The person who answered the phone to answer our question was very nasty.  

I do not like "resorts" where exercise room and/or spa are not in main building.  You should not need to walk outside to get to exercise room or spa.

Views are amazing.

I question whether it is proper to charge a resort fee.  I question even further whether it is proper to charge tax on the resort fee.

Read the menu, order at the front, get a number. This adorable little gem has great breakfast lunch and dinner. I highly recommend the Tumeric Latte. They also have WiFi! You can walk around the town afterwards as well

Visiting from Dallas and wanted it to be so much better. Let's start with the positive. We received very good service at the bar and it's a nice environment.  Sadly, the food is mediocre at best and for the price just not good. The wedge salad and the Mac and cheese are very good. The steak, oysters and baked potato no better than what you'd get at Outback. The spinach, or cheese with green stuff mixed in, is truly awful.  I'd say go to the bar for drinks but avoid the food.  Somehow 2 of us managed to spend $265, including tip, for a $75 meal. Sadly, not going back.

Oh my gosh! This brewery may be tucked away, but they're putting out some great beer and awesome food in this little unassuming place.

Parking available behind the building (on the west side) with doors in the front and the back. The bar takes up a lot of room inside, but there's plenty of seating available. Mark and team is making some great brews.. I'm a big fan of the Coconut Porter and the Big Ed IPA (throwback to the days of ATA) is always a winner. I've heard they're currently making the third batch of this IPA that was originally supposed to be a limited release.

Now, you could stop just with the beer and be quite happy, but if you're hungry, you owe it to yourself to take a look at the food menu and grab a bite to eat. The kitchen is in the basement and the chef puts out some killer grub. Nope, no simple fried bar food here. Instead, you can get a great salad or a sandwich or even an entree that will go great with whatever you're drinking. 

I'm keeping this place on my radar.. I think they're gonna explode before too much longer in popularity and it'll be tough to get into.

I really want to like bryn and dane's because their concept is so great, but every time I go to any location I am disappointed. I agree wholeheartedly with some of the prior reviews expressing that this place delivers anything but FAST food. I went to the Bryn Mawr location for breakfast on a Sunday morning. The place was deserted and yet they still took about 20 minutes to make two egg wraps, one smoothie, and sweet potato hash. Totally unacceptable! No sense of urgency and overall, the staff seemed like they had no idea what they were doing. No greeting when I arrived and no apology when they took forever to make my order, looking like bewildered, incompetent idiots the whole time. Very frustrating and irritating experience, and I won't be back to the Bryn Mawr location ever again. They really need to work on training their employees and making sure they know how to make what is on the menu quickly. I don't think that's too much to ask.

Ordered 2 sides of naan only.  Arrived at restaurant 20 mins after order was placed.  Waited 10 mins for the bread to come out.  When I got home,  the bread was burnt on the outside but the spinach and cheese was cold inside.  Won't be back,  at least not for takeout.  Despite there only being  3 or 4 seated tables,  apparently they were too busy to simply put naan in the oven when I called it in ...  I wasn't the only person waiting for takeout either.

My boyfriend and I love this place for a low key dinner out. It's great when you can't decide where to go, because this place has everything! Literally the most extensive menu ever. Yes, it is often full of senior citizens, but I don't mind that lol! It tastes like home cooking and the portion sizes are large enough to get two meals out of it. 
Recommend getting the soups, any hot sandwiches and the strawberry cheesecake is to die for!

What a neat little family and dog friendly area downtown Tampa! It feels like a festival all the time. Different food "trucks" lined up in old shipping containers. And at the end a Bowling alley with great food! Beer, wine, grassy area with corn hike boards. Shade umbrellas, and security for safety. Check it out!

Me and my wife stopped in for happy hour on Weds night @5:30. The place wasn't busy yet. We sat there for 20 mins before anyone came to our table. I ended up waiting 45 min to get a beer. The first beer I ordered  came after 15 mins of ordering it and it was flat. I took it up to the counter to let them know. The rude waitress told me to go sit down and they would pour me another beer. When I told her that I thought ther must be an issue with the keg. She repeated harshly for me to take a seat and they would pour me another of the same beer . I then went and found our actual waitress and told her I wanted a different beer. The other waitress came over and told her to pour me another of the same beer . Again telling me to go sit . We got our food and I tried the Caesar salad. The salad was drowning in dressing that  was like watered down mayonnaise. There was something in a small condiment cup that looked and tasted like it had been scraped off of the bottom of the fridge. Finally after 45 mins my beer was delivered to me. We had ordered the " special which was falafel plate .It  was deep fried to the point where it was hard to bite into. I opted not to eat any of the food . My wife was hungry so she nibbled at the gross food. I wanted to send it all back , pay for our drinks and leave but instead we left most of the food on our plates finished our drinks. Paid for the disgusting food and left a nice tip for the poor service. Not going back to this place . It's sad because we like the atmosphere and it has been fun taking friends from out of town there. Never again. Our actual waitress was nice and friendly and was juggling tables while the nasty waitress chatted with a table of friends , she also almost did a faceplant because of the inappropriate shoes she was wearing.

So I had to come back and update my review after getting in to try some of this food......MY GOODNESS!!! I wanna curl up and just lay on the plate with the food! I'm from Atlanta but I promise, I'm coming to this place every time I'm in town.  I wish they could mail me some of the wings!!!! The women were very friendly even after I fussed before!!!!  Dope!!!
I love the variety of bagels they have. There's something for everyone. I try to come on Mondays  for the $7 Baker' s Dozen.

Tried Applebees again after a long hiatus due to bad service and I was reminded why I should never have gone back.  10 min wait to be seated, no big deal, but after we were seated, we weren't even acknowledged!  Not a single person came by to take our drink order or even to say they will be right back.  No manager in site, so we just left.  I have never done that before but more than 15 min waiting at the table is ridiculous.  People who came in after us had their drinks already.

Had a hankering for some kalbi and nengmyun after a hot hot eagles game. The food is not bad it's on par with the surrounding Korean restaurants in the area. Their service game is lacking though, we pretty much had to ask for everything and there was no smile or any warmth with the service. It's kinda off putting when you're eating and you have to ask for simple things constantly with a cold ok. I felt like I was bothering my server and usually I don't mind if my server isn't very talkative but this was more like she was not wanting to be there. Oh well maybe it was a bad day. Regardless if you're in the area it's not a bad place to get food just don't expect exceptional service.
This is a favorite for birthday dinners or special events. Entertainment and dinner all in one. Food is delicious and huge servings, come hungry.

My husband and I stopped into Flipper's last night to sample there pizza. We just moved down to the area from Long Island NY and we are vey familiar with "NY PIZZA". We ordered the cheese bread and medium size pepperoni pizza. We were pleasantly surprised with both items. The crust was not too dense and very fresh. As soon as we sat down we were greeted by "Grant" who was extremely friendly and offered many suggestions being that we we first timers at Flipper's. They also have happy hour specials on wine, and craft beers. It truly was an enjoyable experience!! Thanks again Grant!!

As a long-time fan of Restaurant BT and impeccable Chef BT, I was initially a little skeptical of this casual "to go" concept. But I have now enjoyed several lovely meals at BT to Go, and everything has been terrific.  This is a great spot for a quick bite, or a lite lunch, or some healthier alternatives to take on the boat. My favorites are the bahn mi sandwiches and the chicken cabbage salad. Teas are good, as well as wonderful fresh rolls, what more could you ask for? This place is fabulous.... Thank you, Chef BT, we love you and really love your food.

I'd give them a 0 if I could. The owners were completely rude and asked us to wait outside in the cold with a 5 month old baby. We opted to leave and go to Sitar instead where they are very family friendly.

I ordered take out even though everyone had pointed out how terrible their customer service is. They were nice in my opinion, placing the order and picking up the order there really weren't any problems. the food was what i had a trouble with, I order Pho Ga, it just felt like something was missing in it... not sure what but there was an overpowering taste of star anise and cloves in it which was a big turn off... also when they gave me condiments, they put siracha (even though i asked for chili sauce that had the flakes) and hoisin sauce all in the same container so it was mixed together and it just didn't help at all. so for me the service was good but the food was okay.
Place is good for drinks.Kieran is clueless by best.Wouldn`t come back to this place again.

Since we were new to the area and it was our first day at the Madeira Beach.  We went to Yelp to find a place.  The Boardwalk Grill had amazing reviews, so we decided to check it out.  We were not disappointed. Great very friendly service.  AMAZING FOOD.  Decent Beer selection (has local options).   I highly recommend the Fish and Chips, Grouper Sandwich, Onion rings.

Me and my friends went to this nice Cafe down on 4th Ave in Tucson. Once we paid they made the Crepes right next to the register so you can see the process. The cashier was also really nice in explaining everything to us since it was our first time in this cafe.

While we waited They had a few board games to let the customers play at their tables which was really nice. Out of the 4 people in our group, we got two breakfast crepes, and 2 desserts, and they were well worth the visit.

EDIT: I forgot to mention. The portions are huge. As you can see from the photos, you do get your money worth,

If you are near any other Steak 'n Shake go to it. This one has really gone down on service and cleanliness. The sign said "Please wait to be seated" so we waited five minutes for someone to come and give us a table. We then waited for fifteen minutes for someone to come to our table to take our order along with a drink order. We never did get any water. 

He ordered a steak burger with thousand island dressing on it. I ordered chili Mac with a steak burger with mustard and onion.   Of course his burger had no dressing on it. My steak burger with onion was laughable.  It had one piece of onion on it. NO, NO!!  Not a slice of onion - one piece of onion. After waiting a while for our food, we were not about to complain about anything and have it taken away to get it fixed. 

As we paid our bill at the counter, we both looked at the floor behind it and it was horrid. French fries and trash all over the floor. I'm amazed no worker slipped and fell. 

Would I come back here?  No, I'll go the extra miles to the one on Hampton Avenue. I won't catch you on the flip side here.

I am in Nashville for a bachelorette party. My flight arrived a good four hours before everyone else and I decided to check out Five Points for a few hours. I was told by Uber driver that we were going to the 'hipster' part of town - East Nashville, and according to Yelp, he also dropped me off at the most hip coffee place in the city. Thank god I didn't wash my hair today and chose to wear a black wide brimmed flimsy hat and combat boots (seriously). 

For what this place has to offer, it does its job well. Great coffee, and a good place to read or laptop browse for a few hours. I would say this isn't the best place is you're looking to study intently- People watching is distracting and in general there are no nooks or crannies that you can stick yourself in to have some privacy. 

It is great for what it is- a little hide away to grab some coffee to start your morning and do some reading with a generally quiet crowd that keeps to itself. The baristas weren't assholes to me but maybe it was my hat that helped me blend in ;)

We got there on a $10 steak and jazz/blues night. Everything was delicious. I believe they were a little understaffed that night, so it took a long time to get our food. Also, our waitress rarely showed up to check up on us. Other than that, the steak was delicious. 

You guys should definitely try the crab and shrimp dip. It's to die for!

Top notch local food!  If you like hole in the wall restaurants with fresh local food, this is your place.  Super veggie and meat entree options.  Unique food and drink combinations.  Highly recommend & I eat out a ton! Small restaurant with limited seating. Worth the wait.

Sunday afternoon five of us decided to try this restaurant for the first time. Several of the group had one had homemade Indian another had never had eaten Indian, two were very familiar with Indian. We opted for the buffet, that had multiple options, to include butter chicken, tandoori chicken, Nana, 2 rice options, desert, salad, and other dishes I can't name. Service excellent. Waiters refilled drinks, brought extra Nan. We all loved it! One of our party was 88 years old and a work traveler. He said he will be back. This is a hidden Indian gem in Oldsmar.

I'm never disappointed when I come to Tierra. The portions are huge and the food always tasty. The service can be a bit slow once it's time for your check so don't go when you're in a rush. Some delicious plates I've had have been: avocado and mango salad with either chicken, churrasco steak or salmon (all delish), mofongo, sampler platter, Cuban sandwich, medianoche sandwich, garlic shrimp, churrasco/skirt steak with sides, fruit drinks, breakfast platters and more. Come with an appetite and be satisfied.
Really enjoyed dinner Friday night and they have live music. Very underrated place and would definitely go back.

My absolute favourite thing to get from the Duchess is their Coconut Cream Pie. Best coconut cream pie I have ever had. After eating anything from the Duchess, anything from a grocery store bakery doesn't cut it anymore. I don't even like macarons but the ones from here are my only exception. I always get the pastries to go, though -- it's way too crowded in there usually. That isn't something I would take a star off for, though.

Tex-Mex fast food, chain store variety. That being said, it's typically pretty good considering its chain store fast food. For the love of God, get rid of the corporate mandate making employees yell "welcome to moes" every time somebody walks in the door.

Great Gyro- ask for the sauce on the side. They put way to much on the Gyro for my taste... great mid-day stop- has a nice St. Louis feel... 
Side note- cross the street at your own risk! McCausand traffic stops for no man or red light for that matter...

Had the whole pig banh mi and the brisket. Both were delicious. Friendly folks. Small seating area inside. Since it's so close to Masterman HS avoid going in right when school lets out due to crowds. About 20 hungry teenagers descended on the place directly after (thankfully) I ordered. Definitely will be coming back here!

Great food! I'm so shocked by these other reviewers' low scores. I got the Salmon Benedict and it was EXCELLENT. 

The only turn off at this restaurant was the rather cold hostess. Our waiter was excellent however! I forget his name but he was an older gentlemen with excellent service. For example, he saw us trying to take a selfie and offered to take the photo for us!

Figure out your auxiliary staff's cold demeanor and you've basically got it made! Will return.
Been here many times and never been disappointed. Great food and beer selection. Many different options of seating. Staff very friendly and constantly asking if we were satisfied.

Hidden gem is correct! Breakfast was awesome. I had a ny bagel with egg, cheese and fresh spinach. My girlfriend  had the breakfast burrito. We found both extremely delicious! The customer service was great, we even got a hug from April. I highly recommend hard to find this kind of comfort in St Pete.

If you want to have a good time out with your friends this is an awesome place to go. The food on the other hand was a different story. I had the ribs and they were dry and very charred. I couldn't finish them. The side items included macaroni and cheese, collard greens, and slaw. I was not impressed with any of these. All were flavorless and the greens weren't fresh at all. It was like they were taken right out of can and put on my plate. I will give them refit for the presentation of the meal. It was spot on. The staff was friendly and overall I had a great time there. I will go back just to hang out and enjoy the music with friends but I don't think I'll eat there.

One of my go to favorites.  Brisket  sandwich is my first choice. Try the salmon. So moist and tasty. Best I've ever had. Lots of food. Staff is so friendly.  They go out of their  way to make sure your taken care of. Nice to go where you can see memorabilia  of people who fight for our freedom and save lives making us safe in public.
Love the different pizza's they offer. Great service, and great pizza. Won't go anywhere else now.

Highly recommended for a weekend brunch date! Trendy atmosphere, not too crowded, attentive service, fresh ingredients and overall great meal!  First of all the Bloody Mary was amazing. Spiced just like I love it. I had the short rib hash. The ingredients were very fresh, I highly recommend this dish. Let me turn this over to my beautiful GF to describe her dish. :) I ordered the breakfast sandwich. Brioche bun, avocado, egg, bacon, with a side salad-what more could you want?!  Go here for brunch!!
We went here for our 9 yr wedding anniversary. The views are beautiful, the food was very good, the service was great!

Definitely the trendiest-looking Vietnamese restaurant I have ever dined in. You can tell it's not your usual pho spot when you walk in and there's no smell of fish sauce lingering around. 

My group decided to let me choose my post-Broad Street Run brunch. I asked them how Le Viet's Cafe Sua Da is and it took no further discussion. After twenty minutes of circling the blocks around Le Viet, we found parking (thank Buddha, I was starving). The restaurant wasn't too busy for a Sunday during brunch hour. Worked out well for us and we were seated right away.

Since I knew I was going to be gorging at some type of buffet in the evening as my BSR reward to myself, I opted for small items. I ordered Goi Cuon, Banh Xeo, and a Cafe Sua Da. Little did I know, the appetizers were not small at all. The Goi Cuon was stuffed with noodles, a little too much in my opinion. But the dipping sauce was delicious.

The size of the Banh Xeo was on a different level. It was probably the size of a cheesesteak! Unlike traditional restaurants that overfill the Vietnamese crepe with bean sprouts, this one had a lot of pork and shrimp, very tasty. Beware, the dish is served with a tremendous amount of vegetables that you will probably not finish.

My Vietnamese iced coffee finally arrived after my meal was almost finished. Not sure what took so long, but the server apologized. It was ready to drink in a plastic cup with a straw, no drip cup necessary.

Good company and good food helped ease the soreness from running ten miles, until I had to get up. I had a good experience at Le Viet and will be back soon!

The menu reads really interesting, some really interesting sandwich concepts, but they don't eat like they read. The sandwich ideas are awesome, the execution on them just doesn't hold up. Regular deli turkey on the turkey sandwich? It says citrus sous vide, but I don't taste it. Maybe I was expecting something more, but I wasn't expecting regular old deli meat at this sort of craft style sandwich shop. Maybe I came in with incorrect expectations of what Tasso was going to be. The bread, and let me preface this by saying LOVE crusty baguettes, was hard to eat. This bread would be perfect with some soup, but not in a sandwich. The roof of my mouth was destroyed after the sandwich, but r takes more than that to get me to put down a sandwich so I continued.. The rest of the toppings were good, but nothing amazing. The pickle was drastically, like somebody messed up on the amounts of the brine, salty.. so much that I couldn't even eat it. The side of mojito cucumber salad was plain and boring and not seasoned at all. Somebody forgot the seasoning or vinaigrette. Wasted 4.00 on that side, I took one bite and just put it to the side. Thankfully.. the meal was saved by the cheapest, insignificant addition to the meal, the popcorn. The popcorn (self serve) was great. I'm guessing curry or garam masala is the spice, but it's a great snack to have with a sandwich. 

I hope they work on the execution in the kitchen and shore up some of the recipes, I'd love to come back and try a different sandwich! They do read well, I hope some of the others have a bit better execution.

Great diner-esque food with a huge pastry bakery case up front. My friend and I were getting hungry and I've seen signs all over for Ponzio's and thought it would be a great time to check it out.

Our first server was a little..odd. But she had to leave half-way through and the next server was ok, but she was semi staring at us once in awhile. This was about 5pm on a Saturday and it was packed. 

To start out, the green bean fries were tasty and the philly cheesesteak spring rolls were super hot, crispy and flavorful. Being as hungry as I was, and knowing I can't actually eat that much I wanted something I could easily heat up the next day as well. Answer- chicken parm with a side of angel hair pasta. Huge portion! Everything was cooked perfectly with a really nice tomato sauce. My friend got a Reuben and loved every bite.  

The menu was large with a copious amount of options. I was deciding between shrimp scampi, strip steak, blackened chicken wrap.. I was on the point of being hangry, but the chicken parm hit the spot.

I had a reservation last night with my friend at 7:30 pm. I got there at 6:45 and asked the lady if she can get me a spot for two little early. Though the restaurant was busy I saw many empty tables. She said she will get me seated asap. She got me seated right at 7:30 after my white friend asked her if she could sear us how. The person who is incharge of reservations is a total racist. Made me wait for 45 mins and didn't offer to sit at bar or even water.

How about using some soap and water !!!
so worried about social distancing!  

Not busy at all and worried about too many at a table worry about soap and water on your dishes.   Masks are too much.



Another chance at what ? 
Taking my money 
Not caring you has the recovery moment and failed !

Surprise ....surprise..... Don't judge this place by the outside, stop in and try it. Went with a couple of friends after work, we ordered wine flights, fondue,and a cheese plate all was enjoyed! Owner is very friendly ,  so are the patrons, Will return soon,

Finally a place to eat right by the water on delaware ave!!  Not only is the food really good but the entire staff is super friendly.  You can always find the owners just chilling and talking with all the customers.  Whether you just want a coffee or a quick bite to eat this place is perfect! Oh and did I mention the food is awesome!!!

I can't figure out if they're understaffed or just not good behind the bar.  I know it's not a wine bar but asked for a broad description of a red wine I was answered with, "I'm not a wine drinker."  

I ordered a burger with an egg and was asked about all the extras...lettuce, tomato, onion and I said, "yes.  I'll take them all."  I received none...

When I received my food it was without silverware.  I waited for over 8 minutes and then went to a nearby table to get my own.

The burger was decent and the fries were crisp.  

Unless you're a cute dude, service will be slow at the bar.  Not terrible but not a place I'll be back to anytime soon.  And I live in the neighborhood.

Stopped in here on a whim while in the neighborhood and was blown away. This city has so many great cheesesteak joints that it's easy to judge if it's going to be good or not but this spot hit it out of the park. Got a chicken cheesesteak, and they use real marinated chicken breast which was deliciously awesome, and it was huge!!! I refuse to eat the chicken steak that other places sell, stuff is fake! A plus was that they sell beer too so I got a Lagunitas IPA to wash it down. Definitely will be back to try the regular cheesesteak which looked awesome as well. I also like that they chop the steak. Definitely top 5 steak i've ever had in philly hands down.
nice inexpensive eat. very casual great place to spot for a bite at all hours
The bagels were very good and the bagel and egg sandwich was delicious. Also the coffee was excellent. The people that work there were very nice and I highly recommend this place.

I hate places that brag about their local heirloom ingredients and then serve the same crap everyone else does. Since when did grape tomatoes become heirlooms? Local vegetables in January? Hardly likely. Be honest and admit you are a bar with average food with above average prices. Service was snotty and you really felt like they were doing you a favor by coming to your table. Serve cream or at least something white with the coffee, maybe the heirloom heritage cow was off for the day?

Wasn't horrible.  First time visit. What made me visit was the photo of the shrimp and grits they posted on Facebook. (Sponsored post, I believe)  I see a lot of reviews that rave about the cheesy grits, so I had high expectations!  Unfortunately, I was let down.  The price was $12.99. Not outrageous, but I felt there could have been more grits on the plate. The plate was very shallow, but wide.  As for the taste of the grits, I was ready to have awesome, cheesy grits, but to me, they were lacking in cheesy flavor. The shrimp were flavorful and cooked well. The bacon in the dish was excellent, so it wasn't a complete bust, but I would not order it again. My wife had an omelet which she said was very tasty.  If we go back, I would like to try the fried green tomatoes.  That is IF we go back.

Servers were extremely nice, still waiting for food after almost an hour. Would not be so bad, but I am tired of listening to hip hop and r&b in a Cajun restaurant. Has a nightclub feel to it. Being a Louisiana native, sounds like staff is screwing with the radio.
It's okay if you want a drink and some cheap bar food, like fried this or fried that, but don't order the brisket. It's the first time I ever had brisket that seemed more like SPAM.

My Boyfriend and I would come here every Wednesday for margaritas and dinner.  Normally, when Brittany was working, it would be an exceptional evening.  Tonight was absolutely terrible.  The server we had acted like she didn't want to serve us.  We had to get our own menus, and basically beg for utensils and napkins.   The food was ok, not exceptional like usual.  I'm very disappointed in what was our every Wednesday go to date spot.  We will no longer be coming back and this disappoints me.
I ordered the night before from Doordash the earliest delivery possible. Woke up to the most delicious donuts EVER!!!!!! THANK YOU PANA!!!!!

Great service I made reservations place was
Packed - wld be a great place to get tipsy w friends but (thats my old life) took left overs home they were sooooo good the next morning

I go to the Publix on Kingsway where this restaurant is near a lot, and thought I would give this place a try. I ordered the Chinese BBQ Ribs, and was quite pleasantly surprised. Instead of the usual "kibbles and bit's" you get when you order BBQ Ribs at most Chinese places, I got 4 full sized meaty ribs, cooked to perfection, with a very tasty Chinese BBQ Sauce all over them.
Yum!
They were served over a bed of really outstanding pork fried rice. I could barely finish all that food, so I took home the Egg Roll, and gave it to my friend. 

Service was great, and even though all the few tables in the place were full, the owner actually moved menu's and decorative stuff off an unused corner table, so I had a place to eat. 

I will be back here for sure, the next time I get a craving for Chinese Food In Brandon.

We like this Wendy's a lot. It is our go to fast food option and you often will catch us here Sunday afternoon. The restaurant is clean and updated. The staff is super kind and has even remembered who we are and what we order (shout out to Angie). We like the 4 for 4 option because its cheap and a lot of food. They always have fresh baked cookies too, which I am a sucker for. 

See you next Sunday, Wendy's!
Some of the best tacos in FL. There's so many different combinations, there is literally something for everyone. And oh the sangria is spot on. I wanna try everything. IG: Food4YouGlobal

The more unique items on the menu are the best, especially the burgers. The Bavarian Burger rocks as does the one on the Pretzel bun. The Greek salad with chicken is awesome and all of their salads are HUGE as well as their chocolate cake!

I was excited to see another food place open in IV but it was super disappointing...
We went the first day it opened when they were giving out buy one get one free coupons outside. I forgot to show the cashier my coupon and asked him if he could give us a free grilled cheese since it's buy one get one. He said no because the purchase already went through but told us we can use it next time. I thought okay that's fine we'll probably come back! 
When our grilled cheese with added bacon came out it was SUPER dry and TINY... there were about 2 pieces of dry bacon in there cut into tiny strips of four to fit the equally tiny sandwich. Tater tots were good, but not worth the price.
I won't be going back to use that coupon :(
Good prices, noodles are some of the best coming from a restaurant chain I've ever had.

What a little gem! The menu is diverse, the ambiance charming. Our server was helpful, patient and had great recommendations- very knowledgeable too. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town. Better than any vegan joint I've tried in Miami (Miami seems to thinks all vegans subsist off of smoothies, juices and acai bowls exclusively).

Good vibes and an even better burger! 

I've been here twice now, and the servers are super friendly and attentive. I'm happy to see places like this pop up on the west side of town.

Good music! Great patio with board games and cornhole!

What doesn't this place have? Live music, delicious food, and bomb cocktails all around.

Cocktails - Persephone's Downfall and Lavendar Lace. Do it.

Food: Three Muses Fries are a can't-miss. Mac and Cheese with brussel sprouts--I didn't even know I liked brussel sprouts until I had these. I really liked that they give you a small or large portion option.

Service: Wonderful. Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.

Venue: Live music. Made me feel like I was in a dreamy intimate jazz club. Which I was!

Only Con: We got the best table in the house however, it was right near the door so people kept swinging it and hitting V. Hilarious, but he was losing patience. Get a spring for that door yo!

**Only takes 2-3 credit cards per table I believe.

Friendly home cooked meals, great food great prices always busy when we went in. All the waitresses at each of the diners we went to offered service with a smile. The sweet tea was great, loved the chicken fried steak. The grits were cooked to perfection and the pork chop was awesomely seasoned. Dots Diner Definitely pleased and should be tried when you go to NOLA!

It was my first time visiting Nola!! This place came highly recommend for my local friends. So of course we had to find out for our selfs. It was a 5 min walk from the hotel which was nice. The atmosphere was very nice and welcoming we ordered the p and j oysters. We didn't pay close to the what the menu said and how they were prepared. But when they arrived they were green and delicious!! We both ordered sandwiches that were very tasty and filling. i recommend if you ever get a chance you should give it a shot!!

Food was fantastic....fresh, delicious and upscale Mexican. We went with a party of 10 and had Nick as our waiter. He was extremely knowledgable about the menu and his recommendations were spot on. Will absolutely go back!

I've been consistently impressed with Byrd & Barrel. I've ordered the Mother Clucker sandwich (to go) a handful of times. Last night I ate at the restaurant and had the smoked wings and poutine. Everything has been outstanding. The dry rub on the smoked wings is killer... just the right balance of sweet & spicy. The poutine was all around delicious; it's heavy, but not overly so. I've tried the tater tots, too, which also have that killer seasoning on them. If you like chicken, you owe it to yourself to check this place out. I haven't used the drive thru, but it's a great feature to have. The food has always been prepared quickly, as well.

I'm a born and raised Santa Barbaran and for those visiting, it's definitely the place to go if you want seafood and a great atmosphere.  It's always full, no matter what night and expect a 15-30 minute wait, but you can go for a walk while waiting or have a drink.  

The food is awesome although I generally go for the a la carte items.  Their best in my opinion are:

Oysters Rockafeller - best I've had at any restaurant. Always get them. 
Beer boiled shrimp
Oyster Shooters
Baked climbs
Calamari - they are known for their calamari.

The staff is always great and usually cute girls. Prices are good and the view of the harbor is awesome. I suggest you ask to wait for an outside table for better views and a bit less crowding although you won't have a ton of elbow room wherever you sit.
