It's defiitely on my top 5 restaurants I go to, especially when wanting to show a friend from out of town, a Santa Barbara experience.
Rather eat McDonald's or Burger King  not a place to go for lunch or dinner it's an embarrassing service

I think this place is a touch overrated, but it's still a solid dining option in the Cherry Hill area. Met some friends for dinner last evening and were seated at a nice booth in the dining room. Ordered cocktails, which took much longer than expected to arrive. We ordered some of their small, shared plates after we ordered the drinks, and those arrived before the drinks showed up. 

We ordered the breads and spreads, the burrata, two of the bloody beet salads, and a cheese plate to start. I highly recommend the bloody beet salad- it had a great yogurt sauce and was just really light and fresh. I could have done without some of the things on the breads and spreads platter- the chick pea fries were a little soggy, but there was an interesting kale fritter thing with a yogurt sauce that was very good. The burrata dish was very unique so props for thinking outside the box! I could have done with less of the toppings and more of the burrata itself. I think the proportions were a bit off. The bread it was served on was basic and forgettable, but the "butternut peperonata" that it was served with was delicious!

I ordered the shrimp & grits, which were good, except that the proportions were off again. Massive grit cakes, and only 4 shrimp. The short ribs were delicious, very tender and, the veggies were great. A friend ordered the seared tuna served on a pesto risotto. The tuna itself was overcooked, but she said the risotto was excellent. The other three ordered sandwiches and raved about them. I think that might be the way to go. Everybody, except myself, had been there several times before, and were raving about the open faced greens sandwich. 

Not sure I'd go back, but now I'm very interested in trying out their Philly location to compare!

This place was cool, casual and delicious. I had grilled swordfish and my wife had cioppino and they were both outstanding. The fish was really fresh and well prepared. The menu is what you would expect with a few surprises given the proximity to the harbor. The clam chowder was delicious as well and from the second floor, the views of the harbor are worth a visit alone!
I stopped by for my daily $1 diet coke. No notice price increase to $1.72, 72% increase. Icing on the cake dealing with long waits. There are plenty of other choices!

Great neighborhood market/coffee shop/bakery/restaurant. There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating includes couches. I recently enjoyed a terrific omelet, which was made to order. The dish included potatoes and my choice of a croissant or cinnamon roll. One downside to the breakfast was the price... with my coffee, I believe it was around $9.
The worst service I've ever received....the waitress was super rude and the management unreceptive and unapologetic. From the moment we walked in...worst experience ever!

There is not much parking in the area for self-parking, which I realize is a common problem for most South Tampa restaurants. Be prepared to valet. Limited vegetarian options, but staff was accommodating and friendly.  Fried green tomatoes (without bacon garnish) was yummy.  Eggs benedict was a little on the bland side. It was good though. Overall I  was satisfied with my experience.

Was looking for something healthy on Google and this place popped up. Never heard of it but was open to giving it a try and will definitely be back. The staff was super friendly and the food was actually really tasty. Being a "healthy, fit restaurant" the taste is often not there for most places but the bowl I got was absolutely delicious. The wait was a bit longer than I anticipated (20min) and it was not crowded but the food prep apologized for the wait when I finally got my food. Definitely recommend!

Zero Stars!!!!  We We went at 11:00 on 4/28/2018.  There were only two  tables occupied and we sat down.  The blond waitress continually walked by our table without so much as an acknowledgment.  I thought, ok, she is there by herself so give her a break.  After a half hour two ladies came in and sat down.  Within five minutes, she walked over there to take their order - 40 minutes and not a word to us...  NEVER AGAIN!!! We walked out.  Not bad service..NO SERVICE!!!!!!

We were headed to the place across the street for oysters but they were so busy. We decided to skip the line and head to Felix's. Well the oysters were just okay. I was expecting a "WOW" factor. I did not receive that at all. The server was meh as well. I think I had high hopes and it was just meh. Not bad but not memorable. We had raw oysters and some other kind with cheese.

The good thing is they get you seated pretty quickly.

Restaurant week and we waited until the last minute to make reservations.  Cafe Napoli was our one choice and it did not disappoint.  I chose not to order off the restaurant week menu because I love the Penne Vodka and have not had it in a while.  Others in our party order from the pre fixe menu.  Lots of good choices Cioppino, Branzino, Linguine with clam sauce, there were a lot of good choices.  Service was great, it was very busy but we had a good time and really great food.

Java is solid, but it's not that great. Further, they are very expensive. I'm talking like a hot chocolate is $1 more than it is at a coffee place just a block away. This is definitely a cool hangout spot though.

My wife and I used to be regulars here,  but we started to try the newer restaurants in town for a change. Last night we decided to go to happy hour and came away disapointed. The muscles were a great price but arrived at our table cold and seemed to be dry. We also ordered Escargot with Roquefort, while it came hot, it lacked the creamyness and garlic flavor we have come to enjoy over the years. The waitress in the bar seemed overwhelmed with the crowd but was pleasant. Maybe they need two for happy hour? The salad was great. However, we had to ask twice for bread. I hope they fix their issues, we used to love Rapscallions.

I've been here more than a few times and every time I go, I'm impressed! The food always has a freshly-prepared-with-love touch to it! If I can't finish my plate, I know my boyfriend will! My favorite sandwich on the menu is the "Big Red" paired with their savory sweet potato fries. However, they offer new specials regularly, so you also have a multitude of options while dining!

This was my first time eating here , a coworker of mine insisted that it was amazing and it really was! Good modern environment and the food was amazing! Seriously from the iced tea , chips and salsa, fried avocado tacos everything was fantastic! Will definitely return!
Great service!!! The seafood was so fresh and the kids menu was filling as well! We do not eat pork and this place has a Seafood Gumbo that doesn't have any meat other than seafood. It was delish!

Had a really great time here again. Service at the bar was great. Happy hour specials keep you full and tipsy (if you are into that). Food was SO good!  Shrimp seviche was flavorful, ahi sashimi was tender and red, and my bfs chicken wings even seemed to have a higher end quality. The prices are a little much during non-happy hour times.
I eat here all of the time and we also use them to cater food to our company regularly. Always good consistent quality and quick service. Recommend for sure

If they had an option for no stars I would definitely rate this "restaurant" that. The best thing I had to eat at this restaurant was the queso...the wait staff was rude and ignored us...the chicken quesadilla had no flavor at all...the steak looked like ground beef and it was overall a disappointing experience especially since they got such good reviews...

Went here on a cheap date night. We started with flaming saganaki for a appetizer, which was delicious. Reminiscent of fondue, it was a nice serving of hot, Greek cheese and wine set ablaze. The flavors, salty and tangy, were fantastic. The appetizer came with two pita breads, which was not enough for the generous portion of cheese. Unfortunately our dining experience went downhill from there. It was a Tuesday and there were at most two other small parties, yet our beverages weren't offered to be refilled until towards the end of the meal. We would have asked for more pita bread for our appetizer, had our server been anywhere to be found. Our Greek pizza arrived after quite a wait. The thin crust was not too thin nor too thick and was the best part of the pizza. The cheese was overly abundant (way too much) and the other toppings scant. Red onion, bell pepper, beef gyro, tomatoes, and kalamata olives sounds yummy, but in such small quantity didn't give much flavor. I was confused as to a single dolmade placed in the middle of the pizza. I love dolmades, but just one on a pizza? Odd. In the end, the Greek pizza was completely lacking in the flavors I love about Greek food. Given the slow service, I was able to fully "appreciate" the "interesting decor." Well, someone definitely loves artificial greenery in cheap hanging baskets. Red vinyl tablecloths provide additional divey feel. The appetizer alone would get four stars. Service and pizza way less. So I will call it two. Not likely to return.

Yum!  Just YUM!  Everything I have had, which is just about everything on the menu, has not disappointed.  My families number one choice when asked should I pick up something for dinner tonight.  I work in the building so my visits are frequent!  Recommend!!
This place is fresh and energetic. The food was exciting and delightful. The manager paid personal attention to the guests and eagerly described the different dishes.

Came in here with a large group and they were very accomodating. The space itself is quite nice with high ceilings and well decorated. 

I was a little skeptical coming in but in the end the food really was quite authentic. I had the hen pho which was a little pricey at 14 dollars but I'm willing to pay a little extra for good food when i'm in the middle of nowhere. The broth was extremely flavorful and it seemed really authentic to me. I also tried the wings and while they were pretty crispy they weren't amazing to me unlike many of the reviews i read. I also tried the grilled porkchop which was pretty good as well; usually its thinner and more flavorful. 

In any case I'm happy to come back here if i'm ever in the area. I'm guessing this is the best viet place in the cherryhill nj area.

Stopped here for some lunch on a Saturday afternoon at about 3PM. No line to order food, we ordered three burgers and an order of crawfish. Took about 25-30 minutes which seemed long to me for not having much business at the time. We got drinks and sat outside while we waited. Sign posted says no alcohol allowed outside but everyone else had pitchers of beer so we just went with it. I tried the Strawberry Basil Lemonade they had as a special I guess, and it was pretty good. I had the Brunch Burger, fried egg on top was cooked perfectly. Burger itself was a little overdone from what I asked but still tasted fine. We got an order of cheese fries to share and those were fantastic. Lots of cheese! My brother says the crawfish were great, they came with two small potatoes and a half of a corn of the cob. I wouldn't go out of your way to come here but it was decent for just stopping by.

The hot chicken nachos are the best in town. I would order these every single time. Be careful with the level of hot you order because it can change a little every day. The mild is a safe choice because the medium was occasionally be a little too spicy. 

I no longer eat meat but if this place ever decides to do a fried tofu I would immediately come back.

such a great coffee place. my first time having stumptown was in new york, so when i stumbled upon this one in the ace a few years ago i was ecstatic. the coffee is excellent, and the atmosphere is unreal. i love thats it's in the ace because that's definitely my favorite hotel in nola

Great place for lunch! Love the buffet. Their salad is usually awesome.,plus I love all the add Ins such as cheese, olives, hot peppers and more.

The staff is always great as well.

One day, we will have to try them for dinne

  I'm going to update my review. I have been back several times since this first review and on occasion I find that the salad is just fair. Sometimes their great salad really pops with amazing flavor. Today it tasted very flat and it's felt or seemed that it had to been out for sometime, and I arrived upon the store opening. The pizza was good as always and I only eat the vegetarian pizza so that's all I can come in on. 

As I love salads, I may not go back as often as I had been since the salads have been somewhat less enjoyable. 

As always the staff is great.

I dig this place. Killer Sunday brunch, awesome atmosphere, fantastic staff! Beer! The backyard is cool especially when they have live music. I would love to give it 5 stars but I can't recommend the prime rib or any steaks we have ordered as they are consistently super fatty and they use a very strong black pepper crust recipe. If that's what you like, you'll be in heaven! :) I order the wings or the pork lately and it's always delicious but brunch is where the party's at. Hoping the Brewery will open again soon, we always had a good time when bands or karaoke were happening!
Excellent venue. The pork was outstanding. The service was great. Located in such a great part of Indy. I HIGHLY recommend this place and will definitely be back.

This is my go to place for burgers but I decided to try thebchick-n-shack. This was a calorie splurge but worth every calorie.  It is  boneless chicken with a crispy coating, herb mayo, and pickle served on a soft bun.  It is fried to perfect without being doused in oil. The crinkle cut fries are good as well. They are not soggy or greasy.  It was a nice evening I dined outside. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Great food, great prices, good service - the rare trifecta!  Kids loved it also, will definitely be back.

The location is just outside the gates of hell. horrible neighborhood!  However the greatest sand which ever made is the Omar Sub. I am not trying to over dramatize it. It is the In N Out double double of sandwhichs. It is made out of ingredients blessed by Angels. Only get this do not share. You will be a rabid crack addict if anyone comes near your sweet sweet treasure.  You should order two in advance to save yourself the extra trip in line

Visited Sahm's on a Saturday afternoon with a group on 5 friends. We sat in the bar area and were waited on promptly! 
Sever was nice! Food was pretty good! I ordered the Nashville chicken bone in hot chicken wings. They definitely weren't hot but seasoned well. They are served with pickles which is awesome and goes with the "Nashville" name.
As a table we also had the Coney Island poutine and a Meatzorilla pizza. 
Poutine was good but just like most stacked fries or nachos the top layer has all the toppings then you have a ton of naked friends/chips left.
The Roadstone Meatzorilla pizza was great! Loaded up with meat and cheese. I would recommend getting it "well done" if you like a crisper bite. Otherwise the pizza was great! 
Also had a blood orange sour from their tap, Five foot freak. It was good but just seemed to be missing "something". 
My only complaint is that they offer certain apps at $3.33 between certain hours. They have the list inside each menu. After our group finally agreed on a few apps the waiter came back as said "I was just informed we aren't doing the discount on weekends". There was no days listed on the app list only times. I'd recommend they remove the advertisement during the weekend or list the days that these items are offered. 
The server did ask if we had a Sahm's card and explained what it was but never offered to sign any of us up even after we all said we were first timers ‍

I think there are two types of people in Tucson. The people that go to Frog & Firkin and the ones that go to No Anchovies. I'm the latter. I love it that I can always find a place to sit on the patio and get a quick slice with my beer. I also love that you can hear the band at Frog & Firkin, but you can still talk to the people your out with! Great place to kick back in!

Even though I have been in Delaware County for a long time, I just recently went to Nick's.   There are only 5 different sandwiches on the menu (roast beef, pork, ham, turkey, and broccoli rabe).   There are some sides like fries and mozzarella sticks and lots of beer.   My dining partner and I split the roast beef and pork  sandwiches.   We ordered combos which means you want it with sharp provolone.   Fries and drinks are not included.   The roast beef sandwich was reminiscent of the old Drexel Ale House in the Bond Shopping Center.   Both sandwiches were tender and replete with gravy so don't come here without expecting to get your fingers dirty.  Service is on paper plates with plastic forks.   Parking is tight.   Sandwiches are around $6.50.   Plain fries are $2.50.

Amazing! A genuine French bakery! Food and service superb! Pain au chocolat straight out of the oven! I had to have two for good measure. Don't get the decaf coffee though...but I guess that's my fault because who orders decaf!...#newbornbabywoes

I have had the pleasure of spending lots of time in Europe.  Mostly France but in Italy and Spain as well.  I love pizza.  Not the soggy, faux cheese kind but real, thin crust, lightly sauced, wonderful taste with high quality ingredients.  Never found that in Tucson until I found Pizzeria Bianco.  Without question the best pizza outside of Europe.  If you don't love it you are a cretin.

Went here for happy hour last night with a few friends and wow! What an awesome happy hour that they have. $4 select rolls. We tried California, pumpkin and avocado which were all fresh. They had a few other options like spicy tuna, salmon Avo, etc.. The chicken and shrimp dumplings were very tasty ($4 each as well). And what can I say about the martinis .. they certainly don't skimp on the alcohol provided in them. Overall, we will be back!

Half & Half is one of my fave brunch spots! Also have always had excellent service! However, on this visit, I ordered the sausage egg cheese biscuit that came with potato's and was pretty disappointed. The biscuit and eggs were great but the sausage was tough and had an odd flavor . The potatoes tasted like metal and had a bad aftertaste. I decided to mention it to the bartender after I paid so not the restaurants fault I didn't order something different  just hope they can make some changes to this dish option going forward.

Travel Tip:  Find out about the best local eateries from your Lyft or Uber drivers.

One of the suggestions from our kind and "Uber" friendly driver (see how I did that? Lol) was Drago's.  He proclaimed they had the best charbroiled oysters, and he told no lies.  The piping hot oysters arrived at the table crusted with Parmesan cheese on top, and swimming in butter.  I grabbed a piece of French bread, gave my best somersault tuck, and dove in!  So rich and flavorful, just sublime.  The spinach dip was tasty as well, but the oysters are a must.
The fried spinach appetizer was out of this world, definitely recommend. I also really suggest the lamb meatballs with saffron rice.  Price was moderate

Let me start off by saying the owners are very nice people looking to improve. Our waitress was a nice young lady but inexperienced. On multiple levels. The oil that came with the amuse bouche was not EVOO. Clear, flavorless oil. The bread was pretty good. If the pasta is home made mine was a few days old. The sauce with my veal appeared to use canned/jarred ingredients. Pizza was undercooked. No color on the crust or cheese. We'll give it a try again in a few months.

Great atmosphere , Venues, vast beer selections  and fresh Food . The selection / variety of food is very good as is the quality  & quantity . The steak alone is 5. Worth the parking issue if u encounter one & there's always valet parking .  If your looking at going after dinner for clubbing etc.. it's fun, festive , great indoor & out with fire tables etc... It dose get fuller the later it gets as it should if ur looking to network , meet up or party with ur friends . Its very well rounded with something for all at the right times. With that said it isnt a place I'd advise parents of young kids to go to on weekend nighit or game nights. They offer entertainment like guest speakers , live music and pay pre-view boxing events etc.. enjoy & peace

I generally love the curry chicken.  I have ordered  twice in last month and both orders were incorrect.  There is no manager to speak to when you are upset. Only children can speak English fluent enough to participate in a conversation but they lack the maturity to problem solve. I'm not sure what has changed here but it's really unfortunate considering that not many places deliver in Plant City.

This was another Yelp search that proved successful.  We searched for nearby eateries and this one came up highly rated as well as the YS had heard some good things about it as well.  

We walked in and it was seat yourself and so we did.  A big open air room with lots of bar stool tables as well as regular tables.  

Our waitress came right up and greeted us and as it turned out had went to high school oh so many years ago with the YS.  How's that for going back in time.  

We ordered up a couple of specials and since they brew their own gin there the YS decided to try a martini.  It and the turkey sandwiches and soup/salad were all quite tasty and decent sized portions.

The service was good and the refills on the soda and water were right on track.  

This looks to be a fun place to hang later in the evening.  We were there with the work day lunch crowd which really started filtering in as we were leaving.  

A fun and tasty stop.  I would try this place again.
Not bad long island iced tea was good but the nachos didn't have much topping on them not near enough chicken

Love love love this place! What a nice little treasure to find. Fast and friendly service, great atmosphere, outdoor seating on the patio in the back and front, nice decor inside, and of course the food was delicious! We ordered specialty drinks Drunk Geisha and Summer Splash. The drinks were perfectly balanced with flavor and alcohol. We had the appetizer of Tam Yum Goon which was similar to crab rangoon but much better quality! And the sweet chili sauce that went with it was to die for. We each got Pho which is a broth with your choice of noodle and protein, bean sprouts, cilantro, spicy peppers, basil and seaweed. You got to add the ingredients  to it with as little or as much as you wanted. We left full and happy and with some leftovers. I highly recommend this place if you like Asian cuisine. We were also told there is live music on the weekends!

I am giving one star because I can't give zero stars. 
Pizza is good,  but so not worth the pain you have to suffer through to eat it there. 
This place is sooooo loud.  Filled with many large parties. None of whom have learned to use their indoor voices.  People talking loudly, even yelling. Ill-l behaved kids running around. Screaming and yelling.
The acoustics in the place also contribute to the intense noise.
Our most recent, and last-never-to-return-again visit, found this place to be so loud that I had to shout to make myself heard to the hostess.
We asked to be seated outside because of the noise inside. 
It had just finished raining,  so the outside table  and chairs were wet. The hostess brought us outside,  placed  menus on the table,  then left saying she would have someone come out to wipe down the chairs and table. 10 min later,  no one came out to help us with that.  We left. 
Won't ever be back.  We WILL Tell everyone we know not to go there if you want to have an enjoyable neal where you can converse in a normal,  conversational tone.

Jerry's State Court Cafe gets four stars from me because of its big effort to provide a gluten free menu. The gluten free menu is huge - pancakes and toast for breakfast and a huge variety of sandwiches for lunch and dinner. There is also a gluten free Benedict that I need to go back and try. My kids loved getting gluten free pancakes off the breakfast menu, pretty much never happened before! The country omelet was pretty good and the bacon was crisp, can't go wrong there. There's tons of seating (the old Elmer's on Fairview) for the many people who seemed to be crowding into the place.

This hip little joint is the first restaurant on The Hill that my husband and I tried when we first moved to STL. One year later it is still the only restaurant we have been to on the Hill. The food is amazing and the staff has always been super friendly. We haven't found anything on the menu that we don't like. Definitely a place we will continue to visit.

My wife and I have been here twice now. The food has all been great. The pork chop and the burgers were both delicious and the restaurants has a great vibe.
Highly recommend it.

Stopped in for coffee and wifi and had a great time. Friendly staff, delicious coffee and pastry, I used Xfinity wifi so idk about theirs. I was able to sit on the front porch and charge my laptop while enjoying my breakfast!
Kathy is the best waitress ever! We had a blast at dennys after a night out! Without her it wouldn't have been nearly as good! Thanks Kathy for the great service and hospitality!
Steak with Lobster Ravioli...steak just OK ravioli REAL BAD all for $20 bucks I think..6 oz steak...overpriced and just not very good at all.
Josh is the best bartender in New Orleans. Thanks for the Sazeracs, oysters and gator. Definitely the best gator we had all week. Til next time...

Their Andouille Crusted Fish is to die for. Best I've ever had. Perfect taste was a sign of a caring chef with a touch of love. Also can't forget how caring were the staff. A real two thumbs up for me!

Red Robin has great food and prices. If you join their rewards program, you get a free burger on your birthday. They have delicious milkshakes and adult beverages. I've always had decent service and quality food.

Suiting from LA, came to eat here. Service and ambience was good. The Oysters Rockefeller were burned and a long curly hair was nestled in the spinach. Gross. My shrimp creole was mediocre. Nothing to rave back home about.

I married into an incredibly picky Vietnamese family, and we came here and absolutely LOVED their pho. Wow. Amazing. We all agreed - their broth was amazing (most importantly), meat was high quality, egg rolls were excellent, and every sauce did not disappoint. And absolutely best of all was our waitress - she was THE BEST! She accommodated our every need. (She has dark hair & glasses & served us last night.) Thank you so much!

The food is typical Wendy's. My issue is with the poor management in being able to produce a restaurant that can serve even a minimal amount of guests in a timely fashion. There was only one person upfront and she had to take orders and serve the finished foods. This made it so incredibly slow. There were only six people in line and we waited for almost 20 minutes. Talk about fast food. In addition, in plan view of the window you could see large amounts of food dropped on the floor. I can't blame the employees,  but only the incredibly poor manafeme

Went back into o'charley's was told they closed at 8pm their was about 20 cars trucks in the parking lot I didn't pay him no attention since it was 815 pm he said look pal I'm serious we are closed I ended going across the street to mcdonalds as of 9 30pm their are still about 10 cars in the parking lot..I was their earlier and had no problems this restaurant..but since I don't like to argue with people I decided just to post here instead

Hip ping pong bar with great cocktails. Tables will fill up in advance its best to make reservations. We did see some parties reserve the red room and another area with DJs and their own waiters. Loved the banksy like art and variety of drinks served.

My Husband gave me a Birthday Dinner Celebration  on February 2 , 2019 .  We sat inside , however we took many pictures on the balcony. Very beautiful site . Service was great . Food was amazing. Anika did a excellent job taking care of the Birthday Queen , Hubby and our Friends. Anika , Thank you .

Edley's was recommended by a local during our visit to Nashville. Having grown up on the south, this is hands down THE BEST BBQ EVER!  

When we arrived, their power had been out and had just barely come on. They had told us that it might be a little bit of a wait to cook our food and to pay. However we had our food within 10 minutes.

I had the special of the day, which was a barbecue pork sandwich with grilled peaches, called Sweet Georgia Brown.  My husband had the hot chicken platter. Both were amazing. The plug of coleslaw had an amazing sweet vinegar taste, nothing I have ever had before. The grits casserole were amazing with the Gouda cheese base, jalapeños, pepper and onion. They were definitely a must try. The baked beans melted in your mouth.  We also had drinks from the bar. My husband had a Mohito which was quite tasty. But my bourbon cocktail was something that made you feel like you were sitting on an old porch in a rocking chair, sipping from an old Mason jar. To end our night, we shared a piece of pecan pie which tasted just as good as my mom's homemade pie.

Not only was the food absolutely delicious, but the service was quick, even with their power outage, friendly and above superior. In fact, when we went back up to pay, the manager whoever was in charge, told us that we did not need to pay and thanked us for our patients. I would have gladly have paid twice as much as what our final bill was. It was something I would definitely return to and would recommend to all locals and anyone passing by the area. You do not want to miss this taste of southern deliciousness heaven.
Friendly and efficient service. The food was fresh and delicious. The table side pour over was on point.

We love the tamales, especially when getting them takeout. We hardly ever cook for company anymore, just pick up a family pack and we're good. Everyone has always asked about and complimented the food. The basmati rice salad goes well with tamales.

Decent thin crust pizza with a good array of toppings.

I opted for design your own and went with peperoni, smoked ham, meatballs, italian sausage, mushrooms, and fresh basil all on a spicy red sauce..  You can choose as many toppings as you like for less than $12.

The price can't be beat.  As others have mentioned, it's a bit of a Subway for pizza.. but with better toppings.  

The crust itself was good, but a bit on the chewy side.  Which is still better than the ultra thin soggy mess you get at a certain other 'famous' chain.

They're licenced too, and offer a handful of beers and whatnot.

I'd go back I think.

Great food, had baked oysters to start then a meat & cheese plate & finally our delicious main dish, well my Scottish salmon was very tasty but my husbands & best friends steak frites were really a tough piece of meat. The atmosphere of the restaurant was very chaotic. Not very relaxing at all & noise level was very high. I enjoyed the restaurant but probably wouldn't frequent the place.

So this experience started out bad... The wait time in the drive through was crazy, more than 15 minutes. I called in to see what was happening and spoke to "Matt" and explained the situation, that they have an entirely new staff and everyone was about 3-4 days old. I can sympathize with that. Especially since they managed to get my order correct. The new people were friendly and the food was hot and correct, topping it off with Matts professionalism is what made this a 4 star review. We will give this location another shot!

My girlfriend and I tried City Winery for a Griffin House show in mid-November one Wednesday night. Mostly we wanted to see the new concert behemoth of SoBro (I still hate the name SoBro). 

First off, the atmosphere. This place is beyond superlatives beautiful and tasteful, all at the same time. They've made it obvious it's a nicer place without overwhelming the concert-goer seeking to just enjoy a show with a nice glass of wine. They'll start making their own wine here in 2015 so we'll be interested to go back and see even more of this gorgeous venue.

The wine. I'm just starting to understand different types of wines and an amateur at best in describing what I want in a wine. The waiter was well-trained and did not lead us astray when we were making our selection from the multiple wines on tap, available for a glass, and those available by a bottle. We tried a couple of these before we left and weren't disappointed. 

The food. It was good, not great. I had the leg of lamb pizza, which was tasty with a good mix of spices, crunchy pine nuts, and melty cheese. She got the Chicken Fricassee which was good but reminded me of much less expensive items I've had elsewhere. The food was tasty and good to munch on during a show or for dinner. I'm probably going to have dinner elsewhere the next time we visit City Winery, however.

Pros: Amazing building and predictably great wine selection.

Cons: Food was kind of expensive and didn't blow me away. The parking was pretty terrible. They offered paid valet or you can park on the streets, which is not the best option in this neighborhood.

Overall: This a relaxing, romantic place to take a date for a concert. You will win friends  and influence people if you bring someone from out of town in for a concert. If you can stand the parking situation and high-priced food, you'll be elated to make this spot one of your regulars!
I come here for the wings, burgers and Spanish French fries, those items never disappoint. Great beer selection as well!

I have eaten here a few times. They have done a good job in getting it spruced up from what it was. Breakfast special at $1.99 can't be beaten. 2 eggs, hash browns, toast, coffee. Tip $2. Ate dinner here on a week night. Everyone likes to cluster at the bar or on the Hi-tops. I had the Coneys and they were good, especially for a Chicago girl. Hope they make it. Staff is friendly and they bust it to make your experience a pleasure.

Convinced my dad to leave the place we were at to come eat here and you made me look like a genius . The food and everything involved is 10/10. Incredible all around. Turchettis is amazing. Highly recommend

Only the best calzones in St Louis! I eat out a lot, usually at least 10 meals a week. I have tried hole in the walls and the very finest in dining. In all my eating out in St Louis, I have never found such large and delicious calzones. I have eaten here three times and every time is better than the last. The calzones are always stuffed full of your toppings. They really stuff them full. The cheese is so fresh and delicious. Their sauces are delicious too. I haven't found a calzone better than I find here.

About a year and a half ago I made the move from Long Island to Philly. This was the first bar I ventured out to and still continue to go on a regular basis. The food here is awesome and if you go for happy hour it is cheap!!! The music is great too!! Downstairs they have acoustic music and upstairs there is bluesy music. I also have gotten to know a lot of the bartenders and they are all great! 
I moved to Philly and fell in love.

After ten years as Executive Chef for the Century Hospitality Group, Chef Paul Shufelt decided it was time to start up a restaurant of his own. The Workshop Eatery officially opened a couple weeks ago in The Mosaic Centre, Canada's largest net-zero commercial building. Choosing to open up in a sustainable building definitely poses its challenges, but supporting local producers, sustainability, and using seasonal produce are concepts important to Chef Paul. 

The Workshop Eatery is located in the far south neighborhood of Summerside, which can be a fair drive for many in Edmonton. But once you enter the building you're greeted by an open space and living wall, which shows how unique and beautiful the Mosaic Centre really is. As for the restaurant, you're greeted into a space that is warm, rustic and inviting. I love the open concept and the visibility of the kitchen - there's nothing to hide! 

Throughout the different seasons, the menu will consist of roughly 20 staple dishes and a different feature each day. What makes the menu seasonal will be the different accompaniments and sides to a main dish. If you're ever wondering what's on the menu on a particular day, just check the website! It's amazing that they will be updating their online menu daily! 

We started off our meal with a couple of appetizers, first up was the Arancini ($12). The arancini at Workshop changes daily, and the "New York Deli" arancini with deli meats, a balsamic tomato smear, and Nefiss Lazizz Olive Oil was the feature for the day. These fried risotto balls had a golden, crisp exterior, and broke open to reveal a creamy mix of risotto, green peas, and small morsels of meat. I personally prefer my arancini to be rich and cheesy, so these arancini didn't quite deliver for me. 

Next up came the Chicken Liver Parfait ($11) served in a small mason jar with crostinis made from Bon Ton Bakery's Cranberry Raisin Nut Bread. The liver was whipped with a mousse-like texture and topped with a port and Saskatoon berry jam. It was a perfect balance between sweet and savoury, and I loved the different textures that the crostini added to the mixture.

Our last starter for the meal was the Duck Carpaccio ($17) featuring Moosewood Acres cured duck breast, pickled shiitakes, carrots, daikon, a soy reduction and blood orange vinaigrette. I really enjoyed the fragrant orange paired with the duck, and the tang of the vinaigrette, but found that the dish was much too salty. Typically a carpaccio dish features meat that is extremely thinly sliced or pounded thin, but the duck in this carpaccio was thickly sliced. The thick slice combined with the soy reduction was quite salty, so with some adjustments to the cut and seasoning, I would really enjoy this dish!

Just like the arancini, The Workshop Eatery has a feature dish each evening. On the night of our visit Tangle Ridge Lamb Chops were being served with a butternut squash, corn and bacon hash. The lamb chops were moist and tender, and looked beautiful against the brightly coloured hash. The hash itself was naturally sweet but lacking in smokiness which we expected from the bacon. As it turns out, we didn't find much bacon in the hash either, so that could have accounted for the discrepancy. 

For myself I ordered the Duck Duck Couscous (how fun is that to say?!) ($32) which featured beautifully seared Moosewood Acres duck breast on a bed of warm couscous with raisins, almonds, pickled cherries and vanilla parsnip puree. The duck was cooked to a perfect medium, and the lightly sweet couscous was a great companion to the duck. The parsnip puree was also a delightful addition to the dish, and complemented both components on the plate. Although I love lamb, the duck was definitely the winner for me and I would happily order it again. 

When it came down to the desserts, I was torn between two options. The panna cotta at The Workshop Eatery is made with the rooftop honey and would have been my first choice, but I couldn't resist the Croissant Bread Pudding ($9). The flaky croissant pieces are paired with white chocolate and cranberry, giving this dessert some tart notes to balance the sweet. Topped with a generous scoop of Pinocchio's cinnamon ice cream, this was a comforting dessert that I would eat again. 

Taken as a whole, we had a great dinner at The Workshop Eatery: our dishes were good and the service was attentive. If there's one thing I love about The Workshop Eatery, it's their commitment to sustainability and supporting local producers. Their decision to move into the Mosaic Centre means that the drive to their restaurant is long and far for many patrons, but the principles of the building align with the values of the restaurant. It's great to see so many local farmers mentioned throughout the menu, and I think it will be interesting to see how things shift once the growing season in Edmonton comes around.

I tried district tavern before a show at Amalie arena. My friends and I ordered Moscow mules which were delicious! We also split a variety of appetizers. The grilled cheese dippers with tomato soup shots were my favorite, but they were all very good. The night we went was super busy, so the service was a little slow, but the manager jumped in to make sure that we got served a little quicker which was nice. I will certainly return to district tavern!

First of all, we rode SCOOTERS to get here from our hotel. Second, the food was incredible. But most importantly, the staff went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable.

Our waiter Adam was attentive and funny without being overbearing, and the manager even stopped by twice--once to ask how things were and a second time to bus our plates when things got busy.

They split two of our shared dishes and plated them separately without a special request (the street corn and the paella, both of which were stupendous). And the lamb empanadas were smoky with chorizo and roasted tomatoes. Adam said they were everything you wanted from Hot Pockets but never got, and he was right. But like, in a very elevated nouveau cuisine kind of way. They were nothing like Hot Pockets, but everything like awesome.

10/10, would scooter here again.

I have never in my life received such poor service. I walked into the establishment at 9:40PM, after having instructed to "seat myself" by a sign at the door. Once we found a table, I was passed by several servers during a 10 minute time period. After 15 minutes of waiting, the server that was assigned to our section and table came out of the kitchen chewing and eating.
Once we flagged him down, we stated that we were ready to order. He then informed us that the kitchen as closed. 

When we asked, "When did the kitchen close?" His reply was: "When you all walked in." I then explained to the server that we had been sitting here for 15 minutes, which he then confirmed, as he stated that he had walked passed us twice. Yet, he never approached our table. I would hate to think that as the only Black patrons in the building that night that it was race related. When we asked to speak to a manager, the manager looked at us and never approached our table. 

This establishment refused to serve us after waiting for several minutes with no service. It is not an inclusive establishment. Being blocks away from historic North Nashville where many people of color reside, this establishment continues to show us the horrors of gentrification. The experience was disgusting and I'm disappointed. 

--Dr. B

We are in the area on a short trip and ordered delivery. 

Positives: delivery was fast! And the food was hot and has fresh ingredients. 

Negatives: no flavor... the pad Thai was bland and there was no option to make it spicy on the Postmates app we used. I would have liked the option or at least a couple crushed red pepper packets. 
The crab Rangoon has HONEY MUSTARD FILLING!!?? My husband and I both did not like them and couldn't finish them. It is not traditional and when you're craving the traditional taste it is quite disappointing. This should be disclosed.

Island Style food in Reno, yes please. Found this place and loved it. They have this crack chicken (Mochiko chicken) and it was the Bomb. The bento plates were amazing, reminds me of home(Oahu). Come and check them out. You will not be disappointed. 5 STARS.

I'm a little torn with this review! The food overall was pretty tasting but the portion size was pretty small for the price. I got avocado toast, eggs benedict, and strawberry French toast. 

The eggs benedict were the best. Eggs perfect consistency, although the Hollandiase sauce started separating by the time I got home. I did have a 15 min drive and the food was probably sitting for a good 10mins before I picked up too. 

The avocado toast was 1 piece of toast, with a really meager smear of avocado(like the amount that you would spread for butter on toast). The turkey bacon and egg was good. But that was it. A little lacking for the price that you pay for it. 

The strawberry French toast cost $1.50 more than the regular French toast but all I got was some sliced strawberries. She had asked if I wanted fresh strawberries or the strawberry sauce, so I knew what I was getting for the fresh strawberries but I thought there would be more pizazz. On the bright side, the French toast was yummy.

Fish is a hard sell in Alberta.  Pride in Alberta beef (mediocre in my opinion) and distance from the coast play a part in neglecting this healthy protein option.  When I received a great coupon for this particular Joey's, I was reminded that we do like our fish in this house.  We intended to go there with another couple but sickness meant that we were only two that Saturday.

If location is everything, Joey's is at a disadvantage.  It's hard to see from the street - I recommend using a GPS to locate.  The entrance is also difficult to access because of a concrete walled patio (useless on a cold winter night.  Once inside, the restaurant is roomy, well-lit with a large screen TV on the north wall for those addicted to Hockey Night in Canada.  The staff are friendly and service is initially quick.  My only quibble with the service is that I had to go to the kitchen to ask for coffee and dessert when we were finished our mains.  We never know how we feel about dessert until we finish the first course.  However, the owner served coffee/tea and dessert as well as took our payment.  The waiting staff seemed to be busy with cleaning up, which made us fell slightly rushed.

How was the food you ask?  My wife had the halibut with mashed potatoes, pronouncing the mash great but the halibut too dry.  I must take her word for it because I learned to dislike mashed because that was the only way my father wanted potatoes served and because I ordered the endless shrimp plate.  I was full with the single serving so I couldn't sample my wife's halibut (which disappeared despite the bad review) or eat any more shrimp.  For dessert, we shared the mud pie, delicious.

The coupon worked because we plan another visit some time in the future.

Not one to write reviews but this was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Service and food were terrible. We were sat quickly on the rooftop tonight which was nice. We were sat a table with no salt and pepper or silverware just menus.. okay.. so my boyfriend and I start browsing the menu and pick drinks and our food since no one came up to us for 10 minutes. Our waiter comes by with water and drops a drink menu then runs away. Awesome. Wait another 10 minutes and he finally comes back. My boyfriend orders a beer they didn't have which was fine so he got something different. I ordered a lemonade and they were out of it so I ordered a root beer instead and what do you know they're out of that too. No big deal I just got a coke. We order our food and wait for our drinks. 5 minutes goes by, no drinks but our appetizer of calamari came out quickly and the food runner just drops it. Mind you we still have no plates or silverware but we eat it anyway. Calamari was super plain the menu said it came with stuff on it and it literally came with nothing but marinara. Then our food comes out. I got a ny strip steak and my boyfriend got a pineapple chicken sandwich. When I say Applebee's could of made better food I'm not kidding. I had to go up to the server who was completely non existent this whole time and ask for salt and pepper after the hostess finally brought silverware. Not once did he ask if we needed anything or how anything was. If we wanted another drink. Nothing. I waitress for a living and could see it was busy but that's literally no excuse for how horrible the service was. Both the tables next to us were complaining that he wasn't acknowledging them at all. Only positive was the food coming out quickly but it wasn't even good at all. Definitely will never be back a waste of 65 dollars.

Today we went to Drago's to celebrate our son's graduating from UNO.We wanted to have a special lunch to celebrate such a special occasion.Going to Drago's was awesome,the food was on point.We had the  charbroiled oysters and spinach dip as our appetizers and they were both fabulous.The charbroiled oysters will bring a happy tear to your eyes. My husband had the oyster poboy and enjoyed every bite.Our son had the Seafood pasta dish and I had a huge grilled shrimp salad.James our waiter was very attentive and friendly.We chatted for a few minutes,he told us that he has One Semester left in college.Best to you James!!The gentlemen that brought us our food was as well very friendly,he as well engaged us in a friendly conversation.Our son humored me by wearing his graduation cap.The owner Mrs.Cvitanovich came by our table and congratulated our son.She couldn't have been more lovely to our family!She even gave our son a T-shirt,saying it's something that they do for graduates.The food at Drago's was delicious from the appetizers to the entrees.The time that was taken by staff to connect with us was priceless!!Thank you Drago's!!!DW and Family   I forgot to mention that Drago's has done a great job in table spacing...Considering everything that's going on due to The Coronavirus,thank you to all the business for doing their best in keeping customers and employees as safe as possible!
The views and location are perfect, however the food and the interior need some remodeling.

Not going to be a favorite for me.  Pretty food but not good. Very pricey, slow service. The place is beautiful but loud.  We have traveled throughout the states and other countries. Until last night we had never been charged for bread!
Of course it didn't help that the valet couldn't find our car keys.

I know that I do not need to give any review for this chain restaurant, because I have never wanted to go here anyway. However, we decided to go to this place with my in-laws because we thought it could please everyone (adults and children) and it was one of the few family style restaurants in the West side of town. We have been avoiding dining at Olive Garden for at least 7 years, and now I know we should have gone to another Italian restaurant. 

Their menu is quite extensive and very similar to other Italian restaurants, such as calamari, pizza, spaghetti, salad, chicken or pork scaloppini etc. Everything sounded good in the menu and the pictures looked very enticing.  However, nothing tasted right, and in almost all of their entrees, they have added cheese to their dishes which means extra creamy and FAT. YUCK! Their  kids cheese pizza did not taste good either. The only thing that is fresh is their Garden Salad. The service is good. The price is not cheap for the quality of their food. 

We will cross out Olive Garden from the list...FOREVER.

Suppa had one of the more interesting offerings for Restaurant Week, which is why my wife and I found here on a Friday evening in August 2015. The restaurant had seating outside and being a nice evening, we preferred that option.

Looking through the menu, we decided that one of us would go for the Restaurant week offering while the other of us would order ala carte from the menu. It was nice to have that option and I think not all restaurants have that option when a RW is in progress. The RW menu we chose consisted of crab fritters, mac n' cheese, ricotta cavatelli, and choice of a dessert item. It was nice of them to also include a beverage in the offering. From the ala carte menu, we went for the duck poutine and the cubano melt sandwich. 

The first comment is that the food took a long time to come out. The restaurant was quite busy on a Friday evening and we could only see one server doing the rounds. The first dish to come out were the crab fritters. They were crispy and hot but as my wife puts it, there did not seem to be any crab meat in it. I thought I had found some traces of crab when I first took a bite but I could certainly see what my wife was saying. The next two dishes to come out were the mac n' cheese and the duck poutine. Both dishes were tasty and as the poutine is not something I have often had before, I enjoyed the novelty of the dish. What surprised us were the huge portions. Even though I was very hungry, I decided to not finish all of my duck poutine and leave some room for the other things we had ordered. The cubano melt sandwich was also very nice. The bread was well toasted and the ham, pulled pork and cheese all went nicely together. The cavatelli pasta was quite flavorful too. Finally, when it came to the dessert, we were so full, we just had a cupcake to go and had it at home. 

Positives:
1. Interesting and eclectic menu.
2. Huge portions - I could have a full lunch based on what was leftover from the meal and even then there were some leftovers.
3. Reasonable prices - For what was being served, prices were reasonable.

Negatives:
1. Pretty slow service: We got in at around 9:20 p.m. and left at around 11 p.m. Certainly we were enjoying the evening and lingered on but then a part of the delay can be explained by how long it took for things to come out.
2. Waters were not refiled promptly. In one instance, my wife requested a glass of water and the waiter, absent-mindedly perhaps, just left her with a glass full of ice. It wasn't until another 5 mins. or so after we could hail the waiter that we were able to have our glasses filled.

Overall, this is the kind of place I would be very excited to have in my neighborhood. I wouldn't have the hassle of having to drive and search for parking and that would make it easy for me just to swing by for perhaps a sandwich or maybe one of their brunch items over the weekend. It is certainly a place I would like to return to.

The food is mediocre eggs and toast you Can get the same food across the street at Dennys for half the price. Service was terrible there. Trying to get my toast was like pulling teeth. This place is just an overhyped,  crowded, and not worth the wait for such a hole in the wall

This place opened yesterday and i live in the area so i thought i would give it a try.....first issue in an area where there are quite a few breakfast options i would have expected this establishment to be on its "A" game, however the food was dismal...

The Bad:
Food - F
i order eggs benedict and as i am a vegetarian asked for spinach, tomato and mushrooms in place of the bacon....they charged me extra for each item, even though i excluded the meat, and i didn't even get what i requested, missing the spinach.   The hollandaise sauce was disgusting, not even sure it was hollandaise sauce more like white cream poured over the eggs.  The eggs were the size of quarters, not kidding and didn't even think they could be that tiny....The english muffin was soggy and the potatoes were hard and bland..all in all a pretty poor experience. 

The Good:
Service - A
I spoke with the manager regarding the my situation and he was more than understanding and accommodating.  The waitstaff is very nice and out going.  

Future:
With at least 5 different spots in the area that have fantastic breakfast options, this restaurant will have to do much better to survive...As this is there 2nd day opening i am going to return in a few weeks to try the food again.....with that being said i am giving this diner a generous 2 out 5 until i try the food again.

Went there last night for dinner.  This place was awesome, all of the way around!
Island wings were amazing, mac and cheese bites, conch fritters...those were just the apps.  The wings were probably the best I've ever had!!
Blacked Salmon, Jerk Chicken, Curried Chicken, Corn Bread...this was an outstanding meal.
The waitstaff and owner could not be any nicer and eager to please.  
Can't wait to try Sunday brunch!!

We will definitely be back!!!
Great food, great service not much more to say appetizers were so amazing my husband ordered a second set of stuffed mushrooms. We will definitely be back

Ordered an big party size lasagna. My family loved it so much they talked about it for days. It was so good and fresh. Pizza is also fresh and yummy. I stopped eating pizza in pottstown but now that I have tried this place out I can get a pizza locally now. The people are kind and this place is very clean.

Wish I would have taken a picture.
Burrito and BBQ tempeh wrap are really good. Sides are great, the potato salad is exceptional.

In the spirit of Cinco de Mayo, my fiancé and I decided to finally visit this spot. We were pleasantly surprised. We started off with chips and salsa, the salsa had a nice kick to it. We then had one of my favorite Mexican sides, corn on the cob with mayo, cheese, and seasoning. That alone was worth the visit. My fiancé ordered chicken flautas and I ordered the mole enchiladas. It was my first time trying dark mole sauce, and it wasn't my favorite mix of flavors but I appreciated the dish nonetheless. My fiancé's flautas were delicious with fresh salad and guacamole. 

Despite being busy, our service was phenomenal. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. At the end, there was a small mix up with our check, but it was handled quickly and very professionally. The staff was apologetic even though we weren't even upset. Things happen. 

Overall a great experience. I look forward to visiting this local spot again.
Love the atmosphere and they offer wonderful beer options. Not much for vegetarians but I manage.
Very good craft selection on draft. Staff was very knowledgeable and very helpful in beer decisions. I will definitely be back to this place.

This is a New Mexican restaurant in St Petersburg off of 4th street, very close to downtown. I went for lunch on a Saturday. Once seated, I was immediately provided complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa tasted fresh and had very good flavor. I ordered the Mexican Mule (their version of a Moscow Mule) which was absolutely delicious . It cost $13 but it was extremely big. 

For lunch I ordered the trio of tacos; chicken, asada and carnitas. All 3 needed some sort of sauce or crema. The chicken was extremely dry. The asada had very good flavor and was my favorite of the 3. The carnitas was average. I felt the tacos could have all been topped/dressed differently but instead they all were the same but for the protein. 

All in all, the place is nice, clean and close to downtown st Pete. I give it a 3 not because it's "bad" but because I simply think it's average/good. Certainly not the best Mexican food you will have;
Not even the best in st Pete. But it is good and will satisfying a Mexican craving if you have one.

Great pizza.  Great atmosphere..best crust in town.  Staff very nice.  Owners are real attentive.   Brad , an owner,,grew up in Brooklyn and learned his trade there and learned it well.  Been there 3 times and each time was not disappointed.  The new manager ,Tony, was especially nice and accommodating.  The top Pizza maker ,Dean, is a real artisan and honored my requests and made me one of best pizzas I have ever had in Florida and been here over 40 yrs from NYC and  being an Italian I know my Apizza!!!

Meh. The staff here is unfriendly, maybe it was a culture or language barrier but they were icy and it didn't feel comfortable. The biryani portions were small, but inexpensive so I guess it balanced out. The naan was oily and thin. The channa Marsala was the best dish. All in all it was fine but forgettable. We won't be back, too many other places in the area with better Indian and friendlier service.

Ahi tuna with grapefruit is a great dish.  Tuna was very fresh and it's nice that someone serves ahi tuna with innovative accompaniment. The grapefruit goes very well with the tuna.  I've had this dish there twice.  Miguel from Mexico City is a great waiter, and my husband says they make great old-fashioned martinis (the kind with the olives). It can be windy, cold or hot out on the terrace; check the weather or ask to be seated indoors.

This is a relatively new (5 mo) brick oven pizza place. The fire is purely wood, no gas. They light it the old fashion way, with kindling and a match. I had the White Hibiscus personal 10" pizza. This pizza was as delicious as it was beautiful. Sort of a caprese meets spinach. The owners George and Bob were both there and were more than gracious hosts. They have a large wine and beer selection all reasonably priced. The rest of the menu is worthy of trying something new each time, and I intend to. The place is very comfortable with TVs, great staff, clean bathrooms and A/C to help chill out during your meal.

Update: Service still stellar. Kitchen, less so. 

I love the ravioli appetizer. The sauce with it had gone from luscious to watery. Little care is taken with the garlic spinach not to overpower the dish. 

The steak offerings have been the same for too long, and technique has suffered. My husband loves the Cowboy ribeye so when I stopped by for a solo cocktail, I got one "to go" to surprise him. There were grill marks on one side and gray nothingness on the other. This steak had not seen a broiler at all. I thought perhaps they cook it differently for take out. I inquired on my next visit and was assured it was supposed to be exactly the same. I don't mind paying a premium price for a premium steak. Premium price when I could have gotten a better sear at home in my cast iron pan? No thanks. While this is just one example, we have been unimpressed with the food and outdated menu for some time. Dry aged or grass fed beef? Nowhere to be found. I can now get prime beef at BJs. That alone isn't a selling point anymore.
Courtney was amazing. She made the most amazing Bff Mac and cheese. Hard work and appreciation go a long way.
Kind of a funky little place with good sandwiches and great portions. Decore is a little tired that you need. Good place to watch a baseball game.
Stopped in for lunch. Grilled shrimp po-boy and fried pickles nomnom. Great bar food and tons of beers
Always a great meal at Bandana's. We got ribs, pulled pork & chicken - all were delicious. Not to mentioned the garlic toast and you can't forget donut holes for dessert! Highly recommend

Their drinks are good. But their jerked grilled chicken wings with sauce on the side is magical. I don't know who thought of them but they are well worth a visit. The restaurant is very COVID-19 safe so wear your mask and enjoy. The hostess and staff are friendly and personable. This is my go too place even late night the food is fresh and hot.
Best costumer service ever! good drinks and food  the staff is amazing. I can't wait to come back!!!
Located in the mall very hard to find. Very expensive but I did like the gimmick of having the sushi on a conveyer belt, I won't be back. The food was ok.

Just went to Chatam Tap for the first time because a friend and I were right down the street and in the mood for a beer. I agree with what Brittany S. said about the atmosphere, this is a very laid back bar which is the kind I enjoy. Great beer local and otherwise. Bonus points: soccer on TV. I can only imagine how awesome this place would be during the World Cup.

We came with our cousin from Chicago and had a great time! Of course it isn't our first time here but it has been awhile and we still love it! Nick was our server & let me tell you if we could give a 10 star we would! Awesome food, drinks & service :)

This place really needs to figure out what it wants to be. I went in looking for a light breakfast. The menu look pretty good so i  decided to check Fresh out. When we arrived the grill or whatever they cook on was out of order?!! Ok????
So we  ordered a cup of coffee. We ask for milk were just  given a carton from the kitchen just thrown on the table.. Not sure why people like this place. The management needs to know what's going on with the business ..

Horrible! Ordered to go. They tried to give me egg rolls that sit on the counter for 10 minutes because they forgot to pack them in a previous order.  I asked them to remake so they were hot. I got back to my room and found out my chicken padti was shrimp and tofu. I had to go back down and it took them another half an hour to remake. After all that the food was so so.

First time trying this place. I heard mixed reviews but had to try it for myself. Absolutely love the food. Very clean environment. Staff is friendly and the food came out pretty quick. I will defiantly be coming back and recommending this place to my friends and colleagues.

As a Filipino living in Nashville, you can just imagine how excited I was to hear about this place so we just had to try it!

Came tonight during their happy hour from 4-6. Mannnn were they packed! Nashville is definitely excited to try this restaurant out as they should!

Sitting right in the heart of the gulch, right across Sambuca, the restaurant is beautiful inside. It's big and it can hold big parties. I even saw a segregated room which hopefully you can reserve for private dinner.

We sat at the bar and had their happy hour cocktails. Delicious! But I do want to talk about food so let's get to it.

PORK ADOBO FRIED RICE: this is the BEST thing that I've had just yet. It is honestly perfect and just right. Bartender even told me that this is the most underrated dish they have- people never order it. But he said it's what he always get at the end of his shift. It is DELICIOUS! GET IT!!!!!!

SISIG:. Traditionally made with left overs from a pig's face - this is a traditional bar food in the Philippines. Don't worry! They only serve it with pork belly! It was my favorite from everything we've ordered. 
Update- it was really good the first time we had it. The 2nd time, I wish it was a little crispier.

LUMPIA: traditional egg rolls. You know, I'm a little biased because I've had so many lumpia growing up. I've had better but my husband thought it was good.

BAO: I had their pork belly bao. Really delicious! The bun is on point and that's always the hardest to make. 

CHICKEN INASAL: decent. Not bad. I didn't think it was amazing but I didn't think it was bad either.

SUNDA SUNDAE: dessert and it's their take on the traditional Halo-Halo dessert. You should try it! Also Halo-Halo literally translate to Mix-Mix so when you order this, take a picture, then mix it all together. You have to mix it until the Ube ice cream is completely melted. Trust me!

RIDICULOUS: this was pretty good. It's basically ice cream wrapped with cake. I thought it was just ok. 

Service Was good, too! It was their first week so one of the items that we ordered didn't arrive so our bartender gave us our dessert for free. I thought that was really nice. Shoutout to them!

Parking- there is another parking garage across Bar Louis and it's really cheap parking. There's also a parking garage literally right next to it in the same building so don't worry about that!


Overall, I'm so glad we tried this place and I'm so glad they decided to open a restaurant in Nashville!

My fiancé and I have been wanting to check this place out since it opened a couple of weeks ago and finally had the chance to stop by last night. Super friendly staff and gorgeous restaurant! We ate outside and really enjoyed the vibes. Didn't get a picture of it but the double dip app was phenomenal! Drinks are also well-priced too - the $5 Mexican draft (Monopolio) really hit the spot with the burger! One of the co-owners Maren stopped by our table to chat and introduce herself which we thought was really cool - definitely excited to make this our go-to neighborhood spot, and can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu!
I thought this place was the sh*t, personally.  Gyros were f***ing great, zucchini fries were great too.  Good fast casual spot.

This is more of an "I'm in shock" review than anything else. We love Fork, we eat here every few months. But today after brunch, we brought home a cinnamon roll for my daughter who couldn't come along with us. I snuck a bite and THERE WAS A BUTTON in the dough! 

We called the restaurant and after being put on hold for a good amount of time, the acting manager came on the line and was less than sympathetic. His response to the situation was super awkward and borderline rude. He noted that the chef was wearing the same coat as he was yesterday when making the rolls and no button was missing (ok, ew - why no clean coat?!) but that they'd "look into it" and someone would call me tomorrow. (I had to ask him if he needed my phone number to call me back so not sure about the sincerity of that statement. )

We were polite and definitely are not looking for a handout, freebie, etc., just thought the restaurant should know that a customer bit into a button. Why not just take responsibility and apologize? Super disappointed with the way the situation was handled, and now feeling like the kitchen is less clean/sanitary than we thought. Thumbs down, Fork. Photo of button for the manager who seemed to believe that a lost button in the cinnamon roll was impossible.

This place was close by for a quick lunch. Simple, nice place with interesting display of a bear outside at the entrance.  Felt warm from the cold outside.  
Had to pay for parking in the front of the restaurant. 
We placed a to-go order,  and it took about 20 minutes; which wasn't bad.  
We then tried some drinks while waiting.
Surbabia and Stove rose sangria. Both tasted okay.

We got deviled eggs, boom boom shrimp and tap smoked cheesesteak. 

Deviled eggs were okay, a little too mustardy for my taste.  Has a hint of sweetness,  like caramelized onions.

boom boom shrimp were just okay.  It had a lot, and I  mean a lot more cauliflower than the shrimp.  It should be called boom boom cauliflower with shrimp.

tap smoked cheesesteak was great.  It was the best item out of what I got. 

Try it out if you're in the area!

My wife and I tried it since we live close by. The people working there were very nice. I'm kind of new to Indian food and she was very helpful in making selections. She recommended an appetizer that was very thin like pita bread almost paperthin and it had a very fresh pico de Gallo on top with cilantro onions tomatoes and a sauce that we really liked. I ordered the chicken tiki masala. I'm not an expert on it but it tasted very good. My wife is vegan and they really bent over backwards to make some dishes for her. She didn't care too much for one dish but I liked it. The other Dish she did like it I wish I could remember the name but if you are vegan just let them know and they will make some suggestions or modify a dish for you. The prices were very reasonable in my opinion

I definitely need to come here more often. I think I forget about it because it is so small and tucked away, but I am always impressed by the menu options and flavor of my food. Service is friendly and patio seating is a perk! I like the chill vibe and international vibe that comes from the spices and chai options. I've been pleased with every item that I have tried so far and look forward to trying more things!
If you like to try local places, this is a good one. In town visiting and needed delivery. Easy to order, friendly people, and fresh hot pizza.

Pretty expensive for what turned out to be a pretty bland and small portioned meal. Bread was overly dry also. I ordered the Sabzi Chalaw, and it just left no impression. However, the interior is pretty and the staff is friendly, which brings it up to two stars.

I have only been to this Starbucks location once or twice when I happened to be in the shopping center.  It's your typical Starbucks, except I don't love the set up.  When you walk in the door there is a table right in front of you, and it seems that the entrance area could get very crowded and confusing during busy time.  While I didn't sit down with my drink, I noticed the few tables around, none appearing to be particularly comfortable or private.  Also, the area where the barista will hand you your finished drink is kind of in the middle of the store, leaving you to stand awkwardly in someone's way.

Regardless, it's Starbucks, and I won't hesitate to go to this location if I'm in the area.

This place is fantastic!! Amazing workers with wonderful customer service skills, some of the nicest people I have ever met. Jeanette is running a great ship there and the food is amazing! Special thank you to Brock for being kind and patient when taking my order. Will come back!!

The sushi was delicious and if you're a local, you get a sweet discount with all you can eat! Jennica helped us and was amazingly sweet and always right around the corner filling our waters, etc. The only thing is that the 1st rule of Yelp reviews is to never tell customers to write a Yelp review about your business!! The manager caught us before leaving to tell us to write a yelp review on the place. So, now I'm writing one. Hopefully she doesn't make that mistake again. Anyways, thanks Jennica! The manager should learn some professionalism from her.

In spite of many hipster references on Yelp to this business, I ventured to it late on a weekend night on a simple quest for good pizza.

That actually reminds me of one of my favorite hipster jokes: Why did the hipster burn his tongue on the slice of pizza? Because he wanted to eat it before it was cool.

Lee's pizza is tasty, made with care and the toppings you order on a custom pie are plentiful. And from what I saw while waiting for my pizza, the wings looked good as well. Those came out to a small group sitting near me at the bar that included a man who clearly needed some food in his stomach.

In my opinion, two people can easily fill themselves on this small size pizza while enjoying a drink or two to wash it down. 

There are plenty of beer options, most of which are available in coolers appropriate for a small and older grocery store. There are a handful of craft beers on draft as well and apparently they do pour some wine too...or those wine bottles are just to hold big fake roses and throw people off.

Unfortunately for people like me who drink "crap on tap," as Mr. Dunderbak calls it, Lee's has none of that. Not even "crappy crap" in cans or bottles like PBR or The Champagne of Beers. Which is fine, I get it. They kindly offer Coke products for us old souls who do like French toast, but want the actual breakfast and not a huge brown bottle at an 8.8% ABV.

Obviously, they keep it real simple here: Pizza, wings, craft beer. Seems like they know what they're doing and the employees openly appreciate their customers.

As I finish this review, the Yelp survey questions below include "Good for Dancing: Yes, No, Not Sure." I marked "No" because the only folks dancing here have had way too much of that French toast beer or ABV equivalent and not enough of their quality pizza.

We always have a great time!  We had 1 goal and that was to get the injectable donut holes. We chose to get the three different sauces chocolate, raspberry, and Bavarian cream. They did not disappoint. Our family loved them. Andrew was our server at our bay and he was the best server we have ever had there he gets 10 stars every day.

My only complaint is that it is very expensive and the wait is always crazy long and if you want a reservation you have to pay an additional amount that doesn't go towards your purchase! 

**Olivia and Brianna corner** (the teens thoughts) 

Olivia's favorite sauce was raspberry. The heaters are the best!!

This place is real good !! Truly enjoyed the pad Thai and the curry. The staff is super nice . Hard working young men ..  the chef was nice to come to our table and asked if dinner was to our liking. Love that very professional. Highly recommend this place

Mmm delicious Saturday brunch.  My friends and I sampled about everything on the menu (between the 5 of us) and all of it was wonderful.  I'm Lebanese, so I know when I'm eating good Lebanese food, and this was definitely up to par.  I would recommend it to anyone who is interested in getting great food without spending too much money!

So glad we made it to Twenty Manning. Very cute and hip atmosphere. This would have been 5 stars except for the noise level (so loud we could barely hear ourselves think and were shouting to converse). We didn't have drinks so I can't comment on those. Our food was really delicious though and I give all of what we ordered a thumbs up. One person in our party had the mussels and almost licked the bowl. Another person had the fish tacos (celiac so it was nice for her to have a full gf option) and I had the salmon poke (dairy sensitivity so again, nice that they were so accommodating) and it was truly amazing. It sounded good and was not disappointing. We each only had an appetizer size portion, but honestly, that was perfect. What was served at other tables looked and smelled great as well. If you can sit outside (it was raining so that wasn't an option), I would think that's a good place. Enjoy!

Michael and I went back on Monday and our waitress Nancy showed me a new dish on the menu; a vegan meatloaf and it was out of this world delicious!!! Even Michael liked the dish!! This place never disappoints

The salsa was fresh and flavorful, but the rest of the meal was unremarkable and WAY overpriced.  The restaurant seems too trendy for me and had no ambiance at all.  The only spice i could taste in both mine and my wife's dish was salt or msg.  And lots of it.  More spices are definitely needed for Mexican style food.  The fajitas were bland, and the bacon wrapped shrimp tasted like they used Hormel pre-cooked microwavable bacon. I have seriously had better bacon at McDonalds.  The rice was as unflavorful as the rest of the meal, and even the guacamole, their namesake, tasted like it came from a can.    There are way too many superior Mexican restaurants in the area at a much cheaper cost for me to consider returning.  I would even consider Chipotle a superior restaurant.  Guac is one step above Taco Bell, but charges super premium prices.

I have to give this place one star so I can write a review. But this place charged me for a tab that wasn't even mine. Well not the bar. But Cody Lovell. And when I went in there and he said it was my fault cause I was talking to someone that had that tab. That's not okay. They never returned my money. I would NEVER suggest this place to anyone. Especially never get a drink from CODY LOVELL. He was being rude and disrespectful just cause I asked about it. They really suck. 100% Not recommended

Our family has been going to the Sparks location for over 15 years. They consistently create delicious beers, and their prices for growlers are still reasonable (unlike several other popular local breweries). I've been asking them to make the Truckee River Red a Flagship brew ever since I discovered it; when I bring it home, even people who don't prefer beer tend to like it.
