It's truly a wine lover's beer. My favorite beer at Great Basin is the seasonal Red Nose Holiday Wassail, which is available during the holiday season. If you like holiday spices in your beer, you will love it!

Great BBQ at an unassuming corner place.  The outside tables were perfect for solid brisket and turkey.   It felt like eating in someone's backyard with games on the big screen.   I'm glad we stopped by!

My first experience with Japanese food done fast food style will likely be my last.  I guess overall, I just really expected it to at least taste good - even if it wasn't AUTHENTIC Japanese cuisine.  Unfortunately, I was pretty much feeling indifferent toward the dish and a little pissed at my newly, much-lightened wallet.

I ordered the Spicy Chicken platter (not spicy at all, just like the no-personality cashier said).  You do get a LOT of food.  I also threw in an order of Vegetable Spring Rolls (those actually were delicious, but they're pretty hard to screw up!)   I guess I should start out by saying I'm not a sushi lover.  I'll nibble on it every once in awhile, but I just haven't ever really gotten into it.  I can tell this place probably prides itself on its sushi, but the entire place smelled so unappetizingly fishy, I can't imagine that even the most avid sushi lover would have enjoyed it.

The Sumi & Corn/Bowtie Salads that I chose for sides literally made me say "Meh" outloud and the vegtable skewer mostly got in my way while I was trying to eat the chicken.

All together (with an iced tea) it came to over 14 dollars for just me to eat.  Kind of ridiculous when you're eating something that pretty much tastes like it came from a mall food court.

Overall, if you're feeling some Japanese or sushi and you happen to be near a SanSai, stop in, get some spring rolls to hold you over, and then make reservations at a better place for dinner at close to the same price.

They have a fairly good beer list and bar selection. But don't order a steak, they don't know how to cook it. And don't expect good service unless you're with a regular, because you're just going to get ignored if a regular is there.

This place is an absolutely amazing find!!!...very local cusine with a quaint atmosphere that is very inviting.  The Oyster Rockefeller is absolutely delicious!!!  I'm so glad that I found this place tucked away just off of Canal.

I must say that having traveled in China, Hong Kong, and major cities in the world including NYC, where there are alot of Chinese people and Chinese restaurants, Fushia Asian Bistro does a very nice job.  The service is always very nice and helpful and the food is the real Szechuan spice!  I come here for my Szechuan fix that I need every other week.  Although the dishes can be extremely spicy hot, that is what Szechuan food is supposed to be.  One can order other less spicy dishes as well.   

My main criticism is that the menu is too long with too many items that it is a bit confusing and hard to nuddle through.  Also, they need menus to go.  Otherwise, I really like this place and when you walk in and see all the foreign born Chinese people there with their families and friends, you know that it is the real deal.  

I love the fact that they have brown rice and beer, wine, and sake!  I wish more people knew about this place because it is tucked away on Amberly in New Tampa and a treat to have!
the food was delightful.  the sweet corn soup was out of this world.  and don't pass up the sweet potato beinetts.  the only drawback was how loud it was. we had to yell across the table to be heard.

Andrews bayou ribs was at the feast in the park Faust park.  It's a food truck.  They rib tips where awesome and the sauce was good.  You get a lot of rib tips for the price.  Next time I'm trying the chicken wings and thick cut pork steak.
Brie appetizer was very good. Onion soup suprisingly bland and onions were not cooked enough.  Lobster thermidor was also suprisingly lacking in flavor. Nice dining room and view though.

Great service and great food! We tried Richard's for the first time and were impressed by how smooth the service was. The grilled shrimp appetizer and risotto cakes were very good! My husband had the braised leg of lamb for dinner and I had the cannelloni. Both were delicious. Our waiter, Trey, was also very attentive and friendly.

I give the food a hard "meh". It's a bit lackluster and I would consider it for sustenance only. However, ice cream and drinks were absolutely incredible. You have to go - happy hour specials were off the chain. Standing banana split? Yes please.
Super good, my boyfriend and I go on dates here, or bring it home for movie night. Great food.

We decided to enjoy some fish and chips this evening and Teddy's was our choice. We decided on take away due to the ease and convenience. We were extremely pleased with the results of our choice. Within the meals were four large, not overly battered fish filets, with fries and sweet potato fries respectively. The meals were excellent with the fish surprisingly crisp (even with a 15 minute drive home). We anticipate enjoying Teddy's By the Sea again very soon. This is a must try on the Carpinteria culinary scene.

We've long been fans of The Brewhouse but really only re-discovered this neighborhood gem recently with a commitment to supporting them whenever we are up in Santa Barbara as they epitomize what makes Santa Barbara so special.  In the process, we rediscovered the really impressive beer that this place quietly brews...for years, but still with innovation.  The coffee Porter was among the best I've had.  My husband loves the Motivation Destroyer IPA, so appropriate for the times we are in and so, so good.  And the cheeseburgers with brioche bun and fries....heaven.  So pick up the phone, order a meal and beers to go.  You won't be disappointed...and you'll be helping keep a local Santa Barbara gem in business.

One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. The Pho Broth is next level (I had beef). Don't miss the Vindaloo sauce on the chicken wings or drumsticks. Drinks are fantastic. We will definitely be back. (Shoutout to Ray who steered in the right direction and was a great server)
Great pizza, appetizers, & service too. Be prepared to wait 45 minutes for the crust to be made, but it is worth it & the crust is amazingly good!

My first time here and i wanted to ask the guy that waited on us a few questuons but he had a great language barrier...found the lady cashier next to us was very good at explaining the menu so i just listened to her.  I had the lunch special which consist of 2 chicken tenders, a side and a drink for $7.99 The chicken tenders were very good, nice and juicy and tender, i just had fries although i did taste my friends mac/cheese it was creamy but not really cheesey. My feiend got the lunch special too but she didnt get bread and her sauce of choice was not on her tenders, we had to ask why to understand and hers was a dollar more than mine

This always seems to be a quick and easy go to for dinner.  

Let me start by saying, Our service is always awesome! The food is always hit or miss.  Mostly hit, as it's always fast and fresh. It's great that they have finally updated their menu. 

My three stars comes from the absolutely filthy oil and vinegar carafe and items on the table. I wish those were wiped down every time they cleaned a table.

Great spot for a thin crust pizza.  Not your conventional oven baked pizza but very tasty.  Oblong shaped but a nice size. Give it a try - may not be like your typical pizza joint but you will come back again and again

We love hawkers, but it always takes so long for our server to see us when we sit down. It took 10 minutes our last visit to even have a staff member see us at our table. We have an issue getting seated every time we come to this restaurant. We get told it's an hour wait for a table outside when there are 4 open tables not cleared yet. Madison the waitress took her own time to clear a table for us and seat us within 10 minutes. She deserves Credit for her work. Thank you Madison!
Great menu, fantastic. Good and first class service !I highly recommend Oak and Ola !
This is a great place to eat or to have banquet at. Maryann the banquet manager was great, very helpful.  I Highly recommend this place for your next party or just a night out for dinner.

Our visit: This was our first visit. We visited on a Saturday at 7:30pm. 

The reservation: The hostesses had a few mess ups with us. There were two working the hostess stand. The older woman (post 50) who is vivacious and energetic answered the phone the first time we called and pretended the restaurant was very unavailable. I called at 6pm asked for the first available table for the night for 2. She said they were avail at 8:15pm. I asked if there was anything earlier and she said maybe 8pm and eventually quoted 7:30pm as if she was doing us a big favor for a party of 2. After grappling with the consideration of waiting an hour for the table, I called again. This time the younger hostess answered the phone. She said there was no wait. LOL. So we arrived and there was no wait. ..........

The strawberry feta salad: amazing!!!! I devoured that salad. 

Chicken parm: I didn't eat the chicken because the pasta was so good, but the pasta was amazing. 

The lava cake: this is not a lava cake. It is a brownie that has not been cooked all the way through. I didn't eat much of it. 

The service: now, despite all the flubs, this is why I can not in good conscience give less than four stars. Our server, Maria, was wonderful!! She was calm, collected, knowledge, and delightful. We later learned she's worked there for eight plus years. We briefly interacted with a young food runner with a bad attitude. She was 25-35 in age, thinning blonde hair in a ponytail, slender, corse in demeanor and a tad condescending. I held my tongue and was exceedingly polite to her to counter her condemnation and my usually obtuse husband actually noticed her rudeness and commented after she left the table. I later needed my waitress mostly because the foodrunner kind of left without saying anything-- haha I assume she's a food running because why else would she behave that way. I noticed another server, Kevin, walk by and asked him if he could get our waitress. He responded by saying that he could help us. And we learned from him that our server, Maria, is his wife and they met at this restaurant and have been working there for eight years. They were both so calm and courteous. Next time I return, I'll be sure to request that one of them take care of us on the off chance that the food runner is actually a server and she is our waitress next time. 

The ambiance: sit down. There is a coat rack near the booths and it's a full service restaurant with evening lighting.
The food is delicious, especially the falafel and gyro meat. I ordered to go a few times and the food is always ready by the time I get there. Staff is friendly.
Staff called right away and offered discount.  Very good business practice.  We ordered again and it was much better.  We like it here because they listened to our concerns
I can't believe the people reviewing this place on food. Smh. This place gets a 5 star for it's purpose of a great bar and social spot. End of story.
Please don't smash and burn that burger. I think the employees have no respect for the food. It's sad that smaller chains like this have poor quality control that;s why they don't thrive.

Ive been to a lot of Millers being that I live in the Fort Lauderdale area.  This one is great, super clean, beautiful. Food was awesome!  Omg, the french dip, unreal! Our bartender Ashley was great, knew the menu, had great opinions, I wish this place was near my house!  Bravo!

I've been to Urban Farmer twice and my only gripe is the service (hence the four out of five stars). My first visit was spent at the bar area where I waited 15 minutes to order a drink! Then another 15 minutes to get a menu. Mind you it was a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all! Maybe I should sit in the middle of the bar as opposed to the side but regardless, patrons should never have to wait that long to be served... Or acknowledged. For my second visit, I decided to take my sister and her husband to dine in. We were seated right away. Awesome. We were offered bread! Hell yes we want bread! You would think the bread would come right away but it didn't. It actually came out with our appetizers.... No big deal though. Our main courses also came shortly after. I can continue to complain about the service but it really wasn't completely terrible. 

Overall, I think the place is amazing! I am also obsessed with the interior design... I seriously could live there! 

So let's talk food. Everything I had was amazing! I ordered the duck and my sister and her hubby ordered the steak sampler to share. We also ordered brussels, mushrooms, butternut squash,  foie gras and bone marrow to share. Out of all the appetizers, I enjoyed the foie gras and marrow the most... but everything was just delicious! If you're a big meat eater, I suggest ordering the steak sampler! Worth the money! For my next visit, I'm going to go for the cheese cart and some dessert!

This is not only a great place for locals to dine, but a place tourists or guests at the Logan Hotel can appreciate. 

Can't wait to go back!

Three Sixty is a great place for drinks and appetizers with spectacular views and good ambiance. I've been there about a dozen times. I've used valet every time. The reason for my negative review, however, is that on my last visit, the valet driver damaged by vehicle and did not say anything to me. It wasn't as if they didn't know they did it - they hit the frame directly and hard. And my vehicle which is only a few months old stays parked in my garage all day every day. I wash it twice a week. I know exactly when the damage happened. I called the hotel and asked for the valet manager. Someone took a written message yet no response was received from the valet manager. I called again, asking for the valet manager, and had to leave a voice mail. Again, no response was received. That's poor business etiquette and shows apathy towards a good customer. The reputation of Three Sixty is highly tarnished in my mind. The date of the incident was April 3, 2013.


Update, July 2013:

After posting this, the valet manager did call me and they rectified the situation completely. Today will be the first time I've visited Three Sixty since the incident.

The small plates were delicious, the service was amazing and the decor is very cool. ( I love the giant Ganesh in the doorway). My only complaint has to do with the desserts. The fruit plate was uninspired and the rose ice cream tasted like bubble bath.
The best catfish I've had in a long time. The service was very good. Also have great sweet potato fries.

Slow. Slow. Slow. We came in based off reviews on Yelp. It was 11 am, no other customers. Our server came right up to ask us for drinks. It was super cold and I asked for a hot drink with something fun in it, she said let me check with the bartender. I heard her ask and then they gave her a hard time with recommendations. She never came back with suggestions on what we could order for drinks. Then she disappeared for at least 15 min. No one came over during that time. We were just about to leave when finally the bartender came out to ask us what we wanted. Really?! We already told the girl and you were the one giving her lip. It was so cold outside and we really wanted to warm up so we just ordered two coffees and a shot of Kailua, $17!? Another 10 min later our drinks came. We wanted to eat but after how long the drinks took we decided coffee was it. Unbelievable poor service. We're on our way to K-Paul's for lunch instead. Management should be ashamed of that kind of service.
First time there-very fast service and good food!  Had my five year old and 19 month old-staff was very friendly and accommodating with the kids.  Big food for reasonable prices. Reuben was awesome!

It's a bit hard to find in the shopping center but certainly more than worth it! We had an excellent afternoon tea. I also had the tomato soup, which was lovely. The shop is charming, and the service is good. The tea selection was impressive. I'm looking forward to my next visit.
To expensive for bowling! I'm glad lazer tag was included in the all inclusive price. The drinks were a lil whack, but overall had a Good time with my family.

Modern feel but the food is pretty classic Viet.  I didn't try the fresh rolls but my friends said they were good.  Bahn Mi was superb with a fresh French roll that flakes when you take a bite and fresh herbs and meat filling the middle.  The Bun bowl was pretty large indeed and is recommended.  Grilled pork is sliced thin which is the way to go for these dishes.  Prices are very, very reasonable.  8 bucks for a large Bun bowl.  Great find.
Try the HUMONGO apple pie.  With or without ice cream, it's a treat to satisfy at LEAST 4 hungry-for-dessert people.
The food is tasty and reasonably-priced, and the country decor is well executed. This place deserves better than Penn students looking for a snack after a night of partying.

We went in with a fairly large party on short notice and wow did they deliver! The food was really good. This was my first time there. We had the chicken nachos and brisket. Our service was top notch, very attentive, friendly, everything came out correct. The food was priced reasonably as well. They really went above and beyond for us! The ambiance was really cute, we sat out on the patio. Highly recommend!!!
Wouldn't go back if it was free terrible service and food tasted pre cooked might as well go to wing house if you want crappy microwaved food save your cash folks

If you're looking for good Mexican food, Sweet Taco is NOT the place.  I tried the pork taco and a brisket taco, both were flavorless and bland.  My dining partner tried the nachos, and they were a sorry affair with hardly any toppings and big chunks of lettuce, again, very bland.  The salsa (and I'm being generous calling it salsa) was incredibly bad, flavorless, and an odd color - almost tan.  Worst salsa ever.  Salsa is not difficult to make, so I can't image why they can't even pull a decent salsa together.  The chips served with the awful salsa were thin and crisp, and unfortunately, the best item they offered.  The guacamole had huge chunks of avacado in it and was passable, at best.  Our meals were so bad that we didn't even want to try the donuts, fearing it would be more of the same.  If you didn't like Taqueria Del Sol, you won't like Sweet Taco - all they did was change the name and add a few menu items.  Also, there are several bottles of hot sauce on each table.  I did not use any because the tops of the bottles were so crusted and sticky that it was unappetizing.  I guess they do not notice or do not care enough to clean the bottle tops occasionally.  I ate here once when it was Taqueria Del Sol, and I swore I'd never go back, well, they changed their name and fooled me a second time, but never again!

It want to busy when we went at 11 am on a Friday, and there were only 2 wait staff on, despite about 12 tables being full. Service, however, was prompt, friendly, and over all left a good taste in my mouth. Unfortunately, the food did not. I must say, they have some of the best priced big dishes in town. $10.99 for 3 eggs Benedict and a heaping pile of what could have been delicious potatoes. But, I guess what they do is not purchase, or use, seasoning in the kitchen. They also don't believe in proper plating. 8 thick, full spears of asparagus (slightly under done) was the bed on which my 3 perfectly poached, yet cold, eggs were placed on.

Stopped by today for a Reuben & Cuban sandwich.  They were ok.  Better than average but not nearly as good as some of my favorite sandwich shops.  I'd return again if I was in Dogtown, but if I was to go out of my way, I'd drive to Fozzie's, 9th Street Deli, Adriannas, or Blues City first.

Went here for lunch today after years and it didn't disappoint, food very incredible! The toasted coconut marg is delicious and the cauliflower tacos are AMAZING! Best cauliflower I've had restaurant wise. Can't wait to go back

We went through the drive through at 9:15pm and their signs say they close at 10pm. There were 8 employees in the window that we could see and some even looked at us in our car and pretended they didn't see us!!!! What? We waited and then just went somewhere else. They were all just sitting around talking. Are you open or not??

My husband and I had a quick meal last night. Just a burger and the football game. Food was good, service was friendly and efficient. But after I paid the bill with cash, our waitress ignored us to the point of turning her head when she walked by. I have a very low guilt threshold so immediately thought the tip was too small. In the car, I recalculated. I hadn't misread the total. But just now, we realized that I might have miscounted the bills and left only a two dollar tip. We were traveling so I can't just run in with the difference anytime soon. I just want her to know that it was a mistake. I appreciate that she works hard and I'm very sorry.
The salads are so good! Fresh ingredients. You pick what you want on it. Surreal is so nice- the whole staff is friendly! Mango dressing is amazing. The turkey chili is on point as well.

Normally my experience here is amazing; however today it was horrible. We were told that our wait would be 20 mins but it was a lot longer. My husband decided to walk to grab champagne. He wasn't gone long at all, but they kept putting people in front of us because he wasn't here. I was here and we told her he was leaving, that was her opportunity to tell us that the entire party had to be here to be seated. When I addressed it she was rude and condescending. I hope that the managers will take time to teach their staff customer service. This was a bad experience and I'm highly disappointed because I love Sabrina's.

I would give this spot a 3.75/5.00 if possible. Since I can't, I rounded up to 4.00/5.00 for the delicious wine and great atmosphere.

On my visit to Nashville, a friend who has lived in Nashville for 3 years suggested going to Rumours. It is labeled a Wine Bar for a reason - the waitress recommended a medium body French Pinot Noir that was easy to drink and did not break the bank. The wine went down like water, resulting in splitting two bottles between two people.

We paired the wine with the cheese plate, the meatballs, & the mussel bowl with spaghetti. The cheese plate came with four wedges of cheese, including a delicious goat cheese, tomato marmalade, nuts, and an array of bread and crackers. I enjoyed all of the cheeses, except the Dijon, and would recommend asking to substitute this cheese for an additional goat cheese or the server's suggestion.

The mussel bowl came fresh to order in a white wine & capers sauce topped with feta cheese. I will most definitely order this plate on my next visit to Rumours and highly recommend it to any guest.

Lastly, the meatballs were tasty but tiny. I expected the serving size of 4 meatballs as it was on under the small plates section on the menu. I was surprised that the 4 meatballs were roughly 1 inch in diameter. Still, the carrot-apple-fennel slaw complement the dish perfectly. At $8 a plate, I would suggest a try if you like meatballs but recommend ordering at least 2 for tables of more than 2 people.

Two bottles and a few small plates later, we stumbled out vowing to revisit the next time that I visit. I hope to go back when the weather is a nicer to sit in the gorgeous outside area.

Mediocre service at best, pretty decent French food though. 

Upon arriving to the restaurant you are greeted by a large sign in the middle of the walkway that says "Please seat yourself." I typically have no issue with places that ask you to seat yourself, in fact, I rather enjoy picking my own seat. However, I wasn't greeted by an actual person for 10 minutes after finding a seat. 

When I was finally welcomed the person brought me water and took my order for coffee which she promptly returned with then told me someone would be along shortly to take my order. 

...10 more minutes pass before a waiter comes to take my order. Keep in mind that the restaurant was only 50% full when I came in to eat. 

The food came out promptly after ordering as a nice change of pace and was pretty good. Not the best Croque Madame I've had but certainly not the worst either. 

If they improved their service I would be tempted to return.

Wow! Great recommendation by the Green House Inn staff!  Happy hour was great - although there was wait to be seated (we eventually were sat in the back room that was completely empty until we were shown our table). Oysters, pate, fried oyster salad were impalpable - but food envy of neighboring tables burger, gumbo, and the special!

A must!!

Two words, one name. Brandon Raven. The BEST service that I have gotten at a restaurant in a very long time. He always checked in on us and had the best of attitudes. 10/10 recommend and request him if you can, for the gatsby of experiences!!

When I tell people in Philadelphia that I'm Greek-American, invariably one of the first questions I'll get is "What's your favorite Greek restaurant in Philly?" which is quickly followed by "What do you think of South Street Souvlaki?" I have always been at a loss to answer either because I don't eat out often, and when I do it's almost never at a Greek restaurant. Also, as a vegetarian, I just wouldn't go to a restaurant whose name celebrates meat. 

So when my friend Brad mentioned that he'd heard about a new Greek restaurant and would I check it out with him, I was immediately interested. From the initial reviews it sounded legit, more like the food I'd grown up eating at home rather than Greek food catering to American tastes (the many complaints about the lack of lettuce in the Greek salad were a good sign). The menu does still lean more towards the preferences of meat-eaters (gotta give the market what it wants) but there are several vegetarian options. No fish entrees, which seemed like a pretty major omission for a Greek restaurant, but the garidomakaronada sounds like the shrimp Santorini I used to love, which isn't something you find often. 

But anyway, for my first visit the seafood test was the xtopodi (grilled octopus). Because if a Greek restaurant can't do THAT well, it'll never be great. The verdict? It has potential, but I have to admit it's not the way I'm used to having Greek-style octopus. Usually it's cut into pieces (thus more thoroughly cooked), and here the tentacles were served pretty much intact. The flavors were right though, and maybe this is the way it's actually served in Greece? It's tasty so still worth getting, but it's a huge portion so you probably want to have at least 4 people in your party who love octopus if you're going to order this.

I chose the spanakopita as an entree, and that was definitely excellent. The pita was clearly house-made (not ready-made phyllo-dough) and delicious, and the spinach filling was really well done. This definitely stacked up against plenty of the better homemade spanakopita I've had. Brad got the meat-eater's version, the kreatopita (which had chicken, pork and lamb). I've never seen that in a Greek home or restaurant before, so I'm guessing this was made, again, for American tastes. But it must work, because he liked it. Both dishes came with the horiatiki salad - yes, this is what Greek salad is supposed to be like!

Moving beyond the menu, the decor reminded me a lot of the more minimalist Greek tavernas I've been to, though still with a good dose of Greek art and elements (wall tiles, prints, statuettes, etc.) I could heard traditional Greek music over the loudspeaker but the noise level mostly obscured it - the restaurant was PACKED. Lots of big parties, families, etc. Everyone seemed like they were having a great time, and the hosts and servers ran around frantically to make sure that was the case.

So I'm happy to now know a great Greek restaurant in Philly! Well, close enough - a Philly suburb. Since most of the Greeks I know seem to prefer the suburbs anyway, this actually makes sense. In the meantime, I still need to find a good Greek restaurant in the city itself (eventually).

I've been seeing this place all over social media and have been wanting to try it for the longest time!
As luck would have it I go the chance to go this weekend since I was on the south side of Indy. 
I love it! Located in what was the old ice house bar is Dukes and it is set up like a honky tonk bar, neon lights old signs.. the works! 
They also have pretty legit live music and this comes from a person who didn't grow up with country music. 
Awesome service! I hope people understand that that they are making moves with how packed they are, I even had a guy who was hanging out drinking and was helping a friend bus tables.. 
If you go at night the menu is limited but that's ok! Get the whole fried chicken and all the sides and you won't be mad! 
The chicken is cooked to perfection! And had this seasoning on it that is sweet and spicy and I wish I knew what is was, but it tastes great! 
Hash brown waffle is to die for! The hatch Mac is the right amount of spice and the Brussel sprouts were seasoned and charred in just the right way.
Can't wait to go back to try lunch foods

Brunch was so loud, obnoxious really. Food was amazing, coronarita amazing, and service was pretty great too. The ambiance was really it's before noon, we are brunching let's get smashed. That might have just been the other guests that day, LOL. Really it was yummy and a great time.

This is your classic ghetto chic Thai joint.  The place is a dive, it looks like someone knitted together a couple of dilapidated double wides and called it a restaraunt.  And believe me, devotees are hoping you just drive on by.  This place is another hidden gem.  Looks aside, TPK is serving up the best Thai this and that side of the Cumberland.  The Chi of this place is great, just go look in the kitchen.  You've got of gaggle a lovely Thai grandmas, mothers and sisters cooking up a storm and they know what they are about.

I visited Comfort Food and Kitchenette last night for the first time and I am impressed!  It's very unassuming from the outside, located in a little shopping center in Morrisville, but don't pass this place by - it's delicious.  

The decor of the restaurant is vibrate and inviting.  We sat along the wall of the restaurant where they have a long bench with chairs on the opposite side.  The benches have lots of pillows, which makes sitting down and enjoying your food a comfy experience.

I ordered the eggplant parm stack with cashew cheese and my date ordered the falafel salad - both of them were great.  I am vegetarian, but my date is not, and even he got in on my vegan eggplant.   I definitely go back to Kitchenette and try more things on the menu, the blackboard specials are ever changing so I am excited to see what I get to try next.
Awesome Creole Vietnamese fusion. Small menu centered around flavor (not a bad thing!). Friendly knowledgeable staff. Fair priced bottles of wine.
The staff was extremely rude to me and my wife while we were staying at the hotel. The hotel staff was very short with me and rude on more than one different occasion.

Really, 3.5 stars because I didn't know how to do a 1/2 star. We tried to join another party, they were unable to accommodate us unless we ALL moved to another table so I moved to the bar. Interesting layout as they have a second ring of 4 toppers AROUND the central bar. We got our first waters within 5 minutes of sitting without asking. Within 3 more minutes, our waitress appeared for drink and appetizer orders. Got our wines, (Xplorador, Chile) my glass was dirty and the pour was below my normal expectation of a normal pour. Didn't say anything. Appetizers come next. Got the slab cut maple bacon and the "famous for" shrimp cocktail. OUTSTANDING!!! If Ur a bacon and spicy shrimp cocktail lover, you MUST get this. WARNING: shrimp cocktail is NOT inexpensive. Waitress returns to ask if I want another glass of wine. Yes, I'm running low at this point. I tell her about the dirty glass and the "poor" pour. She says she'll tell the bartender. Glass arrived poured about 3/4 FULL! Now, THAT'S what I meant by a good pour! Main dishes come. We got the St Elmo's Prime Rib sandwiches with house onion rings and cut fries. The onion rings came with a spicy ketchup/cocktail sauce-VERY good! The sandwiches were excellent.  The meat was super tender and tasty. U could easily bite thru the meat after dipping in the au jus sauce. I liked the creamy horseradish sauce better tho. I ask for the bill. No room left for dessert. $110.00 pre tip for 3 glasses of wine, two appetizers (shrimp cocktail $35.00 alone) and 2 entrees. The servers were all attentive, the food VERY good, but the price I thought a tad on the high side.

This place is great in a lot of ways. I enjoy the food. I usually order basic breakfast-type foods and they prepare them quite well. The decor is a very cute Aussie-inspired something or other. Cute, whatever. THEY HAVE MAGAZINES!! Sometimes you have to wait a while to get seats during the brunchy/breakfasty prime-time hours. They have a little stash of books, magazines, and kiddy toys hanging out by the side so you can occupy yourself with that nonsense whilst waiting. It makes the time fly while you wait. The beverages are good, good teas and coffees, and the have little impulse treats you can grab on the way out. It should also be noted that their customer service is exceptional. They're very friendly and helpful.

It was a rainy day. My family and I walked in and got seated immediately; we were table of 4. The server brought us a few waters to start. We ordered some appetizers to begin. The atmosphere was so quiet, I thought it was awkward. It was not at all packed, and I kind of wished they had more customers so there would be a more lively, dynamic atmosphere. I think the place overall was overpriced, but the appetizers were fairly priced. 

Appetizers: 
Coconut Shrimp
Miso Soup
Age Dashi Tofu
Thai Lemongrass Coconut Chicken Soup

The Coconut Shrimp was good and so was the miso soup. However, the Age Dashi Tofu was bland and the Thai Lemongrass Coconut Chicken Soup was not the best. We then proceed to order sushi and our entrees. 

Sushi: 
Crunchy Roll
Hello Kitty
Sexiest Man Roll
Puff Daddy

Entrees:
Salmon Hibachi with sauteed vegetables and white rice
Singapore Rice Vermicelli

As for the sushi, the crunchy roll was superb, and I really recommend it if you like a plain, yet delicious roll. The hello kitty roll was the size of a diagonally cut sandwich and it was hard to eat with the chopsticks. Actually, I didn't know how I was supposed to eat it! Besides that, it was enjoyable. The sexiest man roll was acceptable, and my sister liked the sauce that was drizzled on top of the sushi! The puff daddy was adequate and my sissy and I really like the crunchy stuff on top! 

The Salmon Hibachi with sauteed vegetables and white rice was excellent. I highly recommend this dish. The salmon was cooked perfectly and very flavorful. The sauteed onions compliments the salmon. The sauteed vegetables was great. The Singapore Rice Vermicelli was also delicious and I recommend this dish as well. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for a special event, but for casual dinner or lunch I would rather go to another place.

Best Vietnamese and Southeast restaurant in Delaware. I used to drive to Philly for Vietnamese food but not anymore. 

The owner really cares about his food and the customers.

The overall experience was satisfactory. The stuffed mushrooms was a great appetizer with a warm seafood soufflé stuffing. The taste on New Orleans is the best plate for undecided guests because it provides a pleasing sample of the jambalaya, gumbo, and crawfish étouffée. The best part of the meal was the French onion soup. By far the best French onion soup I've had and exemplifies how it should always taste!!! I don't think the soup gets enough hype as it deserves. Not that other things on the menu weren't good because they were. Just don't forget the French onion!
Bright, colorful, clean and comfortable environs; lots of fresh juice drinks to choose from; tasty homemade soups as well. A nice place to stop by!

Service and ambience were 5 star. Coffee was excellent as well. Food was just a 2. I had the special omelet with beef and cream cheese. It was good. My wife had waffles and bacon. She thought it was okay.
The food here is ok.  I heard great things about the coleslaw but it wasn't really my thing.  The beef brisket was alright, but not the best I've had.  I liked their bbq sauce though.

I had Wild Eggs in Louisville several years ago while visiting a friend, and when I saw the building sign pop up off of 31 on my daily commute from work, I think I immediately began salivating.  I've been anxiously awaiting a visit once they opened, and I wasn't disappointed.  I went with a friend and we opted to share a savory and sweet dish.  We got the buffalo chicken omelet and cinnamon roll.  The buffalo chicken wasn't what I would typically order, but it was scrumptious.  It basically tasted like the buffalo chicken dip you have at parties, but made with an egg and hot sauce.  Hello!  The cinnamon roll was large and perfectly soft in the center.  Yum yum yum.  I can't wait to go back and try more options.

Great place to pick up EXCELLENT but affordable quality meats and accompaniments.  And the Batali sandwich is one of the best sandwiches in town, hands down.  Very helpful and courteous staff as well.

I have not tried this location for a while even though it is the closest to my residence.
The restaurant is still poorly managed. I went for lunch with my son and opted to eat outside. One table was open but still not cleaned and we waited for 5 minutes until I decided to clean the table. 
The wings I ordered were dry and greasy. It seems they were cooked frozen. The curly fries were bits and pieces once I picked the top fries.
Waitress did not ask if we needed anything else and we had to request for condiments. 
This location would not still be open if it was not for Covid relief. I am done with it.
Worst Hooters.

I love The Royale. The decor is great, especially around Halloween. The people are great. The music is great. The food is great, and I love how late they serve it. The drinks are thoughtful and delicious. I especially love how they require vaccinations to eat indoors--it's nice to not have to stress when I go there. Thank you for being wonderful, Royale!

Nola Caye's atmosphere was nice and the decor was on point I loved all of the plants around the restaurant. The dish that I had (Jerk Chicken) was flavorful with aromatic spices; the dish was however missing that heat or "spice" normally associated with Jerk Chicken. I also had a featured cocktail called the "Bayou Breeze" that was decent with a nice balance of alcohol to juice. Will try again to hopefully push my review to 5 stars.

I'm visiting my family here I live in NYC and I was told that this deli is truly New York style deli.
I ordered the pastrami and wasn't that thrilled with it.
I'm used to the NYC delis pastrami with the juicy taste and the darker ends of the meat this pastrami had little flavor and was a bit on the light side and not a flavor I  recognized.
However that said next time I  will try other items just to be fair cause even in the NYC delis their meats aren't perfect every time
The atmosphere was Excellent the staff Excellent with many N.Y. posters and train stations actual signs hanging on the walls that was as delight.
The place was crowded people seemed to be enjoying themselves so I  will re write this review if in the future some other dish their tickles my mouth
Delicious dessert and coffee! We got the cococino and the frutti di basco! Highly recommend this place to come take a little break from all the crazy !

Wow! This place really lives up to the hype. My husband and I came for a late Sunday lunch. It was the perfect time to visit. We got a booth n the corner of the bar right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive.

The lunch prices are really reasonable. I got a delicious split pea soup, followed by a giant equally delicious veggie burger. For under $15 I had enough food to tak home to eat for dinner. My husband had a rigatoni dish that was also amazing and large enough for leftovers. Our total bill was under $30. 

Another reason to go near closing on Sunday - on our way out we were given 2 free loaves of fresh baked bread that would have gotten thrown away. Score! Amazing food, great atmosphere, great service and an awesome lunch value. We will be back often!

This was the last stop before home. The outside area was full, so we were lucky to find a table inside. They had a 40 birthday party, but it was contained and they had enough space. Our waitress was quick to get our drink orders, and every attentive throughout the night. 

Next time I will try the food.
Best pizza I've ever had!   Service and selection can't be beat. A must visit for anyone in the downtown area.

A great place for a good cup of coffee and a snack while I read a book or do some school work. Unlike another nearby coffee shop known for its burnt coffee, the coffee is just the way I like it. Waves has a nice neighbourhood atmosphere with comfy chairs and reliable WiFi.

Arrived 15 minutes before reservation and was told that the seating was on time. No big deal as we made our way to the bar. Bar was moderately crowded but extremely loud for the amount of people. Drinks were mediocre at best. Sazerac was underwhelming and Moscow mules were some of the worst I've experienced in Nashville. For the price I'd expect them to be on par with Morton's or the Oak Bar. 

Sat on time, but took longer than expected for waiter to approach table. After trying the pickles and bell peppers, the bread came which was delicious. We decided on the smoked salmon and bacon as an appetizer. I must say the bacon may have been the highlight of the meal. It was deliciously prepared with a great sauce. Salads arrived and contained surprising delicious tomatoes, especially for the time of year. Going into the entree I had high expectations. However  my ribeye, although prepared fantastically visually (medium rare) lacked the flavor I typically expect from the cut of meat. My wife ordered the shrimp pasta which even though the shrimp was cooked well, lacked flavor. The best part of the meal was probably the skillet fried potatoes and gravy... absolutely delicious.

Overall not a bad experience, but for the price and ambiance I'd much rather go to one of the other steakhouses in Nashville. Definitely worth checking out, if for nothing else then to reaffirm your favorite restaurant.

I love Iztaccihuati and order from them pretty often. But unfortunately, for my last order there was a long black hair right in my grilled steak burrito. This is simply unacceptable. 

I have eaten food from here over ten times and this is the only time I have had a negative result. Pretty disappointing.

We love Bar Taco because of the energy and airiness in the dining room, but it took me about a year to really say I really liked the food. We went the first time about one week after they opened and I was annoyed at the prices. I thought everything was a bit too expensive for what you got. But over time I started to find items on the menu like their tamales and rice bowls that I really love. My husband loves their tacos and cucumber salad. He has loved them from day one, hence why we kept coming back. We also love their green salsa. We find the wait for a table usually too long, so we usually sit at the bar. Their drinks are all fresh juices. Everything about Bar Taco tastes very fresh. Eventually I got used to the prices vs food size and just enjoyed the food. The outside seating is not that comfortable but they do have a few regular tables that are nice.

Seeing that I was dining by myself I opted for the small lower east loop (thin crust) and I wasn't disappointed at all. Wish I would have eaten at the actual restaurant but I got mine to go but it seemed like a great place to sit down for a beer. Pizza was delicious and very tasty, will have to try the deep dish and their wings next time in town. I just didn't want to embarrass myself on my first visit  :)

I'm between a 3-4 stars, but I'll opt for higher at present. Upside: on Mass Ave, and even if it's not on the 'by the glass' list, if you order 2 glasses of something, they will open the bottle for you. How's that for a helluva nice host? Had a decent salad and the entrees were pretty good. My fella had a chicken dish that was quite juicy and tender. 

Decor was a little disjointed and odd, but hey, we live in a disjointed and odd sort of world. I had some sort of fish special that was edible and filling, but not super memorable.

Will be back for further diving...

Love love love! their tuna on rye and the Greek salad!  Burgers are yummy, so is spinach dip. I had the "Pick-a-Peppa", and didn't love it. Menu description was a little misleading, but it's been my only misstep there so far. I've always had great service there too.  Prices seem high, but you get lots of food so I guess it works out.

So, I like Standard Tap.  The food is awesome the beer selection is great, and the service is fast and friendly.  I don't go to No Libs often, but this is a spot I like to drink at when I'm in the area.  I feel that they are a little pricey, but I guess they can be because of lack of competition.  I think their happy hour could be a little better.  $1 off a draft isn't the best deal in the world, but they are my only complaints really.  If you're in Northern Liberties then this is the place to drink good beer.

We always enjoy our dinners here. Tonight we had the bistro rib eye which was better than perfect and the filet with shrimp which  was excellent. The service Is always above and beyond- tonight we had Jimmy who was so friendly and charmIng that  he made  our dinner That much better!

Made my way here with the recommendation from a close friend.  Even on a weekday, this place was hustling and bustling - always a positive sign! The tables are pretty cramped, so it does create an intimate but noisy setting - part of the charm.  I had ordered the short rib pasta, kale salad, and a goat cheese mushroom toast.  Everything was to-die for, especially the kale salad and the goat cheese and mushroom toast.  Normally, I am not a big goat cheese or kale guy, but every last bite was had here.

Highly recommended! Great food and great service.

Best sandwiches in Philly. If you're giving this place bad reviews because they support BLM you're more sensitive than the liberals you claim to hate.
Order the Herschel Waker and shut the f*** up, you wrong-side-of-history mother f******!

Now this is a streak salad! Whistle stop you always please. Thank you for being consistently consistent! Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Had a steak salad that was awesone! Hey @waterandoak take notes!

My boyfriend won a football bet and his prize was to choose dinner. He wanted to go to Seoul Kitchen, but after reading Isabella J's SK review, we decided to try Kimchi Time instead and we're so glad we did! 

The tables were full at 8 pm, which is a testament to their popularity and solid food. The servers were very friendly, but not the most attentive. I did have to flag them a few times but they were especially responsive. 

We ordered the mandu, spicy Korean wings, dolsot bi bam bap, and grilled gal bi - all dishes I highly recommend! They serve everything piping hot, maybe too hot. The wings weren't too spicy in my opinion (I can barely do hot cheetohs). I loved my sweet delicious gal bi. They also provide 5 sides including different kimchi vegetables and sweet mashed potatoes (I asked for extra).  Finish your meal with red bean ice cream and I guarantee you'll leave with a happy belly.

Went in for an early dinner. Wife ordered medium rare steak which came out well done. The waiter was not attentive and rather rude I thought. Not what I expected for this type of place and more over not what I expected when they are only serving a few at a time. 
I'll try somewhere else next time the wife and I want to go out. Not happy experience for $100 worth of food/service.
The French onion soup was exactly what I heard it was....:DELICIOUS!!! Prices weren't over the top for New Orleans.
I have been going to First Watch for years.  I love the menu selection, taste and quality of food and the price is reasonable.  I always leave satisfied and happy with my eating experience.
This place has great service and food.  I had the shrimp and grits. It was tasty and filling.

We did take out from pop-up. The communication with when your order is ready is terrible, we got a text literally right when we were finished eating that our food was ready. 

We both got the Tennessee Tonkotsu, I chose to add spinach for a whopping $2 extra. I'm glad I did. The broth and meat were extremely flavorful but the only thing besides noodles was scallions and some weird mushroom(?) that reminded me of seaweed.  For $14, I would have liked a bit more in my bowl. 

The hot chicken buns were absolutely delicious and honestly, I may just go back for them.

I love, love, love this place! I always try to stop by whenever we are in Philly, we actually came here a few times from NY just to have dinner here.  Did I mention that I love this place?  My ultimate goal is to try all of the dishes on the menu, which has been difficult as I always order the same 2-3 dishes each time.  See below for the dishes I have tried, which are ranked based on my preference:

Prah-Hok Kateeh - My absolute favorite dish and I have to order it every time I come here.  It doesn't look much in pictures, but trust me, you will love it.  It is basically ground pork that is flavored to perfection and you eat it with an assortment of vegetables.  I can eat this dish everyday!  Actually Khmer Kitchen inspired me to try to replicate this dish at home, I have tried a bunch of different variations of this dish using recipes from the internet, and none have even come close to the ones served here.

Sah-Law Machue Yuin - Another dish that I always order. It is a sweet and sour soup that comes with either chicken, fish or shrimp.  My personal favorite is the fish version.  Due to the fact that there are no Cambodian restaurants in NYC, I try to order a similar dish when I go to Vietnamese restaurants, but needless to say, none have come close to this dish.  I love the fresh pineapples (most other places use canned ones), and the gourd melon, which I have never had before I came here, now I love it!

Cha Throp - stir fried eggplant that comes with either pork or chicken.  I love the pork version, the pork just melts in your mouth.  The flavor could be similar to eggplant with garlic sauce from Chinese restaurants, but Khmer Kitchen uses big pieces of perfectly flavored pork instead of group pork, which I think makes a huge difference

Cha Mussels - The sauce for this dish is out of this world.  True story, my friend actually took the leftover sauce to go so that she can eat it over rice for lunch the next day, no mussels, just the sauce.  The mussels are great too, but the sauce this the star of this dish, and I kind of wish they serve bread with this dish so I can sop up that delicious heavenly sauce.

Pleah Sak-Koe- It is basically a rare beef salad.  For people who are a bit squeamish about eating rare beef, this is probably not the dish for you. For the more adventurous eaters, give this a chance.  It is super refreshing, particularly during the summer.  Could be a bit spicy, so be forewarned!

Sah-Law Machue Kr'ung - another soup with either chicken or beef.  I liked the aforementioned sweet and sour soup better, but this one has my favorite protein, i.e. beef.  The beef is super tender and flavorful.  I picked out all of the beef while everyone else was busy talking (no, that's not rude at all)

Kuh-Puh Ch'in - Shrimps that are lightly battered and fried to perfection.  I am not a huge fan of shrimp, but if I have to eat shrimp, I would eat this any day.

Cha La-Pauh - stir fried pumpkin with either chicken or pork.  I don't like pumpkin, but the pork in this dish is so yummy.  I had to be sneaky and pick out the pork as I did with the previously mentioned soup.  Everyone that liked pumpkins at the table raved about this dish.

Cha Kr'ung - stir fry dish with celery and pepper, comes with either chicken or beef.  It was just ok, nothing too spectacular to report.  

Cha Lok-Lak - my least favorite dish.  It is basically beef cubes on a bed of lettuce.  Perhaps I should've dipped the beef in the sauce longer, but it is not as flavorful as the rest of the menu.

This is a family restaurant with the mother and grandmother in the back cooking, and coming here feels like going home to mom's cooking, well if your mom is Cambodian and an amazing cook.  The waiter is super friendly, I assume he's the son/grandson to the chefs.  He's always very patient in answering whatever questions we have, and always accommodating with all of the annoying requests I have (i.e. more vegetables for the Prah-Hok Kateeh, more napkins, takeout containers for the leftover sauce).  The only downside is that the hours can be unpredictable, so definitely call beforehand.  I have been disappointed numerous times because they had to close early, or open late for various reasons, as I don't live in Philly, I couldn't wait around for them to open.  It has been a running joke between us that we are 'lucky' if the place is actually open when they say they would.  However, they have a loyal customer in me, I will come back here again and again!

The best Japanese "fast food" you will ever taste made to order. The place is family owned. Lori and Hiro are the owners and they are the sweetest people you will ever meet. They have a variety of food at great prices.  I look forward to Thursday to Saturday for their authentic gourmet fresh hot ramen. Yummy! This place is a true gem of Tucson.

What a fabulous experience - the lobster bisque was incredible!!!! We went during the 4pm to 8pm happy hour and had a fantastic meal with drinks and were blown away at how low the bill was! The service was good and we felt very welcomed.

I gave this a 2/5 stars because of the impersonal service given by one of the managers, Rebecca. The food, however, is beyond phenomenal! I usually go to the Holdren's in Goleta, which also has amazing food, but decided to try the Santa Barbara location for my mom's birthday. I was supremely disappointed in the server's attitude and attention, and the food was more expensive than in Goleta - but this is to be expected given the location. The only nice thing she did was give her a free dessert. I won't be returning anytime soon.
Awesome place a tiny bit pricey but worth every penny me and my girlfriend got sandwiches a beer and warm mozzarella to share 30$ casual place great for hangouts highly recommended
My "go to" for a quick, healthy bite and delicious juices in downtown Indy!  They're open pretty late at night too and serve amazing cocktails.  Definitely one of my favorites; I highly recommend it.

The premise is clean organic eating which I love!This establishment is counter service during the day and table service at night. First trip I had the Smoked Salmon & Scrambled BLT it was $14 and it was only ok. I drank the free water on the table. There was a lot of bread and I ended up eating the sandwich open-faced. I wish I had gotten a juice or smoothie to try but after $14 on a sandwich that wasn't an option this time. My coworkers ordered other meal options but no one was blown away. It was just ok.

On my second trip I came for dinner with my family because my sister loves this place and I have to say it has improved since opening. I got the chicken salad sandwich and hot cauliflower. I am in love and wish I could eat it everyday! 

 I will say the ambiance was fabulous and this place is truly adorable! If you think you might be into it, I say just go for it and try to form your own opinions because you might like it more than I did.

There is EiO & The Hive parking right outside but it indicates that there is a 20-minute limit which doesn't seem like enough time.
Delicious good and great customer service. A must stop for anyone who's hungry and in the area!

The smoked brisket is AMAZING. I would definitely go here if you're in the area. It has to be some of the best BBQ in Philly. If you can't find parking on the street (good luck) there's a parking garage across the street by whole foods. Everything that everyone in my party ordered (5 people) was very good.

I'm a native Nashvillian and library-enthusiast, so I've seen this place several times but had never been in. I came here for the first time with a friend during the Southern Festival of Books this past weekend. It was a Saturday afternoon, and we learned upon arrival that they were closing in another 10 minutes. We just wanted a piece of cake, which was already prepared and sitting in a glass case. As we were looking at the case deciding on which we wanted, we were stiffly informed "We're Closed!" by a gentleman who worked there and that we would not be able to order. Then he turned to the woman working the register (who was in the process of taking a man's order) and told her to continue helping that man, because "he's a regular." He proceeded to point us toward the door and made it abundantly clear we weren't welcome even though it was 10'til. Unbelievable. With all the tourists that were in town this weekend for the home game & the book festival, I am baffled that someone would chance dirtying a visitor's experience in our city with that kind of nonsense.

Despite how rude we felt this encounter was, I went back the next day to get my cake & a coffee-drink. Because, you know, cake is cake and I have needs. And I've got to tell you, the customer service was lackluster and the cake was at best mediocre. The coffee was so thick and sweet I threw more than half of it away. My boyfriend got a panini, and that was really good, but still--definitely not worth patronizing this business after how I've seen they treat their customers. I work in corporate retail, so maybe I'm overly sensitive to these things, but I very firmly believe that there is absolutely NO excuse whatsoever for poor customer service. And that is definitely what's happening here.

Anyway, the second star is for the panini. Good thing they have "regulars," otherwise, I don't know how they'd stay in business.

Hands-down, one of the best meals I've ever had from a fast food restaurant. I ordered the spicy bacon and cheese and chicken burger with french fries and both were cooked fresh. I'll wait seven minutes on that any day! They must've changed management. Lol this was at 1am also

We Had a great time. People were sitting out side they had air and mist blowing for everyone outside so they would t get hot. We  decided to sit inside because we had a party of six. Our waitress was outstanding. We ordered  2 appetizers the flaming cheese saganaki... Amazing, and Tzatzikii which came with pita bread. Yummy yummy yummy!! I could have licked the bowl but my family would never have gone out to eat with me again. I got the chicken gyro platter... Loved it... it was so much food. It comes with fries and a Greek salad. Three people in our party got the regular gyro platter. Everyone of them had to get a take home box as well but they loved every bite... they wanted to eat more but felt they may have to roll out the door. The salmon was very good and she ate every bite of it! My nephew ordered the  cheeseburger and Greek fries and he was as satisfied as a teenage boy with a phone and a burger would tell me but there wasn't anything left on his plate   The waitress came through and put on the music and danced threw napkins up in the air and all over us yelling  OPA and dancing around the room celebrating my daughter. They threw plates into a aluminum bucket  braking them in Greek tradition yelling  OPA and clapping! And dancing! It was great fun and such a sweet surprise for my daughter. We will be back! The food was great the atmosphere was fun and the staff was so friendly!  ( also we were more than 6 feet apart from any other table ... we felt very comfortable)
This is the best sushi I've had in Philly! After many attempt to find good sushi in this city, Kai wins it!

We ordered food to go because the restaurants at Union Station all had 1.5 to 2 hour waits. The food  at Maggie's was so good, we ordered it twice.  We had the black bean burger, which is served on a giant pretzel bun.  I ordered it with lettuce, onion, pickle, tomato on the side and they packed up the condiments in a foil packet, so the bean burger wasn't soggy.  We also has a cuban which was great, pretzel bites with cheese, french fries, onion rings, chicken wings, and pepperoncini dip.  The orders were all completed accurately, the food was delicious, and it was prepared quickly.  We called the orders in, and 20 minutes later they were ready to be picked up. The serving sizes were large. The pepperoncini dip was my favorite. Will definitely get food from there again when we are back in the area.

Delicate & delicious "short eggs" spicy marinara casserole took me back to my childhood. Friendly, efficient staff and hip clientele plus great coffee and, oh yeah, CLOTH napkins. Very classy and enlightening.

I am a regular at Zizzo's, because it has the best brewed coffee in town. I probably go at least 1-2 a week just for a 24oz large coffee for 2.50!! A delicious cup of coffee (or technically three) at this price is unbeatable.

I'm definitely a coffee snob and I care deeply about the roasting. My husband is from Seattle and my mother travels quite often to Colombia. Zizzo's is my favorite because they always have a light roast, medium roast, and dark roast coffee of the day to chose from. 

Let's talk about light roast. I have a deep appreciation for light roast coffee for a couple of reasons. First, it has the highest caffeine content. Second, it's hard to do light roast that has a good prominent flavor. All of Zizzo's light roast coffees are amazing. I personally love the Mexican Altura and the Guatemala Antigua roasts.

The medium roast is the Santa Barbara blend and it's great too. A solid go-to. I'll occasionally get a dark roast, and have never been disappointed. Occasionally they have a Tanzania peaberry, and I can never pass that up.

Their food is okay(but delicious at their other location), the clientele are friendly, they love dogs, and I've never ever had bad service. Tammy is my favorite barista, she seems genuinely happy! 

This was all about the brewed coffee, but their espresso drinks are also really good. I like the Mexican mocha the best. I don't recommend the biscotti, but the other baked goods are fine.

They also give my pup a dog treat, and that makes me happy!  I also forgot to mention they have a few great beers on tap, and a fun system where locals buy each other beers in advance and Zizzo's puts their names on the wall and what someone has purchased for them.

A taste of home in your mouth they hit the mark on good west coast authentic Mexican food and real sangria we are Cali born girls and Los Arroyos gets our stamp of approval and our waiter Deven was/is absolutely amazing & attentive

The best dunkin location out there. The workers always happy to greet me and sandwiches are always toasted perfectly, never too cold or overcooked like i have had at other locations. I always go out of my way to come here
I'm so full! And my phones gonna die. But great all you can eat shrimp with a fantastic waiter

I have dined in four times now and every time it's been consistently delicious. If you're from the Northeast it's always a challenge to find a great deli sandwich.

Pickles plus has the real thing, their corned beef and or pastrami sandwiches are lean, carved thin and piled high on freshly baked breads, pumpernickel, or rye. Great, spicy deli mustard. Everything's home made. I love their home made potato salad, unlike other area deli's whose condiments come in pre made manufactured tubs.

Fridays I make a special trip for their homemade New England clam chowder. Nice and creamy with lots of clams.

Pickles plus has one of the best Greek salads I've tasted, it's huge. Very courteous servers who go the extra mile to ensure you're satisfied. I understand they have an excellent breakfast and that's what I'll try on this Sunday morning.

Located in Northwood plaza at McMullen-Booth and Enterprise Rd.
Good service, good location, good food. They are doing everything that they can to stay alive during this COVID-19 thing. Try the Fish and chips, as good as you can get.
I took my husband for his birthday on 10/17 and we really enjoyed our 1st time eating there!

My fiancee and I do not got to Mexican restaurants a lot because all of them seem to have the same exact menu as the next. We heard about Guac through some friends of ours and decided to try it even though we thought that it was just another typical Mexican restaurant. Luckily for us Guac is so far from the typical Mexican restaurant. In my opinion, Guac puts other Mexican restaurants to shame.

Just like all other Mexican restaurants, there are the typical items: Chimichangas, Burritos, etc. My fiancee ordered the Burrito and Salsa Verde, it was HUGE !! I didn't try it so I can't comment about the taste. I can however comment about my dinner, the Mariscada Ranchera. Amazing and delicious are the 2 only words that I can use to describe it. Filled with seafood that included: snow crab, squid, shrimp, scallops, octopus (didn't eat the octopus, I have my limitations) among other things in a spicy red sauce. It was delicious and very filling. Imagine Joes Crab Shack.....but Mexican style !! Make sure you ask for some extra napkins because you will need them for the snow crab legs !! 

It is not overpriced at all.  My meal was $15.99 and my fiancee's was $8.99. For the 2 of us for dinner with a some queso and chips and 2 drinks, it was roughly $40. Not bad at all. Our server Jake was awesome and made sure our drinks were filled at al times and was really attentive to our needs. 

Make sure you give this place a chance. I see some negative comments on here but try to look past those and give Guac a shot. You will not be disappointed.

That's all I'm saying !!

Perfect place for a special occasion, such as a birthday for a special person. Ordered calamari for two as appetizer w/Merlot wine, snapper w/risotto and spinach, prime rib w/baked potato and asparagus. Closed with Glenlivet single malt scotch, chocolate bourbon pecan pie, and coconut cake baked on premises! Did not have to ask for bread w/olives and olive oil, water with lemon! Waiter not informed by staff that coconut cake should come with candle for "birthday girl", but quickly remedied situation. On top of this, live music to serenade us! A hidden gem in Ewing Township!

New Year's Eve 2015 was just another night at Basin, and I love that.

We had a reservation, and were seated immediately. FYI there is a specialty cocktail list on a chalkboard above the open kitchen. Our waiter didn't mention it, but we found it anyway. 

I got the duck ragu and he got the yellowfin tuna. The duck was great and I wolfed it down, but the tuna was DIVINE. Buttery, perfectly cooked and served over a Mediterranean kind of salad. Yum, Yum, Yum.

We used a restaurant.com coupon so with one cocktail and two entrees it was only about $40.
We just happened to be in the neighborhood  and stopped in. Definitely off the beaten path but definitely a destination. Better to stop here than at Panera

I was first introduced to UFO Pizza in its St Paul location. Close to my home town, it was one of the better choices for great pizza, and lasagna.
I was very delighted to discover after moving to St Albert 6 years ago, that a location for this restaurant was fairly close by:)

Service and food was ok. When we walked in we were told that the service was going to be slower than normal do to a large party that had not arrived yet. Drinks were left empty and required us asking to have them filled. The food portions were large and impressive.

I had long marveled at the fact that Franklin was such a black hole for good coffee.  Starbucks was everywhere, good coffee shops had shut down, and even the few place you could go were mediocre at the very, very best.  Downtown was especially bereft anything resembling good coffee.

So, I was driving down Bridge Street, and I see "The Coffee House," and suddenly, I realized that hope abounds.  To be fair, I do know that recently another coffee shop has opened downtown, but I hadn't been able to get a coffee there, so I'll call "The Bubbly Gorilla" to maintain anonymity.  I actually had stepped into the Bubbly Gorilla, but the line to the counter was practically to the door, and I just didn't have time.  This is not the establishment's fault, and I will get around to it whenever I have an hour to invest in downtown Franklin

With all that said, I do enjoy The Coffee House very much.  I could see it as a casual relationship whenever I am in the area, say as a local buddy I visit if I have time.  I go to see it whenever I am in town, maybe get a cup of coffee, but The Coffee House will never be my serious coffee relationship: it's just too far from where I live.

When I made my order, the fellow that I had was competent, thoughtful, and considerate.  I'll be the first to complain about brain-dead  teenagers at making my coffee, but my experience did not reflect this problem.

It has a nice comfortable layout.  Various rooms for various purposes.  The record room was a really nice touch.  It's literally a room where people can listen to old albums.  Other dining areas were nice too.

I will echo those who complain that the counter area is not well deigned.  There's just room to maneuver around if someone is standing at the ordering area.  It's a serious flaw, and they should really figure out a better solution.  The also use Bongo Java coffee, which is tasty, but I can get it very easily elsewhere.  So many places use Bongo Coffee in Middle Tennessee that a coffee shop trying to distinguish itself should really go a different direction.  That's just my opinion, though, and The Coffee House does still makes it very tasty

Franklin was desperate for good coffee options, and it looks as though they're doing a lot better.  I can't wait to try the Bubbly Gorilla, but I already know that if it is a disappointment, The Coffee House at Second and Bridge is a great place to visit.  Do not ignore this place if you're in Franklin and like coffee.

My husband had the Mixed Grill entree with pork, steak and lamb. It was amazing. I had the Berry Salad with grilled chicken. It had two squares of fried Brie and raspberry vinaigrette. Yum! Service was good. Make a reservation first! We're going back!

Lives up to the hype!

I've been thinking about going to Sabrina's for brunch for a while now, but I've been unwilling to deal with the wait. I finally gave in. I went on a Sunday morning. They told us it would be a 30 minute wait, but they probably got us seated slightly faster. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was absolutely first rate. Everyone at my table loved their dishes. The coffee was excellent. Service was efficient (not overly friendly + got shit done). If you're not in a hurry, Sabrina's is well worth your time. I love when a place lives up to its hype. Will definitely go back.

Glad I gave it a go! A decent place with good food and friendly workers. Bf and I had the One Shot breakfast sandwich w/bacon and the Ultimate breakfast sandwich. Both were yummy (we preferred the One Shot). We also shared a bacon cronut which was a nice "appetizer" to our breakfast. I had a coffee and he had a chai, which was also tasty. The wait for the food wasn't terrible. I also like that you order at the counter, they bring you the food, and they pretty much leave you at peace (kinda like how they do at Cosi's, but more personable). I'd come back!

Great Food, TERRIBLE Service. 

23

Yes, 23. That's how many servers passed me in the 7 minutes after being seated before one came to my table (of course, some of them were actually serving).  That put the experience off to a bad start, what with my low blood sugar and all. I was about to walk out, feeling snuffed and ignored, more so when the table next to me was immediately greeted upon seating.  

When the server finally arrived to take my drink order, things began to look up. The Wisconsin Cheddar Bites arrived and were excellent!  Hot. Crispy. Tasty. Not quite worth the wait (because the wait was so long) but still delicious, with a tasty, chunky Marinara.  

But then another 23 minutes of waiting for my main course and then they got it wrong. Once they finally got it straight, the manager brought it out herself, IT WAS GOOD!  Tasty. Fresh. And Generous. The Baby Backs were fall-off-the-bone good (but still had the silver skin on) and the BBQ Chicken was done just right. Their Honey BBQ Sauce is very good, but you'll want to ask for extra. 

Vicky, the Manager on Duty, checked on things and seemed to care, but still the Service left so much to be desired. Unfortunately, I didn't have a Penny to leave for a tip.

We've been to the Blue Dog a few times, to both locations (in Chalfont and Lansdale) but as Lansdale had a beer we really wanted to try, we hit them up for some dinner.

The crowd was quite light, with several booths open so we made our way to one in the center of the restaurant and proceeded to take in the menus. The Blue Dog has a decent amount of pub food, but it's rather limited in variety. You won't find juicy burgers or the like on here -- the only burger I saw was on a pretzel roll. Also, no cheesesteaks (a Philly staple!!). The beer menu is pretty deceiving as well. You are handed this large menu with what looks to be about 40 craft beers on it and you think "SCORE" until you get to the point after the 11th beer and it says "Coming Soon..." *womp womp* and then there are arrows of ones coming soon pointing upwards. 

The food was ok.  Not that it was bad, but it wasn't anything to write home about.  The French onion soup is perhaps the best I've ever had in awhile, but the sandwiches (I had the chicken italiano and he had the filet Panini) were loaded and soggy. There was no way you could eat it as a sandwich. I had multiple versions of fries on my plate, too (steak, regular, small .. very odd and inconsistent). I do have to say that our server was top notch and very helpful and attentive.  The dessert we had (homemade chocolate peanut butter pie) was probably the highlight of the evening. Very good but chunky (has nuts for those who aren't a fan).

I believe the pub has a bunch of events throughout the week - we happened on Trivia night. I guess the locals enjoy it, I've been to better (Steppy's in E. Norriton on Wed.nights). The MC was a little too creepy for my taste and the questions weren't really trivia relatable - just stupid knowledge.

As for the take-out area, they have a lot of decent beers, many locals that are bottled. If you drink those in-house, it's a $2.50 upcharge per bottle.  You can also try Capone's in E. Norriton for some really great brews as well and I don't believe they have an upcharge for drinking in the restaurant.

Been here many times order the same thing chicken Greek salad ! Good salad good portion and best of all the cook the chicken fresh ! Comes with some pita bread and cucumber sauce ! 10 buck for lunch always a good deal !

Table ordered loco moco, teriyaki and katsu with Mac salad and musubi. 

First off a Hawaiian place without Hawaiian sun is never going to be good.

Spam musubi is terrible. Absolutely offensive to someone who has consumed thousands of them. Rice is horribly mushy and over cooked and not seasoned, spam has hardly been cooked or seasoned. Where's the furikake?

Loco moco is ok, tastes like powdered gravy. 

I would say, do not come to this place.

Edit: Mac salad is terrible. Invest in your business, send the manager and cook to Hawaii. Please. My mama would shake her head.
The staff was very good, the good suggestions. They were right on the money,  the chile verde fries  really good.

Not too impressive. The basic service is good. However, the cleanliness is not what Red Lobster used to be.  The food is disappointing. Don't think you are ordering something that looks like the photos in the menu. Very disappointing.

We live close by and used to love the Cheddar's in Mt. Juliet were we use to live. 

It's Friday night so obviously very crowded. They sat us in section that has 2 parties in it. One table with about 10 people, and the other with about 18. Experience (as a patron and working at restaurants) tells me that, other than the obvious noise, food quality drops drastically when that happens as cooks struggle to get all the food out for that table at the same time, and other orders are either rushed through, or die in the window as they are ignored being the mountain of plates for the party. This is a good test of a kitchen, but let's keep an open mind. 

Our waitress Tiffany was very nice, friendly and helpful. She said she would put our order in before party which she did. Very nice. 
We ordered the Texas cheese fries, and the grown up grilled cheese. I usually have the Monte Cristo but wanted to try something new. Had a Caesar salad for my side. 

We ordered before the big party so our food got out fast. 
The Texas cheese fries were great as expected. No complaints there. 
The grilled cheese had roast beef in it, which tasted very bland and over cooked. The worst part was the cheese. It was sliced cheese which was by far not high end to say the least. 

Caesar salad was fine. Not bad, not great. 
The croissant on salad was awesome and sadly the best part of the meal. 

Not sure we will return. Not good enough for the price and so many other great choices with a 3 mile radius.

Our friend took us on an eating tour of philly, and this was one of our first stops.

The line looked long but it moved super quickly, this restaurant is tiny and we ended up taking our food to dizengoff to eat. I wish there was more seating inside because this restaurant is so popular.   Prices are decent for the food, we ordered a 3 piece, every order comes with a fresh donut!! We also ordered 2 of their flavored donuts. 

We chose the ranch powder flavoring, and got some extra spicy sauce on the side. Sometimes when you order fried chicken, you end up with a soggy mess because of the sauce. Not here!! The chicken is crispy and super tender inside. I could have used more ranch powder though. I wasn't a huge fan of the donuts because  I only like yeast donuts. These cake donuts are super fresh though, since they are made to order!!

This restaurant is a must go in Philly!!

I am definitely a fan of Dakota!
