Having dined here about 5 times, I can honestly say that it deserves a 4-star review and if you find yourself on the eastside of town, you should definitely eat here.

The atmosphere is great!  I love it!  Traildust Town is unique and quaint and simply fun.  If it's not too hot, or if the misters are going, sit on the patio and enjoy the periodic gun fire from Pinacle Peak.

Enjoy the apricot tea!  It is amazing!

The staff has always been kind and attentive and knowledgeable.  I've never had to wait for a table, but it's never seemed deserted either.

The food is decent.  If the food were spectacular, I would give it 5 stars, but it is simply decent.  It always seems fresh and healthy, but there's just nothing special about it.

To conclude, please dine at Dakota, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

My wife struggled at this place being a vegetarian. I had the oxtail, plantain, rice, and passion fruit juice. Everything was great except the food not being hot. The guy actually stuck my styrofoam box in the microwave, lol. FYI that's a no no. But being from the Caribbean , I can honestly say that the food is authentic and pretty good despite the meh service. Vegetarians might want to look elsewhere though.

Delicious! I had the Spicy Tuna burrito and it was more tasty than I could have imagined!!!! The laid back, positive attitude of the staff coupled with the delicious, fresh food reminded me of being in Santa Cruz. I WILL be back soon!

Food - 4
Price - 4
Environment/Service - 5

I have heard a lot of good things about The Libertine, but only visited during lunch time thus far. Their dinner menu seems interesting, so I will come back soon.

The Libertine is located with all the other lunch options in Clayton, while being much less crowded (no wait, not noisy at all) and fairly priced. Nice decoration, interesting and bold menu.

Ramen: Having visited many ramen bars in both Japan and China, this is not a typical bowl of ramen... With that said, it's good. The pork belly (bacon) was excellently grilled, and the soup has the right touch of shiitake mushrooms. The noodle is less than authentic but ok.  It, however, lacks the hearty and casual feeling the ramen is entitled to offer. Dining with the Clayton crowd also makes you unwilling to take up the bowl and drink the soup, which is what you SHOULD do when you eat ramen.

My friend loved his burger. Will come back for lunch, good place for business lunch.

Overall Value:  Super crispy, juicy chicken at a reasonable price.  Far superior to Bon Chon and most other Korean Fried Chicken that I have had.  And they have a fairly large menu -  we will definitely come back to try some of the other items (and get more KFC, duh).  

The Food: We got the half chicken Korean fried chicken ($12.95), which you can get in two flavors - we got honey soy super spicy and sweet chili spicy.  We also got a tuna taco ($5.25), which they were nice enough to cut in half, they through in a free crunch ball (normally $2.75) because it was our first time visiting, and we got a medium matcha green bubble tea ($3.50).  The chicken was SUPER crispy and still very moist inside - it was phenomenal.  This was especially impressive because the half chicken isn't just wings or drumsticks - it's a half chicken that is cut into smaller pieces, so you are getting pieces of chicken breast too.  But these pieces were still impressively moist and flavorful as well (and I usually much prefer dark meat).  The sauces were both good, but my only complaint is the spice level on the super spicy was kind of weak.  If you are going to call something super spicy, it needs to have a bigger kick.  

The tuna taco was also quite good and had a really fresh flavor with the guac, cilantro, salsa, sour cream etc. A minor quibble is that because there is so much else going on in the taco, it overpowers the tuna a bit, but still good a decent size (it better be for over $5!).  The crunch ball was awesome.  Again, SUPER crispy outside and delicious filling with kimchi and rice, covered in flavorful sauce.  Matcha green bubble tea was delicious as always.  

We skipped out on fries because we thought it would be too much for two, but probably should have added fries to the order.  Half chicken wasn't quite big enough for the two of us, even with the taco and crunch ball (we eat a lot though).  We will go back to try the Korean Oven Chicken when that is available (there was a sign that said coming soon), and also try some of their many other dishes. 

Service:  So friendly and helpful.  On top of giving us a free crunch ball, they also were patient with us and gave great recommendations for the menu, and let us sample the sauces.   

Space and Pace: Fairly large interior with plenty of seating.  We came on a Friday night around 7:30pm and it wasn't too crowded - great spot to meet up with friends and get some awesome chicken.
Your food was ok yesterday just ok, the fondue was delicious other than that our $300 meal was ok

There were 8 tables in the restaurant this morning. I saw at least 4 servers walking around. There was also a breakfast buffet set up. It took 5-10 minutes for someone to even greet us at the door (we were the only ones up there), and the lady told us to figure out if we wanted the buffet or eat off the menu, then left. When she came back, she told us to sit at one of two clean tables. Another customer said that they were out of half of the stuff on the buffet. We got to our table and sat for another 10-15 minutes, were passed by multiple servers and the General Manager, and not one person greeted us or said anything to us at all. We got up and left.

Is "too much toast" ever a bad thing? I doubt it! At Toast, in New Orleans, you may suffer from "too much toast" syndrome, but by suffer, I mean benefit greatly from... until you enter into a debilitating food coma 30 minutes after finishing your meal. I love toast (the bread). I love to toast (the bebidas alcoholicas). And I definitely love to Toast (eating brunch at Toast, the restaurant). All three of which, I can do at once, at Toast! On my recent visit there, I ordered the Croque Madame, and instead of the side salad, I substituted a side of bacon because... bacon! It was so good, and so filling, I couldn't finish my meal! I haven't tried the Aebelskivers yet, but can't wait to do so, along with pretty much everything else on their menu, to be honest... I also want to toast to Toast with toast, at Toast... some day soon!
Amazing!  Hosted a private party in the upstairs area and everything went perfect.  The food was amazing, the drinks were amazing and everyone had a great time!  I highly recommend for birthdays!

I am so happy this little cafe moved to a new location by my house! I loved my Bavarian Honey Ham sandwich with a delicious rice pilaf for lunch! I had sweet tea and later got a coffee to go, all of which were delicious! My boyfriend had an awesome roasted chicken panini and the regular unsweetened tea which he seemed to enjoy to the last crumb. I am definitely coming back to this place! I can't wait for the dinner/tapas menu to begin when it gets cooler!

PIZZA IS AWESOME
 Service could use some personality. The girls seating people did not even great us. We almost turned around and went to Hooters .. But, a friend really recommended the Pizza. So we gave a shot and loved it.

I don't normally patronize Channelside, nor do I normally bowl. Frankly, I can't honestly remember when was the last time I was in Channelside or when I bowled. I am a germaphobe when it comes to wearing bowling shoes and using balls that everyone and their brother has touched. 

It was not my night to pick out our outing, so I was told we were going to Splitsville. After cursing myself for not overriding the decision, I armed myself with Lysol wipes and hand sanitizer and mentally prepared myself to go. 

The business has disintegrated so much in Channelside that Splitsville is only open on Thursdays through Sundays. After psyching myself up to go bowling for the first time in years, I must admit I was a bit disappointed tonight that Splitsville was closed. 

I cannot blame Splitsville for only being open on select nights. After all, these Channelside businesses need to make some sort of profit. I only pray Jeff Vinik's bid gets approved by the end of this week so that there is some sort of revitalization of Channelside. 

We plan on returning soon so I will need to stock up on my Lysol wipes and hand sanitizer and start mentally preparing myself again. I will update my review upon our next visit!
Love love love this place!! My husband and I have only been in Hendersonville 12 days and we've already eaten here twice. The place is super nice, great service, and really good food!!
Service is awful...I had tacos and a vodka soda...taking forever to get my check...just got it. Don't go when it's close to closing.

My husband and I went there for the 2nd time last night.  First time I would have given 4 stars so we went back there last night.  We asked to be seated outside since it was such a beautiful night.  Very small patio area, but nice - had plenty of TVs and, like I said, beautiful night.  When we were seated an employee had to be asked to get up so we could sit at the open table.  (He was there smoking and watching the cards game).  The employee then went to a large table with only 2 people sitting there and asked if he could sit there - they said yes.  Throughout my meal I could see this was the employee hangout, not the nice patio seating I would have enjoyed.  Even our waiter would come out and first talk with the group of employees before coming over to help us.   There were even people (I assume were employees) that would enter the patio from the parking lot and start joking around with the now over flowing, standing room only, table of employees - the couple that was sitting there had now left.  There were three other tables on the patio that were slowly emptying.  This meant that now the diners from inside could now come out to the patio for a smoke break.  I understand that the diners on the patio could smoke, but was a little frustrated that now there was a stream of people coming out to just smoke while we were trying to enjoy our meal and drinks.  I don't have a problem with other people smoking if they were there on the patio with us enjoying their meal, but the place turned into a literal smoke break patio.  
We would have continued to stay and had drinks had it not been more of a "smoke break" area.  Even employees would come out on their break (assumedly) and have a cigarette.  We had gotten there around 8pm and left shortly after 9pm.  So, this also wasn't  really late.  Glad I did not have my children with me, because the employees also had mouths on them that would not have been appreciated if my children were with me.  Bottom line - if you are a smoker and don't have a problem with a ton of people smoking around you while eating?  Sit on the patio.  If you're not - stick with inside.
Food?  Meh.  I ordered the pasta con broccoli without mushrooms.  Pasta was dry with absolutely no flavor.  Looked like it came out of a box.  There were maybe 5 pieces of broccoli in it.  And pasta still had a few pieces of mushrooms - glad I'm not allergic.  Visit before that I got the steak salad - salad was great, but basically had to pick all the steak out - fatty and tough.  For the price?  Not worth it.  Husband got the unsmoked fish sandwich both times and liked it.  Fries were soggy and had barely any on the plate.

We ordered "to go" and brought it home due the restaurant having a full sitting area at the time. (half were eating and the other half hanging out working on laptops) We had to trash all the food we ordered as it was mashed up and kinda slopped together when we opened it. A gold star for the chips and green tea though. We I would not give them any stars at all for anything else. We try to give a place a second chance because anyone can have a bad day, but this WAS the second chance. Probably will not go there again. Burger King next door is actually a better choice if that tells you anything.

Dropped in on a v cold nite.
Ordered a special. Bowtie chicken soup.  V poor.  Luke warm.  Broth thin, no flavor.  3# bowtie pasta, 1 slice carrot no chicken in sight.
Pork cutlets, spinach and rice, fries, macc n' cheese.
Cutlets heavily breaded and fried in old oil. Spinach and rice, tasty but cold.  V GD macc 'n cheese.
Jello.
Waitresses helpful.
Huge room for improvement.
Front of house v cold.
This place is spectacular! Not only is the food amazing- the owners are super sweet!!!! You have got to try this place- you will not be disappointed

This is a sorry excuse for an Irish Pub.  Overpriced garbage for a menu. Sucks. Whoever was hired in the kitchen in charge of cooking eggs,..take a class or watch a video on how to make eggs appear yellow, not brown to serve.  This so called Irish looking pub, if you want to call it that, has Omelets that are served here with a dark gold tint of brown on the entire omelet when brought out.   I wonder, if it was a one time deal only served to me?..or could it be consistent of late? I asked for a recook, and it still came out brown on the outside and not even cooked on the inside, or barely. *Regroup and try again especially at 8 or $9.00 for a plate.  Experience in cooking is key, even as basic as eggs. Also,  one pad of butter for toast?  get real  

*I see the college gals for servers are still dressing riskay

WONDERFUL - two nights in a row.  Visiting from the Bay Area I was excited to find that Sierra St. Kitchen had such a high rating and was within walking distance of our hotel.  We enjoyed the first night so much that we returned a second night in a row.  From start to finish this restaurant definitely deserves 5 stars!  The quaint ambiance is perfect with an open concept, warm lighting and Frank Sinatra playing in the background.  We thoroughly enjoyed the craft cocktails and amazingly delicious food.  The level of flavor is on par with the great energy warmth this restaurant exudes.  We thoroughly enjoyed bruschetta, Cesar's salad, beet salad, shrimp tacos and tiramisu.  The service is spectacular, you won't want to miss the experience.

When we gutted our kitchen we must have ate 10-15 times in 6 weeks.  We have been patrons since the first year it opened.  

Very good food and a good beer selection.

This Bar Louie is pretty awesome!   Great Location right in the heart of International Mall and next to my other fav spot Blue Martini.   Love the look of it inside the booths are round and comfortable. Plenty of seating for you and all of your friends.   Plenty of large screen TVs for watching sports at any angle.   The service is excellent as well.  My meal was very good!  Great place, location and excellent service!  I will be back.

This place is always good go to for a family celebration, or just to hang out with friends.  The atmosphere is a little loud, but obviously people are enjoying themselves.  We have always had a good experience.  The beers are good, don't get too attached to any one flavor because they are all seasonal.  I wasn't sure which beer to choose at our last visit, so our waiter brought both out for me to sample.  I recommend if you aren't a quick beer drinker to ask for a frosted mug to keep it colder longer.

The food is always delicious, and is enough for me to have another meal the next day.  We took minors our last visit, and the staff was extremely pleasant with them, they had a good time also.  This is a well liked establishment, so the waits could take a while, my favorite part of waiting is the porch swings they have out for people to enjoy.  Always enjoy going back.

Ordered food from here twice. Been disappointed both times. The food doesn't taste authentic, the owner or I believe is the owner treat the employees as if they are nothing( from the time I've been there). If you want the food to have that Middle Eastern touch, at least train your cooks to perfected. The falafel tasted so bland, the wrap had an old taste,  as if it had been left outside for a very long time. Fries were too greasy for my liking. All in all it was a great disappointment. I tried to give them another opportunity to be disappointed again.

We've been keeping an eye on Dr BBQ for awhile now.  Tonight we finally made the trek over from our part of town. 

We were a party of 5 and seated after a brief wait. We stood in the entryway and were very entertained watching all the food the kitchen put up on the line. 

Everyone at the table ordered a variety of foods so we could try lots of dishes. 

Hands down the ribs were the fan-favorite. Pulled pork was the runner up. Also tried pork brisket, beef brisket and sausage. 

The sides were sadly all just meh.  The hot dishes were cold and cold dishes were lukewarm. We are big fans of bbq beans and we all agreed while the bean combo presented well, they lacked flavor. based on the servers suggestion, also tried- Mac and cheese, potato salad, collards, purple slaw, blue cheese slaw and fries. None were homeruns. 

Service was super speedy. The sauces are impeccable! Our table polished off a full bottle of sweet sauce.

Not sure I would drive over just for dinner again. However, if I was headed to the Trop I would likely give it another try.

If it was located anywhere else, this venue would probably earn a three from me but the location and prices cannot be beat. 

We ventured here a few minutes after it opened this morning around 11:15. The outdoor patio right next to the rail were already slowly getting filled up with patrons. We were lucky to secure the last table right next to the rail. Our host was very nice and told us our server would be with us shortly.

Sure enough, our server popped in to get our drink orders. 

The three of us shared a combination of things from the menu.

We ordered the Fried Clam with Tartar Sauce, She Crab Soup Bowl, Grouper Tamales, Super Cajun Grouper Sandwich with Fries (+$0.99 for fries to substitute chips), Tuna Poke Tacos.

My least favorite was probably the fried clams because of the inconsistency of batter to clam ratio. Some pieces were just pieces of batter. That being said, the clam pieces were delicious. 

The grouper tamales were average. The grouper was delicious and so were the sauces they served with it: rojo and salsa verde. I didn't like the masa mixture. I thought it too thick and bland. 

The she crab soup was delicious but super rich. I don't think I could have eaten the entire thing by myself so thankfully it was shared among the three of us. 

The grouper sandwich was delicious and very flavorful. I wasn't a fan of the fries that came with the sandwich. They were cut way too fat and not crispy enough for my liking.

My tuna poke tacos were very flavorful. I really enjoyed the sweet thai chili sauce and cabbage slaw that was underneath the tacos. The fish was generously portioned. 

My boyfriend ordered their Beer of the Month special which was $2.50 for a bottle of Banks Beer. He said the beer was watered down and not flavorful but considering the price, I wasn't surprised. 

Overall, it was a great experience and I can see why people love coming here. I loved sitting right next to the rail enjoying the oceanfront views.

Service was great. Our server got my tuna taco order wrong but was quick to fix the issue and apologize even though we ordered a lot so it's easily misunderstand as another dish on their menu.
Being from Phoenix and traveling north, the great tacos become harder to find.  We found them here.  Great atmosphere with quick and tasty food.  Loved it!

Went there for dinner tonight and had the chicken pot pie , you could tell it we home made. it was very good and I would get it again. The food came out very hot, it didn't take long for the food to come at all. Oh and the fish and chips is very good. The service was very good.

Save your money and go to a local cafe. Don't support this toxic work environment. I worked here for over 6 months and it was the absolute worst experience I've ever had working anywhere. Each employee here is overworked, overwhelmed, & underpaid. 

Starbucks is a mega corporation thats more than capable of paying their employees more. Not only that, but dear lord, please check up on your management. Creepy bosses, district people coming in a watching you while you work, at least one employee leaves crying everyday. It's ridiculous. If you ever consider working here; don't.

They want cash only!
Didn't like it and won't comeback again because of the wait and the food was not worth for the wait! 
My order was a chicken noodle, it came with only a little ingredients. I personally don't like the chicken breast and the taste of the soup. Overall it was too salty.

This is apparently the place to go for Sunday brunch in Brentwood. I happened upon it a few weeks back and was astonished. A friend of mine claimed they had a wonderful brunch, but I was skeptical. We got there and had to wait 30 minutes to beat seated, a shock. 

It's a chain, and that's pretty much how the food is, but the brunch was okay. I won't say it's my favorite, but if it's all you got, it's not bad. I'd say it's on the same level as a Perkins, just without the bakery.

Would give them a 3.5 if I could.

I was working down the street and stopped in about a month ago to pick up food for myself and a friend.  I was almost ignored by the staff.  They were busy talking to their friends that had walked in the door after me.  They forgot one half of my order and had to go hustle back to make it as well.

The rib eye sandwich was only okay.  The meat needed to be trimmed.   On the other hand we also had a chicken sandwich which was good.  I can't complain at all about the sauce which I did like.

I guess if the service would have been better they would have a solid 4.
Such a nice find! Very busy for lunch when I joined them. Definitely check out their happy hour for margaritas but if you don't want to sit at the bar I'd def recommend a reservation.
We've been here the past 3 times we've visited Clearwater. I love seeing the beach, love the drinks and the waiters are so chill and nice and funny! I'd definitely recommend going there.

Good food, fast service, affordable, and very nice decor. Seating arrangement not great. They should have more tables for 4.

The veggie bowl with fried tofu was pretty good. Loved the full size portions. Hearty, healthy meal.

If you're going to go to Kildare's for a meal, I would recommend it for lunch or an early dinner.  After a certain time in the evening, however, it just gets too crowded for comfort and too loud to talk.  

There's really not much to say - they have a fairly extensive bar-food menu, and everything is just decent.  I asked for my sandwich sans onions, but when it came out those little suckers were melted right into the cheese.  I didn't bother saying anything since the food took a little longer than neccessary to emerge from the kitchen in the first place.

No surprises here.  You pretty much get what you would expect.  I'm not going either way on this one.
A very tasty and very creative menu. Their usage of La Colombe coffee is a great choice, and the service is swift and friendly. Brunch with my girlfriend was a wonderful affair. We will return!

Christie's is a great little gem tucked away on 19th street. The sandwiches are great and you can tell the ingredients are fresh. The customer service is superb. The owners always ensure you leave satisfied. I'm so happy I discovered Christie's.

We are visiting from another state and my husband made us a reservation about a month ago to this supposedly 4 star restaurant. Well, tonight they we way off. It started out ok . We had amazing service until Randy the lead waiter took over. He was way off for sure . Foreshadowing, he almost tipped over my wine glass. Thank goodness for Nick , he was amazing and made sure we had water and anything else we needed. Then captain Randy shows up. Don't most steak houses have you cut into your steak before you eat it? Well, that didn't happen here. Fast forward to dessert . When Randy asked what we would like for dessert, my daughter asked for the cookie cake, he left and came back and said well sorry. We ran out of That last night. Weird , don't you make your food fresh each day??? Ten minutes later, he says that he was mistaken , they DO have the cookie cake. Ok , so we get our dessert and have that and then we have been finished for quite sometime before Randy graces us with his presence again. When he does show up and all the dishes have been cleared, he reaches over and spills water all over my husband . No apologies. My daughter and I are handing him napkins and the awesome guy who brought us coffee and water helped get it all cleaned up. He is the one who actually apologized!!! We said. Well you didn't do it. Such a nice guy. Randy came back with our check though and still nothing mentioned about his crappy service. We were done by then. Way too many cool restaurants to go back to this one . Just no!
Delicious, fresh ingredients. Adorable restaurant with kind staff. Love the feel inside. Unique feel. Our new go to spot!

All the hype this place gets... I was excepting to be blown away. The decor was great and very country. The service was not good at all. It was the end of breakfast and they were all getting ready for lunch. The servers were at a table by the kitchen and all on their phones. They were looking at dresses as I past to go to the restroom.  I am a server and we are not even allowed to have our phones on us ( but we do and hide them) let alone on the floor for the customers to see. Ok on to the food. It was mediocre. I ordered the Benedict with biscuits sausage and gravy it said fried eggs instead of poached so I asked mine for scrambled. When it came the scrambled eggs look like it came out of the carton and not fluffy like real eggs and the taste was bland. I had to add hot sauce and pepper for some taste. The potatoes were good with the bbq sauce on it. The sausage was dry and my cousin did like like his always he said his was very dry..Not sure I will ever go back. If I do it would have to be a different location.

The food was much better before the fire. I love IHOP but this place should be ashamed. Got the hearty ham and cheese omelette and when it can out looked like someone threw it on the plate all falling apart. It also had a white garlic tasting sauce on it. When I asked the waitress about it she stated it was a white cheese sauce. Now I have gotten the hearty name and cheese omelette more times than I can count but never has it bad a supposed white. cheese sauce on it. I gave up at that point and just ate it anyway seeing as I was hungry and didn't want to wait for another bad attempt at a simple dish. Won't be eating at this one anymore until they get there act together.

A wonderful lunch and even better service.  Alexis was very professional and made our lunch even better. We enjoyed outdoor dining on a comfortable temperature day. Everyone in our group was satisfied with each menu item ordered. Excellent iced tea. They offer plenty of appetizers. They have a weekday lunch menu. They have a shared parking lot but plenty of parking available. So glad we stopped in.
If there is a better Thai restaurant in town, I have yet to find it. I live on the north side of Indy, but I'm more than willing to make the drive!  So good!  I highly recommend this restaurant.
Top notch. Food is always amazing and the service is also great. Have tried a good variety of their food and brunches. You get what you pay for and its good. Family friendly too :-)

We ducked in just for drinks when it wasn't busy. My husband's never been to Philly and I wanted to show him the gamut this city runs in a short time. I knew it'd been an old bank built in 1925. Today, this place may appear unassuming from the outside, but definitely has WOW factor once inside, the kind you just don't see anymore in newer buildings. The ceilings, the columns, the marble counters, the wrap-around staircases, the wrought iron, a beautiful dining mezzanine, the old vault, etc. etc. This place is a CLASSIC.

We order old-fashioneds everywhere we go. The ingredients the bartender used were simple and humble, but she made hands-down the BEST old-fashioned I'd ever had in Philly. So well-balanced between the whiskey, the bitters,  and the simple syrup. She finished it with a bit of fruit cocktail. Now I always ask if I can add fruit cocktail if I need to doctor up an old-fashioned. They always look at me like I'm nuts, but don't knock it till you've tried it, and guess they haven't been to Del Frisco's in Philly!

Thank you so much for the wonderful experience for my husband and me on that cold afternoon, with the mid-afternoon light filtering through those stories-high windows, and our drinks warming our bellies.
Excellent service. I had the lamb, chicken, and beef kabob platter. It was nicely done.

These bagels are fantastic. They're baked in a wood-fired oven, and thus infused with feel-good-campfire-cozy-morning-sunrise kinds of flavors. I swear. Other reviewers have mentioned a line, but every time I've been here I've been first or second to order and there have been plenty of free seats. I just love this place. It smells great, they play awesome music, the staff seems kind and fun-loving, they brew la colombe coffee to perfection, and the little seats by the window provide the perfect amount of sunlight and people watching for your afternoon snack.

I went to shack shake for the very first time and was a bit unimpressed. Growing up on the west coast with In'n'Out, shake shack did not measure up. The burgers were delicious, but my mouth kind of dropped when I saw the size of the burgers. I wouldnt say I eat a lot but it would take 2 of those to fill me up.

 I also have a beef with the shakes. Since its called shake shack, I figured the shakes must be pretty good. Well they were, or at least the chocolate one was. But again, for 5 bucks the quantity was not there. Since I am a college guy, looking at the relatively small burger and small sized shake made me sad :(  

Note: I would probably go to five guys instead, but Shack shake is always worth trying so if you haven't gone, try it!

Sopapilla's customer service alone wins it 5 stars. 

Other reviewers mentioned the lax attitudes of the servers, and I can attest to this, but I can't say it's a bad thing. 

The atmosphere feels right and is a nice departure from your cookie cutter chain restaurant. Definitely favors more upscale without the huge premium generally associated with that.

Long list of tequilas. Decent sized menu without being overwhelming. Plenty of outside seating. Amazing location. 

The food was very good. I got the fajita quesadilla and I enjoyed it. My wife ordered the ahi tuna tostadas even after our server explained that they were only lightly seared. Upon receiving her dish, my wife realized her mistake and ate off my plate instead. As soon as management heard she was not happy with her meal, they informed us it was being taken off the check. We told them this was not necessary but they insisted.  

If I had a complaint, it'd be with the table-side guacamole. For $10, it's really just not that good. Seemed like on the salt maybe?

Regardless, we were overall happy with our experience and the associated price tag. We intend to return.

I had the pleasure of dining at Booty's Street Food recently with members of my family.  Due to the extensive menu we were able to sample many different things and enjoyed them all. The cocktails were slamming!; with original drinks I have only seen at Booty's. I loved the way the "Loos" (rest rooms) were decorated as Booty features 2 different artists works monthly allowing them to showcase their talents by decorating the rest rooms.  My only complaint is I live too far away to enjoy Bootys on a regular basis, you lucky Nola gang!!!. Next trip I will have my Booty on a stool at Booty's Street Food. oh yeah and loved me some Stumptown Coffee!!!!
Best Cajun Po Boys in Indy reminds me of home, Nawlins! My family and I have been here several times. Gumbo is excellent as well as the shrimp and grits. Staff is very friendly.

Rather than cook after a long day, we decided to go to Steak n Shake in Maplewood.  We were seated quickly, no problem there.  We placed our order, again no problem.  I really wasn't all that hungry and just ordered the small fries and a drink, while the person with me ordered a sandwich and fries, plus a drink.  Now here comes the problems.  We weren't offered water, but I thought my drink would be out quickly.  Nope, not even.  So, we waited a half hour, all the time looking back at our food sitting up on the counter.  The cooks were coming out serving people while the waitress was doing whatever it was she was doing.  Finally, we got our food and drinks.  My fries were barely warm, but I douse them with ketchup so figured since the ketchup was good, I wasn't risking waiting another half hour by complaining about the quality of the fries.  (Besides, I know better than complain to the one handling my food)  We weren't offered refills on our drinks, and by then, I just wanted to leave so I didn't ask.  Before we were finished, our waitress came and grabbed up my companion's plates.  We were never given a check, so we just went to the counter and paid our bill.  The family behind us had kids that were asking for something they had ordered and never got.  I guess we weren't the only ones that were less than pleased.
I have come here several times and every single time it has been a disappointment. We got wings one time and it was sooooo dry and overcooked. I could barely get passed 2 wings.

The food was excellent.   Ordered pepper steak, house special fried rice, crab Rangoon and wanton soup.    My only disappointment was the chicken in the house special fried rice.     Excellent food, I will certainly get food from here again.

One of my favourite restaurant in Delaware. 
Been here a few times already . It always seem to be busy. Just my luck,  I usually end up waiting at least 40mins for a table. 
However,  It's worth. 
It's a great place for tex mex. It can get pretty loud at time. 
Food, portion wise, is a lot. Therefore,  try not to eat too much of the complimentary chips and salsa.
  
I usually get their Gumbo. Don't know what about it that makes me keep on ordering it everytime i'm here. It's really that good.   

I recommend stopping by here if you're near Delaware park casino or Christiana hospital.

Went on Sat 3/18/17 approximately 1:15 p.m. Maybe 12-14 customers there. Floors were filthy. Server couldn't find a table that didn't need bussing, so I sat at the counter instead. 5 mins went by without anyone greeting me. I left without eating. So much for their new tv commercials.

Everything except the oysters and the history of the building is terrible. We were placed in the entryway with red lightning that hurt my eyes the entire dinner. In addition, the waiter was not attentive to us, especially to me who is a female and kept giving the check and receipt to my boyfriend, though I was paying and ignoring my presence.

Dined here last night, my wife and I both had Filet Mignon ordered Medium and came to table well done, no pink. It was good steak but horrible preparation as over cooked. Ordered a flight of wine for $30 got three tiny glasses, should've ordered one glass at $16 it would've been more quantity. Service was ok, not exceptional at all. We'll try someplace different tonight. Did not feel it's a good value for money spent.
Decent enough sports bar, looking for a cold beer and bar food this is your spot.  Decent burgers and fried food.

Great good and drinks!! Love their tiki bar in the summer time. Such a great environment and lots of entertainment! Any night of the week you will have an amazing time there sitting outside enjoying a nice cold drink
Great bar, great coffee drinks. Being a fan of the Big Lebowski I had to get the White Russian which was made to perfection. Quality service

I am updating my review of Bully's after the last TWO visits.  The second to last visit, the waitress got all three orders wrong and tried to charge us double because she got the order wrong and she also didn't refill drinks AT ALL, Very rude.  The last visit will be forever my last.  My husband and I walked to Bully's (Yes it's that close) and sat in the bar so that we could watch the Olympics, the second we sat down the bartender turned ALL of the TVs to something else, Okay fine, I asked if all of the TVs had to change and she got completely snotty and said " I can change it back.." I looked at my husband and said, we are out of here! I will never enter that place again. They need all new wait staff and bartenders without attitudes towards customers that visit often.
Great family red gravy Italian restaurant.  Big portions, taste good and a very fair price.  Nice basket of bread with each table.  We've been more that 20 times and always leave happy.

Not as good as a proper sit-down restaurant, but they're not trying to be.  What it IS is a lot better than standard fast food.  Most of the menu items are vicious calorie bombs, but they're tasty and fresh.

Although Mike's made my list of Nashville must-trys on a recent trip, we accidentally stumbled upon this place on a walk of Broadway on a recent trip--and boy, are we glad we did! Mike's is a small ice cream parlor, one that barely fits the patrons and its popularity. There is some effort that went into decorating this place like an old school ice cream parlor, with it's small tables and chairs, counter tops, and unique wall décor. 

Mike serves a wide selection of handmade ice cream in a variety of different ways and they are extremely generous on their scoops. Between the two of us, we shared a single scoop of pralines and cream on a waffle cone and it was almost too much--and we're both like our ice cream! The ice cream is very creamy and incredibly delicious. In this particular flavor, there were generous amounts of praline--a few in every bite, and lots of caramel swirls. Our ice cream was truly divine and it seems like everyone else's ice cream was also delicious as no one could make it to the register without first taking a bite! 

Although we didn't venture this way, I noticed a few cool things that could spice up your ice cream treat here, such as a cookie cone or a Nutella sundae...but who needs spicing to this already delicious treat? Definitely a must try and completely worth the calories!!!

We stopped in to the Macaroni Grill for a friends birthday lunch and this is where she wanted to go.  I'm a sucker for ravioli and I had heard they have really good ravioli.  They share a parking lot with Barnes & Noble and Great Basin Brewing so I imagine parking can be an issue during busy times.  They have two dining options - the first is with their traditional menu where you sit and a waiter takes care of you, the second is their express dining.  It's sort of a lunch line where they make the food fresh, but it's a limited menu and they do it for both lunch and dinner.  We went with the traditional dining and were seated promptly.  Our waiter was friendly and he kept the drinks and fresh bread coming.  The bread was delicious, piping hot with rosemary and they have olive oil and balsamic for dipping.  I ordered the Mushroom Ravioli for lunch and it was really good with lots of mushrooms.  However, I think the plate may have been left under the warmer a bit too long.  The plate was scalding hot - no biggie but the parts of ravioli without sauce were very dry and almost crunchy.  That's really the only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 4.  I was really looking forward to that cheat lunch and it just didn't live up to my expectations.

I love the patio ! Its all outdoor so put your hair up. It's a very casual place and the drinks are great . No kitchen but most places deliver there. Check out ladies night it's a blast with great specials. And if you love college football get there early on Saturdays with your Gator gear on

The last 2 stars are for Riley our server. He was awesome and ready for us to order anything. He made the experience. Otherwise the person at the entrance and the other bartenders were not very personable...did not want to make us return. Food was good. Prices cheap. Service definitely ruined the experience for us....besides Riley.

I walked in and was not greeted at all. They had multiple tables cleaned off and clearly spaced for seating. They sat a family that walked in right before us. Then had 2 other tables open and available and then told us they were reserved. We were also told that you can not make reservations. So I am very confused. The past couple times we have been in, the food has not been cooked well. The service has not been good. Very disappointed and most likely will not be back.
Great neighborhood place to enjoy a cold beer (great options) and excellent bar food. The wings with the whiskey dry rub are delicious!
Great food and waitstaff. Decent rotating craft beer selection and daily meal specials. Great place for a family. Gets a bit loud though.

DO NOT come here if you're expecting a quick pick up like any normal sandwich shop. 2 customers in the shop and it took 30 minutes for a single cold sandwich to be ready. 

What was most infuriating is the last 10 min of the wait was because they ran out of a specific topping but left the sandwich on the side while they worked on other orders. I finally went to ask if that was our order and apparently they were waiting to check if I was ok with a replacement or the pickled vegetables. I stood waiting inside the restaurant the entire 30 minutes - the fact that they couldn't have just asked is ridiculous.

Says it's open when it's not. Do not recommend- I'll be at McDonald's 

I use Yelp to see what's open, when I arrive and it's closed that's out of my way and unprofessional so update your business.
Great atmosphere, great bar staff,  great food, great draft beer selection. Can't go wrong here.

Everything was delicious. It's rare to get good fish and red meat at the same place. Sides were delicious. Accommodations for Paleo and food allergies appreciated. We enjoyed the staff's personalities. Convenient from Chimes Bed & Breakfast.
The Monte Cristo is a must have for lunch or dinner! Couple it with a bowl of loaded potato soup and you have yourself a meal you will not soon forget!

Ok, so now I live a block away from this place and have been there a couple times. Their burgers are really good. Their beer selection is average. It seems like a happen'n place but I still don't really enjoy eating there.

We ordered Grouper Cheeks and got mystery cheeks...They were swimming in a mystery buttery sauce. They gave us a lot of whatever it was. It was overcooked and you never get that many Grouper cheeks when they  real cheeks. I told our waitress my thoughts and she offered to comp the Grouper Cheeks. I just wrote it off. Never again.
Delicious food,attentive service, fun atmosphere

Love this place! Lots of gluten-free things, great coffee espresso, hot or iced... Really friendly service I'm so glad the opened this in Davis Island. They have amazing gluten free bread (best I've ever had) and their omelette sandwich has been amazing every single time (and I have it a lot)
I love the atmosphere here, and the food is toothsome. All ingredients are incredibly fresh and the dishes are thoughtfully prepared. Their coffee is also excellent.

Diner food does not get any better than this!!!! Came here because I had been here before and loved it. This time I had the senior Meat Loaf. It came with 2 sides and the waitress let me have the soup as a side. A great choice as it was Navy Bean soup with big old chunks of ham in it!!! Meat loaf tasted like Mom made it!! Mashed taters and 2 buttermilk drop biscuits made this a scrumptious dinner!!!! I must eat healthy the rest of the week!!!!!! I love this place. Good thing it is in Tampa is for a treat now and then!!!!!!!
Best vanilla cupcakes ever.  Period.  Light and fluffy.  Their vanilla cake with buttercream icing is equally awesome.

Poor service to start off with. Server was abrupt and seemed to be kind of snippy I guess you could say. Waited 25 minutes for food and when it arrived it was luke warm at best. Something we had never seen before but they would not let a couple pay individually. There were 3 couples in our party. Safe to say we will not be going back.

I regret not going sooner. I've lived in the area for almost a year and it took using the groupon to get me into Eats. And now I've been twice in a week.

From the outside, it's not much to look at. Parking looks difficult and the place looks small.  There's a whole parking lot in the back though, and the inside is bigger than it looks. Upon walking in, we were quickly greeted and told to sit wherever. We were quickly served and the waitress gave us great recommendations of some of her favorites and best sellers. The rest of the menu looked like great twists on classic meals, whcih was pretty cool. She brought out these house made chips and a dip that were very unique, and so good that we asked for another order. I ordered the Rib and Mac, which had rib meat on mac and cheese with texas toast for the bread.  It was one of the greatest things I've ever had. We also had a San Francisco burger and a V Jack burger at our table, and both said the burgers were juicy and had very good flavor combos with the toppings. Their fries that they serve as a side have the crispy outside, which are the best kind of fries.  

While we were there, they told us about the $5 burger Mondays, which I then returned for the very next Monday. This deal has a $5 base burger which is completely customizable for add'l cost per topping. Again, the burger was very juicy and well seasoned. It was very substantial, too, not what I was expecting for a "day of the week" special. It's a really good deal for the amount of food you get.

Only tried donuts from here recently when my coworker brought some back.  On the website, they had some interesting flavors.  The donuts at softer since they are fresh.  My coworker said they moved slow in there and he had to wait a bit.  The donuts I had in the office were nothing special.  They were different but nothing about them really jumped out.  I'd actually be ok eating my store bought donut.

Cute neighborhood restaurant we stumbled upon while shopping. It is located in the back corner of a plaza with Michael, nutrition smart, and some others.

One tip here is that it is cash only! But they do have an ATM in the store. One thing this place makes me feel is like I am in a small town. Despite it being located in a busy area the atmosphere feels homey. 

The menu is a decent size and they offer breakfast and lunch. Looking over the menu, it looks like they have a Greek influence. There are many greek items mixed in the different categories and a while greek section. 

They had many specials available, including the pumpkin pancakes. We were pretty hungry after running errands all day, so I wanted an omelette and pancakes. Luckily, they have that as an option with their omelettes. I got the Greek
Omelette with a pumpkin pancake as my starch. I also got egg whites instead of the whole egg.

What I liked here, was that you get a lot of food for your money, that also tastes good. My food was as described and good. I think we found a new neighborhood breakfast spot to come to!

Ok fine,,, I'll give it to you. I always thought that this chain was a bit too tourist trap-ish... BUT I can't just let my bias get the better of me. So we're here and we're going to smash.

Let's begin shall we.

Waffles:     I really enjoyed the texture, soft and crispy that's not painful to consume. The syrup was perfect accompaniment to the whole dish.

Mac & Cheese:     This side is fire yo, I adore the depth and meaty flavors. This dish definitely came to slay.

Greens:     I can't believe I'm eating greens from a chain and it's actually phenomenal. We definitely enjoyed every bit of this dish.

Chicken Quarter (HOT):     WEAK, I was expecting my mouth to be on fire but it didn't. I feel as if an amateur spicy food eater can handle this level of heat. Plus the flavor was a bit lacking.

3 stars, just because the opening acts should never EVER out do the main event. This spot definitely scored high marks on the side show category. High enough to forgive that excruciating wait to be seated. Anyways, it's whatever. I gave my score because I was not impressed by whatever food you're known for. People will still flock to you. Your marketing is definitely on point.

Thank you so much for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!!

I'm kind of sad i discovered this place the last day I lived in Fishtown. It is so good! Every time I come here even though it is so far out my way now I always get the hot chocolate with the homemade whip cream. It is extremely good if the right person is making it. Their food is pretty good too. The turkey sandwich (i can't remember the exact name of it) and the vegan whoopie pie are out of this world. The service is pretty good for a fishtown business and for some odd reason i love the kitschy decor they have here too. If i lived in the neighborhood again i could see my self being here everyday before work.

Went there for lunch today with a friend. She had a ruben and I had a burger. Very cute place! Loved the decor. I felt the menu wasn't very extensive but I have nothing to complain about really. The service was good except for the stinky cigarette smoke breath on the server. Next time I'll request a non-smoking and or non-breathing server. Very cute. Will visit again.

Unassuming location, but very good food!  Lunch specials are an amazing deal!   The 5-stars is for the combination of price/quality.  Vegetables were appropriately crisp and flavorful, and the Hot & Sour soup was terrific.  Check it out!

I brought my wife to Roux for brunch for our anniversary because she loves creole food and we really like Datz.
The food was really good, she had the chicken and waffles and I had the lobster bisque and shrimp Po' boy. 
While the food was good and the ambience is pretty nice, the service was terrible. Our waitress was flat out rude, she seemed bothered to be serving us. The place isn't exactly inexpensive (brunch and drinks for 2 was $70) and we gave her a good tip despite her attitude, she was still rude to us as we were leaving. The people next to us also had issues with their waitress not paying them any attention. 
If it weren't for the terrible waitress and bad experience we had with her, just based on ambience, food and drinks I would have given 4 stars.

This is the second and last time I will eat here. The food was very average. The "chutzpah" was charging $8.50 for a bowl go matzo ball soup. The soup was skimpy and watery. The price was ridiculous. I have never seen such high prices for such 2nd rate food.

I have been twice, both within a week of each other, and the food is great! I would give 5/5 for food and 5/5 for ambiance. The only reason I took off one star is for service, as it seems it can be a bit of a hit or miss. The first time I came, the waiter forgot quite a few things and charged me for a spicy mayo he never brought. The 2nd time the waiter just seemed like he was new, but he was great aside from not being too familiar with the menu. .
They also have happy hour specials, with discounted sushi rolls and cocktails. I recommend the Lobster Fresh roll and the 1st Avenue roll, and the Bourbon on the Ave drink. All very tasty! The Lobster Fresh really lives up to its name, as it just tastes super fresh and crisp.
All in all, I am a fan of this place and will definitely be returning. It's a bit of a drive for us considering we have a usual sushi place we go to near where we live, but it is worth it for evenings where you want to go downtown.
Dark, cool and excellent. 20's speak easy feel. Great service and some of the best cocktails around. The fried Brussels  Sprouts were sinful. Will definitely come back again.

Hands down my favorite pizza in Brownsburg! I will say that I like the speciality pizzas much more than your average ho hum pepperoni. I've had pizza's here that I could do back flips for and others that were just OK.

Here are my favorites:

Chicken/Bacon/Ranch Pizza
BBQ Chicken Pizza
Fultz Sticks (bread sticks)

My one complaint is their cheese sauces. It's the worst cheese sauce I've ever had from a pizza place. I hope they upgrade it soon. Their ranch on the other hand is wonderful!

My husband and I were staying at the hotel it's located in and we decided to try it out. We open the door and it takes the hostess a couple minutes to seat us. She starts to seat us in one location and changes her mind, tells us our waitress will be right with us and leaves. We watch a waitress come by check on a table and leave. We think she's our waitress. Another two tables get seated and she goes to both of those. I finally get her attention and she claims she's not its but will take our order anyway (we had been sitting for 15 min). Get our order in, twenty min later while we are still waiting, another waitress walks up and asks if we've got our order in. We say yes and she walks off. Find out from her talking loudly to the girl who took our order that she was supposed to be our waitress and that we were in her section. Awkward.  Finally get our food and a couple of the waitresses are continuing to fuss at each other and a stack of plates are left next to our table the entire time we were there.  We only had drinks and an app luckily. We weren't the only ones to have that issue and it was a Saturday night.

Since this KFC is in my neighborhood, once in a while I'll stop it. Over time I've realized, this KFC is a hit & miss. You have some good days & you have some really bad days, however the good days are far & in between. They have a tendency not to pack your order right, or maybe give you the wrong item. The customer service could be so much better, and there's been times I've walked in & the dining room area need a good cleaning (That's when I walked back out).

Bad for groups. Portions are small. Staff has a bad attitude. Be warned, after providing sour service they will add 20% gratuity to group checks. 

Here's the scoop: Attended an unfortunate happy hour here with some girlfriends. The meal was uneventful until after dessert when the bartender Cassie screamed at our table for being too loud. She said there had been complaints and that the bar area 'funnels' noise into the dining room.  I find it curious that she didn't say anything to our group about the noise earlier in the meal as we're not intending to bother others.  Another male patron told us that we were not bothering him but for reasons unknown to us he started screaming across the bar area to us, "F**king b*tch, I'll come over there!" Repeatedly. "F**king b*tch". It was unreal. Cassie then told us his behavior was 'fine'. 

It was an unfortunate situation that was escalated by Cassie. We are normal people and did not intend to cause a problem. I just wish she had asked us to quiet down before she lost her temper.

My boyfriend and I visited Philly for the first time a couple weeks ago. During our travels we always choose one night to go out to a high-end dinning location with beautiful views. I was pleased to find R2L which was located around the corner from our hotel. I visited their website to make a reservation which stated "in order to guarantee a table by the window with city views you would need to spend $100/ person" and there was a $25 reservation fee. I decided to call instead and was able to easily make a reservation without paying a fee. We decided to wing it and hope that we got a table by a window. We were greeted at the hostess stand by a very pleasant young lady which was happy to seat us  by a window. The restaurant was absolutely beautiful, the ambiance was very romantic and elegant however my excitement was cut short by the table sitting next to us. There was a table of 5 in their early 20s sitting approximately 10 feet away from us. They were loud, uneducated, with no regard for manners or restaurant etiquette. They spoked with profanity and had highly inappropriate conversations. Everyone in the restaurant patrons and employees would walk by and stare at this table. Their server which was our server was completely flustered by them needless to say we were not greeted for about 10 minutes. Once greeted we placed our wine order and she mentioned we would get our water and bread shortly. Approximately 5 minutes later the bread arrived and about 10 minutes after the bread, our water glasses were filled. About 30 minutes after being seated we finally got our wine and we were able to order. The bread was absolutely delicious! Our food was actually quick to come out. We both ordered the filet and braised short ribs with brussels sprouts and mac n cheese. Besides the mac n cheese, everything was extremely salty. I could not finish my meal because I could feel the hypertension setting in. Still very distracted by the table next to us, I decided to skip dessert. The check came its was approximately $150. My bf handed his card over and when he received the check back to sign he had been charged for another table bill $288. He mentioned it to the server and she disappeared for another 10 minutes and finally came back with the correct check. On our way out we shared the elevator with another couple and asked how their experienced was, they mentioned it wasn't very good for the price and that they had found the food to be very salty. I really wanted to love this place but it fell short, management should have been more present perhaps came over to the table next to us and had a conversation with them or perhaps when were charged double for our meal. I more than likely would not recommend this place, there are other rooftop restaurants nearby.

This is our favorite brewery! The beer is very good, all of them! I think I've tried just about all of them, lol, except for the IPAs only because I'm not a fan of them, but my husband will only drink IPAs and the Citrazona is his absolute favorite. My first choice is the Hefe! The food is great too. I honestly have not had a bad meal, beer or experience here. If you're looking for your next favorite brewery, it's here, man! Also, happy hour is the bomb!

Just ok- I work in Clearwater but live in Tampa. If everyone in the area doesn't know by now Delcos in Clearwater has the best and most authentic Cheesesteaks around. When Kruks opened I was so excited thinking that John Kruk would be able to replicate the magic that comes out of Philly in their cheesesteaks. Well I must say Kruks was quiet disappointing. The steaks were just ok. I would've enjoyed going to the store and buying Steaks Um's just as much as this place. If your jonesing for a real cheesesteak take the ride to Delcos you will not be disappointed.

We made a reservation for 11 people on a Saturday night, and they were very accommodating! Once we got situated, the food was great, and service was amazing. We were really happy, almost overwhelmed with the options for the homemade pasta. Definitely recommend :)

I love the updates that this business has made in the past year! Updated deck flooring, landscaping and lights throughout the rooftop. The location is perfect to look at the skyline of Indianapolis and still centrally located in the wonderful fountain square. The menu selection for drinks is extensive  and the appetizers are highly recommendedz

People seem to want one of two things in a coffee shop. Some want a place to enjoy a great cup of coffee and good eats above all else. Others will put up with mediocre coffee if the environment is great for studying or socializing. Sparkroot excels at providing a consistently good local bean to it's customers but...

...the environment however isn't the coziest and isn't the best for trying to get things done. While there's plenty of natural light and plugs to keep you connected and productive, the furniture is more trendy than functional and there aren't many areas where groups can be truly comfortable for long periods of time. 

All of that said, if you want a good cup of drip or espresso, Sparkroot won't disappoint. The food selection good and everything on the menu is worth the wait - there's always a wait as food service is slow given the single line cook on duty. The gluten free bread is spot on and the salads are fresh and filling. Their non-coffee fair including chai, teas, and fresh juice are also up to par. It's also one of the few places I've found where you can get flavored drinks that aren't full of processed sugar - the mocha is made in house with dark chocolate and the vanilla and chais are house made as well.

Sparkroot has a great product and good artsy vibe. As someone who enjoys coffee solo or with a buddy, Sparkroot gets 5 stars from me. However, coffee shops are expected to be social environments and Sparkroot can use some improvement. 4 stars.

I'd go far and wide to have coffee here -- husband and wife team, EXCELLENT coffee (and I am from Portland, so I would know). Lovely room, interesting furniture (some they made) and fixtures. Fresh baked goods, some savory instead of sweet. The kind of coffee bar to hang out in. Morning shade on the outside tables. I will be back!!

Stopped by their little cart today at Food Truck Friday in Idlewild, and I gotta say, this is the best ice cream I've ever tried.  On their website, they don't really list the descriptions for all of their flavors.  I was always curious about the flavor called "Home Means Nevada", so I was stoked when I saw they had it on the cart.  The description on the menu said it's sage and pine nut, and now the name makes perfect sense.  I need more, and soon.

I recently moved to Philly and work near the 30th street station so the food court there is a go to for our office.  My first trip in, I was given a pastry just for visiting.  This time I didn't realize I was talking a manager as I asked how the pulled pork hot wrap was.  Not only did he give it to me complimentary to try, they threw in a soup to go with it.  The staff has always been great and smiling and haven't tried anything from here that has instantly become one of my favorites.  Kudos to the store staff, their great attitude, wonderful food and becoming one of my favorite stops on any day I need to grab something tasty and good for me.

Went there on a Friday night. Very busy but the turnover was good. We both ordered Fish & Chips, mine with haddock and my husband with Cod. Both were excellent and came with fries (the chips) and coleslaw. We will be going back and trying more of their original British fare! Recommend!! Full bar and friendly bartenders that are quick with your drink.

Only the best tacos and quesadillas I have ever had.  My mouth waters thinking about this place.  How can it be so
Incredible?  I don't know.  Better than la Suparica and even the batting cages. Omg.

Love this place! Food was great! Biscuits and gravy are amazing. Staff is always friendly. Stopped in on Tuesday for take out and the manager delivered it herself. Nice to know that management cares about the customers.

The BEST beef tacos that we've had since we've moved to Idaho, 3 years ago. 
I would love to have given 5 stars, but due to tortilla's being on the floor and the young chef's snapping eachother with towels within full view of the customers I gave a 4!
Waiter was great, very attentive. We sat outside and drank margaritas. The music and the setting is comfortable. The food was good I had a cóctel de camarones which hit the spot.

I loved it!  The Blue Agave Restaurant has been reincarnated as "Nectar Eatery & Lounge"--and what an excellent makeover it has gotten.  The interior has been updated and is still very intimate and cozy with just the right touch of lively.  I started with a craft cocktail, the "Passion Del Diablo"--yummy!  And especially 'cuz our server, who was excellent BTW, had the bartender go easy on the chili-infused vodka so it had just the right amount of punch without being too overbearing.  Next enjoyed the goat cheese and prosciutto wrapped dates as an appetizer, and later salivated over the Portobello Burger Plank Warm Goat Cheese Crisp, Ancho Tomato, Arugula, with Fries Salad.  Outstanding all the way!  Will I be back?  You bet!

Just say no. 4 meals and $100.00 wasted. I do not know where to start. I have eaten at PJ's for decades. Last 2 visits the food was just awful. Seriously.  I know they changed their cocktail sauce, fine I can live with that ...sorta. I honestly think my fish was cod not grouper, the bread was gross, think sticking a bun in the fridge then popping it in the microwave on high for 5 minutes. The steak was raw, the coconut shrimp overcooked and flavorless, dense texture, just gross.  Frozen, Sam's club would be better. 
BTW: I am suspect the main lobster was actually cold water lobster - I know this is rough, but three waitresses and one cocky woman on the phone when I called after I got back just ticked me off. She wanted to know if the food was so bad why did we bring the steak home?...I told her it was the only thing we could salvage off the whole table, I can finish cooking it here at home. If you wonder why we did not send back, all 4 MEALS bad...would seem a waste of time. If the owners are cutting corners, please stop.

Suffice to say if you dont know what Taco Bell is all about at this point in life, you are most definitely missing out.  Crunchy tacos, soft tacos, mexican pizzas, and double deckers are the only way i go.  the place rocks, and the hot sauces are a Mexican fast food staple.

Wash it all down with a Mt. Dew for maximum satisfaction!

I have to admit, I haven't been to Block 1912 enough times to formulate a full opinion, but I always felt uneasy at that place, and last night it I was able to figure out why.

The food, the coffee, the gelato, the desserts, are heavenly! Everything they make tastes incredible, and that's what keeps me coming back, but...

My only issue with this place is the ordering process, people always seems lost as to where to line up and where to pick up. I know that might sound ridiculous, but for me these 2 points are pivotal in a coffee shop.

While visiting Philly for the weekend I was searching for a fun brunch spot. I came across a few, and then I saw Common Wealth and the menu looked amazing and inside décor was super cute, so we decided to give it a try!

We were sat right away and a guy who I think was the owner/manager overheard us discussing a few beers on the menu that we had never heard of. He brought us over samples without us even asking and told us to let him know what we thought! So cool. 

We all ordered something different to eat and every single plate was basically licked clean. There was so much flavor packed into each bite and it tasted so fresh and was cooked perfectly. I will absolutely be returning, and highly suggest checking them out if you're in Old City.

Delicious. I had the trio and loved it. Almost too much food.  
I will definitely be back with friends.
We always love dining at Cielo.   The food is terrific and the views of St. Louis are even better.

Went there last night. The food was awesome. Service was friendly and prompt. There were 4 of us. We had ordered the Fajita's, 2 Bacon Fig Quesodillas and Chicken stuffed with spinach and ham. Everything was great. We will definitely be coming back here in the future.

Hamburgers, fried noodles, beer, chicken wings, and oysters -- a unique combination!

Last week was my first time back to this establishment since it re-opened a couple of months back, and I've dined there a total of 4 times already.  Bar-ly suits my cravings because there are days when I crave a hamburger with a Leffe Blonde (excellent belgian), and then there are days when I feel like having pan-fried udon with a Leffe Blonde.  So whatever is called for, Bar-ly is able to satiate my appetite.

Another staple from Bar-ly's menu:  Sriracha wings.  The wings appear to be an iteration of Korean style wings -- double fried then finished with a coating of sauce. Bottom line is Bar-ly's wings are a successful iteration, and I'm glad I do not have to drive to SoHo for wings anymore.  

Oysters.  Growing up right outside of New Orleans, I'm accustomed to $0.25 per oyster;  Bar-ly, however, is the closest thing to that.  Although the oysters are $1.00 a piece here, one would be hard pressed to find another establishment that can match Bar-ly's pricing.  There are typically two choices of oysters, and I usually order both just for the heck of it. 

Bar-ly's food and beer selection, in my opinion, were wisely chosen to compliment each other.  This combined with an upbeat, fun, and welcoming atmosphere is what brings me back to Bar-ly on a weekly basis.

Amis is delicious.

No really, the whole restaurant is delicious.

Get the squid ink pasta with chorizo- it's creamy and perfect. It's black and will probably make your smile a little silly looking, but as long as you share it, that's fine. Both you and your dining mate can have black smiles for a little bit. The bits of chorizo add just enough meat flavor to offset the otherwise too luscious nature of squid ink. 

The bruschetta bread is great: it's thick and grilled with just enough olive oil to add a nice juicy crunch. The imported buffalo ricotta is creamy, but that's about it. It's fluffy, but there's not much flavor.The salami, similarly, is fine. It's cured meat, and the beet jam is pretty good. If you put the salami on the buffalo ricotta, then you've created a great appetizer. The mild saltiness of the meat combines nicely with the otherwise undetected sweetness of the black pepper ricotta. 

As for dessert, you'd be a complete idiot not to indulge in the tartufo al bacio" chocolate and hazelnut semifreddo - even if you're allergic to nuts. Basically, you've got some sort of semifreddo mousse/ice cream blend speckled with hazelnut halves covered in a dark chocolate fondant ganache. It's a hill of succulent indulgence with the perfect sweetness offset by the perfect bitterness of the dark chocolate.

I was kinda skeptical at first with this place being small and not "branded" but oh boy....I was totally wrong. It was so delicious. The lady at the counter walked through most of the menu since it was our first time there. We got "meat me in St.Louie" and "The Duke". I was sooo looking forward for the Nutella and banana one but I was so full with the first one that I promised myself (& my wife) that we would come back to St.Louis at least to eat this again. This time I am gonna start with the Nutella one. 

Totally enjoyed the food. Thanks Sauce on the Side for great food & yelpers for the reviews that made us go there ;-)

Unfortunately I have never had good luck at this place. I hoped that my experience would have been different here because it reminds we of a small town diner. I have tried out Addie's two times. Both times I had the chicken fried steak and both times it fell below the mark. The second time I thought the meat had gone bad because it tasted sour! After the waitress cleaned up our table she didn't even ask why I was returning a full plate of food. I would recommend saving your money or try out one of the other spots downtown.
Not only was the food scrumptious, my wife left her purse and new iPhone and they held it behind the counter for her while we came back to get it. Thanks for the integrity.

Went here last night.  Service was poor-they were short, rude, and supposedly out of everything we asked for.  On top of that, all four of us were sick throughout the night after eating there.  I am done with Burger King.  There are plenty other fast food places around and most of them give much better service.

Ok, this is my first ever yelp review.  I feel like I have to say something.

The crepes are ok.  It's not amazing, it's just...average.  Their filling is good, but the texture of the wrap is disgusting.  It's soggy and gross. Especially after transferring from Berkeley, crepe a go go has fantastic crepes.  There's just something about their batter makes their crepes very crispy and fluffy.  Cafe Equilibrium pales in comparison, but what I REALLY want to try are their waffles.  For some odd reason, their waffle maker keeps falling apart everytime I visit and am craving for a waffle. It's not like they're gonna reimburse me because customers typically pay first before they make your food here.  It's really upsetting.  Their gelato is average at best; I've had better, loads better.  

So I guess what i'm trying to say is, can you PLEASE fix your waffle maker?  Or at least buy a new one? I don't eat out often, and on those several occasions I want a waffle, it would be nice if THE OWNER doesn't look at me pitifully and say , word by word too,  "sorry...the waffle maker is misbehaving ; would you like a crepe instead?."   NO I WANT A WAFFLE.  IF I WANTED A CREPE, I WILL ASK FOR A CREPE. Goddamn , I hope the owner sees this so MAYBE, just MAYBE they'll finally fix it

It's sad that I signed on to yelp just to vent.

Get there early is all I can recommend. Getting there 2 hours before close, most of the items were sold out. Which speaks well of the food, and the adage of being early.

I had gotten into St. Pete that day and while hanging with friends, was debating on what to eat. We ended up talking for a while and debating food spots. All I really wanted was something I can't get good back in California - barbecue! This had great reviews, a huge menu, and a parking lot. Works for me.

We arrived, and from the menu in the door there were already items crossed off. When we got to the host, he mentioned they had closed off sections already and for the quickest service would be the bar. My friend and I didn't have a problem with that, but still a weird thing to say.

As we were checking out the menu, we asked the bartender for his recommendations. He gave us a bunch, but then it turned into a sad state of "Uh oh, we're out of that."

Stick ribs? Sold out.
Mac & Cheese? Sold out.
Pork Belly? Sold out.
St. Louis Ribs? Sold out.

With what options were available, we went with the following:

What's Caulilini - Fried cauliflower in a light oil. I know, not what you would expect to order, but with a big dinner, figured something light and roughage would be solid. And these are tasty!

My friend and I each got a Texas Two Step. Mine came with Sliced Brisket, Pork Brisket, Sandi's Bacon Blue Cheese Slaw, and Fries. The sliced brisket is excellent, really enjoyed that. The pork brisket was okay. The fattier pieces were more enjoyable, but required a lot of chewing. The slaw and fries were both great. 

My friend got the Burnt Ends, aka Meat Candy. GET THOSE! So tasty.

All in all, I would definitely come back to Dr. BBQ, just at an earlier hour so I could get everything I wanted. Definitely those burnt ends.
I love this place. I come every time I'm in Nashville. Their Hot Chicken Cobb Salad is amazing. Those smoked eggs!

I'm very familiar with the Spring House location but since I work in Abington/jenkintown it's convenient that this location is in the area.

Small and modest setting but delicious sushi. Very consistent to the Spring House and Philadelphia location. 

The rolls are 8 pieces- I got spicy tuna, tuna avocado, and shrimp tempura (3 roll special: $11.50) and my only issue was the shrimp tempura roll was very small. No veggies and the shrimp was small. 

Another observation, most sushi places I've been to give a ridiculous serving of wasabi but I didn't get half way through my rolls before running out of wasabi! Never thought that would be an issue but the portion was very small. Other than that they have a variety of rolls and options. So good!
Such a great idea for a restaurant. Food was good and the portions were huge. Nostalgia at its finest

Staff appear to hate life and are unable to answer simple questions.  There is no delight to serve and every request feels like you are ruining their day.  Food is ok, restaurant cleanliness is not the best, but the service is just sub-par and unacceptable.

this restuarant is like being in a roller derby. i have never, ever had wait staff run by like they were wearing skates. we went on a saturday night and the place was loud and crowded. there is absolutely no relaxing in this place because everything feels rushed. the second star off was for 10 dollar old fashioneds. they were made with cheap bourbon so there is no reason to charge that high for a drink.  i would expect that at a higher end restaurant with better house bourbon. the food from the greek menu side was good.
Brand new establishment.  Super clean.  Great for family fun. Met the friendliest bar back, Collin.  Such a sweetheart.  We'll be back when we're in town

Do not stay at this resort if you have allergies to dust, dirt or mold. The spa facilities are extremely dated and in need of a serious overhaul. I suffered a burn in their whirlpool. My bedsheets were only changed twice in six days (I know because I have a frequent traveler trick that I use) and the conference room that I spent a day in had no running water in the washroom just a bottle of hand soap. The decor is more modern in my 90-year old mother's nursing facility but she doesn't care as she is blind. Maybe she would enjoy a vacation there. I doubt it because she still has some taste. Absolutely deplorable. And, if you are thinking of attending the smoking cessation program, forget about it; save your money, buy the patches and go to a luxury hotel instead!

Cute cafe with good service. The food is mediocre, but you can't expect too much since it's at the airport. I thought the prices were reasonable as the breakfast meals ranged from $11-13. I got the Heuvos rancheros, it was decent but lacked spices. It consisted of crispy corn tortilla with fried egg and cotija cheese. Overall, quick and convenient spot for a bite to eat before your flight.

Ahhhmazing cocktails served here! It's a cool place to meet friends and hang out. Kid friendly too! Best when there's a food truck and live music (check their website). Service can get a bit slow when the place gets crowded and the drinks are a bit pricey.

We had a company dinner with 15 people. The service was great and the food was wonderful. They have an appetizer "Seafood Trio" that is absolutely addictive. I will have that as my meal the next time that I am there.  I highly recommend this restaurant!
Very delicious and tasteful dishes. Tapas are very good. Excellent service and nice environment. Try it out abc you'll like this place.

Nice atmosphere and the food is ok.  This place is definitely a chain, but it was ok.  We had deviled eggs, onion rings, crab cakes, prime rib, and blue cheese filet.  All was good.  The deviled eggs were awesome. The onion rings were a little greasy and the crab cakes were a bit dry, but everything had a good taste overall.

Let's start with the service. It's 2 45 on Tuesday.  There are three customers and myself. I start speaking with the server, two sentences in to the conversation two people walk in.
