You interrupt the conversation without excusing yourself to. We start again. Same thing. This is unacceptable . I ordered wings and a pulled pork fondue. The wings were tasty and had a nice kick.  The pork was burnt and bone dry, the fondue hardeneed. Nice presentation in cast iron pan. Terrible end product. Called the next week and left a message asking for the manager to contact me, so I could provide feedback regarding the exoeriece.....food and inaatentive, sloppy customer service....no call back....will not be returning ....way too many excellent quality restaurants at all price points then to chance another time for service that tells me   I don't care about you or my job

ATMOSPHERE: Beautiful, decor is very cool. Ladies - dress up a little, and be sure to check out the restroom! 
FOOD: The fig and chevre 1st course, and the pierogie 1st course were both amazing. Also had the puttanesca - delish! Pork chop wasn't my fave, it wasn't quite cooked long enough for my taste. But the dessert - popcorn profiteroles - a must!!
SERVICE: Didn't see any non-alcoholic drinks listed on the menu and had to ask the waiter. The waiter also disappeared and was replaced by another guy - who was also very nice - but then the original guy came back just as our dessert was being served, so that was kinda weird.

Great Thai food; very reasonably priced, consistently quick and good service to boot. You can also order to go. The chicken dumplings appetizer (forgot what they're called) are great, as are the crab angels (crab rangoon).

I'm pretty addicted to the chicken dijon sandwich here. It is so good. The pork belly gnocchi is the best gnocchi I have ever had, though be warned it is incredibly rich. Good to go halvesies on it with someone else and also split that sammy. Great mac and cheese as well, and yummy pickles. Love everything on the menu though they serve chips with sandwiches which is annoying, they're nothing special.
So much atmosphere squeezed into a small space! Its just cool to have a bar and restaurant in a house, also. Enjoy on a hot summer night.

Great local places with killer burgers.  You will see everybody from Bankers to bikers, Grooms to Grunts.  This is not your corner wine bar...staff was friendly and having a good time with regulars   Beach bar with the "end of the road" feel.  

10 of 10. Would go again
Average. Not great but not awful. We went out of our way to check it out and had a 35 minute wait which is all fine for good food.... Won't be back.
Great place to eat. I was pleasantly surprised at the service and the food quality. Treat yourself to a pleasant breakfast, lunch, and indulge.

I've been really wanting to visit Karachi Kafe since it opened! The interior is gorgeous and very well thought out. You can tell the owners really care about their business and it definitely shows in all the effort they've put in creating this beautiful place.  I had Samosas, the zinger burger and Kashmiri chai which were all so good! I also was at a wedding recently that catered from Karachi Kafe and all the food was SO good. The staff was so friendly and nice and that alone is a good enough reason for me to visit again!

Cafe La Maude is the quintessential Philly destination for an excellent weekend brunch. The service was fast and efficient. They have outdoor booths open that allowed for fairly spaced out outdoor dining. The food was excellent. Between the two of us, we shared the Red Shakshuka and the Apple Pie Banana Pancakes which were excellent portion sizes. The red shakshuka was an excellent blend of Lebanese sausage and tomato flavors with a delicious touch of Harissa Labneh; the entire meal was hearty but not too heavy even with the pita bread. The Apple Pie Banana Pancakes were an interesting combination of green pancakes with bananas inside and caramelized apples with blueberry cream cheese yogurt. Overall we felt safe and had an excellent meal, would definitely go again.

Fabulous restaurant. The decor is so different for Santa Barbara . Very hip . Loved the appetizers . The entrees and sushi are first class. The tempura wings are crispy meaty and tasty.  And the side of fried rice goes great with everything . I suggest ordering a lot of different options on the menu and sharing. The service is fantastic as well . They will pace your orders so you can savor every bite. I havnt had a chance to go to the 2nd floor by the fireplace for "social hour"  but that is on my TO DO list

I was visiting my girlfriend in Philadelphia and she made a reservation at Scarpetta because it was near her apartment and had availability on a Friday night. What was expected to be a pleasant Friday evening turned into an infuriating dining experience.
 
To start, we were seated behind a pillar and no one attended to us for the first 15 minutes. I noticed four Caucasian girls were seated behind us after us and were immediately greeted with menus and glasses of water. Our designated waiter realized we were waiting without menus after flirting with the four girls for a good 5 minutes. (Fred C.) had a look of -oh shit- written across his face. He finally came by with menus and asked what type of water we wanted.
 
After taking our order, we still did not receive our water and two Caucasian girls were seated next to us. We finally received our water after they served us our drinks. Then, we noticed the girls next to us received their bread basket, and yet again, our table did not. Our appetizers came and still our bread never came. We had to bring it to the waiter's attention and THEN he immediately brought our bread basket over.
 
It was becoming difficult to feel like this was not an act of discrimination. We brought it to the attention of the manager and he responded with "Sorry, it is really busy. We will give you an extra dessert." I am not sure why he thought dessert would fix everything and he completely ignored the fact that we felt neglected throughout the entire dining experience thus far. It felt like he wanted the dessert to shut us up and it would make up for all the mistreatment at a dinner I am paying for with my time and money. It seems obvious a restaurant would be busy on a Friday night, and so why was that an excuse? Did he want a pity party? Did he want us to sympathize with him and manage the restaurant for him? I've been to busier restaurants with impeccable service despite the crowds. (Honestly, it wasn't even that busy for a Friday night.)
 
Finally, the bill came and instead of charging my girlfriend and I for the glass of wine we ordered, he charged us each for a bottle. I was livid and done with the entire experience at that point. I probably should have walked out the first 15 minutes. Safe to say I will not come back just to pay to be treated with negligence for an hour of my life I will never get back.

All of my critiques on staffing have been addressed. Great hostess, perfect staffing, great dining room Managment and as usual....spectacular food. Go Meauxbar. This is going to be a long relationship.

Great service, food was just average.  We had the beet salad and lentil soup for apps, ricotta gnocchi and a pasta dish with bacon for dinner.  For desert we had the nutella pudding. Everything tasted okay, but nothing impressive.  Very cozy and nice atmosphere, just wish the food was more impressive.

Food was AMAZING!!!!  Loved the Basil Fried Rice.  First bite had me, not only was it so good but I didn't blow up like a balloon from sodium.  My new go to spot for Chinese.  By the way, the service was great too!

Coming to RR is always a great way to finish off the trip to NOLA especially if you happen to come in for Sunday brunch. The live jazz trio during your meal is like icing on the cake for a trip to NOLA. The food here never disappoints. We had the fire roasted oysters to start, then moves to the main course with the ricotta gnocchi lobster, BBQ shrimp and grits, death by gumbo and the duck confit and eggs. To finish off we had the strawberry pain perdu (French toast). All the dishes were fabulously presented and had complex flavors. At the end of our meal, our server Sam offered a tour of the kitchen and wine cellar which was a great way to finish off the experience.
Always great food been there several times.. .. its a must go... can be costly but its a craft to make great bbq!!

Didn't take pics of the food. Sunday was $1 wing day. Everything was fresh and delicious. Wanted do take pics of the food but they wouldn't wait lol. I recommend the pear, pineapple or mango BBQ sauce. I waited a really long time for my order next time I'll call it in. Parking is a little tricky but it does exist. I'll give 3 out of 5 only because my wait was over an hour but again the food was phenomenal.

I knew that I'd be heading to Brownsburg to explore a nature park, but I had no other plans. Didn't even know what would be possible thanks to Corona Virus. 

But once I had walked the entire loop at Arbuckle Park, capturing the scene as I went, I worked myself up a good appetite. But where to go?

Just then there was a frenzy of activity in my brain as I considered where I was, remembered Plainfield and The Oasis Diner was not far away, and finally might be able to use a gift certificate I'd been saving for the perfect opportunity. 

So #Franny and I headed to Plainfield. We #found the diner, I scanned the menu, and I ordered something I'd never dreamed possible but wore the name of the restaurant: The Oasis Burger 

And it was delivered just as described: two beef patties covered with cheese, bacon, pulled pork bbq, slaw, and pickles, served on a brioche bun with a side of fries. 

The only thing I could do when it was in front of me was laugh. And pick up my fork and knife and dive in!

All I can say is that it was so sloppy but so good that I didn't feel the bbq sauce all over my chin until I was driving back to INDY, AFTER I had said goodbye to the staff! ‍

And, no, I could not eat it all. So yes, we will be reunited soon. 

Now more than ever, friends, we need to support our local businesses if possible. #Getlostindiana at Oasis Diner.

Very disappointed. Was told they required masks, took temps, tables set apart. Sounded like they believe in science and scientists. Drove from Clearwater Beach, parked and got ready to go into venue; BUT, since two of the three people entering before us had no masks and walked right in, it was apparent they also subscribe to Don The Con's brand of truthfulness. We elected to bypass this venue. Don't patronize any establishment that does not Para rice and enforce safe practice and definitely don't patronize any establishment that blatantly misrepresents their practices and policies.

Had lunch here with a girlfriend of mine yesterday and I am so glad we picked Brown's Social House!
It was my very first time to this establishment.
The decor definitely helps set the mood and the environment is rather comfortable. Our server Megan was an absolutle delight. She was very funny and sweet. Took care of us promptly and quite professionally.
I had the steak sandwich and was very pleased with it. The portion size was perfect and the meat was cooked perfectly though it was a bit on the expensive side. The drink was exceptionally well paired and my only complaint about that would be it was lunch time and I was driving so I couldn't have more!
I didn't get to try the oreo dessert this time but I can for sure say I will be back and I will definitely be enjoying oreos for dessert!!
Oh and parking was beautiful!

This restaurant was highly recommended to us by many, many people. We were very excited to try it out one day while we were at Indie flea market. It was very crowded but that seems to be the norm. We were seated after about 20 minutes and from there the experience worsened. We have to say this may be one of the worst dining experiences we've ever had. We had extremely long wait times in between our server stopping at the table. There were employees everywhere but it still seemed to be slower than ever. Our food took over 35 minutes to get to us and we had only ordered two sandwiches and a cup of soup. When our food came, we asked for ketchup. The server said she would go and get some, however, she never came back. We waited about 20 minutes and held off on the fries, ha ha, and finally asked a staff member that walked by for some ketchup. That person said they would go get some. But again they never returned... So over 30 minutes later we asked our server for a second time for some ketchup. It came to us about five minutes later. It confused us because all of the sandwiches were served with fries, yet they did not have ketchup anywhere handy. They had to go back into the kitchen to get the little cup of ketchup. After our plates had been taken away when we were done with our food, we had to wait over 30 minutes for our waitress to come back to give us the check. we never were even offered drink refills. Not even for water. we saw our waitress standing off to the side talking with another employee and giving us a weird look. We didn't really know what that was all about because we hadn't made any complaints. Finally , we waved someone down who got our waitress to give us the check. She was very rude and just dropped the check on the table and walked away. We really don't know what was going on the day that we went. It seems like they were staffed appropriately. We do not intend on going back here, as there are many other options in the area that we would rather go to that have nicer / more attentive employees.

This is a divey little bar with a handful of simple but excellent poboys and other small Cajun eats. Nothing elegant about this place but it definitely has a charm. Prices were reasonable. Service was friendly. We will definitely be back when were in Nola

My mother and I went there for lunch on a weekday and I was surprised the place isn't packed all the time.  I've been there twice now and the food was great both times.  The first time I had the crab cakes which were nicely crafted except I like them to be fried a little bit more so they are crunchier on the outside but the flavor profile was spot on.  The second time I had the appetizer as a meal of mussels in a garlic white wine sauce mmmmm, mmmmm, mmmmm so delicious.  I can't say enough good things about this.  First of all the portion was very generous I had a whole other meal out of the left overs.  The mussels were perfectly cooked and the broth was so yummy I couldn't  get enough of it.  My mother had the spinach lasagna which I also sampled and I don't care for the red sauce or gravy but I could have eaten this sauce by the jar full it was sooooo good.  My mother actually wanted to know if they sell the gravy by the jar because she would be a regular customer.  The lasagna consisted of a lot of ricotta and mozzarella cheese and in my book you can never have too much ooey  gooey cheese on anything.  Very much a comfort food and again the portion was more than generous.  For dessert we shared a piece of tiramisu and our server told us it had just been freshly made and indeed it was so fresh and good the only thing that it was missing was the coffee liquor which would have made it over the top fantastic.  Everything was very fresh and delicious and I will be certainly going back there more often now that I know I can have a great meal there!

So the food isn't bad, not great, but not bad. UNTIL there were hairs cooked into my omelette!!! not on top, COOKED IN! Once, I can try to forgive and move past, but TWICE and I'm done. I won't be returning.

We stopped in for a drink and appetizers in the afternoon. Bartender was amazing. So personable and knew when to bring water, another drink, Etc. Wish I had her name.  She has worked there 15 years. Ordered potato skins with bacon and cheese.  Great afternoon appetizer. Would absolutely come back to sit at bar again just for amazing service!

This is kind of a hip/trendy burger joint with a cultivated "divey" feel to it (i.e. I'm sure that's exactly what they were trying for).  They have an "OMFG" burger challenge, and apparently the Man vs Food guy showed up to do it once.  If you finish their 3 lb burger in 30 minutes it's free.  I think that was the challenge.  If not, it's something like $30 for that burger.

There are only a few tables, so you may or may not get seated anytime soon.  We got lucky that there was one table available when we showed up.  They were just cleaning it, so those folks had recently left.  Shortly after we sat down other people showed up but the place was full.

"Is it worth waiting?", you ask.  Weeeellllll....maybe.

Their menu features some unique burgers.  How about one with peanut butter on it?  How about another where each half of the bun is actually a grilled cheese sandwich (so, yes, you get TWO grilled cheese sandwiches with that burger)?  You can do some customizing if you choose, and they do have a few more conventional burgers.  The burgers are 1/2 lb patties.

I got the shroom burger but changed the cheese and put the sauce on the side.  The sauce it turns out is chipotle and Thousand Island.  Tangy and spicy to the point that it would overwhelm the burger if you aren't careful.  I added just a little bit because without it the burger was very ordinary.  Not bad.  Reasonably good, actually.  But ordinary.  I could get a comparable burger at Red Robin for less (plus bottomless fries!).

Speaking of fries, those are a separate side dish here.  Not included with your burger.  Now to their credit the fries were cooked perfectly and had a nice seasoning.  They also offered a "gravy" dip (for an extra charge) that was a peppery-beef gravy.  It actually worked quite well with the fries, but I thought it kinda stingy of them not to offer it free with the fries.  How much would a little cup of that gravy cost them, really?  Especially when the order of fries was half the price of one of the burgers!

So my verdict?  Good burgers, good fries, good gravy.  Not fantastic, but good.  A bit pricey.  However, if you're military (former or active) they do give a 10% discount.

Service was OK.  All interactions were friendly, but they were pretty busy so they didn't check on us much.
Excellent food! I absolutely love the farmhouse tots! Service staff was very attentive.

This family-run business was an instant success when it opened, and for good reason. The ingredients are the freshest and everything is made with care. The cafe is bright and comfortable and the service is friendly. Excellent coffee and breakfast sandwiches. Delicious lunch sandwiches. Bagels and bread from Le Bus and home-made carrot cake to die for. 

A much better alternative to the Art Museum cafeteria - tourists pay attention! And a great little spot if you just happen to be in the neighborhood.
From the moment we sat down, our server Brianna was wonderful! She made great recommendations (the gumbo was out of this world), and all the food was delicious! Definitely recommend this place.

Had dinner here and really liked it. I had the breaded tenderloin and my friend had fried mushrooms and the wings. The tenderloin was really good. The mushrooms and the wings were also good. I look forward to trying their pizzas and other sandwiches.

This is a fantastic cafe on a quiet block of the Warehouse District.

- Food: Caribbean/Brazilian/South American-themed. Healthy yet extremely tasty; has vegan/vegetarian options aplenty if that's your jam. This place is so delicious that I order takeout there a few times a week. In particular, their rotating entree specials tend to be amazing, so be sure to ask about those. Great salads as well. Lots of organic/wild-caught fare.

- Ambiance/People etc.: The staff there is awesome. Super, super friendly, and they seem very invested in you enjoying their restaurant as much as they do. Seems like a tight-knit crew. It has a casual, relaxed ambiance that is very enjoyable for dine-in. They always have really cool Caribbean cocktails as well. 

Can't recommend the place enough. Truly awesome. Please go and enjoy!!

The food here is very good but the menu is a little limited.  I love the duck burger and the calamari appetizer.  The calamari is in long strips rather than little rings and comes with dipping sauce. The duck burger is not greasy at all and you should try it with a side of crispy brussel sprouts which are my new favorite unhealthy veggie.  The bison burger is good as well.  We have both eaten here and had it delivered.  i would have been more prone to give them five stars if they would put their delivery food in better containers but they send it out in coated cardboard boxes which may be green but it is rather unappetizing to have some things thrown in a box.  Its okay for a sandwich but we have had pasta from there delivered in the same kind of container and it is just not appetizing.   This is not to be critical but I can say we would order from there more often if they had different take out containers.

Stayed at adjoining hotel. Enjoyed dinner (Caesar with shrimp) and wine. Inexpensive and good flavor (I hate a bad Caesar). Came back for breakfast (order the breakfast potatoes). Great service. Would go back again.

We had reservations for 12:30 but arrived early and they sat us right away. The decor was very nice and pretty. We had a water waiter, a drunk waiter and a food waiter all were very nice & the service was great. We started with bread and butter, the bread was really good and it had just come out of the oven. My fiancé had the Crab stuffed artichoke - it was really good but it was stuffed with shrimp, not crab, so weird.
Andouille crusted fish with a side of fried oysters was delicious! I had the gumbo which was really good, and then the shrimp roll - it was okay nothing out of this world. It should state on the menu that it's a cold dish. The dessert looked good but we were stuffed. Def recommend this place and make sure you make reservations!

Amazing service-great atmosphere-fresh ingredients!

Just moved recently from San Diego- and this was my first time here- Saturday night around 5:30- with a party of 5 and a baby.

Our Party ordered wine and beer-a pepperoni pizza (more pepperoni on a pizza that I've ever seen) a few orders of the Chicken Pot Pie (crust was to die for) this came with a side salad with fresh Spring and Frisée lettuce and homemade dressings. 

Next time I hope to order a dessert- they looked amazing- most importantly the customer service was warm and friendly and food was fresh and delicious!

My wife and I tried Chuy's for the first time a few weeks back. We were satisfied with the selection, taste, etc. The "happy hour" nacho bar is awesome! If you're looking for Tex-Mex food, this place is great!

Jenga beer game: pull from the bottom 1/3 and drink for 2 seconds. Pull from the middle and drink for 4, pull from the top and drink for 6. Enjoy.

Never thought I'd be able to say I would PLAN to eat dinner at a divey, game filled bar... not even for happy hour or even late night munchies. Options and quality combined usually set me up for a hangover worse than the day after your 21st. However, Half Moon has a delicious veggie burger that's big enough to share and of course their potato wedge like fries are an excellent addition to the table. I highly recommend stopping in after work with friends to watch a match (on TV or a nearby table) or play your own version of an assortment of board games. They also have Wednesday trivia! May the most knowledgeable on random material win!

Watching the news I saw this place so I decided to try it, after all the news segment featured this savory creation of goodness, a simple must have (The Gorilla Dog). Well it wasn't as good as it looked 1st it was luke warm and I hate luke warm food Hate!!! 2nd all the nathens hot dogs I've eaten had a distinctive snap, there was no snap so other than that it was decent but not worth the 30-minute trip from my house...

This is one of my favourite restaurants in Edmonton. First time I had was when a did a takeout order for 12. There was lots of different types of meat and they were all delicious. 
I also went to brunch here after finding other places very busy and the food was amazing. It is not a place that you would normally think of having brunch. But the chicken and waffles was outstanding.

I got the wedge salad with chicken. They can put chicken on any salad.  It was great. Fresh and the blue cheese chunks were bigger than marbles. I was pleasantly surprised for an airport bar.  I will be back.
The only bummer was they were completely out of any IPA beer.  A few people asked for it.

The service was great and the food came rather quickly. I ordered the carne asada burrito. The burrito was huge but half way into it I was starting to believe I had ordered a rice and bean burrito and that a couple pieces of meat fell into it in the process. They need to put carne asada in their carne asada burrito.

This is a great local business that serves great sandwiches, soups, salads, and loafs of bread.  I have tried almost every sandwich on the menu and am never disappointed.  Some are better than others.  

My personal favorites are:
Stan's Stack
Rex's Revenge
Max's Muffalatta
Avi's Avo
Joel's jolt
Its Greek  to Me salad

The only problem with some of the sandwiches is the bread can be pretty much impossible to eat without your sandwich falling apart.  They put a tooth next to the hard bread, which are often very tasty options, but are too hard to eat when making up a sandwich.  They let you substitute any bread though, so just in case you don't want a super hard bread.  

The sandwiches are huge and will often be impossible to eat the entire thing.  The stan's stack is basically 2 sandwiches, so for 10 bucks you can really get 2 meals.  

For sides, the pasta salad is really good.  But I like the kettle chips.

The iced tea is awesome.  

The desserts are amazing.  I always get a peanut butter chocolate cookie.  My all time favorite cookie.

Any place remotely connected with Cochon knows what's up.  We enjoyed the amazing breakfast.  Irish coffee, Bloody Mary, Cochon de lait eggs Benedict are all a must!  Had a couple of bites of the bananas foster French toast and loved it but couldn't do the diabetes challenge.  Can not wait to come back.

I almost forgot I ate here.  My food was wonderful although I forgot what I ordered.  I remember the young lady that took my order. She was nice and friendly.  We shared a couple of really good laughs. She recommended a drink I really enjoyed.  And my food was really tasty.   In which she also recommended.  I forget her name but she was a very young black girl who rocks. .

I went for lunch here with 3 friends. My burger and salad were great but the two friends I was with only had sides - cornbread and mashed potatoes. The side of mashed potatoes was probably the smallest amount I have ever seen given. It was in a little container that ketchup would be in! I was in awe of how small this amount was especially with the price. They also told me that the cornbread was the most unique one they had ever tried and they didn't really enjoy it as it was so different. The atmosphere of the whole restaurant was very nice though.
Love love love this place....have bern coming here for years....love the veggie pizza and salads.

Oh Wild Hare, I wanted so badly to like you.  I like your concept and quirky atmosphere, but my positive feelings stop there.

I don't mind paying a little extra for good fresh, local food... but not THIS much extra, especially for food that tastes far from fresh. I don't remember the exact price tag off hand, but maybe I'm extra bitter since I also had to buy myself another lunch elsewhere afterward. 

The lobster pizza sounded amazing, but tasted like microwaved fish sticks.  I had once piece and had to stop.  Judging by the other reviews, this item must be hit or miss. 
The server tried to sell me on a brunch cocktail, but when I asked for a drink menu she said, "um, we have a full bar."  Well, ok then.  I decided to be fancy and get a mimosa, but 10 minutes later she came back to tell me they were out of orange juice and she was making it a poinsettia (with cranberry) instead. Well, ok then.

Slow service, bad food, hefty price tag... The only thing keeping this review from a 1 star is that my boyfriend seemed to have a little better experience than I did food-wise, so I'll give them a little benefit of the doubt and hope that I just ordered the wrong thing on an off day.

You know a place is good when you haven't even been to Santa Barbara in 4 years, yet HAVE to go back!  That's what happened to me the other day.  It was about 9pm on a Tuesday so State Street wasn't crowded, so I just had my date drive down the street until I spotted "this really good Italian restaurant that my mom and I discovered years ago and that Brittany and I always used to go to".  I swear, this place gets better every time I go!

On this visit, I ordered the Brie and Garlic Appetizer and my date ordered the Ravioli Sampler (cus I told him how good it was from past visits!).  The garlic bread here is so good, btw....my date loved it and ate practically the whole basket!  They brought out another, which we took with our leftovers!

The Brie and Garlic was sooo good!  Warm oozing delicious brie cheese, topped with caramelized walnuts, a whole clove (is that what it's called) of garlic that was so soft and tasty, a few slices of pear and sliced french bread.  I was eating it without the bread cus it was sooo good and I'd rather save the carb calories for the pasta!

The waitress mistakenly put the wrong order into the kitchen and they brought out something called the Pascucci Pasta(I think) instead of the Ravioli Sampler.  So we did have to wait a few minutes for them to prepare the raviolis, but my date was stoked cus he got to sample another dish!  It had some kind of spicy sauce on it, so other than the one bite he coerced me into taking, I steered clear.  But he really enjoyed it.  

The Ravioli Sampler is delicious.  Cheese with marinara, Italian sausage, portabello mushroom(YUM!), gorgonzola(I think this one's my fav), and butternut squash(pumpkin pie, I swear!).

Washed down with a glass of Pinot Grigio and I believe the proper term for this meal is : Spectacular!  I definitely will not let four year pass before my next visit :-)
This is the best Pakistani food I've ever had.  And the atmosphere is way cool, too.  Highly recommend!

Although a small venue in a  lonely corner in Center City Philly, definitely a place worth checking out. I had the Enlightened Bamboo dish, and as cheesy as the name sounds, the meal was delicious.  Very flavourful.  Being a BYOB makes this place even more appealing, AND it had online 20% coupons!   My only complaint was that when I requested to have the 3 hot chill peppers for level of spicyness (yeah i handle my spice), which they advertised on their menu as 'needing a distinguisher' (yeah instead of extinguisher, you can overlook English errors when the food is this tasty). Anyway, the dish in my opinion was not spicy at all!  Especially since when I asked the waitress for it she said I was so brave for even requesting it and that not many people do.   So I ended up getting extra chilli sauce on the side. Anyway, I definitely recommend this place despite what level of spice you get!

I do recommend this place!
Especially "Raw oysters" and " Charbroiled oysters"
It was first place what we visited in this city,and we are not disappointed at all!!!)

Minus a star just for cleanliness. When I walked in, someone was carrying a huge pot of beef juices/stock from the kitchen into the dining area. Wtf?! It was filled to the brim and he was this close to tripping and throwing scalding out juice on a customer.

Ok that aside, the value of this place is awesome. The regular hoagies & steaks are huge (see apple for scale) and stuffed full of meats & veggies! And better yet, on Tuesdays they have a $5 hoagie deal when you buy a drink. My only complaint is that the bread is pretty stiff/stale, and obviously the cheesesteak meat isn't as good as places like Delassandro's.

Still love this place, highly recommend, and I really want to try it for breakfast!!

We've had good and bad experiences with Olive Garden. It's becoming less of a value as their menu prices seem to be increasing more frequently. 

Last night my family and I had dinner. Kris was our server. She was off from the start; seemed confused or something. I think every step of the way she made mistakes, not just with our table, but the party of 8 adjacent to us. The manager comped some of their food, but I guess word of the poor service we experienced didn't make its way to the manager's attention. I decided it just wasn't worth it.

We finished our meals and asked for (2) to-go containers. Kris brought back 7 of them! She then watched as I combined two entrees into a single container and when I looked up, she was shaking her head and said they weren't going to fit. Well, they fit and I had plenty of room left over. Now, what was I going to do with the extra to-go containers? And, why the hell did she bring so many in the first place?

When we were finished, Kris asked if we paid our bill already. I told her no. How could we? Upon leaving, I paid our bill while Kris hovered over me watching me getting ready to apply the tip at the table kiosk. I looked up at her with a quizzical look and then she explained how the slider looked. I told her I was very familiar with it. 

The total price of our bill, including tip, was around $51. I mistakenly left without a receipt. On the drive home I calculated our three entrees and my daughter's milk. It came to ~$43 with tax and tip. It didn't add up. I'm thinking now we paid someone else's bill.

The funniest thing was when Kris brought a tray to clear some of our dishes, she left in right in front of my wife's chair, not allowing her to get up. Kris walked away and my wife squirmed out of her seat.

This is a popular breakfast spot in a Carmel strip mall. We stoped by for breakfast. The inside is decorated like a 50s diner with a long counter and plenty of tables. We sat in the back. A table for two. 

The menu is upscale trendy but the food is traditional breakfast. I ordered the avocado breakfast sandwich which was served on a grilled sour dough bread with egg and avocado. The sandwich was good, but a little greasy and could have used more avocado. 

They do a brisk morning carry out business with a significant group of regulars.

Saw the review on oysters and had to try them. Some of the best I've had. Very meaty and clean.  Enjoyed the crab cakes and shrimp. Great sauce for the cakes but they plain old cocktail sauce was, I think, congealed and tasteless. Price were very fair and we enjoyed the meal.

Moshulu is an interesting dining experience where the diner can sit in a vintage boat from the early 1900's. The interior is dark and musty but and authentic feel for a boat who has been around for over 200 years! The food is fare and better than one can expect. The service is excellent and the views are nice. Everyone should visit at least one time, both tourist and locals.

The burger was terrible. It tasted more like meatloaf or a meatball than a hamburger and it was not cooked well done as requested. The "Red Hook Ale fried shrimp" were bland without much flavor. The shrimp in the breading looked (and tasted) like the kind of shrimp you would find in one of those prepackaged cocktail rings at the grocery store or the kind that you would find in cheap Chinese food. Coleslaw was bland as well and very stringy. Not chopped enough. The "half moon mozzarella" looked and tasted as if it were purchased from the frozen food section of a grocery store. Sure, they cut them in half and presented them on a bed of lettuce with "homemade" marinara sauce on the side but they still tasted store bought. Lastly, I am currently writing this from the toilet at 1:45 am and my girlfriend whom I took there for dinner is feeling nauseated. Please avoid this restaurant.
It's not very broad, but what they do, they do well. Try the lamb. It's awesome, if you're a lamb lover. If  not, try the chicken...very tender.

I had lunch here and was really disappointed.  The servers that served us reeked of cigarette smoke.  The whole place needs a good cleaning!  I overheard some of the servers arguing.  It just could be so much better.  Does management ever care?  This could be a nice place, the salads we got weren't that bad.
Veggie burgers are bean based. Definitely worth a try. Try out the Maine Root sodas!  Friendly and attentive staff. Overall a pleasant stop for lunch.
Sausage  pizza was the best ! Staff is extremely friendly. Salad tasted fresh as can be. Can't wait to go back!
When we went to yellow stone it was delicious and all of the waiters were really nice I recommend this place to EAT!!!
This family-run donut shop is lovely, literally staffed by the actual family! They went out of their way to bring a special box over for the Bonaparte's Retreat booth at Record Store Day! #delicious

First time here and were immediately welcomed and seated. The owner, Maria,  was very kind and went out of her way to make sure we were well taken care.. including bring us some delicious appetizers on the house. Our server, Amy, was equally wonderful and attentive. She made sure we had everything we needed at all times. Will definitely be returning and highly recommend this place if you enjoy a great dinner with a superb jukebox!

We were fortunate to arrive at Cafe La Maude and we were seated immediately.  I was very impressed with the staff and the owner was very gracious.   For many years, I worked in high end restaurants.  That being said,  I am very demanding.  I have nothing but praise for Cafe La Maude.  The service was excellent and the food superb. I could see and taste the "culinary pride" in the food.  I am a very good chef and I was totally impressed.  "Best pancakes my son has ever tasted"  and the Brisket Huevos Rancheros was the "best breakfast dish I have ever eaten!"  Fantastic coffee as well.  We live in Baltimore and cannot wait to return.
Went to Nashville for the first time this weekend.  Every where we went was super fun, except this place.  So boring.  $17 for a cocktail with Blake Shelton's vodka?  No thanks.  Skip this one.

Food, is declining in quality  mean ,rude obnoxious owners and staff, absolutely do NOT eat there, Bob might pick a fight with you even though you plan on spending  a lot of money for big party of 45 people, makes me wonder what might be going on behind the kitchen doors, good luck Bob  and Mark, you're gonna need it.....

I really enjoy the food.  The lack of a star is for my first online ordering experience.  I ordered a sandwich and I thought it included fries, but it did not.  It showed the waffle fries for an additional charge but not the regular fries and am unhappy about the lack of clarity.  I asked and was told fries are extra.  Overpriced for just a sandwich, but the entrees are priced OK.  I'll return but not sure if I'll order online again.
The red snapper was fresh and perfectly cooked.  I was happy to learn they have my favorite beer on draught.

This place have a good decor and outside sitting area too. I was eating here with some friends. For appetizer we had the good tasting banh xeo battered shrimp (which came out after my pho). I had the Pho Beef broth with Flank and Rib-eye as an entree the broth did not have a pho taste was too sweet i could not taste "beef" lol and the noodles was vermicelli not the pho noodles.

Just had my wedding reception here.  Valerie was great to work with and the staff was excellent!  Everyone loved the food and all the extras I asked for were all perfect.  This was the best part of my entire wedding and it rained cats and dogs.  The Wild River Grille didn't make even one iota of a mistake.  So many of my guests came up to us and said this was the best wedding they ever attended.  Could it get any better?  Yes!  My only wish would be for us to get married again just to have this experience once more.  Cheers to the Wild River Grille!
Best sub shop ever!  Great food with quality ingredients!   My husband and I are hooked!  Have had the pastrami sandwich and just had the Colorado Cuban sub.  YUMMY!
Service was horrible. No attention. Portions were pretty small but did enjoy the live music.

I don't usually write food reviews unless they are good. Viva wins my vote for one of the best mexican restaurants in town.  I like the new menu and better prices.  We can actually afford to eat there more often.

You will love the location and the turtle fountain right outside the door.  Great outdoor dining.  Still need to work on the price of the house margarita.  A bit pricey!  Otherwise, a good mexican beer with you meal is another great option.

We just had our joint 50th birthday wine-paired sit-down dinner at LaFond Winery and catered by Montecito Wine Bistro.  We and our 50 guests had a wonderful time, and a huge part of the credit goes to the Montecito Wine Bistro and in particular to the manager, Ernesto, and the chef, Victor.  

From our initial tasting at the restaurant, we knew Ernesto was a find.  We wanted a one of a kind evening for our friends and family with a special dinner and just the right wines.  Ernesto got that from the start.  His suggestions were perfect but he made sure we sampled plenty of dishes and wines so that we were confident in the final menu.  Then, Ernesto helped us plan the evening, including the layout and the timing so we never felt rushed and had plenty of time to enjoy the company and the lovely setting.  

Chef Victor delivered a dinner that was every bit as good as the tasting we had at the restaurant.  From the hors d'oeuvres (ahi bites, kobe meatloaf sliders & bruschetta) to the 4 course dinner (kale salad, ravioli al limone, sea bass en papillote & karabuta pork spare ribs) to the dessert (peach cobbler, chocolate tarte & creme brulee), the timing and the food were perfection.  

This was a dinner we and our friends will be talking about for years to come.  Thank you Ernesto and Chef Victor!

i've been back quite a few times now! try the tuna tuna roll and the spicy tuna crunch roll! im blanking on the appetizer we got but it was a fried roll...with shrimp and three dipping sauces-- that was great as well. and the fried ice cream for dessert! the waitstaff has been extremely quick and nice the past 4 visits. i've also ordered speedy takeout - success!

Standing outside for awhile, waiting for the girl who would be my gf, saw a LOT of people going into this place. Some walking out looked happy. 
Couple of pic a nic tables outside on a beautiful November day with some nice looking food being eaten. Couldn't wait. 
We went inside and got in a line about 12 ahead of us. It went fast. Some people just came in for the huge, fresh made, decadent donuts and pastries and coffee. 
It was noon, so we had brunch. Yes, donuts and sandwiches.  
There are stools facing the kitchen, booths along the wall, and it seems like it's a bigger place than it is. 
Placed our order with a very cute freckle faced girl who was patient with our goofy acting selves.
THE FOOD: First up for me...Irish Coffee donut with hot cocoa. Nice soft bite on the donut, tasty, light but sweet frosting. 
Cocoa was just ok.
Waffle fries, a little less done than I like (I like my fried potato foods done a little darker), but hot and good. 
The cheeseburger I had with bacon and a fried egg. It's quite delicious and, although it's little more than slider sized, satisfies the appetite I had. It had great flavor. It says B&B pickle on the menu, I thought it was cucumber slice on the burger, but in any case, added a little fresh crunch and lightness. Of course, the girl who would be my gf took some of my bacon...so there's THAT!
The girl who steals my bacon started with a muffuletta on a toasted, tasty bagel. The meats and cheese were exceptional. Not a lot, but packed with flavor. The olive mix was delicious, and overall, again, small portion, just enough,....but dynamite! She also had a had a kind of Double/Triple chocolate roll. Dark, rich, sweet, chocolate with bits of chocolate on top with some lighter chocolate mousse-like stuff squirted inside. I took 2-3 bites and had a sugar rush like a kid after Halloween. The girl who would be my gf was having a blast fingering the chocolate hole inside, so.... ?? 
She loved it. 
They had a nice late 80's, early 90's mix of music playing which made the girl who fingers the roll hole sing out loud. Maybe it was the sugar. 
Love this place. Not too expensive, 2 sandwiches, 2 donuts, fries, cocoa.. $27 bucks. 
Good atmosphere.

Ordered  2 burrito bowls that were slightly different in ingredients. The two bowls I received were identical.  I paid $$ for guacamole and did not get at all.  Overall the bowl is tasty  and works for this small town.  If chipotle or Tijuana flats opens up in plant city, they will have to step up their game.

This is a long overdue review but Ding Tea is another great boba option in the Northwest! We went a few times when they first opened and of course the line and wait was incredibly long but it was worth the wait. The boba is always cooked perfectly which is one of the biggest issues with boba shops in Reno.

Like most places you can customize ice, sweetness, and select from a plethora of toppings. I'm typically a milk tea loyal but the fruit teas here have got me branching out! Try a guava green tea, made slush, with aloe vera. SO good on a hot summer day! Otherwise you can always count on the signature milk tea, thai tea, taro milk tea, or wintermelon milk tea all with their golden boba (and maybe some egg pudding).

Once they introduced the online ordering it made it a much better experience: not having to wait in line in the very tiny shop, especially during COVID times. While it hasn't happened recently, in the earlier days there was always something wrong with our order. Wrong/missing topping, forgotten sweetener, wrong size, missing drink etc. Since it had only just opened and was very busy I didn't want to be too quick to judge but it was frustrating that it had happened so many times. 

Overall a great place that I think has finally found its feet and I hope it sticks around!

Food was excellent.  Place is kinda pricey, had to buy salad separate from entree which is unusual in a restaurant of this kind. Was a slow Saturday afternoon, so I choose to sit at bar.  There was one other person at bar and he left 15 mins after I got there.  Despite the few customers the bartender seemed overwhelmed and service was slow at best. Took 10 mins before bartender came up and asked what I wanted, but he was t even in the bar area for most of that time. Table near by waited 25 minutes to get their order of burgers.  Pretty sad.  Quality of food is what saved the rating and my gift card. I had the Queensland shrimp and chicken pasta with side of coconut shrimp.

We will not be back.

My review consists of many of the comments you will find in the bad reviews for this place. 

Pros: The food was not horrible. It tasted fresh and most everyone enjoyed what they ordered. I ordered the lasagna and it tasted "just okay". I tried the pizza, and it was delicious. The Gelato was divine.

Cons: The night that we visited, there was not a sole in the place. We had a good sized group, (we called ahead) and they sat us in the far back of the restaurant. There was no AC running and the place was hot. It's hard to enjoy anything when you are miserable. The server, who spoke very little English, took forever to greet us, then took forever to give us water (delivered one glass at a time), then took forever doing every little thing throughout the evening. The owner seemed very mean...stern, without personality, unwelcoming...
Had the fried shrimp basket.  Real nice flavor of the shrimp and wonderfully paired with the cocktail and tartar sauces.  Beer is cold. True dive bar.

We went to this place because of its great reviews and historical location. The atmosphere is great. Subdued lighting, chandeliers, and tasteful decor. The food is another story. The food is mediocre at best and the portions are too small for even women with small appetites. I ordered the butternut squash pasta, which consisted of 3 noodles (no exaggeration), this greasy sour cream tasting butter sauce, shavings of kale, and 5 tiny pieces of squash ($17 and barely a side dish; rating 3/10). Their beer seems reasonably priced ($5-6) but is served in a half pint glass, which they fail to mention. I realize that this place is going for the fancy upscale vibe, but at least call it what it is....small plates, so people realize they will have to buy at least 2 to make a meal. Of note, my sister said her pasta, some pesto and pork thing, was "okay" so maybe some of their dishes are mediocre. However, I wouldn't pay $17 for 3 mediocre noodles. I gave them 2 stars for the nice atmosphere and staff.

I think my favorite thing about The Family Wash is how cozy it is. The service is great and 3 out of the 4 times I've been there the food was great too (the 4th, the Reuben, was just OK). My favorite time to go is breakfast and unfortunately they recently took a one of my favorite items off the menu. However their delicious pancakes are still available so I'm sure I'll be back.

You have to try the grilled lettuce pockets with black beans and guac. Absolutely heavenly! There's live music on the weekends and it's a fun place to hang out, grab some bevies and enjoy yourself. Not to mention it's in such a pretty area of the Foothills- this place is cool.
I might be slightly tipsy from the drink and drown well special at the bar but the skillet Mac and cheese was delightful and sinfully delicious.

An actual, family owned sushi operation, with friendly staff and truly talented and caring chefs! Jewan (sp?) is my favorite chef, because you can see the pleasure he gets from serving up a truly well done sushi roll.  He goes out of his way to make certain that you are getting the taste that you're searching for.  I will keep coming back, week after week!  :-)

We were looking forward to this meal so very much. It had been recommended by multiple friends. Upon reading their website, we realized my boyfriend needed a sport jacket (which is required). We decided to go out and purchase a jacket while we were in NOLA to eat here and see what it was all about. We ate here last night at 9:30. Upon walking in the restaurant it was nothing as I expected. Very bright lights, odd 1940s wall paper, bright white tile floor, and gold fixtures. I decided that it was what they were going for as it is a very old restaurant, and I got over it. We sat down and thought we would be on the second floor (as walk ins are seated on the first) I don't know if there is a difference, but we gladly took our spot on the first floor and didn't say anything. We were greeted very enthusiastically by a server who was very casual. She told us that crab is "out of season" and we should get crawfish instead.... Ok. A few minutes later another server came and took over without introducing herself. This server told us they were out of crab for the night. I'm sorry but crab is on half ur menu! How can u be "out" esp. When the other woman told us it's out of season and not to get it. They brought out bread and butter. The bread was a simple French loaf and they do not use bread plates. For appetizers we ordered the soufflé potatoes and the crawfish Maison (they were out of crabmeat...) the crawfish were tasty. Very poor presentation. On a bed of iceberg lettuce and tomatoes slices that needed some more time in the greenhouse. The soufflé potatoes reminded me of a French fry missing it's insides... I've never had this before, but it was strange. Main courses I ordered the drum fish with the meunière almandine and my boyfriend got the shrimp étouffée. My fish was dry, fried (as recommended) and tasteless. The almonds were sliced and roasted- definitely not a sauce as I expected. It was so disappointing. My boyfriend's étouffée was actually delicious, the one highlight o our meal. Our (very over salted) sautéed spinach came out after our entrees and our server forgot the turtle soup which we asked for as an app. She told us she was sorry and she would go check and not charge us for it. She "checked" and told us she couldn't get us any. Now I have served a lot in my day and know for damn sure the kitchen had put it away. But clearly we r from out of town and ur supposed to be one of the best restaurants in the French quarter! Go get that soup out of the cooler and heat it up, or offer something else. Anyway, we were so disappointed. I can go on. I was just underwhelmed and so unimpressed with the food here. Our waitress never checked on us and our bus boy was way more attentive. We would have asked about the soup way earlier if she would have came to check on us. The entire restaurant was closing down and putting stuff away, which I understand but there were still 4 tables. Another server was counting her money at one of the tables too. The entire staff seemed ready to bounce even though there were still customers dining. They have suit jackets at the front in case u forgot urs. So if you're wearing jeans and a hoodie they will make u put on a jacket and u can still eat there. There was a table dressed like this, and the women all had jeans and sweatshirts on and the men had the coats the restaurant lend them. This to me was cheesy as hell. I get what ur trying to do, but either enforce ur dress code, or don't have one. A nice restaurant should have a reputation and not have to do this. The manager also was very apologetic to a 4 top table of older clientele (bc our server was also theirs and forgot something too). But he said nothing to us. Just because we are young doesn't mean we should not be treated the same. Plus, we have social media at the tips of our fingers and are more likely to impact what others think. If ur in NOLA and want a nice dinner, don't waste your time here. Go to restaurant August or somewhere that u will be wined and dined for the price you are paying.
My first time at Grub Bar. The turkey burger was great. My wife's Blue burger was good too. Goodbye Elevation Burger.

Thr3e Wise Men sponsors the 317 races and provides 2 free craft beers to racers after the race. So we go for dinner after the race and I give my beers to my husband and opt for wine. The restaurant is full and loud w boisterous customers enjoying Thursday night out. Our waiter was attentive and a 5 star. The folks I am with order the supreme pizza with thin crust and I go for the healthier wedge salad option.  My salad was fabulous romaine cut in half and smothered with blue cheese tomatoes and bacon. The bacon was thick cut and favorable. My table mates enjoyed their pizza which was served in a cookie pan.  They said their beers tasted a little watery which is unusual from past visits. 
We had a toddler with us who received a colorable child's menu, crayons, and a nice cup of water with a lid. The options for the kids were carb loaded so she selected chicken fingers and mandarin oranges. 
For pub food and beer, 3WM is a good option and they support the running community.

Can you say options!? This place is a go to if you have a big party with lots of different food preferences! You can get anything from Sushi (which is amazing!!) to Pizza! Personally, I love their bowls, and you can substitute the rice for noodles, or even spaghetti squash (if you're feeling healthy). Great tasting foods and lots of flavors!!! Don't even get me started about their SLAM-GRIA!!
Good vibe, cool mobile table announcement, really good beer selection and oh my the Buy The Farm burger is amazing.

Which Wich in the loop is my favorite sandwich stop! I love being able to choose each item on the ordering sleeve. I feel like it's great for picky people and it limits confusion at check out.

The staff is extremely friendly. They greet you as soon as you walk in and make sure you know how to place your order.

The tables are always super clean and you never have to fight for a spot. If it's ever too packed, the upstairs seating is nice and cozy.

I used to order sandwiches all the time, love their warm bread. (Warming is optional). When I found out that I had a gluten intolerance, I was crushed... until I discovered the bowlwhich. The bowlwich is like a salad of all your favorite ingredients. I love it just as much as I loved the sandwiches. 

Last, they have a sweet rewards program with double punches on Tuesdays (I think Tuesdays, don't quote me on that). Each time you fill a punch card, you get a free item. It's pretty awesome. 

I highly recommend this place!
For the money this was a wonderful place to stay. The lobby and casinos are incredible. The bed in our room was very comfortable.

The people that work at Pat O'Briens are extremely rude!!!! I understand that their patience might be thin with all the tourists but those tourists keep Pat Os in business and they've chosen to work in the service industry. 

My fiance and I had a table in the piano bar for a few hours and had the famous hurricanes. We were ready to leave so I said that I was going to use the bathroom and come back and get him. The bathroom is outside the piano bar and up the stairs. On returning from the bathroom, the man attending the entrance to the piano bar refused to let me in. He insisted that I had to wait at the end of a very long line. I explained that I had a table and I just needed to get in to get my fiance and then we would leave. He didn't care and maintained that I had to wait at the end of the line. As I stood there in shock and amazement, a man came up to my right with drinks in his hand. The attendant told him to go to the end of the line and the guy said that he had a table and had been there since 2pm. The attendant then let the guy in. I looked at him, confused and infuriated, and he said that he hadn't seen me before so I wasn't allowed in. I tried to call my fiance but he couldn't hear me over the noise. Frustrated and irate, I stopped a lady on her way out and asked if she would get a guy sitting alone with four empty hurricane glasses on the table. My fiance came out and we left. 

After this experience, I will never go to another Pat O'Brians. Also, if you want to get a good hurricane that doesn't burn the tastebuds off your tongue, skip Pat Os and go to Lafitte's Blacksmith. Soooo Good.
This is my favorite resturant in Dunedin!! Super fresh ingredients, friendly staff, and reasonable prices!! Outstanding.
Best Wings Anywhere!!!!!! I love how Florissant can still have an awesome Bar/Grill that isn't a chain!!!! Great Food, cold drinks, and a great staff!!!!

A great post yoga place. There are smoothies, but very few food choices outside of Kitchari, and a small box of baked goods. The space is small and cute, but there's a park with a lot of tables across the street. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. I plan in returning when I feel a cold coming on to see if the tonics work.

Shaye was absolutely amazing!!!  They had her all over the place, but she remained personable and was very knowledgeable of her job. The kitchen messed up some of our orders. Anytime I'm by the stadium it's a must I stop by and see Shaye. And if she is not there I'm not staying!!!!

Disappointing experience.   We saw all of the great reviews and couldn't wait to check out Ground.  The food was ok as customer service was really not good - not greeted at the counter.  I finally asked if she was ready for our order.  You can see everything being cooked and prepared which I like, but you can hear everything as well.  It was busy yet Very chaotic. Will waiting for our food two different returned their food.  On guy wascooking and  talking about skin falling off while taking a shower.  Not appetizing.  Trash was overflowing.
Dirty, horrible service, and rude staff. I don't know how McDonalds allows this location to keep their brand.
Three visits.  The interior of this place is great, but the food is not good at all and overpriced.
I have traveled 70 miles for Chicks cheesesteaks....have been to Geno's and Pats in Philly and Chicks beats them al.......just wish they would branch out to north Jersey

This is by far one of the best upscale restaurants in New Orleans. Tonight was our third visit and it keeps getting better and better. Sam took care of us and was fantastic! All the food was amazing. We ordered a selection of great starters. The wine list is unbelievable. Go hungry!!!

I'm a big fan. My only complaint (and it's really only HALF a star) is that in three visits, we have found the family-side of the restaurant to have very loud music, making it difficult to visit and talk. I can say, however, our servers, all three times, were quick to turn the music down when we asked. I addressed this with the manager (on Facebook) and got a speedy and positive response. I have faith that they're really watching the volume now.

Enough with the quibbling. The food was delicious. I am a particular fan of their pasta dishes but the pizzas, soups, and salads were also "a cut above the average" -- fresh and delicious. Basically, there's something for everyone in the family on the menu.

In three visits, the service has been very-good-to-excellent.

Nice attribute: easy seating for larger parties. This will be a go-to place for extended family dinners and birthday parties, for sure!

We're so pleased to have this new restaurant in the neighborhood. Keep up the good work, you guys!

Great course I used to ride here when I was a kid I know the original owner and we get our three wheel..bikes..vw's... non taged..trucks.. dunbuggys and fly up and down this coarse of woods puddles mud fields... Jeff across street. James and the Bad Boys even FatPaul k we really had a blast and now these guys did such a great job I can't wait till it's finished the restaurant is also very well maintained and great food thanks to the chef management and of course  the owners....crazy joe

Love this concept. Eager for more locations in Tampa bay. I'm addicted to the shrimp po boy. The soups are killer and thankfully they sell Coke products. Picked up a to go chicken salad to bring home and ate it by itself. Didn't even bother putting it on bread. Just delicious!

Excellent service and food. Brooke was our server. Very polite and charming. She knew the dinner menu. Service was a quick and food was delicious. We started with the Board. Nuts,cheese,salmon, garlic and bread. We had Chicken Cobb salad. Short ribs and Pesto and pistachios with chicken. For dessert,Salted Caramel homemade ice cream.

Excellent find on our way back to N.J.  Great atmosphere, friendly and very good food. Calamari was super good, comfortable bar setting with seating in the back as well. This was the end of "burger" week which included: wild boar burger and my hubby enjoyed it. I had their classic burger which was also very juicy and tasty.  The only thing I didn't love was the fries which came with our meals. I would have upgraded to the duck fat fries if I would have known they were dry and bland. I would return and happy we found this great this place to stop and enjoy.

I haven't been to TGIF in a while but I'm loving the updated menu. They finally started carrying Fireball and I tried their new shot, Cinnamon Toast. It's a nice summer addition to the menu. As a non meat eater, I always had a hard time finding food on the menu for myself, boy has that changed!! They started making new seafood dishes and I was quite surprised. I tried the new Mahi Mahi Naan Sandwich and it was amazing!! Did I really just say that about a menu item at Friday's??? I guess I'll be joining them more this summer, as I have to do something with all these reward points I'm racking up.

If you're in the mood for grilled shark chunks. This is the place....I wasn't in the mood. But I did request seafood. I ordered the grilled wild salmon laced with a sweet and tangy bourbon glaze. I didn't detect any Jack Daniels (something was in there) but I did enjoy the properly prepared portion of fish. Most dinners come with your choice of 2 sides. (wide variety) I opted for Syberg's famous house salad: a crunchy romaine/iceberg lettuce blend tossed with pimento, red onion, provel cheese, homemade croutons -ending with and a delectable ranch dressing featuring garlic overtones. My other side choice was a generous amount of crinkle cut fries -think Nathan's. My guest ordered fish also. The fish and chip basket. Four small cod loins hand dipped in Old Bay seasoning -fried to perfection, served alongside buffalo seasoned cottage fries and a sampling of cole slaw. (think Cracker Barrel). A rather tasty- rather small entree. It was more like a costly snack. Did I mention the meals come with....... BREAD! Joe Fazio hoagie rolls-that Is- complete with butter pats. All in all a decent meal. Next time I might just order a pizza. Apparently, another fan favorite. Sorry, no shark chunks. Are they offered as a pizza topping?

Our first time here! Our waitress was fantastic. Super friendly and attentive. Very welcoming. I tried the very large relleno burger, my husband got the chorizo burro, and the kids all got Mac and cheese. Delicious food! The fries were perfectly seasoned and crisp. Fresh brewed iced tea for bonus points. We want to try dessert, but we were full, so next time. Highly recommend!

So, this place is on my way home and I so want to like it, but past few visits have been just ok. Grave and am bartenders are nice, but LOUD in smoking section at 530 am. Ordered food, BLT with avocado, got a total of 3 small slices of it on entire sandwich, kind of disappointing and Acapulco Fettuccine.  Total of 5 shrimp, no parmesan and mushy fettuccine.  Flavor was good though and didn't take overly long to get it. Last visit, blue cheese bacon burger was good, but well done. Fail on that one, Archie's will beat FT on a burger hands down,  sorry. Fish and chips is always a winner and they give you 4 BIG pieces of fish. It seems clean overall. They have giant draft beers. Parking is good. They also have gaming. If you buy in for $20 and spend the whole $20, you get ONE free drink. Kind of high for just one drink imo. Overall, good local place with pool, music, food and drinks.

Great service today for lunch with my gal pals.  
Excellent salmon salad, with a nice atmosphere.

The staff here is very nice and deliver quick service. The hamburgers and fish tacos are delicious! We ate here 3 times over the weekend, because it was convenient to the hotel. Thank goodness it was good too!

If you like your hamburger cooked rare or medium rare forget this place, they will only prepare medium to well done hamburgers. Everything else about our experience made us consider the place average at best. There's better options available nearby.
Ate there last night and it was wonderful and wonderful decor very comfy. The food is terrific
Back at ramen 4 Real . And I love this place. Every time it gets better and better. If you haven't been here then you missing ou

Giving 5 stars because on a busy Sunday (New Years Day to be exact) our waitress was on point- service was excellent, food came out hot, fast and was delicious! And I am picky with breakfast. Also reasonably priced

Cozy decor
Friendly, slightly disorganized service
Hit & miss food (mind you, I've only tried their breakfast menu)...

While the beef bacon, grits, and various omelets were good, the french toast was made with cheap bread and served with fake maple syrup. (The waffles and pulled chicken were both dry, as well.)

If the owners simply want Rose Petals to be a diner that has a warm, coffee shop decor, then they've succeeded. However, if if they truly want it to be more, and compete with the various brunch places in Center City, then they must use better quality ingredients (preferably organic, which would be a great selling point). Also, fresh, natural iced-tea would be nice.

I really want to like this place, especially since I respect what the owners are trying to do for the community. Hopefully Rose Petals will find its feet within the next 6 months.
It's so dead the ice is killing the stores. And the guy David is very RUDE he must want to go home. Other then that I love Starbucks...

The first visit made us come back for more. The Bandit Blanco is to die for. We also had Huevos Ranchero, The Eggleston Sandwich and a normal egg and bacon. It was all wonderful. The place is vibrant and very active. We are only in Tucson for 5 days, and already I regret having our first breakfast at the hotel.

What a fun, relaxing and elegant  experience at Bacara's Bistro! The elegance was the amazing service by James, the outdoor, ocean setting and the presentation of the over-the-top, delicious food ...and what a surprise to find all that for no more than the cost of most restaurants I frequent in  Santa Barbara.

We were a party of seven.  We only had to wait to get sat 30 minutes at 2 pm in the day....odd.  Our food took a solid 45 minutes to get to our table and it was nice to get the butt of the waitress helping the party next to us all over our backs.

The decor was nice but they need to stop placing tables so close together and the kitchen needs to step up their game.

I really wanted bagel and lox but they were out of bagels so I opted for the lox eggs Benedict. It came out with the lox fried! Yuck! Since I won't send anything back unless it is inedible I lived with it. I just don't understand frying lox. Who does that?  Otherwise this is a good diner with attentive wait staff but I just can't get past the fried lox.  Lox, by definition, are not cooked but smoked only. If it is going to be fried, then it's just salmon.

This is probably one of my favorite burgers I've had in a while. I'm not a terribly into burgers, so that's saying something. I got the 4 Cheese Garlic burger with a side of Mac and cheese, both delicious. The buns are definitely one of the best parts of the burger. My boyfriend got the 96 with a side of fries and loved it. The only thing I would say is that the patties are very thick. So, if you're a thin burger lover, this isn't for you. To finish, I got the ABC milkshake-- AMAZING. You can see my reaction in the photo. Overall, delicious and will be back again.

This is our go-to bagel place in St. Pete. The bagels are always fresh and delicious, and my bar is set pretty high as I grew up in NY with an abundance of great bagel spots. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone and everyone looking for a great bagel; why would you go to a chain place when you could support locals, and the product is infinitely better? The only improvement could be in selection- I would love to see some whole wheat everything bagels, or multigrain styles.

They also sell doughnuts, which are good, very good, and fresh... but not great. Then again, I have been to Doughnut Plant NYC, which was basically life-changing, so again, bar set high. But it's a nice bonus when I'm picking up bagels to bring home a treat. If you're into really soft, light, yeasty doughnuts, you will like these. Husband enjoyed the red velvet cake doughnut.

I travel quite a bit and let me say amazing customer service! The Happy Hour at Luke's was great, the oysters even better and the service was the best! Two employees in particular were happy to be there and treated all customers great their amazing attitude was contagious - it was great to meet you Jamaal and Roshawn!

Food:
The best selection of bruschetta.  My favorite is the goat cheese and pesto unfortunately for some reason they took that off the menu - which I'd like to go on record as saying I am upset about that.  My second favorite (which is still on the menu) is the Pistachio herbed Ricotta with Lavender Honey.  Tria's food is on the lighter side.  Usually when I go with someone else we load up on brushetta and cheese and split a panino.  One of my favorites is the Smoked Chicken panino.  During happy hour they have good beer specials.  If you don't feel like drinking while you there I recommend the passionberry iced tea.  It's bottomless - can't beat that.

Service:
I've been here countless times and never had a problem with the service.  Everyone is nice and the food comes out quickly.

Ambiance:
It depends which one you go to.  The one around 13th is bigger and has nice heated outside seating.  The one at 17th and sansom is smaller and since you can't make a reservation you have to get there before 5 to get a table.  The inside are both are basically the same.  Hardwood floors and a nice bar.  Candle at the table.  It can get a bit loud but other than that it's a nice place to eat.

This place is great, even for vegetarians.  The food is fresh and delicious.  The sauces are fantastic.  The staff are courteous and helpful.  My daughter and son-in-law live in nearby Lansdale and it seems as if we stop here for a meal at least once every time we visit them.

I always love eating at Schlotzsky's. This one is the closest location to us. We live in Murfreesboro. The place gets pretty busy during lunch. My daughter always gets the cheese pizza kids meal and I like their Tuna Sandwich. My other favorite thing to get is the veggie pizza. Food always comes out fast and hot. Big plus is that they sell Cinnabon too. Somehow though this time my cinnabon was hard as a rock almost like it was old. Hopefully next time it will be softer.

This was a medium deep dish that I took home. Never had a pizza slide to one side like this one a 10 minute ride home, but there's no doubt this is my fault. Regardless of the sliding to one side, Crust was soaked in grease like a wet sponge and it was everywhere. Salad was mediocre. Wings were good.
Thanks for the wonderful hospitality and great ethnic food. We felt very much at home in this Italian environment.
Amazing breakfast and espressos. Love the environment and the staff. Super friendly very family friendly! Super cute inside. Very kid friendly as well.

I can't quit this place!  Love the food and the atmosphere!  Don't be deceived by the line... both times I've been it goes pretty quick and it is worth waiting for!  Plus there is coffee and water while you wait.

I don't even know how I'm going to get through this review without drooling. It's by far one of my favorite Italian spots these days. Tucked in the adorable town of Sweedsboro, Botto's is a must visit. Reservations are welcomed and their menu is filled with infinite gluten free pasta options, which is always a plus for us since we do our best to avoid gluten.

To be honest, I'm writing this review past due, so I'll do my best to recap the details. My fiancé and I both started with cocktails...both were fruity and refreshing.

For appetizers we tried the crab bisque and antipasto salad. The soup was absolutely delicious: smooth and creamy in the most perfect way. The salad was good, but the cheeses were just a bit too pungent for my liking...that's not saying much though- I'm more of a boring cheese eater (sadly admitted).

J got the GF chicken park which doesn't miss...he's gotten it multiple times at this point and it's consistently tasty.

My go-to is the GF penne alla vodka with grilled chicken. It is THE BEST!!! The chicken always has that fresh grilled taste to it and the sauce on tender penne is just to die for.

Botto's is known for their sausage, as I'm sure you've seen their packages in stores...worth trying at the restaurant! Very, very good! Also, be sure to visit their Italian market which is packed with a variety of fresh Italian goodies. I especially recommend trying their desserts.

To frame my experience with Dooners I will preface with this disclaimer: my review largely reflects my feelings of Dooner as a place to get some late-night eats after a night out in Downtown St. Petersburg. After the demise of Fortunato's a block, over it's getting pretty hard to find something greasy and satisfying late at night within easy grasp downtown. Dooners can easily fill that void! 

I went here with some friends after a couple of rounds and we split the Dooner fries ($10.99). It was pretty filling for four adults, and I really liked their take on a Dooner. The vegetables were unfortunately an upcharge but it made for a perfect endcap for our night out. The single dooners (which are basically pitas) are also a great choice if you're feeling particularly hungry.

It's also worth noting that I've been coming to Dooners since I was in high school and I have noticed a bit of a change in the quality of their food. If you're looking for a proper schawarma/dooner/gyro experience (especially when all your faculties are intact!), I'd try another place downtown before considering this one. It's not exactly the cleanest or most aesthetically pleasing place on this block, especially considering St. Pete's recent glo-up.
Best food ever service was great, Get on the waitlist before you come or you have to wait 20 minutes. The presentation is beautiful. Best Breakfast in the state.!!!
I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. The chicken was stale and management can't even speak proper English. I doubt they have a real Chef in their kitchen. Don't waste your $$ here

Cool atmosphere, great wine, excellent service. Our server Chantel recommended the crispy Brussels sprouts salad and it was delicious and different. The pressed coffee was so good we ordered another pot.
This is actually our second visit.

One word. Tortas. 

My boyfriend and I have only tried these delicious sandwiches and haven't found the desire to explore more. French fries are on point, which is the usual side, and the rice and beans, which you can sub, were surprisingly really really good.  We've tried the chicken, al pastor, and carne asada. All good, but I prefer the al pastor...which is usually my MOC. (Meat of choice)

Again, take out only, but I really want to go on a Friday night soon for the Mariachis. I prolly will order another torta, but hopefully I will move on from sandwiches, and eat big girl food someday, but what can I say? I love me a Sammie.

Also, they give you Tapatio packets with your take out order! Tapatio. Packets. It's the little things.

Very affordably priced good food. Very slow service inside and the drive thru is even worse...we've been to a few different locations. Great shakes but dont come here if you're in a rush. We ordered two burgers, fries and a shake and it was less than 12.00

Great selection of beers from around the world. You can try a lot of the beers on tap. They have a ton of TVs for your viewing pleasure. Right next to a pizza place and burger joint, which I believe you can bring your food over. Cheers!

I've been here twice now.  Once for dinner and once for lunch within 10 days.  I had to come back for the Squid Ink Garganelli with Scallops!  The scallops are perfect - not mushy nor hard.  The sauce is rich but not overboard and the homemade garganelli is al dente!  I also loved the Fried Oysters Rockefeller.  Such an interesting make-over.  I didn't have but my son did - and he thought it quite good - was the KFC Sandwich.  The kimchee looked like it could be chopped a little better, but oh well.  The truffle fries were a big hit with my son but I thought they could be a tad warmer.

Love this bar, the vibe and basic premise of a dream lived out loud.   Most especially I adore prosecco on tap.   Come for the quirkiness.
