à la minute...

Live bravely to create unknown
inside my mind; outside of time
But watch out world-
when she finally finds
Her own self/worthy.
Writing it down, recreating the sound 
that speaks loudest
in the silence.


Experience your best self.

I first tried this Pacific counter two weeks after they opened and was happy with what I had found. The poke bowl and Dole whip were to die for and it was even more fun that it was done in the coconut itself. Tried it again today and it continues to deliver on its promise to provide fresh, healthy choices. The decor is minimumalist but inviting and colorful. Check them out!

This is a tricky review to write. But I'm sure the next time I visit it'll be a 5 star visit. It took a while for a waiter to come introduce himself/take an order. To the point that he had 90 seconds to appear before I was gonna walk out. Ironically after we were finally tended to, a manager came by shortly after to see if we had been helped. So I appreciate that. Maybe they were a bit short staffed that night. 

We went for spiked milkshakes. My beau got the Reese's one but wasn't satisfied with the alcohol content. I got the maple bourbon or whatever it's called and let me tell you. That's the way to go if you're looking for alcohol. In fact I wanted to order more ice cream to sort of disguise the alcohol more lol. It was delicious nonetheless. And I'm confident in assuming their non spiked milkshakes are good too. They know how to make a tasty milkshake man. 

As for the food. I ordered the popular Kentucky burger (or maybe it was Tennessee, I forget lol). I thought it was dry. I ordered extra glaze on the side thinking it would be like Jack Daniels bbq or at least a thicker consistency and it was NOT what I was looking for lol. Next time I would go heavy on the toppings. Order mayo and bbq sauce. The burger had a nice grilled taste to it. But I just wish it was juicier. I did get it well done. But I'm used to having well done burgers being juicy still. 

I'll definitely give this place another try. Even if it just means ordering milkshakes and tater tots. (The tots are dynamite!)

The food was good but in my opinion expensive. 
Noisy to the point where we had to shout at each other
Service was poor with long periods of time before someone came by. 
We told the manager who was very apologetic but took off a couple of drinks off the bill but left the sodas and sparkling water. 
Probably will not return

Dined here last night for Mother's Day. Amazing experience! They went out of their way to accommodate us and provide a wonderful dining experience. Skyler, the bartender and our server, was attentive and friendly. 

Started with beers--we all had the Grand Canyon pilsner. Beers were $7 and they no longer have a happy hour so that would be my one complaint. 

Had the nachos for an appetizer. Very good. My brother and I had the salmon, my mom had the trout, and my dad went with the half rack of ribs. Everything was delicious. 

The biggest gem of this place is the view! Set at the base of the Catalina mountains, the sights cannot be beat. This is a true Tucson specialty and a place not to be missed when in the Tucson area!

I really wanted to give this place a 5 based in the food and a 3 based on the service/convenience. Went there for lunch on a Thursday and first could not find a place to park. I had to go find a spot up the road in a neighborhood. I sat at the bar and was greeted after I had to ask if I could eat food at the bar. They were friendly. You could tell they were busy and a bit of chaos trying to manage the lunch crowd yet the place was not packed. I ordered the chicken tacos and they arrived 25 minutes later. :( I kept checking in to see when it would be ready and they were apologetic and said soon. By the time I got them I had to run like a bat out of hell back to my car so I could get back to a class I needed to attend. Then I had to torture my classmates with the smell of amazing smoked chicken but apologized as I scarfed down my food in class. The chicken with corn and slaw fixins and tortilla was amazing. The other sides of slaw and potato salad was also yummy. Fix some of the lunch execution issues and this is a 5 star place to visit.

Wish I could do 3.5 stars. In sum, Craft beer lovers-- give this a try. They offer a "brewski" which is a paddle of all 6 beers currently on draft. One of the six was skunky, the rest were okay to very good. They have a killer Oktoberfest on right now.

I got the brew burger which is a hand formed ground chuck with goat's cheese and caramelized onions-- simply delicious. Oh, and their house side is mashed potato bites. Amazing.
Tsunami is definitely the best sushi place in town. Their sushi is so delicious and the prices aren't outrageous like some other places. The Lucky 7 roll is the best!!

Found this place on a walk in uptown, and returned later for a dinner, and (spoiler) it was superb.  I've traveled Spain and the rest of Europe, and my spawn has spent a significant time in Spain, and we both loved the Barcelona.

In fact, up to this point, the best tapas I have consumed were not actually in Spain, but Amsterdam at Joselito, where we were so enthused we ordered the entire menu.

With most small plates at Barcelona costing $5-$6, you can order a whole bunch of food to share and enjoy;  the also offer cooked to order paella, with the traditional rice base, and a variation featuring angel hair pasta.  They also have some entrees, and the whole menu is online.

We tried a variety of hot and cold tapas and loved them all.  My favorites were the ones featuring Jamon Serrano, and I liked his version of Patatas with aioli drizzle. 

If you live in New Orleans, you'll find Barcelona a nice change.  You can linger and sample a variety of dishes. Great date nite place.  It's right behind the Walgreens on Carrolton.

Tourists can find the restaurant with a half block walk off the St. Charles streetcar, so when you get tired of deep fried seafood at high prices in the Quarter, hop on the street car and transport yourself temporarily to an evening in Spain.

He has an "order slip" at the table similar to the ones in sushi bars - just read the descriptions on the menu and check off your choices on the paper slip.

Having heard that this restaurant was under new management we had high hopes for this place. My husband, father and myself tried the lunch buffet Friday and were not disappointed. It was certainly better than the previous occupant in this space. The naan was hot out-of-the-oven, fresh and delicious. The buffet line on this occasion boasted some delicious fare and was frequently replenished as needed. It was a positive experience and the best part was the exemplary service we received from start to finish. Bravo Flavors of India!

I've been to the velvet cactus multiple times since they opened a few years ago but today was probably the best experience I've ever had. Although they are a little overpriced for Mexican food, due to the area they are located in I don't blame them. But our service was phenomenal! From the minute we sat down until we had to check out with the waiter. Shout out to Dane! He was so attentive and refilled the chips when he saw that all was left was broken ones. The family grill plate is perfect for a family of four! Such a family friendly restaurant and can't wait to come back.

Average at best,  The quality of ingredients has either gone down since they opened, or just the prep / recipes aren't followed correctly, but it isn't a place to go if you want consistently good food or service.  What mainly is consistent seems to be poor server service.  Last 2 times I was there, it took forever to get drinks and order.

Wow ... we were touring Nemours and wanted to grab some lunch afterwards... the atmosphere was cool... the wait staff were so nice and pleasant. They allowed us to substitute side salad for fries - and offered great specials of the day . We had an appetizer of Sidewinder fries- all I can say is AMAZING - you won't find these anywhere else- in fact everything in the menu is original- the house made sauces just add to the deliciousness... our paninis were perfection- and those side salads - The attention to detail- fresh and crisp - all seeds removed from the cucumbers and tomatoes ( we did not request this either) ... we will return as we plan to tour Wintertur soon - they boast being the best pub in the country and you know what - we think it's true .
It was our first time visiting Maple Street Biscuit, and they did not disappoint. Excellent customer service and the food was delicious. This will be our new breakfast spot when we're in town.

I'm super glad the King George reopened. I'm even more glad that they changed their menu up a little bit so that it's more casual-friendly and inviting to those who don't want to only eat here for special occasions. I came here for lunch one day with my mother. The waitress was super nice, it was great to have a nice view of the Delaware river and the lobster bisque was pretty decent. 

Their vegetarian options are pretty lacking, however. The avocado and hummus wrap was just that - unseasoned and unimpressive hummus slathered with a bit of tomato and avocado. Nothing else. It was the epitome of boring. I couldn't finish it. Blaaah. Makes me apprehensive about coming back. Although they have weekly specials, like a $5 burger deal I think on Tuesdays? Anyway, this is where you can go for some burgers before heading over to the Bristol Riverside.
Mostly friendly and efficient, but sometimes you can get a person in a bad mood.

So my husband chose this place as we were roaming around in the area and I was skeptical. The outside/inside decor has much to be desired and it was awkwardly silent once the loud groups waiting for their to-go orders left. It was weird to talk because everyone can hear what you're taking about. 

However, I'm glad that we tried it because it was surprisingly good food. 

Our sever was kind, attentive, and even gave our girls their own "kids plates" so they wee excited. Our Gyro Plates/Chicken Kabobs were flavorful and came out within 15-20 minutes. 

I saw that they also offer hookah (if you're interested!) 

We'll definitely try again! :)

We came here to skip lines at nearby restaurants. Big mistake! The food was terrible! I had a bacon and sausage omelet and my bacon was completely burnt. The bloody Mary looked amazing, but was also terrible.

I came here with a group for lunch and decided to order a burger and see what all of the hype was about. I also ordered a side salad instead of baked potato, because I figured I needed to at least halfway order something healthy. 

Anyway, I'm still not sure what all of the hype is about.

The burger was overly charred on the outside, yet somehow served cold (none of the cheese was even the slightest bit melted). The inside was actually a nice medium pink, but of course since the burger was cold it wasn't that enjoyable. The salad was iceberg salad mix from a bag, which I probably should have guessed from the description of "lettuce, cabbage, carrots." 

The service was fine. The drinks were fine. I'm just not sure about the food quality after this visit. It was very "meh."
The Local is great! I tried the shrimp and grits and it was made perfectly and the portion size was great. Service was very good as well. Will return!

3.5 stars.  One does not visit and leave Philly without trying a Philly cheesesteak!  I've always found myself making my rounds visiting different cheesesteak spots and happened to stumble upon Cleavers given its proximity to Rittenhouse Square.

Between two people, we ordered takeout for:

- The Cleaver to-go, which is 1lb ribeye steak with American and cheese whiz
- Waffle-cut fries

Overall, the cheesesteak was good and ribeye was cooked to perfection.  My only gripe was that they were super generous with the whiz (probably a bit too much for my liking).  A thick layer was lathered under the meat which made the bread a bit soggy.  The waffle cut fries were okay...they tasted a bit stale. 

The staff was friendly and the bathroom was clean.  When I visited, the indoor seating area was closed off for COVID, but it seemed like a cool spot to hang out.

I would recommend coming here at least once to try it if you're near the area.

Just destroyed this place tonight. Been 5 years since I've been in NOLA. This is what I ordered. Gumbo. Cowboy Oscar style. Crawfish stuffed double baked potato. Peanut Butter Ice Box Pie. Absolutely delicious!!! Would eat here every week if I could!!! Thanks Amanda for such great service and the entire team!!! Cheers!! MC

Timing was not bad, we did eat at this location. During this covid adjustment, the company followed all procedures. And we happened to be the only people inside others simple had delivery or picked up. The place smelt a little funny like well water but it was no biggie.

We got a platter and a plate, both was way to much food but that's a good thing. Surprised at how big the empanada was and it was so tasty we had beef. Tostones were good and the portions size again was plentiful. 

I will be returning and I also recommended this place to my neighbors.
This is our first time ordering from here and we were so impressed. Pad Tai was delicious and the portion was huge. General Tao chicken cooked to perfection. We will be back.
Great food, and lovely service. I always get the breakfast tacos and they're absolutley delicious every single time!

This place has really gone down hill the last few years. We went for a birthday party this time. From 5:30-7:00 we were stuck in the party room. The kids were done around 6:15 and ready for games but we waited on Kenya to bring us the game cards for way too long.  When they finally got them it was almost too late. They did laser tag which was ok. That took a half hour to play for 8 minutes.  Then they tried to do go carts and they had one employee working the whole track. For every 15 minutes it took to load the kids got a three minute ride. Bad enough but the attendant let other groups cut in line again and again.  Finally, after waiting 30 minutes we had to leave. My kids were crying and it was a real mess because they did not get a turn and others kept cutting line.  It was surreal.  

Plus, this place doesn't seem safe. My friend says police get called here nightly because of all the problems here.  Look, there are a lot of these kiddie places now, don't waste your money here. It's expensive and lousy

I've been wanting to try this place since it opened, so I'm glad I got a chance to today. The location is prime and the actual decor space is lovely. The wait was only about 30 minutes which is pretty good for breakfast/brunch on a Saturday in Nashville. My friend and I both ordered the Not Bloody Mary which is their own house made Bloody Mary with cucumber and basil and their own tomatoes. Super refreshing but doesn't pair well if you get something sweet like the cinnamon roll or homemade biscuit with honey like we did. Those two items were SO good. The cinnamon roll wasn't too sweet or sticky, it was perfect. The biscuit was cooked perfectly and fell apart like it should have. Not dry at all and the honey to top it was incredible. 

The reason I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of our main meals. My friend got the TN Ham and apple sandwich, which didn't have much flavor and I think it's because he said he wanted it without the honey mustard and got mayo. Bad choice. I think it would've been better with the honey mustard. I got the Dirty Benny, which is essentially eggs Benedict but they use prosciutto and some kind of gravy. Way too salty for me with both the prosciutto and gravy together. The English muffin was also soggy and not crisp at all. But the home fries were soooo good. I love them. Super crisp and flavorful. 

I'd like to come back to this place and try something else, though. Definitely worth it!
I gave this place another try, and it has improved greatly, went back a few times and the food was great.  They have a happy hour, and make great drinks.

My journey to find "my" brunch spot in St. Louis led me to Half & Half at the recommendation of a friend. It certainly will not be my last visit to Half & Half!

As others have said, there can be a wait, but as always, Yelp comes to rescue so take advantage and put your name on the list before you leave home. The hostesses left a little to be desired in the friendly, welcoming, customer service department but the waitstaff makes up for it. I can't remember my waitress' name (Mandy?) but she was absolutely the best and made sure our waters were always full. A difficult task when dining with my boyfriend who can easily drink, what feels like, a gallon of water over the course of a meal.

I usually find it easy to narrow down my choices when looking at a typical breakfast/brunch menu. Half & Half's menu was a different story, everything sounded amazing. I settled on the Clara Cakes and my boyfriend went with the chorizo and guacamole benedict. But first! The doughnuts! Breakfast should always start with a doughnut appetizer. Honestly I would make a (not very balanced nor healthy) meal out of the doughnuts. The 3 pancakes are huge and fluffy. Sandwiched between is raspberry compote,  mascarpone cheese, and granola. The tartness of the raspberry compote helps balance the sweet of the mascarpone while the granola keeps it texturally interesting. My boyfriend devoured his chorizo benedict, kindly saving me a small bite of chorizo and potato. 

Will I be back? Absolutely! I'll order my own chorizo benedict next time!
Best coffee and sweets in riverview.  Tried Cuban for the first time and delicious as well. Highly recommend Cali cafe!

Ordered Chicken Tika and the chicken was not cooked. I crunched 2 pieces of uncooked chicken in my mouth. The garlic naan was very old and just reheated. From eating their food now I have a scratch on my throat probably because the food had god knows what else in it and I got a mouth blister from it. I know it's during a hard time but cook fresh food don't sell old and uncooked meals!
One of the best in Indy!  I love the Pep, Ital sausage, bacon, mushroom well done!  OMG it is delish!
I had bun bo hue.  Theres a good amount of meat, all the right greens to go with it.  The broth base is clear but flavor was not strong.  Very generous quantity.

Pretty sure I've found the best kept brunch secret in Philly! 

I came here months back to take my neighbors daughter out for her 21st. A waiter caught us on the way out and mentioned we should come in for brunch some time..its AYCD. So yes...I will be there!

We have come twice now, I however have ordered the same thing both times..the crab cake Benedict which is phenom. Portions are huge and it comes with a nice little salad on the side! My friends have been happy with the brunch burger but had a slippery experience with the pulled pork sandwich which was far too fatty. Their menu is pretty scant which is the only draw back in my book!

The deck is the place to be, great views with a nice breeze plus you can get a nice tan on a sunny day!! 

I've always had great service but if you're ready for a new bottle of champagne make sure you leave it out of the bucket so the servers can see!!!
What a lovely place. Great service, great food, beautiful view of the water. I absolutely loved it.

One of my favorite spots when I visit New Orleans.  The hurricanes are better here than anywhere else I've had them, and the piano bar is incredibly fun.  If its your first time in NOLA, you have to go.  

Yes, its touristy, but in all the good ways.  Its great when its 100 degrees or raining outside, its always dark, cold, and there's tons of atmosphere in here.  I haven't tried anything aside from the hurricane, and probably never will, I don't see any reason to.

We were told we HAD to go here so we stopped in and to be honest it's just another bar. I thought it'd be more of a brewery personally. 

We got 2 Blonde Ales and they were decent, nothing about it that made me want another though. 

Place was pretty crowded on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and football was on many tv's throughout which was nice. 

Overall, decent but nothing I need to see again.

This review is only for the East Tower. I understand the West Tower is somewhat nicer.

It appears the rooms were renovated in the last year or so as everything still looked fresh and shiny. Having said that, the rooms are not any better than your typical mid-range hotel or motel. Basically 2 beds, a bathroom, night stand, small table, and hutch with TV. Missing were coffee maker, not that I care but standard issue nowadays, and safe, also standard issue especially for a casino hotel. Housecleaning seemed to do a relatively perfunctory job, only making the bed, as the towels in the bathroom were still where I left them. I didn't eat or gamble there so I won't comment on those aspects. So basically a decent place to sleep and shower but not a place I would stay for an extended period of time.
Much improved since their opening.  Usually a good beer on tap.  The chef has been coming up with great specials.  Lots of veggie options lately that I'm loving!

I have been here twice for brunch.  The selection is good and they have omelette made to order.  It is a little pricey but our family enjoys it and it is good for kids.  It does get crowded if they are having a party and you might have to wait long in the Buffett line.  They offer items from the menu also.  I want to try it for dinner next.  Service was good the staff is very friendly.

Came here for dinner today and was very disappointed. It took a while for someone to take our drink order and then took a while to actually get the drinks. Then once we ordered the pork buns they weren't as good as expected. 2 for $10 and one of them had pork that wasn't even cooked the way. Too much bun and not enough filling. Then we thought they forgot to put our food order in because it was taking forever and the people next to us who were sat after got their food already. When the food finally came out (after we felt we were forgotten about) it smelled horrible, similar to a dumpster. We did not eat it and paid for our appetizer and left. Don't come here. Overpriced and horrible service. Not worth it when there's so many better restaurants to try in DTSP. We won't be back.

Stumbled upon this gem on the way to West Fork Whiskey.   We started off with the mozzarella sticks. What can I say...they have truly elevated this simple dish   we all love.  I would order it again and again.  Next, we had the destroyer pizza.  It was the perfect balance of sweet, salty and spicy.  King Dough is my kind of place. It has great food, a relaxed atmosphere and a creative menu of cocktails, starters and pizza.  Highly recommend!

A favorite locally owned sub and gyro establishment. Everything on the menu is great, they abide by Covid19 policies and have daily specials. My favorite items are tacos, burrito, gyro, salads, phillies, quesadillas. Support local businesses- you will be one happy person.

We should have known to pass on this diner when we saw there were only two cars in the parking lot at 430pm.

The service eas poor, the eever had no clue as to the soup of the day or the specials. Food was bland and cold microwave meals.
Good food and service just give them a try, they are willing to help you out with the menu and help you make a selection if you are not familiar with the food
Decent prices and good fries. The burgers are ok. Nothing special. But I have only had one burger there. Definitely worth coming back to try more and find your favorite burger.

Even though I read all the negative reviews on restaurants, I still try them for my own experience. Me & my wife went there a couple of days a go & it was great, great service, good price, no problems. The calzone came out cheesy & greasy, just the way I like it. Greek salad was great, no complaints, will go there again.

I'm so bad at taking pictures - not only did I forget to document my birthday, I also can't show you the beautiful presentation of the food! Anyway. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal there. We went during Devour and enjoyed a 3 course meal. It is an expensive restaurant, but if you are looking for great food in a lovely atmosphere, I'd highly recommend the Meridian. The corn soup is fantastic as is whatever salad I had - just the right amount of dressing. The Salmon was cooked perfectly and my partner enjoyed the short rib. We shared he carrot cake and donuts for dessert. As a bonus, our server was fantastic and very knowledgeable about the wine list!

I have two words... acai bowl. Seriously, this is some incredible stuff! I had an opportunity to learn about this wonderful local biz started by college sweethearts Leslie & Ross at Yelp's Big Fat Business Crush event. I stopped in to the City Market one day for lunch desperately searching for something healthy because I was detoxing at the time. I immediately hightailed it to Twenty Two Juicery & Smoothie Bar. I ordered the Traditional Acai Bowl, which at $8 a pop seemed pricey, but it was well worth it (and I've learned cheaper than most other spots). This stuff is addictive. A tasty concoction of acai berries, bananas, almond milk, strawberries, hemp granola, raw honey, and more freshly cut bananas. Delish! So filling and ridiculously healthy. It is the perfect no guilt treat.

This place has a lot of great breakfast options and sweets. Highly recommend. Many vegetarian and GF options too. Most items are made in house including their meats. They also have cappuccino as well. Give them a try!

Last night me and husband went for dinner and was excellent and server ( Hasan ) was very friendly .we will visit again .
Iti

Bad service, and overpriced items. The waitress wasn't   polite, because as soon as we ordered the grilled platter  and not dinners we were treated like second rate customers. We had few drinks and the large appetizer and before we payed the bill they started to wipe the table while we were there still talking .

1 stars just for the grilled platter of meat was delicious  and exactly what we wanted. The food and atmosphere was welcoming, the customer service was  rude and offensive. We tipped  over 20% as usual but regret it after hearing how hurt my  family felt from being treated so poorly.

I could not think of a more charming space. The staff is absurdly friendly and knowledgeable, but even if they weren't the menu is so chock full of gems that you really can't go wrong. I liked the The Block, but this is next level and then some. The braised beef features gnocchi with a perfect balance of soft and chewy, and the wine reduction played perfectly with the beef. And if they are serving the ham board, do yourself a favor and grab it. Biscuits, ham, figgy apple butter and cheese that plays perfectly with the savory notes of the other items. Throw in cocktails crafted to perfection and you have the makings of a night to remember.

One of the better restaurants we found along Clearwater Beach. Located below the Hilton hotel, It's not right on the beach with a view but it's a close enough walk to the main pier and sand area. A plus is that it is not as touristy as the others and there was no wait on a Sunday evening . It seems more Mexican fusion with the surf and turf burrito and steak fajita ,but instead of red peppers there was tomatoes. I give it a four star because although service was friendly and fast ,we did not get any refills on our drinks and my fiancé usually drinks about 4 cups of soda with each sitting. The price is a little bit higher than original Frenchy's restaurant along the beach that we wanted to go to , that was worth not having to wait 45 minutes for a table however.

This is probably my favorite vegan restaurant in the area! Every dish is tasty and the owners are very sweet. I have never been disappointed when eating here! Even non-vegans have plenty of food they would enjoy - every dish is so tasty that my non-vegan friends forget its vegan!

Jimmy B's is pretty decent. It's attached to hotel. There's a bar inside the hotel and one right outside on the beach. It's an older crowd scene. There's a DJ at the outside bar. It was really packed so my boyfriend and I went to the inside bar. Free token games, foosball, and pool tables. ALL FREE.  It took about 45 mins to a hour to get our food. It's bar food, nothing to get excited about. Drinks are good averages $10 a drink. Would go here if I was in my mid 30's and was looking for bar food.
Great staff! Great service! The food was stellar and the coffee gets 5 stars from me... definitely try the french toast latte

Ran in here for a quick dinner before a show at The Fillmore. It wasn't crazy busy but they seemed to be understaffed, which caused confusion on who was assigned to us. Took quite a while to get our order in, but food came out quickly after that. Food was ok, nothing to write home about. Just felt bad for the couple servers we saw who were literally running back and forth trying to take care of everyone in their areas.

The coffee is really great! The bread in the pot is cute and in line with the theme. The main courses were okay to good and took a really long time. The thing that really ruined my experience is that there were a bunch of flies that repressed my appetite. My friends and I spent the whole time swatting away flies. Come in the winter. Cute for Instagram.

I've been to Metro in JAX once or twice and now this one twice.  I remember my trip to Jax fondly, even if I don't remember what I had, but my first trip to the St Pete location wasn't so great.  Okay, but not what I remembered.  I think I got a breakfast burrito, but since I can't remember, lets ignore that experience.  Besides, it seems to be the outlier.

On this trip - and I don't know what I was thinking - I ordered a breakfast pizza.  I'm kind of a healthy person - buffets and bacon aside, I work out and try to avoid too much carbs.  But here I was getting an easy 1000 calorie breakfast covered in pork and butter (which is all hollandaise sauce is made of).  And yes, 1000 calories of pork, carbs and butter sounds freaking amazing, but I'm usually better than that. But not this day.  This day, I was weak.  Fat and weak.

So what is a breakfast pizza?  Well, its dough - not sure pizza dough or what, but basically a flat round dough about the size of a personal pan pizza on steroids.  On top, they cover it in hollandaise like it was pizza sauce.  Then you get cheese, bacon, sausage, peppers, egg and more hollandaise, and I am pretty sure I am missing a topping or two.  It sounds like a lot.  I admittedly am the type of person to go full kitchen sink when I can - froyo?  Fill that cup with 6 different flavors and 5 toppings.  Buffet?  Mix at least 3 or 4 cuisines on a single plate and pile it layer upon layer.  However, even I can admit that when you do that, sometimes you lose any taste.  It just becomes a mess, and after I ordered the breakfast pizza, that is what I was expecting.

Wrong wrong wrong wrong wrong wrong wrong!  This was fantastic.  I mean, I felt so guilty after eating it, but this was delicious.  If I had one complaint, it would be that maybe it was too much hollandaise.  They could have done it like pizza sauce, or topped the whole thing, but doing both was a bit much.  Still, I was full after half of it and then practically swallowed the other half whole.  Great breakfast for the will-powered challenge or the more fatty inclined of you.  Basically, me.  Great breakfast for me.

Taking a star off because (a) it was a bit heavy on hollandaise and (b) their coffee is weak as ... well, as weak as me when I ordered the breakfast pizza.  Shame, but you're a breakfast and brunch diner - you should have halfway decent coffee.

Nevertheless, I remain a fan of Metro Diner and the breakfast pizza.  Go on!  Be a glutton.  Be fat.  Be like Todd.  Enjoy a breakfast pizza.

How it has 4 stars is an absolute mystery. I, along with many people, was looking forward to a new casual spot in the village- and seafood to boot! For some reason a good, casual (or otherwise) restaurant is an obvious gap on a street 3 blocks from the ocean. Frankland's absolutely blew a golden opportunity. My first meal there I ordered local crab. Not much meat in there and no proper tools to appropriately extract the overpriced, poorly seasoned, crabmeat. Really, disappointing on all fronts. It was an utter mess. I grew up on the water  I know how it's done and this isn't it. It's as if they thought people (maybe because it's Montecito and people on vacation) would just roll over and pay the price. Fool me once... And almost twice. I went in this evening after a couple of months of driving by and seeing few, if no, people eating there, because I just really wanted to treat myself to  some crab legs but didn't want to drive the extra few minutes to the pier or East Beach. Lucky's, Honor Bar and others are packed, Frankland's is empty. I walk in and see Alaska crab legs 70-something dollars (20 less elsewhere) and not a soul to be seen in the kitchen or front register. If your struggling, make it easier, not harder for people to choose you. I waited a full minute, that's a long time when no one is in the restaurant. Last straw. I wanted to support them, I wanted them to succeed but you have to earn it with food and service, Frankland's has succeeded at neither.

Great Christian coffee shop where everyone is welcome. My family and I have frequented Elena's shop for 3 years (every since they opened) and have never had a bad experience!  Thank you for making this a comfortable place and a staple in the Dunedin community.

What a cozy place with delicious food! I was amazed by the seared tuna sandwich with polenta fries. 
I can't wait to go back!

This is a great place for the beer fanatics,health conscious or the full of flavor foods like burger and wings people. Servers are knowledgeable and quick to serve and the patrons make it feel like a second home.


Enjoy!

It's a rare occasion that I would order Mac and Cheese at a restaurant, but I decided to after reading a few rave reviews about the Steak Mac and Cheese on Yelp. It was fantastic! The steak was cooked at a perfect medium rare and using gnocchi instead of macaroni really elevated the dish. I was expecting slow service after reading the reviews, again, but the service was pretty timely.

Very cool location.  Park Avenue always has great coffee and very very good gooey butter cake.  This location is very small but has a lot of character.  There are probably only 10 chairs on the inside (and half of them are at a community table).  If you go mid-day you'll likely have enough space to set up and work, but I wouldn't plan on getting a table in the evening.

One of my favorite places in Franklin/Nashville. The food is always really good, the hostesses work hard to get you a table and if you are lucky you might get Doris as your server...she is awesome!

Nothing but the best!

Great atmosphere and great service. Craft beer variety was the best I've ever seen. Had the onion soup which was excellent and for the main course I had the sweet and spicy chicken and waffles. Tasted good, nice mix of flavors.

This place is like a big adult playground. It is amazing! I went on a Wednesday afternoon to watch an away game (Mets, We won!! GOphills!) and it was dead. I have to say this is the best time to go. There is a giant cornhole field, horse shoe outside the front door, that after a few beers I was a champ!  The whole staff from the door men, security, cleaning staff and bartenders are the happiest people. I felt like a regular after my first visit.

We kind of stumbled across this place one day and I have to say I am obsessed! The decor and atmosphere really makes this brewery stand out from the others. 

We opted to wait in their tap room and grabbed a pint each. I got their coffee blond which was so unique and really refreshing!   

Once we were sat we ordered pretty quickly. I opted for their chicken sandwich and my boyfriend got their pulled pork sandwich. We decided to share an order of their truffle fries - which were AMAZING! 

If in the area this is a must try establishment!

I am going to add my review to the LONG list of reviews that address the significant service issues at this establishment. The food is great. I have dined here at least half a dozen times and I am always pleased with the fresh, flavorful items I order - from brunch, to lunch time sandwich, to pizza to steak. All delicious.  However, every time I dine at Campo I experience horrible service.  The last time, I spent over $200 on dinner and left disappointed and aggravated. With all of the choices available in Reno we (the customer) don't have to deal with rude, inefficient service. I won't be back to Campo.

Indy's. Best. Wings.

I really don't need to write anymore in this review. I just said it all.

Ok, you want more. I can tell. You twisted my arm.

So I love all the sauce flavors I've tried on the wings... BBQ, Asian Chili, Honey BBQ, Teriyaki. My favorite is the teriyaki. 

Why are the wings so, sooooo good here? Plump, juicy wings smothered in sauce. No skimp here. 

KSR reminds me of restaurants in my hometown. Good, down to earth people work here and eat here. It's a very popular Colts bar. Lots of 'regulars'. The menu has every fried thing imaginable. 

Speaking of fried things... the carrot fries are off the hizzy. Order them.

Need a to go order? They do that. There, you have no excuses to not eat some wings on your favorite sportzball day. 

Tip: Ask for two wet naps. You're going to need them.
Very friendly employees. They did not have gluten free bread, but they let me use my own!! So cool. Only vegetarian options, but very delicious.

My husband and I recently moved to the area and found this spot less than a mile from our apartment. We love the relaxed atmosphere and the service is terrific! The food is good and extremely well priced. Our favorite part is that they allow dogs on their patio and they have been so sweet to our pup, giving her a big bucket of ice water and snacks every time we visit. We have found our new low-key hang out in St.Pete!

One of my favorite go-to's in Reno. Recommend to make a reservation. Many time I try to go there the bar is full and the dinning room is all booked up for the evening. We had a party of 10 for my boyfriends birthday and they accommodated us very well. Was able to store the cake in their kitchen and provide new forks, plates, and a knife to serve it with! I love this place. My favorites on the menu are the fish and chips and the tomato soup!

This is our first time here for dinner. I ordered the seafood potpie and it was truly amazing. The scallops are always difficult to cook the right way and these were perfect. It came with.rice and asparagus. The appetizers were phenomenal as well: Gator hush puppies, cabage oyster boats and octopus.

We live very close, so not only is it convenient, but the food is good. I'm not a buffet person, but their salad/soup bar is awesome. They have giant chunks of feta, yummy greek olives, grape leaves and other delicious items on the salad bar. And of course they serve drinks. Oh and if you like french toast, you must order it. Challah!! What more could you want.

Great place to watch baseball or to eat outside.  

Food was just OK though.  Wings were undercooked and soggy which is kind of an instant turnoff.  Our service wasn't too good, but I think it was waitress specific, as other tables seemed to see their servers much more frequently.  Wasn't able to get a drink refill at all, or the check in a reasonable time.

Great beer selection! This place has something for everyone. Local beers and beers from near and far! Food was tasty with a good selection of Germany fare. The wait staff was knowledgeable, kind and attentive. Seat yourself with a variety of stools, table and couches. Great Sunday funday!

Rick's Boatyard is one of my faves!! I've eaten here on numerous occasions. The first time I ate here was when they had the King Crab special, although the crab was delicious that is not what hooked me. The clam chowder soup and Blue Crab stuffed mushrooms is what made me do my Oh yeah this is  dance

Aside from the food, the ambience of the restaurant reminds me of home. I'm from Florida and I love eating by the water on a deck while enjoying some good ole seafood and in some evenings you can enjoy live music.

The customer service thus far has been great and attentive.

We showed up an hour early before our reservation on a Friday night. Got seated right away. Ordered a bottle of wine, a salad, a soup, a steak, lamb chops. Side of shrimp, two veggies and split a dessert. $325 with tip. Some of the food and the service was very good except the lobster bisque was just okay and the banana cream pie. No whipped cream? Just a banana custard and some sliced bananas in a crappy pre-made shell. Overall, despite tasty entrees,  it's a bit uninspired in our Philly restaurant scene these days though. But... if you are in for a steak dinner and want it to come out sizzling, then this is the place for you, 'Darlin.

Wonderful dinner with my mom! The atmosphere & staff were wonderful. Every one knew the menu really well & answered all our questions well & honestly, which is what an indecisive gal like me loves! 
I forgot to take pictures of the appetizers, because we jumped right in, but we got the salmon tartine & the shrimp in muddy waters. Both were good, but didn't extremely excite me so, next time I would probably try something different!

My mom got the seared scallops on top of the fettuccine Nero, and oh my gosh talk about delicious. My mom loves scallops & gets them everywhere she can, and she said they were the best scallops she's ever had. I definitely agree! I'm not much of a fan of scallops but even I couldn't deny that they were delicious! The squid ink pasta was also delicious & the vermouth cream made it so decadent. I would definitely recommend the scallops. It's not a huge portion, but I think it would be perfect with an app or if you're not super hungry.

I got the lamb shank. It was really good as well! The portion was big! I only ate half & the leftovers were just as good. It falls off the bone & I didn't even have to use a knife! I think it was just lacking some salt, which was a bummer. I don't think I would get this again either, mostly because I would love to try the rest of their menu. Or get the fettuccine Nero all for myself lol.

We also split a side of Brussels sprouts and OMG they're the best Brussels I've ever had!! I even ate some of them cold the next day & I still found myself saying "I could eat these everyday". They were delicious!! Get these!!! I can't stress that enough!

For dessert we got the goat cheesecake. It was good & light, which was great for us because we we already pretty full lol. I think I would try a different dessert next time too.

By far the highlight of our meal was the seared scallops & fettuccine and the Brussels sprouts!! Would highly recommend both!! 
All in all it was a great meal. We'll definitely be back.
So-so.

I called for a pickup for pizza and wings. The food was overpriced. I had forgotten the menu which had the coupons. My order was $30 but the owner refused to give me the coupon for $5 off. In the end he took off $2. So cheap. Why make it so difficult cause obviously you don't want to keep me as a customer. The pizza did not taste good and the wings were mediocre. I would not go back... there are plenty of other options around.
Best food ever. Will be returning. Get the spicy Miso. You won't regret it. Until the next morning.

I love this place. Staff is always friendly and the food is great. I started coming here after they did a great job catering a last minute, large lunch order for my employer. The food was hot and fresh and came with no attitude about the rush (can't say the same for a certain well known local sandwich shop).

The cheese tamales are my favorite but the green chile and cheese is a close second. I buy a bunch of frozen ones and keep them in my fridge.

The staff is always so friendly. I've never had any issues at this location. 

P.S. Sign up for the Chick-Fil-A app as this location gives freebies sometimes and honors the free rewards from Lightning game wins

A beautiful little find on South St. or should I say "Bellissimo."  The husband and wife are pure Italian - in fact they were watching football (we call it soccer). I ordered the meatball hoagie which was served up fast and hot. The meatballs were very well seasoned and the marinara was rich. Placed on a crusty roll, the sandwich was excellent. My wife ordered avocado toast which she enjoyed very much.

When I really like a place I tend to go there time and time again, so expect to see me more. The food was amazing, the atmosphere was comfy and cozy, the staff was so accommodating, the price is reasonable. I love that the owner walks around and talks with the guests. As I sit here eating the leftovers I must say this place it top notch.

Bar food at it's best.  We're talking fried pickles, fried banana peppers,  individual sliders (aptly named Shorty burgers), pork wings & loaded tater tots....

Great spot to wait out the first half of an über-long track meet.

I really enjoyed Blue Sushi Sake Grill. Our server was good in the beginning, but after we got our food she kind of disappeared. It took a long time for us to get our checks, that is the only reason I didn't give this restaurant 5 stars. The food was amazing, some of the best seafood I've had in Indianapolis. I went with a couple friends and we visited during their happy hour. My friend and I shared the dragon shrimp, mango crab rangoon, blue balls and crispy rice cakes. I loved the mango crab rangoon and the blue balls, they were my favorite. The Blue Balls are tempura fried tofu pockets stuffed with spicy crab mix, served with eel sauce and they are delicious. I ordered the Lion King Roll, it was amazing. I will definitely be back!

So we walk in and I witness an employee sweeping a table...Um okay hope that was a magic broom. Then our server who I could only assume is a villain from a Disney Channel original movie comes up with his hospital bracelet on, at this point I'm feeling like I've made bad choices in my life and I'm being punked. Like where is Ashton! But no worries we did receive our food and at the same temperature as the shake we received two visits later. Needless to say this is not a visit I will soon forget.

awesome sashimi! awesome teriyaki!!
trumps my previous favorite in northern wilmington (le shio) - which is great because their other dinner dishes are very reasonably priced, and both food & service are better. 

got the sashimi appetizer -  best sashimi i've had in wilmington. this is possibly the first time i really enjoyed cuts of sashimi other than tuna/salmon/hamachi outside japan. the fish had great texture and the taste was very fresh. it's like the chef's choice was actually great catch of the day instead of 'kitchen trickey to utilize scrap meat' (as the bang bang theory taught us)

I rarely find myself impressed at teriyaki dishes, always thought of them as typical bento food, not bad, hard to mess up, but nothing to be excited about. the teriyaki here proved me wrong! they come on a sizzling platter, with piles and piles of meat! and what's more impressive is the bed of vegetable under the meat. I swear I perhaps liked beef flavored veggies (cabbage, bean sprouts, onions, pepper) more than meat itself. i've literally been eating what looks like garnish vegetables all night. so damn good! (it's like, better fajita) 

also had their yakisoba. taste just like the ones we had in osaka. tho personally i recommand the teriyaki more. it's a little pricier but worth every penny!

we ended our meal with tempura ice cream. i've been having trouble finding these in delaware and so glad they have them! though i wish they had them with green tea or red bean ice cream instead of vanilla. nevertheless it was still very good. 

definitely will be back!!
Great venue. Good food. Lackluster service. Extremely long wait for order to arrive.

Okay, they make good stuff but the presentation? The price for the size of the food item? It just felt like so much. We spent like $30 on breakfast items and it felt like such a little amount of food. 

Definitely yummy. I think if I go back it would be to eat in the store. When I ordered I felt like the stuff was just slammed in the box all unappetizing.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. Went to get a shake and sat at the intercom drive thru forever without someone taking my order. Then I sat at the window for ever waiting for someone to take my payment for the milkshake. Got the double chocolate shake and it taste like the way mildew smells. 10/10 done with this location.

Great breakfast!!  Everyone was welcoming and friendly.  Even though it was incredibly crowded on a Sunday morning, the service was cordial and efficient.  I had a fantastic veggie omelette with home fries.  I also recommend the pancakes--they're enormous and delicious!!!  The coffee was hot and plentiful.  I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in town.

Great happy hour deals. Bar is fun with open windows in warm weather. Highly recommend grilled fish tacos - they are more flavorful than the fried version. Anything with chicken tinga also good. Love the chili margarita.

We went here in between my son's hockey games at the nearby rink. The food was average, but considering we were a party of 40 I can't expect more. Our server was amazing. I would have lost my mind trying to wait on that many people, but between her, the manager, and some helpers she killed it. This is a chill place to go to play darts, shoot pool,  have some drinks, and watch a game.
When I moved to palm Harbor,  my boyfriend was very excited to show me some of his favorite spots. Waking up to a box of delicious and funky donuts is probably the best thing ever!

Stopped In here on Sunday morning around 10 o'clock and most of the pumps were empty in the parking lot was pretty clear to for those wanting to go inside. I only got gas here and the place is very clean and Well-maintained on the outside. No problem getting in and out as there is a middle lane to turn into the lot from the opposite side of the street. Prices were cheaper than most other local outlets this morning.

Why is this place still open. The good news is that kfc in novi is the worst. It is my fault really. I was supposed to go to wine on us 19. 

Why are they allowed to keep cooked chicken hours before selling.
Always a good choice. Never had a bad meal or service. This one of our regular stops.
Real good poorboys, They overstuff the shrimp pboys and cook them in meal instead of flour and it is a great way to do a pboy.  Extra large, and at a good price.

I bought a groupon for this place. Excited to try it, was looking forward to getting some good brazilian steak/food. Went in very hungry too. Ok it is a buffet I tried a little bit of every item. Some things were average at best, other things just straight up disappointing. Extremely over priced. Service was not bad. But I would not recommend eating here for anyone. Waste of time.
Fried shrimp po boy and fried green tomato pimento BLT with friend pickles was amazing!

We did not stay to eat. Door next to handicap parking (a person in our party has mobility difficulties) was blocked with trash receptacle. Went in to see if this was just because the floor was being swept but it appears the door is permanently blocked. This is unacceptable and clearly a fire code violation to only have one exit at the front of the building.

This place ended up being the highlight of the trip recently. And it wasn't even on the long list of recommended restaurants from Nola connoisseurs.
Start to finish, service was impeccable. The food tasted fresh and seasoned right. We had the tuna tartare which had specks of caviar. The wagyu burger ground in house, and the goat curry.

Best budget sushi I've found in Philly to date.  There are 3 sushi spots on this block, and mediocrity of the other 2 kept me away from this one until Thanksgiving weekend.  My mistake.

Nigiri lunch special is a great value with good fish, a nice mix of flavorful nigiri, half with house dressings and half without.  Dressings were light and complimentary rather than obtrusive.  Rice was on point.  Nothing new or terribly exciting, but frankly well-made and flavorful sushi is cause enough for excitement.

Ended up going back again the next day.

Word to the wise: no lunch specials on Sunday, though they still honored it based on a mistake on their website.  Customer service gets a star.
Great breakfast! Loved the biscuit sandwich!

Food's pretty good. People are great. Place is nice and big, I saw a cool small car show last year and they occasionally have bands or Kare I okee. Inside and outside bars which is cool and carry out food and beer. And a huge beer selection too !
Great food, good service and phenomenal atmosphere. I really enjoyed it and would definitely go back again when in Murfreesboro

I went to this restaurant for lunch yesterday and what a ripoff.  The ice tea was so watered down it looked like yellow water.  It took about 45-50 minutes to get an awful salad.  I had a caesar salad with shrimp.  It had 5-6 small shrimp with the tails on.  Who does this in a salad!!!  The bill with 2 salads, ice tea and tip came to $50.  I felt like asking for my money back but lesson learned.....will never go there again.

Desided to come back here for the second time on Mother's Day. When first arriving. I noticed outside there are a lot of Hornets. please be careful you don't get  stung buy one. macaroni and Grill needs to get some kind of an exterminator out to get rid of them. 

When I walked in I had reservations. And was seated asap, but it was not that packed so I can only guess that maybe I really didn't need to make reservations. but it was Mother's Day so you would expect them to be packed. Better to be safe then sorry. 

After seated, was asked what we would like to drink. I got there peach iced tea. which is very good. And they brought the good bread and oil on a plate to dip the bread in for a little snack. So so good. 

 I wound up ordering the buffalo chicken parmesan with spaghetti with blue cheese and celery mixed in the spaghetti, yes and it was good. The sauce on the chicken parm had a little kick to it. just how I like it. And got a Caesar salad on the side for an extra $2.99. but the Caesar salad was small. Could have gave me a bigger salad, it's not your typical salad. most places that's much bigger and most of the lettuce in the salad Was chunks on the bottom. 

Overall everything was good. except the service could have been a little bit better. especially at the time I was there it was not that busy.

I chose Twigs for my NYE/Birthday celebration this year. I'd never been before but I'm a Martini girl and wanted a place to gather a small group of friends central to us all. There were 14 in our party, had a 730pm reservation and was seated at just before 8. Our server seemed overwhelmed and bit inexperienced on how to serve a group. Salads and appetizers were forgotten. When the manager came by and we mentioned the items missing he simply walked away without a word. Our server came right over, acted as if the items that were forgotten were our fault? but she would get them. I had the Cod and fries with Gorgonzola dipping sauce. Nothing special about my meal but the Gorgonzola sauce was late to the table, cold and way too salty. I had a bite of the crab Mac n Cheese and it was really good. The Thai pizza also looked delicious. The best part of the night were the Martinis- I ordered a huckleberry lemon drop and a mango pomegranate martini- both tasted amazing but both glasses were only half filled? If I pay $10 for a drink, I expect the entire drink.
Bottom line- only come for the Martinis, don't bring a large group and for the price you should eat elsewhere. Only reason I'd return would be for a Martini after a dinner/movie date.

I visited Mise en Place with a friend the other day for lunch and neither of us were too impressed with what we ordered or the service we received. 

First, the place was nearly empty but yet they squeezed us into a table next to the only two other occupied tables by the window. (I assume to give the false appearance to passersby that the place was busier than it actually was). One of my pet peeves is when a restaurant is empty and someone sits at the table next to me or the host puts me next to an occupied table. I don't want to hear the conversation from the table next to me. Give me some space!  There should be a minimum of one empty table between customers. I suppose I could've asked for a different table but I didn't want to inconvenience them. But I digress...

Started off with two types of bread and butter, which I really enjoyed. For my entree, I had the buttermilk fried chicken with sweet potatoes and collard greens. It was just OK to me. 3 stars.  Nothing more, nothing less. My friend had the quinoa with chicken, squash, beans, corn, etc. Equally unimpressed.  The daily soup was pretty good though.

Service was 2 stars. The server paid a lot more attention to the table that had ordered a bottle of wine. Bigger tip for him at that table since we just had waters, which I had to flag him down in order to get refills/check.  Took him awhile to come back to our table to take our order too. 

Skipped dessert since I wasn't impressed with my entree. I lean towards 2 stars instead of 3 since it didn't live up to expectations or the price point of the meal.

Visited Felix's for lunch to try their alligator. You can choose from blackened or fried for $12. I suggest blackened if you want to taste more of the meat and I found it to be delicious. The Felix special po boy ($14) on the other hand wasn't as good as other po boys I have tried.

Inside area is dimly lit and atmosphere is casual. Service was slow and subpar. Glad I tried the alligator but an overall so so lunch experience.

So this restaurant just banned our orders w/ no explanation !!! We never really got what we ordered w/ changes( even though we paid for them...) I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone ever!!!!!

Honestly, if you want a good sushi burrito, go to Yoshimatzu! Sorry to sound so hateful, but this place lacks love! There aren't very many topping options at all, for the poke or the burrito. Plus, the manager was kind of annoying the workers, which annoyed us. They had everything handled, but he'd rush over to them like they needed their hands to be held. Very invasive. The sushi burrito didn't quite taste right...like maybe it wasn't as fresh? Not sure. But I probably won't come back here...

I first had Spice Box on Georgia St. where their food truck was parked on First Friday and loved it. So glad to see that they now have a second location in Fountain Square. We went into the restaurant earlier this week and were impressed at how thought out the space was with cool posters on the ceiling, telephone poles protruding from the walls/ceiling, and just the overall vibe of the place. It is a long, narrow room but the seating was great for us to conduct a business meeting and enjoy lunch.

Corvids is a wonderful replacement to the former establishment called World Cafe. Corvids coffee is wonderful and the food is delicious and reasonably priced. If you're looking for a new place to enjoy and hang out with your friends, this is the place to do it.

At first glance this place will having you wonder if this could possibly hold up to the positive reviews. Trust me, you want to eat here.
I had the fish tacos. Fish tacos usually have a bunch of slaw. These have only a hint, leaving room for fish. Lots of fish. I was a little too salty, but the sauce they use is slightly sweet. The other thing about these fish tacos is that they have cheese melted on them...CHEESE ON FISH! It totally works.

There's a lot said about their lobster roll. All the good stuff is true. Both rolls brought to our table were overflowing with. Lobster meat. Not a bunch of filler. Just lobster. And the roll is toasted to a crunchy golden brown. 

The fries ARE along as a dollar bill, and fresh cut. They are also seasoned with old bay. Awesome!
We didn't have the onion rings but when an order was carried to the table next to us we knew we had missed something special. They were huge and they were battered in a tempura-type batter. 

This place can seat 25 people inside and another 8 outside.

Picked up a to go order of Lasagna & it literally fed me & my fiancé two nights in a row. A little pricey but worth every delicious bite. The garlic bread is also very yummy!!! We will definitely be repeat customers. ;)

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Santa Barbara.  I loooooved this place while attending school @ UCSB and still look for excuses to drive up and eat here. This says a lot since I rarely crave Italian food!  The garlic bread is outta control delicious as well as the caesar salad and bruschetta.  Highly recommend the Steak Panini (San Remo?).

I love this place! Their pad Thai is the best I've ever had and is definitely authentic.  Their sushi is also very fresh and a good portion.  I recommend their coconut mango shrimp tempura roll. Delish.  I also really love their tom yum soup.  The service is a hit or miss but most of the time a hit.  I recommend going for lunch because they have some really good specials

I had my birthday dinner here with some friends & it was absolutely perfect! Our waiter was friendly and fun, and mostly importantly, knew the wine list like the back of his hand. We ordered at least half of the menu & each tapa was fantastic. The standouts were definitely the steak with truffle vinaigrette, patatas bravas, & the chickpea dish. At the end of the meal, I was surprised with a decadent molten chocolate cake. The bill was also surprisingly low considering all of the wine & tapas we ordered. 

Can't recommend this place enough!

I like it a lot, food was good service was good what else could you ask for it was not crowded like some other place around not empty either but just right. It as a little drive from the hotel but worth it.

I came here 05/31/21 around the afternoon and the girl working was really rude. I went inside to grab my food, and I could see my order was ready but the workers were all just standing there doing nothing as I was telling them my order was ready. The food was still decent but it looked like my food was just thrown together and thrown in the bag. Hire people with manners , it's not hard to be nice.

We had such a strange and uncomfortable experience that we left before our food even got there. The blonde server had an attitude from the beginning. Saying that they don't have milk that " they don't use it for anything"  even though it was on the beverage menu. Then there was no sweet tea and "they weren't making anymore." Finally, after i tried to order an egg over-hard for my two year old i was told that they "only make scrambled eggs." Omg. Then what do you put on the sandwiches? Either the waitress was being purposely difficult because she could or the kitchen people were being jerks. No apologies for anything. The server was outright mean after she realized we weren't happy. Whatever the reasons, the air was so negative and combative that we left and canceled our order.

We happened to walk in (on a Sunday afternoon might I add) while he was making fresh batches of the Shoyu Tuna Poke and the Spicy Shoyu Tuna. As soon as I saw the spicy tuna, it was love at first sight. 

I got a brown rice bowl with spicy shoyu tuna and topped it with scallions, pickled ginger, house made eel sauce, sesame seeds and avocado. Holy moly. So delicious. The avocado was nice because it took a little of the heat off, not that I minded how spicy it was. (If you're not a spice lover, get the plain Shoyu Tuna.)

My boyfriend got the burrito with jasmine rice, nori, half shoyu/spicy tuna, kale, avocado and some other goodies. Also delicious. 

Fresh fish - this is huge for me. The fish had zero odor and was a beautiful colour. My only constructive suggestions would be to possibly chop the tuna a little smaller. In Hawaii it's traditionally small cubes - these were bigger chunks. Just a personal preference I guess. And I would love if there were a cold sushi rice option, kind of like a chirashi bowl. Feels a little odd putting my fresh chilled tuna on a base of warm brown rice.

Delicious. Will return. Maybe tomorrow. Highly recommend!
This is my spot for sandwiches.  Every sandwich I've ever tried has been magnifique.  I love their chips,  it's a sweet n salty goodness be sure to ask for the extra drizzle that stuff is Ah-mazing!

Such an amazing, friendly and delicious restaurant. I got engaged after a wonderful dinner here. I live 3000km away but when I'm back in Edmonton, this is somewhere I just need to return to. 

Good:
- Super high quality ingredients with a very 'Alberta' feel. 
- A very cozy, warm and friendly atmosphere. 
- Great service.

Jimmy B's never disappoints when it comes to live music and atmosphere.
The only problem is it  usually gets too crowded and there's a lack of seating inside by the band but that is because it is the most popular beach bar.. Bartenders are always great and very attentive
Beautiful place. Decent selection of foods but very pricy. You can go upstairs and see the historic ghosts table.
The Depot was fun with great food Wine and cocktails. Lamb Shank done to just right falling off the bone tender and juicy. Schnitzel with a Cherry compote under it was very tasty!

I'm honest especially when it comes to food. I'm surprised this pizza was voted number 1 , Bella's right down the street has a pie alot better. The people are nice but  I ordered a calzone, I'm not so sure they are even certain what that is because it had no ricotta cheese in it, I ordered steak and cheese and got sliced roast beef instead. (Sliced roast beef with the shiny color similar to our like the roast beef you get when u order a sub) first time I've got a calzone not in a box but wrapped in foil too. Had high hopes for this place,but if u want great food try Bella's up the street. You'll see there's a world of a difference
A+.  The barristas are so sweet and friendly. They offer all sorts of ways to customize your coffee drink.  It's such a nice atmosphere.  Just excellent.  I always leave happy.

Another great recommendations by my buddy Mark! I went for brunch and I was blown away by the soft shell crab in a jar! An explotion of flavor from the first bite to the last. You have to try it! I was feeling a little adventurous and I I was rewarded handsomely. I saved a little room for the oysters and a cold glass of a local IPA and thank goodness I did. It was an overall great experience and I will be recommending this place to all my friends.

Khmer Kitchen has been on my must-eat list basically since it opened, so when my colleague suggested that we head there for a mid-week dinner, there was no way I was going to pass up the chance to FINALLY try Khmer Kitchen. I was surprised at how small the dining area was, but this is the case for a lot of small BYOBs in South Philly (maybe 24 seats tops?) The atmosphere is clean and homey, and the service is warm and welcoming. I came by with a friend who is a regular, but I don't think that we got any more special treatment than any of the other diners. Our server was awesome and super funny. For the table of three we shared:

Nyum La Hong, the green papaya salad, which we went for with medium spice, just trying to be cautious, but I think I definitely could've gone for spicy
Prah Hok Kateeh, pork in coconut cream with fish sauce and tons of fresh veggies for scooping - this was like nothing I had ever tasted before and was a true highlight, as many of my fellow Yelpers have pointed out
Sah-Law Kah-Ree Mohn, curried chicken with lots of fresh veggies, especially celery, and rice
Cha Throp, purple eggplant with oyster sauce and we went with the pork option - this reminded me a lot of Thai sweet basil dishes I've had in the past and while it was tasty it was not the most unique in terms of our overall experience, but seriously it was tasty

If you've never had Cambodian before, I would say strongly that you should not hesitate to check Khmer Kitchen out. There is nothing intimidating about the experience even if you're a newbie, so expand your palette and hit up these folks ASAP.

Here Sunday. Smaller place than I thought. 
Had the Hot Fish and Sizzling eggplant, as this was reviewed well. Did not disappoint. Both delicious. Service was friendly and quick. Definitely going back and try other items.

I was here for lunch during the week day, so I can't speak to the atmosphere when the bar is in full swing, but the food is mediocre.  I had the french onion soup and a portabella mushroom sandwich.  Nothing that I couldn't have gotten at a run of the milll chain like a bennigans or houlihans.. the beers on draft were weak, but they did have some good bottles for the winter season (troeggs mad elf, rogue yellow snow, etc).   Bottom line: this was a one and done place.

REAL BIG price for a bowl of cold noodles with a few sprinkled cold meat bitz - loaded with FAT & meager bean sprouts - not worth it!
It was rather unappetizing - my dining partner dumped chili sauce to give it some flavor.

Found out you CANNOT get pho  'dry'  in the restaurant,  but they'll 
give it to you if you drive thru!
That's just dumb & not happening!
Get with the program and cater to your customer!
Every other Vietnamese restaurant will offer 'dry' .  (broth on the side)

I ordered 'charbroiled' pork over rice. 
The price was astronomical for 1 oz of slivered pork, 1 cup half-warmed rice, two cucumber slivers, two twigs of ancient cilantro, dried carrot shreds, and ultra salty dipping sauce - this was lunch hour - you'd think at least the rice would be steamy. 
Who needs it?

The owner, a New York native, will smile if you ask him "Why Indianapolis??" and he'll reply "Starting a business in New York is very difficult, Too much competition, but I can come out here to Indy and start a business without any major competition." 
Then it dawns on you that this business will succeed, the only problem is getting the name out there. With such excellent service and a wonderful owner, that won't be too difficult. The store has only been open 45 days and he's still trying to esconsce himself.

If you go, I suggest you try the Manburger. Its a quarter (or a third, I forget) pound burger made by hand.

When you visit this place you should treat it like a sit down resturaunt but with a big city type of feel. 

You won't spend more then 8 bucks for a meal. But it is VERY worth it! The lemonade is amazing! Made from real lemons!

I want to see this place open one year from now, and I want to see it flourish!
Walked in here randomly when we were looking for a quick snack. Had the chorizo queso which was amazing. Also had the iced coffee which is also recommended.

This place was delicious! They found a way to make dessert natural and healthy with all the flavor you crave!  I had the Matcha soft serve and it was amazing! I wish I could live off of it but I made the rookie mistake of thinking this was a keto ice cream substitute because they use coconut sugar and that's not the case:( totally worth the cheat meal though! I just think next time my friends go I'll have to skip because I'll be way too tempted to eat this again! Seriously everyone go try this place and eat all the ice cream for me!

This place has probably the best view in Tampa. Unfortunately, you pay for that view. In return, you get sub-par food and service. I had heard this before, and had not been to Jacksons because of this. However last night, it was the location for a friends going away party. I can name 10 places in Tampa that are better and cheaper. I won't be back.

Been here back in April and we loved the food and on our way home had to stop this time bringing our dog and able to have in the patio area. 
This time I got their honey fried chicken sandwich which is very flavorful and tender, I am not a slaw fan but the slaw on the sandwich was great not to much sauce which I loved. 
So I also ordered what the call the Margarita flight and sever it just like when you go the the brew houses so yummy  
I am an out of towner so you know a place is good when you make a point to come back
Recommended by a friend and came here for the first time. It's absolutely amazing and stunning from many other traditional Chinese Restaurant. 成都燃麵真的太好吃了。作為一個廣東人，其實這個辣度我也可以接受。下次還會再來，還會推薦給朋友。

One of the best steakhouses with awesome waitstaff.  I always have steak which is always cooked to perfection.  I must recommend the creamed corn and sugar snap peas for sides, they are delicious!!! It's the only time I eat creamed corn.  The price is a little high, but it's a very nice, upscale place.  Great wine choices

Definitely a neat spot, definitely swank.  The service was ok and the food was above average.  A place I think is much more of an ambiance experience then a culinary one.  I got the trout and eggs with a side of fruit.  Trout was good, eggs were standard and fruit was starting to turn (over ripe).  I have gone back with family and they enjoyed their food but didn't seem like it was the best around.  I would rank this high in atmosphere and mmmeah on food and service.

Good meat. Damn good meat. 

I've pretty much had the meat every which way they serve it. The prices are high but the meat quality is top notch. I recommend the meat platter the first time around to get a feel for what they have to offer. 

Have yet to try their matzah ball soup but if you're looking for a low carb option, you can't go wrong with the meat platter. 

Also a huge fan of their special with corned beef. They stack it high with meat, slaw, and Russian dressing. 

There's so much to eat in Reading but IMO this is a must try.

I just stopped in for a quick lunch here and had some sort of pulled pork sandwich that was very tasty, and the service was good.  I was there mid-week at 1PM and was pretty shocked at how slow they were.  I guess lunch service is new here, hence the sign outside, but I'd go here again.

This restaurant was absolutely incredible. The reviews on the food were super helpful. My friend and I shared the Mexican corn, the steak bites, the ranch burger, and the prosciutto flatbread. Everything was beyond expectations. Even the butter that came with the hot crispy bread was insane. I have definitely found a new place to come back to every time I visit Santa Barbara‼

At the recommendation of Samantha we tried the whipped ricotta with sour dough bread. OMG, so delicious, along with the wings (not very spicy), asparagus & portobello, pizza and various tasting sized brews. A great outing. 
Very attentive service. 
Clean venue 
All around an enjoyable outing.

My family has been frequenting Double Greeting for years!!  I have loved the food and two of the long-standing waitresses, however, in the last year, the quality of the food and service has drastically taken a nose dive.
Last night I was dining with my parents and my 8 year old son.  As usual, we were browsing the menu and my son suddenly screeched and yelled "Mom!  A cricket!"  It wasn't a cricket - it was a cockroach.  I smashed it with my menu and it fell on to our table where I proceeded to conceal it in a napkin.  My dad asked that I not say anything or make a scene, so out of respect, I didn't, however, that bug was the last straw for me.  I will not be returning to this restaurant - I can deal with the occasional crappy service, but where there is one bug, somewhere nearby there are many.

I've been to tiramisu twice and was underwhelmed both times. The first time (lunch) we shared a pizza and salad. We asked for one of the other salad dressings to come with the salad instead of the one it's normally paired with, which the waitress said was fine, but it did not come with the dressing we requested. We also ordered a pizza specifically with the Peruvian peppers, but there were no peppers on the pizza let alone Peruvian ones. We then had to wait an obnoxiously long time to be able to cash out. The restaurant was not that busy.

The second time (dinner) we had to wait a solid 15 min from sitting down to someone coming to get our drink order. We decided to order everything right then so we wouldn't have to wait longer. Bread was brought out and it wasn't that good (needed salt or something, was really bland). We ordered the arancini (risotto balls) which were tasty but the marinara sauce that came with them was bland. My husband ordered the Salsicca pasta which came with Italian sausage, walnuts, sundried tomatoes and pasta. He enjoyed it. I ordered the carbonara with chicken. It was very bland, almost tasteless, and a few bites in I noticed uncooked gelatinous egg white everywhere which really nauseated me. I had to stop eating. 

We got desert (still hungry after not being able to eat the carbonara!) - a raspberry mousse dome which was decent, and a cheesecake which was completely dry.

Definitely won't be coming back again.

I first visited Mi 'N Tea for a Yelp event about a year ago, and I thought it was great!  When I was in the area for a doctor's appointment last week, I thought it was the perfect time to swing by again for lunch.

I ordered:

-Thai Sunset:  This was thai tea, cream, and cold foam, and it was DELICIOUS.  I added boba which in hindsight I don't really think it needed.  I usually ask for teas half sweet but it slipped my mind while I was ordering.  I actually thought it was great as-is though.  It was definitely very sweet and creamy, but it made for a nice treat.

-Viet Pork Skewers banh mi:  This was another home run.  The sandwich is pretty big and I was already getting full after the first half, but I kept eating it until I was done the whole thing because it was so good!  When you first unwrap the sandwich, it may look like it doesn't have that much filling, but that's just because the toppings are stuffed inside and the bread has an overhang.  If you look at the cross-section you will see there is plenty of goodness inside!

-Taro Fries:  I love taro and I don't see it available much near me, so it was a no-brainer to add these fries on.  They were hot and crisp.  One thing I will say is that it seemed like the coating had a little sugar in it which I could have done without, but it was balanced out by dipping in the side of spicy mayo.  Note you could also get spicy kethcup instead of mayo if you prefered.

Service was great - everyone was really nice and they brought my tea out first while I was waiting for the rest of my order.  I definitely recommened Mi 'N Tea and hope to be back soon!

Was in the area and Stumbled across this great place. The restaurant wasn't that busy, so we were seated right away. It took the waiter a couple minutes to come over to us. When he arrived to the table he explained the menu and took our drink order. There was an issue with getting a dirty fork with food left on it. The waiter apologized and quickly replaced the fork.
