The food was great. Other than the dirty silverware everything else went smoothly. I liked the fact that the bill came in a book and people wrote nice notes in the book.

I had a steak sandwich with green bell peppers.  The sandwich was really delicious, the best steak sandwich that I have had in Philadelphia, definitely much better than the one I had at Sonny's on Market Street.  The sandwich was quite large with lots of meat, but I certainly expected that much meat for $8.95.  They also have a couple freestyle soda machines with lots of drink options.  The staff was friendly, and the place is clean. The dining area is upstairs, so if you have trouble negotiating stairs, then this could be a concern.  I would definitely return and highly recommend Cleavers.

Wine/Beer popcorn flights?! Yes please. I have visited Just Pop In a few times this summer and my experiences have always been great. The staff take Covid precautions seriously and I feel safe sitting on their outdoor patio. I recently ordered the wine and popcorn flight. The wine pours are generous and the popcorn is always delicious. They do offer more food items other than popcorn. I highly recommend visiting here if you are in the Brip area!

First, I must say that this restaurant is significantly more expensive than yelp indicates. That is truly my only complaint.

I've been here many times and had nothing but the best when it comes to service and experience. The waiting staff is very knowledgeable and personable. If you go to this location, make sure to ask for Cat. She is absolutely the best around. If she didn't have to wait on us, my friends and I would have made her sit and enjoy the meal with us. Dining experiences don't get much better than that.

Friday night, we were finally able to give Hedge Row a full test. We had been there only for a mid-day snack and that was not enough fully to review. It must be pointed out that Chef Brad Gates is the real deal. He was Union Square's chef de cuisine for 10 years. Also, this restaurant is focused on wood roasting and locally sourcing (to the extent possible). So, for example, some of the veggies came from Silverthorn Farms (one of our favorites). Friday night, we were with four other people and everyone at the table was willing to share. Accordingly, we got lots of different tastes. It was the unanimous judgment of each of us that everything we tasted was excellent! We started with the shrimp hush puppies, wood roasted carrots and wood roasted beets. We had enjoyed the shrimp hush puppies before (on our mid-day snack) and, as before, they were truly delicious. The wood roasting gave the carrots and the beets a lovely flavor. On Chef's recommendation, we moved to the lamb meatballs and each of us enjoyed one. The lamb came from Viking Farms. The flavors in them were extraordinary and were we not saving room for other tastes, we could each have handled more. Next we went to the mains and four were ordered that were shared six ways: the half chicken (Gunthorp Farms), trout (Rushing Waters), salmon (Skuna Bay, Canada) and the pasta with veal bolognese. Jacque Pepin, in a cooking class, had told my spouse that roast chicken is the test for a good chef. It seems so simple, but to do it right is really difficult. Hedge Row DID IT RIGHT! The difficult trick is keeping the breast moist while cooking the thigh fully. Our half chicken was just outstanding. The breast was still moist and not dried out and the dark meat was perfectly cooked. For us, the test on trout is whether the skin is crispy and the trout not overdone. The sauce for the trout included a hint of ginger which gave it an unusual flavor which we all enjoyed. Again, Hedge Row passed with flying colors. The trick on salmon is getting it done enough without overcooking and, once again, the salmon was just done enough. It's accompaniment was Asian in flavor and complemented it very well. It should be noted that with each of these dishes, there is no place to hide mistakes. And there were none that had to be hidden. It is possible that the pasta bolognese is a bit more forgiving, but here the question is the flavor of the veal bolognese (outstanding), the amount of sauce (excellent - not over sauced, a common error) and proper cooking of the pasta. Again, a dish that we all enjoyed. Finally, four of us went off menu for our dessert, ordering either the chocolate or vanilla ice cream and a shot of espresso we could pour over (for our own affagatos). Two of our number ordered the sticky toffee pudding (a mainstay of the lamented R Bistro). The pud was wonderful and our affagatos were just the right, light end to the meal. We paired the first part of the meal with a lovely mid-coast California rose (which was dry and fruit forward). The last half or the meal, I chose a Barbera d'Alba which was a light enough red to go with everything. So our bottom line is whether a restaurant will make our regular rotation. This one definitely is going into the rotation.

The ambiance and atmosphere are breathtaking! The brick grilled chicken is scrumptious and satisfies the palate. I just wish more people would give this restaurant a chance to prove itself as they are really trying to appease all their guests. If anyone is not satisfied please let management know before posting a negative comment. Tucson is our home and I feel that if we treat one another in a more thoughtful kinder manner our city would prosper and our spirits. Cheers!

After waiting over 15 minutes (I'm sure it was longer I just didn't think I needed to time them) we decided to leave once a couple who just got there was seated and promptly had a waiter at their table.

I really just wanted to try this place and it's a shame poor service made that impossible.
Prompt. Good portion. Tasty hash browns. I'm surprised for the low rating here. Good breakfast at this diner.

Firecracker shrimp is more like a sparkler

This place is close to my work, has plenty of options, and good prices. I ordered the Firecracker shrimp tacos expecting them to be really hot but they had more of a tangy flavor followed by a light heat that dulled quickly. For me, that's perfect because I'm not a fan of spicy flavors but if you're expecting a jalpeno-hot sauce scolding bite than you might want to ask your waitress to tell the chef to make them super spicy. The overall experience was good, no complaints, but it didn't stand out either.
Another excellent experience at Oban!  Make a reservation...enjoy the ramen...enjoy the sushi.  It is all good and you can't go wrong.  Love the vibe.

Best ramen I've ever had.  I get the spicy ramen with craft noodles and a soft boiled egg.  It never disappoints.  The servings are very generous.  Sharing could be an option for you if you're into that sort of thing.  The broth is very rich, flavorful, and creamy.  In terms of customer service, they are always cheerful and very attentive.  Once I ordered to go and the ramen was leaking.  They replaced the entire order with fresh ramen in no time at all.  The vibe inside is really nice.  Not too loud but plenty of life and conversation.  Dimly lit but still very casual.  Five out of five, would recommend!

This is one of the best mexican restaurants near my house in New Tampa. The tacos are all amazing, I have tried almost all of the varieties and every time I leave satisfied. The wait is also very short and I find it very creative that you can turn any kind of taco (Ex: The Ranger) into a burrito or bowl or even nachos. All the ingredients are full of flavor and freshness. They even have a menu for later at night that offers deals and exclusive tacos. My boyfriend and I go here all the time, it is our favorite place. Would HIGHLY recommend!
Love the atmosphere and the decore, feels like your in Mexico eating.  Food is great, I just wish the had more authentic food, Taco Dorados, Cactus.

I just ate here for the first time and had to throw out my food. My coworker and I decided to try this place b/c her husband delivers food to them and he said they were really clean. Walking in the place it was extremely hot but the appearance was really nice.  I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and it was inedible. As soon as I opened the container I knew it wasnt going to be good but I gave it a try anyway. The wrap was soaking wet, Im not sure what they used on it but it was not buffalo sauce and there was about a pound of blue cheese on it not to mention the pieces of chicken were huge. I couldnt get it down without gagging. I was very disappointed to say the least. On the other hand my coworkers had a slice and said it was really good. Maybe once I get this terrible taste out of my mouth I'll give their pizza a try.

The inside of the cafe is unacceptable. The walls are badly damaged, the floors are unfinished, the heater(s) paint is falling off, the tables and chairs are beat up. I can not just not rationally pay $5.00 to $7.00 per coffee to sit in a cafe that looks hideous. Not relaxing at all.

Came here with my family last weekend, and it really exceeded my expectations. I got the Wisconsin mac & cheese with parmesan crusted chicken and it was heavenly. That chicken was so juicy and flavorful. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
The bill was around $32 for my family of four. Amazing. Our bill is rarely under $60 at most similar quality restaurants.
(Also, my 'regular size' portion was much larger than I expected, which I appreciate.)

Great place. Cool atmosphere. 

Food had all the great tastes. 

BLT. they advertise it's piled high with bacon but intact it's the lettuce that's piled high. There was a total of 4 pieces of thin bacon. 

Like I said the tastes where all there. 

The night time staff were a little slow. 


I could take it or leave it.

The service here is always slow. Be prepared for the food to take a really long time. The servers are always nice and friendly and they always make sure your coffee is hot and your cup stays full. I've only come here for their pancakes because they are the best. The cinnamon swirl and chocolate chip pancakes are the biggest and best thing on the menu.

My food here was okay. I tried a llanera arepa with grilled steak and avocado and cheese. I also tried a patacon with shredded beef, and had a passion fruit smoothie to wash it down.  It seemed quite plain and bland.   The good thing was the server was very nice, helpful and very cheery.

Saw this recommended on yelp and tried it this morning. Thanks for the posting that said it was in a strip mall - would have missed it otherwise. Friendly, fast service - GREAT diner food at a good price. I had the huevos rancheros with refried beans and a side of grits - really good.  My mom got the biscuits and gravy - also very good. Didn't have room for dessert - maybe next time. Will definitely go back when I'm in Tucson again.
Great hangover food. I created my own burger and couldn't have been happier with the results. Their menu is also great

Lucas Park Grille is a somewhat upscale restaurant.  I say this based solely on menu prices and not food quality.  I spent more than $50 on dinner and after I was finished, I concluded that I have eaten better tasting food at Crapplebees.  It's not revoltingly bad or anything, just bland and tasteless.  The service is friendly enough and I do stop in for drinks from time to time.  It gets too crowded on Friday and Saturday for my liking, but that's more of a personal preference than a critique of the business.  

In all, if you're going to Lucas Park Grille, I would suggest it for drinks only.  There are much better restaurants in the area.

As it turns out, the food gets even better.  The specials of the day are authentic Iranian food.  The last time I went they had a chicken and saffron dish with cranberries and a Persian stew.  Both dishes were amazing.  I'll definitely be going back and seeing what other specials they have to offer!  The More I eat here, the more I'm convinced that this restaurant has great food but is cursed with a rather unfortunate name.

Very well done, young and hip.  Fabulous fresh and innovative food with complex well done spicing.  

The menu has an original approach of categories, plates are medium size. 

I would come back to SB to go here for dinner.  

Excellent innovative and complex taste meal you shouldn't miss.

So I won't lie I'm a ride or die sushi goer and this place has it going on.
Amazing service, legit sized nigiri (not too big or small), perfect rice ratio on every roll and a great selection of rolls

Only thing I would say is lunch DOES NOT include dessert and a few of the apps are prettyyyy deep fried...

Other than that...Triple S roll and Disney we're amazing! And the service was 85stars out of 10.

The lobster roll was great - they put some special voodoo on a regular hotdog bun that made it taste crispy and delicious. Fish tacos were also great but next time I think I'll get them blackened for more of a punch.

Overall it's a tiny place with a few outside seats-not the most quaint inside but the overall ambience of John's Pass is perfect.

Yum... Their truffle Parmesan sauce on their pizzas is delicious! I am pretty sure that's all I need! The interior is very modern and atmosphere is pretty hip! I think the only complaint I have is that I wish there were a little bit more toppings on the pizzas my friend and I ordered and more evenly distributed. 

I would definitely come back though!

My visit to Jonathan's Grille was the worst dining experience I have ever endured. An hour after being seated we still had only water to drink. Several of us had ordered the featured bourbon, but were finally informed they were out of stock. The rest of our drink orders were simply not completed until later in the evening. After inquiring as to where our waiter was, they finally began taking our meal orders over an hour after our arrival. Prior to ordering our meal, we were informed they were out of baked potatoes. Really? How does a restaurant allow itself to run out of baked potatoes? Half our appetizers were never delivered to the table. Several times while we waited they came to our table to tell us they were out of yet another item we had ordered. After our meals were finally delivered to the table almost two hours after we were seated, the waiter told one in our party that he would have to order something else. They had just discovered they were out of his order after everyone else finally had their meal in front of them. At that point he did not feel inclined to reorder and decided to pick up a pizza on the way home. The rest of us felt quite uncomfortable eating our meal while one in our party went without. The food was average, but expensive. However, the reason we considered cancelling our orders and going elsewhere was the attitude of the wait staff towards several members of our party. Probably the most egregious example was when we shared with the waiter that two in our party were recently engaged. His response was a sarcastic "Congratulations" to the bride-to-be and "So sorry" to the gentleman. No one at the table was amused. Another waiter asked, "How is your meal?"....before anyone at our table had been served. We left wondering why any establishment would treat their guests in such an abusive manner. Never again.

Food is nothing special. Wait staff is very slow and everything took forever to come out. We waited 20 minutes for water. Then talked to what looked to be the manager, who told us he was not the manager, but we later found out he indeed was the manager. Very odd. There are much better places to eat with better service, better food, at a better price and much better atmosphere..
Great donuts, very well Maintained establishment. Will definitely being going back. Great prices.

I love Starbucks coffee. I love the way it tastes and I love the way it smells. But, they are NOT all the same. Some are consistently good and some are flops. This one is one of the best. Take this morning, for instance. I had a nice conversation with the very personable lady at the counter regarding our kids. (She showed me a pic of one her sons - pulled it out of her apron pocket - love that!) Then I waited for my decaf frappucino. The girl making the drink put one down only it was slightly wrong (caramel instead of coffee) so she took it back and tried again. Evidently, she wasn't able to get it right so she had the guy working there do it. The guy made it (and it was perfection, btw - so many places don't know to blend the ice until smooth and you end up with ice chunks blocking your straw) and I thanked him and was just about on my way when the girl who had tried making it let me know she had comped my drink since it took a little long. Wait? What? I wasn't even upset about it nor did I complain and they took it upon themselves to comp my drink? In the words of DJ Lance Rock on Yo Gabba Gabba, "That was Awwwwesommmmme!" Seriously, most places don't do anything to correct wrongs unless you complain. This was sincerely most appreciated and it dawned on me that I have always gotten primo service at this particular Starbucks. Bravo!

Good fries and dips. Wraps are mostly arugula which is disappointing. Not many vegetarian options. Horrible customer service. I used to come here all the time when they first opened here in 2012 and it was great. Now wraps are stale and employees are rude and disrespectful. I won't be back.

This place was fantastic!!  I cannot say enough good things about it.  The restaurant is a staple of Indy, and whether you are here visiting or live here...you have to check it out.  I would recommend reservations.  However, if you do not make them and they are full...the bar area is lively and fun and you can either wait  there and have a drink or eat there.  The Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail is a must.  I love spicy and boy did it clear out the sinuses.  I thought another person in our party was going to fall over it was so hot for them.  Side note...you can buy the cocktail sauce in a bottle from the restaurant.  Every one in our party got a steak.  The ribeye was wonderful and melted in your mouth.  A buddy gave the filet the same review.  Each steak came with a side and a soup.  I had the lobster bisque...so chunky with large lobster pieces I didn't know what i was eating...again it was great.  I had the mashed potatoes as a side...pretty good as well.  The meal was so filling...would go back often if I could.  As an added side note...the Dalai Lama was also dining at St. Elmo's the night we were there...very cool.  He would not steer you wrong!!  Check it out!

The decor in here is cure! You can tell someone definitely put a lot of thought and effort into it and it truly shows. Definitely has a personal small town feel and not something corporate. 

Haven't had the ice cream yet, so only speaking for coffee! Each time I've gone in they've either gotten my order wrong or been out of what I wanted. :( The people at the counter are always really nice, but not the best at accuracy. It's local so I really want to support it and still stop in especially being so close, but honestly, Starbucks is cheaper and gets my order right more often so it will stay my regular stop.
I've found my new lounge. Fairly priced drinks, good atmosphere, with good looking women. How can you go wrong?!

The most recent visit to Lenox Village BR was about the same as when we went in July '16.  My first visit a couple of years ago was great.  Fell in love with the "buy the farm" burger and crave it (we live out of town).  Both times I got it lately, the burger seemed slapped together with hardly any relish  - half the bun was dry, and off center egg, lettuce and tomato.  Their small rectangular plates are awful, especially with a messy, large burger to wrangle in a 4x4 space.  Their portions are fine, why the tiny plate?  
They were out of  EINSTÖK, so I tried the Gerst which was happy hour price.  It was ok.  My last visit, I forgot what I got, but they had just opened a new keg, and my glass was the first one off with about a 4 inch head.  
The thrill is gone.  Pie In The Sky pizza a few doors down with great pizza, pasta etc will be getting more $$$.  Sorry BR, gotta step it up.
Great lunch! My vegetarian friend was happy to find this spot, and I had the best steak sandwich I have had in years...and it was soy!
Awesome service. Great food every time you order. The to-go people are efficient and friendly. I love ordering from this location. Great job team.
I had a wonderful and very healthy lunch. They have lots of dishes for people who are vegans or vegetarians. I had a wonderful salad and would definitely go back if in the area.

I've dined at Erinis over the years and always a great experience. During this pandemic, we've been there these last 2 weeks in a row. They are doing such a great job at making you feel safe and keeping to the social distancing. The service both times was awesome (George was our server) and food delicious. Last week I had the seafood risotto which was amazing and this week were the crab cakes which is a signature dish. The octopus appetizer is the best I've had anywhere. Amazing!! I felt so safe dining here and we'll be back and back and back!!

My friends and I were looking for a place to get dinner for my birthday and went to three different places before stopping here. We were about to leave due to the 45 minute wait, but the manager was very friendly and got us appetizers to make us comfortable as we waited for a table! Amazing service! Highly recommend!

Haven't been here in years and a friend threw her kid a birthday party here. The kids had a blast! It was so much fun and I as weird as it sounds it would probably be a good mommy hang out with your other mommy friends eat a pizza and drink wine while your kids run a muck place... so you can catch like 30 minutes to yourself LOL 

It's totally understaffed and unloved inside but what chuck e cheese isn't? The part I like the most is that they are high on security. You and your kid are uniquely marked and have to be together when exiting. It's fun it's cheap who doesn't like that? there are always coupons and an easy place for you to let your kids blow off some steam and run around. =)

This is one of two Dottie's locations in Philadelphia and it's fabulous. This small donut shop offers a wide variety of all-vegan donuts that will knock your socks off. I brought a dozen to my non-vegan quasi-in-laws and all of them loved the donuts, including the picky children.

In particular, the chocolate pistachio ($3), the Boston Creme ($3) and the coffee cake (which is one of the few non-donut offerings they have) were wonderful.

These donuts also hold up well. They still tasted good even 48 hours later, whereas I've found most other donuts are stale within a few hours.

If you've had the vegan donuts at places like Donut Friend or Donatsu in LA, or Glam Doll in Minneapolis, expect similar quality at Dottie's. 

Also, Dottie's is way better than famous (but mediocre) places like Voodoo Donuts, Mighty-O and Dun-well in Portland, Seattle and NYC, respectively.
Awesome Mexican food and the staff is great as well. I have tried lunch, brunch dinners and to go and every time its a 5 star!

I heard so many good reviews about this place. After a nice conversation with a fellow foodie while waiting in line for an hour at Curiosity Donuts, I decided to give it a try based on her great experience with the Rigatoni with Fiorella sausage ragu, and that was exactly what I ordered for pickup.

The food was ready when I got there. Very friendly staff. Do not expect to have a skinny rigatoni like those from the box. This rigatoni is giant, cooked in perfection. Al dente with tasty fresh sausage and a splash of red sauce with a hint of cream. The grated Parmesan on top completes the flavor. I wish there's more sauce , because I can soak it all with a good crusty Italian bread. Portion is big, you can share it with another person, big you can easily finish the whole thing because it is so delicious.

It's definitely the best pasta in the city.

Terrific Italian food, cooked the way your nonna would make it, if she were an old school Italian cook.
Ordered the roasted red pepper antipasti appetizer and, wow, was blown away by the quality and size of the dish. Two of us made only a small dent in it. My friend ordered a seafood pasta dish that he raved about, while I stuck with more "small" plates. (You just can't get broccoli rabe and sausage in Atlanta. The vegetables in all the dishes we tried were delicious and well-prepared.)
We opted to sit in the dining room, as the more informal lounge was a little loud.
Service was wonderful. 
I'll return the next time I am in the area. 
TIP - Botto's also has a market next to the restaurant and it really is like being in Little Italy.

Great service! Great Food! Great Experience!

The manager, Karim, is extremely attentive and friendly.  Definitely worth trying and becoming a regular customer.

BEST. STEAK. EVER.  We drive an hour for the peppercorn tenderloin. It's fabulous....everything about it. The house dressing is delicious. And the fried artichoke hearts with butter dipping sauce....amazing.  You can't go wrong.

Me B's NEVER disappoints. Every time I am in New Orleans for a day or two, I make it a point to eat at Mr, B's. It is a true dining experience. From the time the hostess greets you when you walk in to the time you leave, everything is first rate. I have never had a bad meal here.
Order online at Don Tequila no one in the restaurant knew about the order had to call the boss who was off site still didn't get my 40 bucks back they suck
My parents wanted to take me to dinner here but they were closed -no sign on door, no info on website. Very disappointed!

Excellent customer service! Our server was very attentive and made sure we had all of our needs met. She was knowledgeable about the menu and what wines paired well with each dish. The food was fresh and delicious.

We have ordered a number of times through Grub Hub. Mainly because until recently, there weren't many choices for delivery. Their food is good, although it all seems to be pre packaged food. They have done something a few months back changing the way they made items, and not for the better. My biggest complaint has been their lack of attention to detail. They often mess up orders or forget items. Depending on who is working there, they will either fix the problem for you or tell you they don't have time to replace your food even though it was their mistake. Used their coupon once for free kids meal. They left out almost all the "meal" and when I called they said they wouldn't bring me the fries or sauce for the chicken because I got it free anyway.
Quality fast food BBQ. Not the best BBQ in town but for fast food and under $10 you can't beat it.

One of the worst experiences I've ever had at a Panera. My Mac n cheese was barely full compared to the SAME SIZE my cousin and friend got ~ I asked them to please add a little more and they refused because it is prepackaged. I also asked for NO TOMATOES in my salad and yet , I still found one. This is extremely dangerous for people with food allergies: the manager was compliant and understanding and in turn gave me my money back ~ but it is still a danger.

Burgers.  Unapologetic Burgers.  Every way one could want, and CHOOSE THE PATTIE: (Vegetarian, Chicken, Turkey, Bison . . . ) and every topping, and every fried... whatever, as a side.  Good size portions - EXTENSIVE beer list.  Fun Ford theme with authentic Model T era decor and accouterments (if you like "THEME" then check out the bathroom fixtures).  All things told, if you're wantin' a burger, fries, and a beer, you won't leave disappointed.  OPEN LATE(!!!), BTW, if you want something better than BK at 10pm, indulge your finer instincts...We were there last night.  Sarah was our waitress.  Service was reasonably prompt and timely.  Thumbs up!

Horrible service and rude staff. My husband and I were one of the only tables there and the service was slow and unattentive. Bussers were visibly just standing around when water glasses were empty and plates needed clearing

Hot Oatmeal with Brown Sugar and Walnuts......5 Stars

Toasted Everything Bagel  ................................ 5 Stars

Hot Coffee ......................................................... 2 Stars

Intangibles (Facility, staff, atmosphere) ............ 4 Stars

Cumulative Score .............................................. 4 Stars

I liked Garden of Eatin, had a favorable first impression, and certainly would not hesitate to return when in the area.
Very bad customer service!! Staff was rude ! I Would not recommend going there. They gave me the wrong order and when I came back they didn't even apologise

I have going to Jalapeno's for about a year now,  I love it.  The food is very good and hot.  The staff are so friendly and makes to feel at home the minute you walk in, and they have the best drinks by far around town.

I have had anywhere from just to myself to a small group to a very large party there and they are so accommodating and easy to works with and will do whatever it takes to make any occasion the best experience you will ever have.  
Thank you for being such a great place to come.

Not bad, not bad. Came here after leaving The Daily Bagel. How refreshing to see a big huge nice bagel shop able to actually accommodate patrons! :) an added plus was seeing ALL the bagels in stock and ready to consume. Enjoyed their garlic bagel. It wasn't the best I've ever had but it did the trick this morning for this tired broad who had a bad night. I would return.

I usually frequent Fish Enterprise for the lobster bisque and dollar oysters for happy hour. That's been my favorite for years.
On Monday evening, some coworkers were meeting up for happy hour at the Enterprise. We had the dim sum platter and vegetable gyoza for a very reasonable price! Along with our happy hour drinks of course, which bang for your buck you can't beat. Then afterwards a girlfriend and i shared the lobster special. A huge, tender, delicious, meaty lobster for 30 bucks! It was a great deal and the best meal I've eaten in a long time. We had to wait a few minutes for a table but our server Carris was delightful and very attentive: always ready to refill our glass of wine before happy hour ended. 
All around a very lovely evening. I'll be back soon!

For a pleasant dinning experience punctuated by outstanding service, "The Lemon Grass" is worth a stop if you in Downtown St. Petersburg.

The Lemon Grass offers fairly large serving portions and variety of both Japanese and Thai dishes that will satisfy most pallets.  

Given that this was the first time at this restaurant we were fortunate to  have a couple of outstanding waiters (Art and Tee) provide solid recommendations with great customer service. 

Recommend the crunch roll special (see pic). For those not so into raw fish, they have many alternative sushi options. Their seaweed salad was also well done. Lastly, don't forget to try their Thai iced tea or coffee.
Good wine and good people. I'm a fan of Sevtap!

Fantastic! Absolutely the best wines in Solvang... Arturo is friendly, funny, and more than generous with his pours. 

All of his wines are unique and delicious. I couldn't get over the amazing bouquets they all displayed, very complex and distinct. I dare say these are the best wines I've had to date! 

The atmosphere is relaxed and conversation with Arturo is enjoyable, both about the wine and most everything else. My fiance and I spent the better part of the afternoon just hanging out at Sevtap and the pours just kept coming...

I wish I could name one wine that was my favorite, but honestly I can't. They are all outstanding. I could just swish and smell them all for hours, that's how good they are -before you even taste them! 

We were so impressed by his blends and asking about his next batch of varieties for 2014 (which will include a Malbec and a Sangiovese) that he invited us to this warehouse the next day for a barrel tasting! It was amazing!!! 

I can't wait to come back to Solvang and visit Arturo Sevtap! 

If you're into wines and looking for the best in the area then you MUST stop in at Sevtap! It's a taste sensation in all capacities. Do not miss out!
Crawfish duo was great, and the food here reminds why Cajun food is absolutely incredible. Wish we had this caliber in SF..

First time there with friends on Christmas Eve, took me back to fine dining at Ernies in San Francisco,The Blue Fox,and Doros.Excellent service. Hostess left alot to be desired. Moving  forward,the Oysters Rockefeller,best I have had.Caesar Salad prepared tableside very good. Lobster tail,very large and poached,interesting.Several types of bread very nice. No room for dessert.Coffee excellent.Beautiful atmosphere,no smells like Harrahs Steakhouse,very unpleasant on my last visit. ...My new local favorite.
This place is huge! The patio in the back, paino bar right side, a regular bar on the left side..Omg, The hurricane drinks is a must.

I will admit that we stumbled across this place because the other restaurant we had planned on going to had no tables! After eating here I would like to send a thank you note to that restaurant because this place was spectacular!! We opted to sit outside even though it was in the middle of June but they had plenty of fans to keep us from ending up in a puddle of sweat. They have a really nice outdoor area and we sat at a table on their porch. Our appetizer was the fried cheese balls, and they were so good my husband and I were fighting over who got the last one! We ordered the tutti carne pizza and it was even better than expected! Great crust on and great flavors! Beer selection was really great. A lot of local beers on tap, and that's something my husband and I really appreciate!

I noticed this little spot only a few steps from our hotel. I am sucker for sweets. 

The next day, I took hubby with me to get some goodies. We ordered 2 Macchiatos, the red velvet mousse and lemon mousse cake.

For to go, I got the chocolate mousse cake, and various macaroons (blueberry, lemon poppyseed, mango, and strawberry). The other 2 cakes we ate at the shop with our Macchiatos.  

The chocolate mousse one is definitely my favorite. And this was my first time eating macaroons, and did enjoy them, especially the blueberry ones. Hubby felt they were too sweet.  Overall, I enjoyed myself and if I am ever to visit Philly again anytime soon, I will definitely pick me some macaroons on the way home.

I'm disappointed at the disregard for social distancing and keeping its patrons safe in the midst of supporting them in this pandemic. Happy hour has great potential if they can remember to actually bring out the food you actually order. I ordered the catfish basket, buffalo shrimp, and fried okra. I never received the fried okra. The catfish wasn't catfish, more like a whitefish and it was super salty. We also ordered drinks and hookah. The frozen drinks are super weak and were not my favorite. I would really like them to add dividers to booths, don't sit different parties close together, revamp the drinks, and up their customer service skills before I decide to go back. Until then, they should take the 18% gratuity off the tabs because they are definitely not deserving of it.

It's so hard to find an acai bowl that relies on natural ingredients and doesn't make things too sweet -- I've lived in Arizona, New York City, DC and Chicago and this place by far has the best acai bowls I've had!

All the staff are friendly but today Jacey was especially helpful!

We have been to keep many times pre covid and loved it.  We just did take out and it did not disappoint .
The take out was just as good as dining in , everything we got was delicious ! I highly recommend this gem.
Best pizza in the SB area. Not cheap but worth it. Tasty cocktails too and a nice patio setting. Looking forward to trying some of their other dishes.

Top shelf, high end, innovative burgers!   7 of us, including my 3 grand sons enjoyed this place immensely on Saturday.   Everyone got something different, and I'm talking very different, and everyone was more than satisfied.    

When we walked in the door I saw this massive stack of pulled pork and chicken nachos so of course we had to start with them.  Plenty for all of us 

I had the Bru Burger: bacon cheese and 'fruit" paste that made it very tasty not o mention it was a large burger. 

My wife had a 'slider' and a half apple/pecan salad.  Excellent!  

My grandsons had two small burgers and fries which they ate everything.  

Price was very reasonable. We were there at 2:30 and had zero wait time and the food came in a reasonable time.  Going back this weekend! 

Try their sweet tea while there.  Very southern!   Excellent

As a Bay Area native I would NOT recommend coming here. I ordered the taro milk tea with boba, and the taro tasted powdery and overly sweet in an artificial way. In addition, the boba was WAY overcooked and the texture was unpleasant, so I was unable to finish my drink.

I haven't ordered a drink here since, and I probably won't be back to try another one.

Terrible service !! If you want a peaceful dinner don't go there 
Customer service sucks 
We order appetizer . It came after we finished main course 
Main course came with out roti by the time roti came food was cold

Unfortunately, I did not love Biscuit Love. The biscuits were not warm at all and I could tell they had been sitting out for a while. The gravy and grits were both cold and therefore clumpy. I feel like the line being out the door played a big part into why we wanted to try this restaurant, but with the wait and sub par food, I will not dine here again in the future.

I love the atmosphere, the music and the host. The bartender, however, needs to check his bad attitude at the door.  Every time we have been here, we've sat at the bar. Literally not once has the bartender given us menus, greeted us or made our drinks. It's always been the barback.
Delicious food and wonderful service. Great salads and vegetarian options, with a nice patio for outdoor dining.
I like the sandwich that I had but the mac & cheese is really gross, way too heavy.  They have a very large menu and plenty of things look ok on there I would make another visit in the future.

Great place to go for a quick snack before dinner. I really recommend the California Heat. I think the bacon in it really compliments the sriracha sauce. I gave 4 stars because the tables were dirty and the shrimp were kinda cold.

Excellent service. The food was amazing. I recommend the lemon grass honey chicken, pad se-ew, pineapple fried rice, thai sweet and sour chicken,  eggplant lover with shrimp, Bangkok wings, chicken satay,  crab rangoon,  thai iced tea and mango sticky rice. Everything was fantastic!!!

Although not perfect (but that's OK), it is one of our fail-safe restaurants...used to be TGI Friday's but Uno's is better!  Can't beat the half-price apps!  

Only quasi-quibble is this, and it's rather amusing--wife and I come here about 2x per month, we walk past the same people each time, yet we are always asked "have we ever been here before?"  Wanna be a wiseguy, but I let it go!
Fantastic food, service and atmosphere!  Also the best 'house' wine anywhere.  Great prices well worth going and can't wait to come back!

Probably the best restaurant in the city of NPR as far as the fare goes....your more typical restaurant with steak,sandwiches etc..Good beer, would like more of a discount as I go there during the day...and feel as there could be more beer specials...

Definitely some good Mediterranean food. Don't go by the looks, it is located inside a convience store, a very hole in the wall place. I got the vege fafael wrap, which was good just dry, I had to get extra sauce and hummus as they went very cheap on it.

I had bookmarked this restaurant when we were heading to Vegas but didn't have a chance to check it out.  Since we were heading to Reno, I was ecstatic that they have a location here.  This restaurant is located inside of Harrah's which is close to our hotel so we just walked over. We came here for brunch and for the 5 (3 adults & 2 kids) of us, we ordered 3 regular entrees plus 1 kid's meal.  When our food arrived, we realized that we ordered way too much food.  We ended up taking leftovers back to the hotel and eating them for breakfast the next day.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5...the host did not acknowledge us when we approached him.  He just kept staring at us.  We waited a while before he even talked to us.  It was between 10-11am so at that time, it wasn't even busy.  Also, the breading on the chicken and the pork chop pretty much just crumbled off of the meat and left crumbs all over the plate.  The infamous sage fried chicken with waffles (with bacon) didn't have any sage flavor at all but the chicken and the waffles were good.  The pork chop entree had mashed potatoes and a biscuit underneath the pork chop but since the sauce was served on top of the pork chop, everything underneath was pretty bland.  The other 2 entrees we ordered were just the typical pancake meals so no comment on those.

I really felt awkward at first coming in here - it was like grand central station inside. I wasn't quite sure what to do. I managed to figure it out quickly though, and I found my way through the bustling herd of customers shuffling around looking for a table or getting drinks or whatever they were doing to the cashier to place my order. I was sort of having a low blood sugar moment, so my brain wasn't processing the menu - I asked him if I could just get a turkey sandwich. Then he asked me 20 questions which I did my best to answer. He handed me a number and some chips and a cup and sent me on my way... 

I joined the herd and found a table and got my drink and started snacking on my chips They were almost gone before my sandwich arrived. My sandwich was delicious, but a little dry (I guess that's kinda my fault because I don't like mayo on sandwiches, but the pesto they put on it wasn't enough to overcome the dryness of the turkey). It was flavorful and the bread was tasty. I wish there was one in Phoenix. I would eat there a bunch.

This is the best fast food ever!!! The food was so good I could not take a picture because I was enjoying the eating.  I also had a chocolate milk shake - awesome.  This place has salads as wells a burgers and many choices of shakes.  Can't wait to go back!
Love Love Love this place! The banana french toast is amazing and I love their chai mocha. I wish I could eat here every day.

This place was amazing. 3 of us split everything- started off with 1$ oysters on their happy hour menu, along with French fries, pig bruschetta, and wings. Everything was delicious... Wings had a garlic butter Parmesan sauce on them with oregano. 

We split 2 things off their dinner menu- Clams and mussels that were in a spicy broth with chorizo, and a baked pot pie made with their homemade pig and topped with a savory bread crust. 

Our drinks were awesome too. They had a ton of good crafts, and wine on tap! 

I will be back.

I love everything about this pizza, the ordering and pick-up process. 
First - you can order and pay on-line, pick up in-store.  Which means the margin of error for toppings and such is almost NIL. Also, no stink eye when you order 12 toppings, lol.  Do that at a regular pizza place!
The crust is amazing, not the typical dough pizza we get her in the Philly area.  Toppings are FRESH - and so incredibly tasty compared to a 'regular' pizza place.
I get there on time and go right to pick-up because it is already paid for. So easy!
The manager (Ryan I think) is really nice and friendly at each pick-up. I've never seen a mess in this store, behind the counter is always clean, even during the rushes.
Can't recommend this pizza place more.  
And a bonus, there is a Mod Pizza where one of my daughters lives in another state.  I can order on-line for them and have her pick it up as a surprise for an easy dinner for them - I really like I can do that.
I wish there was a Mod Pizza in every location my adult children live, it is so fun to call after ordering and saying 'Hey - can you add a note to the top of the box for my daughter' and they do!

Not sure why I was the only one there. I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap. Service was great, everyone was friendly. Wrap and fries were both very good. Would go back and recommend to anyone looking for an Irish Pub.

I was torn between rating PF Changs 3 or 4 stars.  The food is good, but it's a far cry from real Chinese food. The service varies depending on the server... We've had great service, horrible service, and a lot in-between. The cocktails are horribly overpriced so my husband and I normally just order a pot of hot tea, which is incredible. Since we live close by we typically grab our food to-go in the curbside pick up area.

This P.F. Changs is located at the Westshore mall so it's always packed. I'd highly recommend making dinner reservations on Friday and Saturday nights because it can be at least a 30 to 45 minute wait after 7pm. The bathroom is poorly located next to the bar so you have to fight a crowd every time you want to go to the bathroom.

As I mentioned earlier, the food is tasty; just not authentic. The lettuce wraps and dumplings are two of my favorite appetizers on the menu. There are many mild and spicy dishes on the menu depending on your spice preferences. We enjoy a lot of spice so we usually order the spicy green beans and the Cho's Spicy Chicken. The honey glazed chicken and the wonton soup are also quite good.

I have never ordered dessert here, but I have tried a handful of the cocktails and they are usually too sweet and fruity for my taste. Be cautious of ordering cocktails that aren't listed on the menu. The bartenders have disappointed me on numerous occasions with poorly made Dirty Martinis and Cosmos.

All in all PF Changs is nothing special, but the food is consistent so you are guaranteed a decent meal.

I haven't eaten here in years and don't plan to ever go back. Ordered vegetable lo mein  and an order of prawns and the food tasted as if food as sitting in a salt vat. Yes that salt and unenjoyable. Overboard with the soy sauce. We also ordered vegetable fried rice and it too was loaded with salt. A local Chinese or Thai place is a 1000% better. What happened?!! I used to love eating here.
Sweet service, great atmosphere, and incredible, fresh breakfast food. Also THE best sausage I've ever had in my life (chicken). I'm eager to become a regular.

Just had our first delivery pizza from Bloomindale, and wasn't disappointed.  Me and my friends ordered 'the special' Sicilian 16" pizza, along with a side order of stuffed mushrooms.  The pizza had a nice, fluffy crust as a Sicilian should with a decent amount of the toppings.  The sausage was even sliced into medallions rather than left as a crumble, which was a nice change.  The stuffed mushrooms were really good, with a pleasantly generous garlic butter flavor.  Looking forwards to giving them another try.
Great made to order pasta. We also tried pizza and chicken park sandwiches. Really good portions and great price.

If you are looking for excellent sushi in a laid back atmosphere, Sushinc is your new go-to sushi restaurant!  Large selection of specialty and familiar rolls.  Observant, engaging service. VERY GOOD prices. Two thumbs up!
The staff is very friendly! Denny's never disappoints for late snigger snacks. And unlike ihop they have a great 2,4,6,8 menu.

My girlfriend and I just finished our meal here. The food was quite good, in particular the broccoli appetizer we shared and the fennel sausage pasta I had as a main stood out.

However. And a big however. 

Our post dinner coffee had just arrived and after we handed off the checkbook with a generous tip, our server returned to inform us that the next party was waiting for our table. In the moment it wasn't too strange, but after she walked away I realized we both had just been served cortados and had each only had a sip, not to mention we both had full glasses of wine. It was a Friday night dinner and we had only been there for an hour and fourty five minutes, which for a coursed meal seemed reasonable if not short. We both immediately felt rushed and did as we were asked, quickly drank our coffee and wine and left, though my girlfriend did ask the server what time the reservation was for the party waiting on our table, which was 7:45, basically giving an airtight window for serving us (our reservation was for 6).

If I read this review, I would likely be focused more on the food reviews and less on the service, which is entirely fair. But when you eat at a place that is supposed to be contending with top restaurants in the city it diminishes the experience when the last experience is being rushed off immediately after paying the check. Had we any forewarning we might not have had coffee, or skipped the appetizers. I know the poor scheduling is not the fault of our server, but she kept us in the dark and only informed us after we had paid the check which, whether intentional or not, made us feel a little conned.

This place has a tremendous reputation, and for almost all of our meal, that lived up. But being young and having too many friends in service (also my girlfriend who ate with me worked in service for years), the service tonight was downright deceptive. We spent too much time talking to our server about food for her to tell us we needed to hurry up as we handed her cash (literally what happened).

For now: Res Ipsa delivers well enough on food and the small atmosphere of a traditional byob. But the service is well below the cost. Not only were we hurried, the party taking our seat had no room to wait comfortably and were forced to stand in the doorway while we chugged our coffee and wine. It was probably the most awkward experience I've had at a restaurant, and for that I can only give them 2 stars.

I give it two stars bc I can walk there and it's always open. 
Aside from that, never let them sit you in the back. I have waited 2 hours back there. It's where they train people. And.... It doesn't work well. 
Always get a booth or sit at the bar and the service is prompt. 
The nachos were some of the grossest things I've ever seem.
I mean, it is what it is. Shitty diner food. But sometimes you want that.
The staff are nice. 
There's a homeless woman who live at the end of the entrance ramp and in 2 years haven't seen her move. That concerns me a bit.

Awesome ww were seated immediately.
1st thing I notice was how clean it was.the young Servers were kind & quick... our server Jershyah was the best The noise level was soft. Now to what we came here for DA FOOD... oh my I ordered the #4, 2eggs, bacon, pancake... everything was Hot and very Tasty... and yes very affordable.
Even though it's downtown it's on my breakfast trek, I'll be back

Since it was the Eagles preseason game, we wanted pizza and wings. My bf wanted a chicken sandwich. When the ordered was delivered, the delivery guy made a smart comment to my dad who didn't even know we ordered food. The breaded chicken cutlets was either over fried or it was old and refried again. The wings barely has sauce and the steak Stromboli was dried. Their cheese thin crust pizza was probably the only thing that was good. Oh and the wings were a good size and not like those unfed tiny wing.

Pros:
Good salad bar

Clean restaurant



Cons:
Service below average, tough to flag down a waiter for drinks....don't they want to sell drinks?

Meat servers....few and far between, plan on getting full on salad bar items while waiting for tiny servings of meat.



Basically it's not awful, everyone understands that they want you to fill up on cheap carbs and not the meat.

Just overpriced considering the lack of meat.... $23 for a salad bar with a few slivers of meat is a bit steep.

(Might have not noticed if I could have found my waiter and gotten some more alcohol in me)

The Parkshore Grill, in my opinion, has the most consistent food and service of any restaurant on Beach Drive.  Most always excellent food and great service.  I eat here at least once a week (mostly brunch for excellent people watching.)

Alright so, I'm actually at this McDonalds right now because it literally takes that long to get through the drive thru. Not only that but I'm not ordering a dang thing because they only accept cash at this moment, but they failed to warn ANYBODY including myself of this outrageous fact before getting in the millennium long drive thru line. Just so everyone knows, if you feel like losing three years of your life go through this line. I'm never returning.

My parents took me to Outback last Friday night for a birthday dinner and I was slightly disappointed with the steak. This was my first time eating at an Outback, and I now eat red meat about once a month, so I wanted this to count. This is a "steakhouse," right?

Granted, I did order the sirloin and those are more lean than juicy, but mine was pretty dry. Still, it was pretty good and my sides (broccoli, sweet potato fries) were excellent. They overcooked my mother's medium-well steak, but they rectified that almost instantly.  

So there you have it. I can't give it two stars because the staff is pleasant, it's a good chain restaurant, but I wouldn't go here again unless someone was paying for my meal again!

I loved this place and experience. Came here on my birthday for brunch and really enjoyed myself. The atmosphere was quaint, quiet and cute. We were seating immediately and served right away. The waitress we had, Hazel, was attentive and got our order perfect. Then there's the food, which was EXCELLENT. I had the chicken and waffles and it was on point. Even the jasmine tea I had was delicious. No, even the water we had was great. Crisp filtered refreshing water. I will put this place on the list of favorites because my experience was above average. 100%.
Hands down favorite place to go to in the broad ripple area. This is our go to place. Great food, service, and atmosphere. Can't beat it!

This is THE BEST BURGER IN SAINT LOUIS! You can pick  your burger from the meat out and it is awesome!! Service is always on point and it is spaced for Covid and clean with sanitation stations throughout.

The coffee is amazing! I love coming here and trying something different every time. I also enjoy the food, as i've had a few of their burritos now. It's definitely a great local spot that is getting more popular. 

During certain times of the year, there is a girl scout there selling cookies. The line can get a little long but your food and coffee are always fresh when they give it to you.
The food is extremely fresh and service is excellent. I enjoyed myself and wil be returning. Love this place!!

Just okay burgers. My boyfriend and I stopped by for dinner after having it recommended to us by a friend, that told us it was a great burger spot. Wouldn't really call it great, you can get better burgers elsewhere. In my opinion, this place is overrated. The restaurant itself is very crammed. Way too much going on in a small space. We could barely hear our waiter due to the fact that tables were so close together and crammed, so overall the place seemed very loud because of other conversations going on around us. Wouldn't consider going back.
Great atmosphere. Awesome beer choices. Opted for the fried pickles and chili. Odd combination but both were very good.  Had to add hot sauce to the chili but all is good.

We had to try a philly cheesesteak before going back to NYC, so we headed on over to Sonny's. I ordered the loaded cheesesteak sandwich which comes with peppers and onions & cheez whiz as my choice of cheese. Hands down, one of the best cheesesteak sandwich I ever had. It's not oily greasy and it just simply hits the spot. Definitely give this place a try!

I don't know why we eat here. There's no consistency, it's not clean, it's run by kids. I wonder if they wash their hands. Tonight the salsa was empty, the trash cans were overflowing, the air conditioning barely cooled the place. Over the last 5 years, sometimes we've had good meals and other times I've been grossed out so we don't return for a long time between visits. I think I'm finally calling it quits.

If you're a fried chicken lover, this has to be on your store in the Big Easy.  If you like lightly breaded fried chicken, this isn't the place for you.  Their breading is a little thicker but gives it an amazing crunch that you'll quickly learn to love.  Always moist and juicy, this place has it all.  You can even have craw-fish, shrimp, or fish if you want to keep with the seafood theme of the New Orleans coast, but this place is known for it's great fried chicken.   You'll be amongst a lot of tourists in this establishment, but this is one of those places where the locals come even though they're surrounded by the "visitors".  All in all, if you like chicken, this should be on your stop to New Orleans.
Absolutely beyond delicious. Everything is so fresh. The service is outstanding and the atmosphere is great. We are frequent diners of this restaurant. A+++

I had an incredible experience at this place. I got a great cheesesteak, which many of you may think is even ridiculous to say, however the waiter said it was a legit cheese steak, he was on top of it bringing me sodas. There was a large selection of beer if I had wanted it. I was watching Friends on my phone while it charged on the outlets under the bar. I mean really what else could you possibly want from an airport bar? Food rocked by the way.

I stopped in here today for the first time after having it on my "To Try" for years! After a long morning walk on the Monon, an iced coffee sounded fabulous to start off my morning. I popped in here with my stroller (the ramp is super helpful for this!). Their coffee menu is impressive as is their machinery. I almost went with the Dirty Hippie (chai tea + espresso) but went with an Iced Latte on a lark. It was SO delicious and refreshing. I usually don't finish all of my coffee drinks, but I slurped up all of this yummy treat. The fun twisty straw was a bonus! 

I also ordered a turkey panini with a side of cottage cheese for some nosh and it was very good. Sliced turkey deli meat, avocado, herby mayo, tomato on crispy wheat bread made this sandwich one to remember!

I loved sitting out on their patio, cooling off, enjoying my meal and catching the sights of mid-morning Broad Ripple. It made for a very pleasant morning. I am not sure WHY it took me so long to visit, but I am so glad I did; and I'll definitely be back!
This place serves hot food with a smile and a full bar. The pub food is pretty good but it is definitely Lacking in the chef department and could stand for some changes to update the menu

I swear this place was designed to host large bachelorette party groups! Extremely insta worthy from start to finish. Came here with a group of 12 for brunch. Food was great (highly recommend the fried chicken sandwich... when in Nashville!) Gives you a great base meal to get the day going! Big fan of cocktails as well!! The service was awesome and very accommodating for a large group giving everyone separate checks which helped a lot. As with anywhere in Nashville, make sure you have a reservation!

While North is no longer owned by Fox Restaurant Concepts, they've maintained their formula/consistency, which is what I always appreciated  about  FRC restaurants. Knowing what to expect is nice, even for takeout the food is a-ok. I still have not dined inside of a restaurant but continue to support with takeout. We ordered online on a Saturday evening, the wait was about 35 minutes. They did not offer curbside pickup but I am sure it they would gladly accommodate the request. Our order included the calamari, meatballs, braised  short rib with polenta and the branzino. The meatballs and braised short rib are always good. The branzino was a touch overcooked but still good. And the calamar I think it best enjoyed at the establishment since it's fried. 

If you are comfortable with dining in, North is open for both indoor and outdoor dining. 

They are adhering to the Pima County guidelines regarding COVID19.
Steak & Eggs on sourdough roll was FAB! Used to live around the corner, ashamed I never came here before. An SB GEM.

Just had my first experience at Stacie's today and it was wonderful! Friendly staff, quick service (made to order!), and , cute, quiet, classic cafe atmosphere.  Lots of options on the menu for both breakfast and lunch - especially the biscuits and gravy! Yum!

I absolutely LOVE this place. My husband and I come at least twice every month, if not more. The food is delicious. From the cheese fondue appetizer (I have only had the cheddar), to the entrée (we get the you pick 3), and when there's room to finish off with dessert (yummy flaming turtle) it is simple heaven. Just imagine fruits, little bite size cakes and bite size rice crispy treats all for your dipping pleasure into delicious melted chocolate of your choosing (there are a lot of choices from dark to milk to white to mixed). If you have not been here yet, I highly recommend you try it. Even if you only go for the dessert, that alone is worth the trip!

About as ordinary as you can get. Went to the men's room and one of the kitchen staff came out of a toilet stall and headed back to the kitchen without even rinsing his hands, let alone washing them. Who knows, maybe he used a sink in the kitchen to wash up.

Love Arni's! It's a great, reasonably priced experience for all. Their lunch specials are great deals! We went for lunch on my birthday to sit outside on their patio and have pizza. Breadsticks are yummy! Pizza is yummy! And oh my, the toffee dessert is to die for and I don't even like toffee! Can't go wrong to visit here summer or winter. The dining room and bar seating is great too.

Walked in, waited to be seated, eventually grabbed our own menus and sat ourselves. Someone came by and gave us three placemats for our group of four... and then never came back. After waiting another 20 minutes, we decided to just leave. Terrible service. So disappointing.
